def.name: version
def.description: The version number of the to test. In level 2, this can be either or .

def.name: local_file
def.description: The local file path (will be overwritten if the file already exists).

def.name: remote_file
def.description: The remote file path.

def.name: qualifiedName
def.description: The tag name and prefix of the attribute, as .

def.name: property
def.description: Specific property, one of: , , .

def.name: methodname
def.description: The name of the method to add

def.name: host
def.description: The FTP server address. This parameter shouldn't have any trailing slashes and shouldn't be prefixed with .

def.name: error_message
def.description: If the parameter is used, it will contain the error message generated by the syntax check. is passed by .

def.name: node
def.description: The compared node.

def.name: setting
def.description: Value to set, either float, or an array of floats as appropriate.

def.name: oldnode
def.description: The removed child.

def.name: handler
def.description: The name of the which shall be used for accessing . It is passed all optional parameters given to and can act on behalf of them.

def.name: command
def.description: The command to execute.

def.name: attr
def.description: The attribute node.

def.name: namespaceURI
def.description: The URI of the namespace.

def.name: source
def.description: The string to compress.

def.name: record_number
def.description: An integer which spans from 1 to the number of records in the database (as returned by ).

def.name: localName
def.description: The local name.

def.name: zp
def.description: The gz-file pointer. It must be valid, and must point to a file successfully opened by .

def.name: data
def.description: The written data.

def.name: attribute
def.description: One of the constants. The constants that apply to database connections are as follows:

def.name: ftp_stream
def.description: The link identifier of the FTP connection.

def.name: record
def.description: An indexed array of data. The number of items must be equal to the number of fields in the database, otherwise will fail. If you're using return value for this parameter, remember to reset the key named .

def.name: count
def.description: The number of characters to delete. If the sum of and exceeds the length, then all characters to the end of the data are deleted.

def.name: doc
def.description: The transformed document.

def.name: value
def.description: The value of the element. By default, an empty element will be created. You can also set the value later with .

def.name: expression
def.description: The XPath expression to execute.

def.name: width
def.description: The return width of the returned thumbnail.

def.name: contextnode
def.description: The optional can be specified for doing relative XPath queries. By default, the queries are relative to the root element.

def.name: username
def.description: The username ( ).

def.name: timeout
def.description: This parameter specifies the timeout for all subsequent network operations. If omitted, the default value is 90 seconds. The timeout can be changed and queried at any time with and .

def.name: port
def.description: This parameter specifies an alternate port to connect to. If it is omitted or set to zero, then the default FTP port, 21, will be used.

def.name: feature
def.description: The feature to test.

def.name: zip_entry
def.description: A directory entry previously opened .

def.name: zip
def.description: A ZIP file previously opened with .

def.name: deep
def.description: Indicates whether to copy all descendant nodes. This parameter is defaulted to .

def.name: fetch_style
def.description: Controls how the next row will be returned to the caller. This value must be one of the constants, defaulting to . : returns an array indexed by column name as returned in your result set (default): returns an array indexed by both column name and column number as returned in your result set : returns and assigns the values of the columns in your result set to the PHP variables to which they were bound with the method : combines and , creating the object variable names as they are accessed : returns an anonymous object with property names that correspond to the column names returned in your result set : returns an array indexed by column number as returned in your result set, starting at column 0

def.name: code
def.description: The code to be evaluated when is called

def.name: height
def.description: The returned height of the returned thumbnail.

def.name: handle
def.description: An open file pointer in which we store the data.

def.name: dbase_identifier
def.description: The database link identifier, returned by or .

def.name: mode
def.description: Similar to the function ('r' for read, 'w' for write, etc.).

def.name: bz
def.description: The file pointer. It must be valid and must point to a file successfully opened by .

def.name: recursive
def.description: If set to , the issued command will be .

def.name: target
def.description: The target of the processing instruction.

def.name: parser
def.description: A reference to the XML parser to get byte index from.

def.name: prefix
def.description: The prefix of the namespace.

def.name: newnode
def.description: The appended child.

def.name: qualifiedName
def.description: The qualified name of the document element to create.

def.name: oldname
def.description: The old file/directory name.

def.name: args
def.description: Comma-delimited list of arguments for the newly-created method

def.name: statement
def.description: The SQL statement to prepare and execute.

def.name: newname
def.description: The new name to give to the renamed method

def.name: index
def.description: Index of the node into the collection.

def.name: errors
def.description: A 2D hash of errors (including fatal errors) encountered during compilation. Returned by reference.

def.name: options
def.description: . Available since PHP 5.1.0 and Libxml 2.6.7.

element.name: apd_breakpoint
element.description: This can be used to stop the running of your script, and await responses on the connected socket. To step the program, just send enter (a blank line), or enter a php command to be executed. A typical session using tcplisten would look like this.

element.name: apd_callstack
element.description: Returns the current call stack as an array

element.name: apd_clunk
element.description: Behaves like perl's Carp::cluck. Throw a warning and a callstack. The default line delimiter is " < BR / > \n".

element.name: apd_continue
element.description: Usually sent via the socket to restart the interpreter.

element.name: apd_croak
element.description: Behaves like perl's Carp::croak. Throw an error, a callstack and then exit. The default line delimiter is " < BR / > \n".

element.name: apd_dump_function_table
element.description: Outputs the current function table.

element.name: apd_dump_persistent_resources
element.description: Return all persistent resources as an array.

element.name: apd_dump_regular_resources
element.description: Return all current regular resources as an array.

element.name: apd_echo
element.description: Usually sent via the socket to request information about the running script.

element.name: apd_get_active_symbols
element.description: Returns the names of all the variables defined in the active scope, (not their values)

element.name: apd_set_pprof_trace
element.description: Starts debugging to {dump_directory}/pprof_{process_id}, if dump_directory is not set, then the apd.dumpdir setting from the file is used.

element.name: apd_set_session
element.description: This can be used to increase or decrease debugging in a different area of your application,.debug_level is an integer which is formed by adding together the following values:

element.name: apd_set_session_trace
element.description: Starts debugging to {dump_directory}/apd_dump_{process_id}, if dump_directory is not set, then the apd.dumpdir setting from the file is used.

element.name: apd_set_socket_session_trace
element.description: Connects to the tcp server (eg. tcplisten) specified IP or Unix Domain socket (like a file), and sends debugging data to the socket. You can use any port, but higher numbers are better as most of the lower numbers may be used by other system services.

element.name: override_function
element.description: Syntax similar to create_function(). Overrides built-in functions (replaces them in the symbol table).

element.name: rename_function
element.description: Renames orig_name to new_name in the global function_table. Useful for temporarily overriding builtin functions.

element.name: apache_child_terminate
element.description: apache_child_terminate will register the Apache process executing the current PHP request for termination once execution of PHP code it is completed. It may be used to terminate a process after a script with high memory consumption has been run as memory will usually only be freed internally but not given back to the operating system.

element.name: apache_get_modules
element.description: This function returns an array with the loaded Apache modules.

element.name: apache_get_version
element.description: apache_get_version returns the version of Apache as string, or on failure.

element.name: apache_getenv
element.description: apache_getenv returns the value of the Apache environment variable specified by variable , or on failure.

element.name: apache_lookup_uri
element.description: This performs a partial request for a URI. It goes just far enough to obtain all the important information about the given resource and returns this information in a class. The properties of the returned class are:

element.name: apache_note
element.description: apache_note is an Apache-specific function which gets and sets values in a request's table. If called with one argument, it returns the current value of note . If called with two arguments, it sets the value of note to and returns the previous value of note .

element.name: apache_request_headers
element.description: apache_request_headers returns an associative array of all the HTTP headers in the current request. This is only supported when PHP runs as an module.

element.name: apache_reset_timeout
element.description: apache_reset_timeout resets the Apache write timer, which defaults to 300 seconds. With and periodic apache_reset_timeout calls, Apache can theoretically run forever.

element.name: apache_response_headers
element.description: Returns an array of all Apache response headers.

element.name: apache_setenv
element.description: apache_setenv sets the value of the Apache environment variable specified by variable .

element.name: ascii2ebcdic
element.description: ascii2ebcdic is an Apache-specific function which is available only on EBCDIC based operating systems (OS/390, BS2000). It translates the ASCII encoded string ascii_str to its equivalent EBCDIC representation (binary safe), and returns the result.

element.name: ebcdic2ascii
element.description: ebcdic2ascii is an Apache-specific function which is available only on EBCDIC based operating systems (OS/390, BS2000). It translates the EBCDIC encoded string ebcdic_str to its equivalent ASCII representation (binary safe), and returns the result.

element.name: getallheaders
element.description: getallheaders is an alias for apache_request_headers . It will return an associative array of all the HTTP headers in the current request. Please read the apache_request_headers documentation for more information on how this function works.

element.name: virtual
element.description: virtual is an Apache-specific function which is equivalent to < !--#include virtual...-- > in mod_include. It performs an Apache sub-request. It is useful for including CGI scripts or .shtml files, or anything else that you would parse through Apache. Note that for a CGI script, the script must generate valid CGI headers. At the minimum that means it must generate a Content-type header.

element.name: array
element.description: Returns an array of the parameters. The parameters can be given an index with the operator. Read the section on the for more information on what an array is.

element.name: array_change_key_case
element.description: array_change_key_case changes the keys in the input array to be all lowercase or uppercase. The change depends on the last optional case parameter. You can pass two constants there, and . The default is . The function will leave number indices as is.

element.name: array_chunk
element.description: array_chunk splits the array into several arrays with size values in them. You may also have an array with less values at the end. You get the arrays as members of a multidimensional array indexed with numbers starting from zero.

element.name: array_combine
element.description: Returns an by using the values from the keys array as keys and the values from the values array as the corresponding values.

element.name: array_count_values
element.description: array_count_values returns an array using the values of the input array as keys and their frequency in input as values.

element.name: array_diff
element.description: array_diff returns an array containing all the values of array1 that are not present in any of the other arguments. Note that keys are preserved.

element.name: array_diff_assoc
element.description: array_diff_assoc returns an containing all the values from array1 that are not present in any of the other arguments. Note that the keys are used in the comparison unlike array_diff .

element.name: array_diff_key
element.description: array_diff_key returns an array containing all the values of array1 that have keys that are not present in any of the other arguments. Note that the associativity is preserved. This function is like array_diff except the comparison is done on the keys instead of the values.

element.name: array_diff_uassoc
element.description: array_diff_uassoc returns an containing all the values from array1 that are not present in any of the other arguments. Note that the keys are used in the comparison unlike array_diff . This comparison is done by a user supplied callback function. It must return an integer less than, equal to, or greater than zero if the first argument is considered to be respectively less than, equal to, or greater than the second. This is unlike array_diff_assoc where an internal function for comparing the indices is used.

element.name: array_diff_ukey
element.description: array_diff_ukey returns an array containing all the values of array1 that have keys that are not present in any of the other arguments. Note that the associativity is preserved. This function is like array_diff except the comparison is done on the keys instead of the values.

element.name: array_fill
element.description: array_fill fills an array with num entries of the value of the value parameter, keys starting at the start_index parameter. Note that num must be a number greater than zero, or PHP will throw a warning.

element.name: array_filter
element.description: array_filter iterates over each value in the input array passing them to the callback function. If the callback function returns true, the current value from input is returned into the result array. Array keys are preserved.

element.name: array_flip
element.description: array_flip returns an in flip order, i.e. keys from trans become values and values from trans become keys.

element.name: array_intersect
element.description: array_intersect returns an array containing all the values of array1 that are present in all the arguments. Note that keys are preserved.

element.name: array_intersect_assoc
element.description: $result_array will look like:

element.name: array_intersect_key
element.description: array_intersect_key returns an array containing all the values of array1 which have matching keys that are present in all the arguments.

element.name: array_intersect_uassoc
element.description: array_intersect_uassoc returns an array containing all the values of array1 that are present in all the arguments. Note that the keys are used in the comparison unlike in array_intersect .

element.name: array_intersect_ukey
element.description: array_intersect_ukey returns an array containing all the values of array1 which have matching keys that are present in all the arguments.

element.name: array_key_exists
element.description: array_key_exists returns if the given key is set in the array. key can be any value possible for an array index. array_key_exists also works on objects.

element.name: array_keys
element.description: array_keys returns the keys, numeric and string, from the input array.

element.name: array_map
element.description: array_map returns an array containing all the elements of arr1 after applying the callback function to each one. The number of parameters that the callback function accepts should match the number of arrays passed to the array_map

element.name: array_merge
element.description: array_merge merges the elements of one or more arrays together so that the values of one are appended to the end of the previous one. It returns the resulting array.

element.name: array_merge_recursive
element.description: array_merge_recursive merges the elements of two or more arrays together so that the values of one are appended to the end of the previous one. It returns the resulting array.

element.name: array_pad
element.description: array_pad returns a copy of the input padded to size specified by pad_size with value pad_value . If pad_size is positive then the array is padded on the right, if it's negative then on the left. If the absolute value of pad_size is less than or equal to the length of the input then no padding takes place.

element.name: array_pop
element.description: array_pop pops and returns the last value of the array , shortening the array by one element. If array is empty (or is not an array), will be returned.

element.name: array_push
element.description: array_push treats array as a stack, and pushes the passed variables onto the end of array . The length of array increases by the number of variables pushed. Has the same effect as: repeated for each var .

element.name: array_rand
element.description: array_rand is rather useful when you want to pick one or more random entries out of an array. It takes an input array and an optional argument num_req which specifies how many entries you want to pick - if not specified, it defaults to 1.

element.name: array_reduce
element.description: array_reduce applies iteratively the function function to the elements of the array input , so as to reduce the array to a single value. If the optional initial is available, it will be used at the beginning of the process, or as a final result in case the array is empty.

element.name: array_reverse
element.description: array_reverse takes input array and returns a new array with the order of the elements reversed, preserving the keys if preserve_keys is .

element.name: array_search
element.description: Searches haystack for needle and returns the key if it is found in the array, otherwise.

element.name: array_shift
element.description: array_shift shifts the first value of the array off and returns it, shortening the array by one element and moving everything down. All numerical array keys will be modified to start counting from zero while literal keys won't be touched. If array is empty (or is not an array), will be returned.

element.name: array_slice
element.description: array_slice returns the sequence of elements from the array array as specified by the offset and length parameters.

element.name: array_splice
element.description: array_splice removes the elements designated by offset and length from the input array, and replaces them with the elements of the replacement array, if supplied. It returns an array containing the extracted elements.

element.name: array_sum
element.description: array_sum returns the sum of values in an array as an integer or float.

element.name: array_udiff
element.description: array_udiff returns an array containing all the values of array1 that are not present in any of the other arguments. Note that keys are preserved. For the comparison of the data data_compare_func is used. It must return an integer less than, equal to, or greater than zero if the first argument is considered to be respectively less than, equal to, or greater than the second. This is unlike array_diff which uses an internal function for comparing the data.

element.name: array_udiff_assoc
element.description: array_udiff_assoc returns an containing all the values from array1 that are not present in any of the other arguments. Note that the keys are used in the comparison unlike array_diff and array_udiff . The comparison of arrays' data is performed by using an user-supplied callback. In this aspect the behaviour is opposite to the behaviour of array_diff_assoc which uses internal function for comparison.

element.name: array_udiff_uassoc
element.description: array_udiff_uassoc returns an containing all the values from array1 that are not present in any of the other arguments. Note that the keys are used in the comparison unlike array_diff and array_udiff . The comparison of arrays' data is performed by using an user-supplied callback : data_compare_func . In this aspect the behaviour is opposite to the behaviour of array_diff_assoc which uses internal function for comparison. The comparison of keys (indices) is done also by the callback function key_compare_func . This behaviour is unlike what array_udiff_assoc does, since the latter compares the indices by using an internal function.

element.name: array_uintersect
element.description: array_uintersect returns an array containing all the values of array1 that are present in all the arguments. The data is compared by using a callback function.

element.name: array_uintersect_assoc
element.description: array_uintersect_assoc returns an array containing all the values of array1 that are present in all the arguments. Note that the keys are used in the comparison unlike in array_uintersect . The data is compared by using a callback function.

element.name: array_uintersect_uassoc
element.description: array_uintersect_uassoc returns an array containing all the values of array1 that are present in all the arguments. Note that the keys are used in the comparison unlike in array_uintersect . Both the data and the indexes are compared by using a callback functions.

element.name: array_unique
element.description: array_unique takes input array and returns a new array without duplicate values.

element.name: array_unshift
element.description: array_unshift prepends passed elements to the front of the array . Note that the list of elements is prepended as a whole, so that the prepended elements stay in the same order. All numerical array keys will be modified to start counting from zero while literal keys won't be touched.

element.name: array_values
element.description: array_values returns all the values from the input array and indexes numerically the array.

element.name: array_walk
element.description: If funcname needs to be working with the actual values of the array, specify the first parameter of funcname as a . Then, any changes made to those elements will be made in the original array itself.

element.name: array_walk_recursive
element.description: If funcname needs to be working with the actual values of the array, specify the first parameter of funcname as a . Then, any changes made to those elements will be made in the original array itself.

element.name: arsort
element.description: This function sorts an array such that array indices maintain their correlation with the array elements they are associated with. This is used mainly when sorting associative arrays where the actual element order is significant.

element.name: asort
element.description: This function sorts an array such that array indices maintain their correlation with the array elements they are associated with. This is used mainly when sorting associative arrays where the actual element order is significant.

element.name: compact
element.description: compact takes a variable number of parameters. Each parameter can be either a string containing the name of the variable, or an array of variable names. The array can contain other arrays of variable names inside it; compact handles it recursively.

element.name: count
element.description: Returns the number of elements in var , which is typically an , since anything other than objects will have one element.

element.name: current
element.description: Every array has an internal pointer to its "current" element, which is initialized to the first element inserted into the array.

element.name: each
element.description: Returns the current key and value pair from the array array and advances the array cursor. This pair is returned in a four-element array, with the keys , , , and . Elements and contain the key name of the array element, and and contain the data.

element.name: end
element.description: end advances array 's internal pointer to the last element, and returns its value.

element.name: extract
element.description: This function is used to import variables from an array into the current symbol table. It takes an associative array var_array and treats keys as variable names and values as variable values. For each key/value pair it will create a variable in the current symbol table, subject to extract_type and prefix parameters.

element.name: in_array
element.description: Searches haystack for needle and returns if it is found in the array, otherwise.

element.name: key
element.description: key returns the index element of the current array position.

element.name: krsort
element.description: Sorts an array by key in reverse order, maintaining key to data correlations. This is useful mainly for associative arrays.

element.name: ksort
element.description: Sorts an array by key, maintaining key to data correlations. This is useful mainly for associative arrays.

element.name: list
element.description: Like array , this is not really a function, but a language construct. list is used to assign a list of variables in one operation.

element.name: natcasesort
element.description: This function implements a sort algorithm that orders alphanumeric strings in the way a human being would while maintaining key/value associations. This is described as a "natural ordering".

element.name: natsort
element.description: This function implements a sort algorithm that orders alphanumeric strings in the way a human being would while maintaining key/value associations. This is described as a "natural ordering". An example of the difference between this algorithm and the regular computer string sorting algorithms (used in sort ) can be seen below:

element.name: next
element.description: Returns the array value in the next place that's pointed to by the internal array pointer, or if there are no more elements.

element.name: prev
element.description: Returns the array value in the previous place that's pointed to by the internal array pointer, or if there are no more elements. If the array contains empty elements then this function will return for these elements as well. To properly traverse an array which may contain empty elements see the each function.

element.name: range
element.description: range returns an array of elements from low to high , inclusive. If low > high, the sequence will be from high to low.

element.name: reset
element.description: reset rewinds array 's internal pointer to the first element and returns the value of the first array element, or if the array is empty.

element.name: rsort
element.description: This function sorts an array in reverse order (highest to lowest).

element.name: shuffle
element.description: This function shuffles (randomizes the order of the elements in) an array.

element.name: sort
element.description: This function sorts an array. Elements will be arranged from lowest to highest when this function has completed.

element.name: uasort
element.description: This function sorts an array such that array indices maintain their correlation with the array elements they are associated with. This is used mainly when sorting associative arrays where the actual element order is significant. The comparison function is user-defined.

element.name: uksort
element.description: uksort will sort the keys of an array using a user-supplied comparison function. If the array you wish to sort needs to be sorted by some non-trivial criteria, you should use this function.

element.name: usort
element.description: This function will sort an array by its values using a user-supplied comparison function. If the array you wish to sort needs to be sorted by some non-trivial criteria, you should use this function.

element.name: bcadd
element.description: Adds the left_operand to the right_operand and returns the sum in a string. The optional scale parameter is used to set the number of digits after the decimal place in the result.

element.name: bccomp
element.description: Compares the left_operand to the right_operand and returns the result as an integer. The optional scale parameter is used to set the number of digits after the decimal place which will be used in the comparison. The return value is 0 if the two operands are equal. If the left_operand is larger than the right_operand the return value is +1 and if the left_operand is less than the right_operand the return value is -1.

element.name: bcdiv
element.description: Divides the left_operand by the right_operand and returns the result. The optional scale sets the number of digits after the decimal place in the result, which defaults to 0.

element.name: bcmod
element.description: Get the modulus of the left_operand using modulus .

element.name: bcmul
element.description: Multiply the left_operand by the right_operand and returns the result. The optional scale sets the number of digits after the decimal place in the result.

element.name: bcpow
element.description: Raise x to the power y . The optional scale can be used to set the number of digits after the decimal place in the result.

element.name: bcpowmod
element.description: Use the fast-exponentiation method to raise x to the power y with respect to the modulus modulus . The optional scale can be used to set the number of digits after the decimal place in the result.

element.name: bcscale
element.description: This function sets the default scale parameter for all subsequent bc math functions that do not explicitly specify a scale parameter.

element.name: bcsqrt
element.description: Return the square root of the operand . The optional scale parameter sets the number of digits after the decimal place in the result.

element.name: bcsub
element.description: Subtracts the right_operand from the left_operand and returns the result in a string. The optional scale parameter is used to set the number of digits after the decimal place in the result.

element.name: bzclose
element.description: Closes the given bzip2 file pointer.

property.name: bz
property.description: The file pointer. It must be valid and must point to a file successfully opened by .

element.name: bzcompress
element.description: bzcompress compresses the given string and returns it as bzip2 encoded data.

property.name: source
property.description: The string to compress.

property.name: blocksize
property.description: Specifies the blocksize used during compression and should be a number from 1 to 9 with 9 giving the best compression, but using more resources to do so. defaults to 4.

property.name: workfactor
property.description: Controls how the compression phase behaves when presented with worst case, highly repetitive, input data. The value can be between 0 and 250 with 0 being a special case and 30 being the default value. Regardless of the , the generated output is the same.

element.name: bzdecompress
element.description: bzdecompress decompresses the given string containing bzip2 encoded data.

property.name: small
property.description: If , an alternative decompression algorithm will be used which uses less memory (the maximum memory requirement drops to around 2300K) but works at roughly half the speed. See the for more information about this feature.

element.name: bzerrno
element.description: Returns the error number of any bzip2 error returned by the given file pointer.

element.name: bzerror
element.description: Returns the error number and error string of any bzip2 error returned by the given file pointer.

element.name: bzerrstr
element.description: Gets the error string of any bzip2 error returned by the given file pointer.

element.name: bzflush
element.description: Forces a write of all buffered bzip2 data for the file pointer bz .

element.name: bzopen
element.description: bzopen opens a bzip2 (.bz2) file for reading or writing.

property.name: mode
property.description: Similar to the function ('r' for read, 'w' for write, etc.).

element.name: bzread
element.description: bzread reads from the given bzip2 file pointer.

element.name: bzwrite
element.description: bzwrite writes a string into the given bzip2 file stream.

property.name: data
property.description: The written data.

element.name: DOTNET::DOTNET
element.description: DOTNET class constructor. assembly_name specifies which assembly should be loaded, and class_name specifices which class in that assembly to instantiate. You may optionally specify a codepage to use for unicode string transformations; see the class for more details on code pages.

element.name: VARIANT::VARIANT
element.description: VARIANT class constructor. Parameters:

element.name: com_addref
element.description: Increases the components reference counter.

element.name: com_create_guid
element.description: Generates a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID) and returns it as a string. A GUID is generated in the same way as DCE UUID's, except that the Microsoft convention is to enclose a GUID in curly braces.

element.name: com_event_sink
element.description: Instructs COM to sink events generated by comobject into the PHP object sinkobject . PHP will attempt to use the default dispinterface type specified by the typelibrary associated with comobject , but you may override this choice by setting sinkinterface to the name of the dispinterface that you want to use.

element.name: com_get
element.description: Returns the value of the property of the COM component referenced by com_object . Returns on error.

element.name: com_get_active_object
element.description: com_get_active_object is similar to creating a new instance of a object, except that it will only return an object to your script if the object is already running. OLE applications use something known as the Running Object Table to allow well-known applications to be launched only once; this function exposes the COM library function GetActiveObject() to get a handle on a running instance.

element.name: com_invoke
element.description: com_invoke invokes the method named function_name of the COM component referenced by com_object . com_invoke returns on error, returns the function_name 's return value on success. All the extra parameters function_parameters are passed to the method function_name .

element.name: com_isenum
element.description: Checks to see if a COM object can be enumerated using the method hack. Returns if it can, if it cannot. See class for more details on these methods.

element.name: com_load
element.description: Equivalent to using the operator to create an instance of the class. You should do that instead of calling this function.

element.name: com_load_typelib
element.description: Loads a type-library and registers its constants in the engine, as though they were defined using define . The case_insensitive behaves in the same way as the parameter with the same name in the define function.

element.name: com_message_pump
element.description: This function will sleep for up to timeoutms milliseconds, or until a message arrives in the queue. If a message or messages arrives before the timeout, they will be dispatched, and the function will return . If the timeout occurs and no messages were processed, the return value will be . If you do not specify a value for timeoutms , then 0 will be assumed. A 0 value means that no waiting will be performed; if there are messages pending they will be dispatched as before; if there are no messages pending, the function will return immediately without sleeping.

element.name: com_print_typeinfo
element.description: The purpose of this function is to help generate a skeleton class for use as an event sink. You may also use it to generate a dump of any COM object, provided that it supports enough of the introspection interfaces, and that you know the name of the interface you want to display.

element.name: com_release
element.description: Decreases the components reference counter.

element.name: com_set
element.description: Sets the value of the property of the COM component referenced by com_object . Returns the newly set value if succeeded, on error.

element.name: variant_abs
element.description: Returns the absolute value of val .

element.name: variant_add
element.description: Adds left to right using the following rules (taken from the MSDN library), which correspond to those of Visual Basic:

element.name: variant_and
element.description: Performs a bitwise AND operation, according to the following truth table; note that this is slightly different from a regular AND operation.

element.name: variant_cast
element.description: This function makes a copy of variant and then performs a variant cast operation to force the copy to have the type given by type . type should be one of the constants.

element.name: variant_cat
element.description: Concatenates left with right and returns the result.

element.name: variant_cmp
element.description: Compares left with right and returns one of the following values:

element.name: variant_date_from_timestamp
element.description: Converts timestamp from a unix timestamp value into a variant of type . This allows easier interopability between the unix-ish parts of PHP and COM.

element.name: variant_date_to_timestamp
element.description: Converts variant from a (or similar) value into a unix timestamp. This allows easier interopability between the unix-ish parts of PHP and COM.

element.name: variant_div
element.description: Divides left by right and returns the result, subject to the following rules:

element.name: variant_eqv
element.description: If each bit in left is equal to the corresponding bit in right then is returned, otherwise is returned.

element.name: variant_fix
element.description: If variant is negative, then the first negative integer greater than or equal to the variant is returned, otherwise returns the integer portion of the value of variant .

element.name: variant_get_type
element.description: This function returns an integer value that indicates the type of variant , which can be an instance of , or classes. The return value can be compared to one of the constants.

element.name: variant_idiv
element.description: Converts left and right to integer values, and then performs integer division according the following rules:

element.name: variant_imp
element.description: Performs a bitwise implication operation, according to the following truth table:

element.name: variant_int
element.description: If variant is negative, then the first negative integer greater than or equal to the variant is returned, otherwise returns the integer portion of the value of variant .

element.name: variant_mod
element.description: Divides left by right and returns the remainder.

element.name: variant_mul
element.description: Multiplies left by right and returns the result, subject to the following rules:

element.name: variant_neg
element.description: Performs logical negation of variant and returns the result.

element.name: variant_not
element.description: Performs bitwise not negation on variant and returns the result. If variant is , the result will also be .

element.name: variant_or
element.description: Performs a bitwise OR operation, according to the following truth table; note that this is slightly different from a regular OR operation.

element.name: variant_pow
element.description: Returns the result of left to the power of right .

element.name: variant_round
element.description: Returns the value of variant rounded to decimals decimal places.

element.name: variant_set
element.description: Converts value to a variant and assigns it to the variant object; no new variant object is created, and the old value of variant is freed/released.

element.name: variant_set_type
element.description: This function is similar to variant_cast except that the variant is modified "in-place"; no new variant is created. The parameters for this function have identical meaning to those of variant_cast .

element.name: variant_sub
element.description: Subtracts right from left using the following rules:

element.name: variant_xor
element.description: Performs a logical exclusion, according to the following truth table:

element.name: curl_close
element.description: This function closes a CURL session and frees all resources. The CURL handle, ch , is also deleted.

element.name: curl_errno
element.description: Returns the error number for the last cURL operation on the resource ch , or (zero) if no error occurred.

element.name: curl_error
element.description: Returns a clear text error message for the last cURL operation on the resource ch , or (the empty string) if no error occurred.

element.name: curl_exec
element.description: This function should be called after you initialize a CURL session and all the options for the session are set. Its purpose is simply to execute the predefined CURL session (given by the ch ).

element.name: curl_getinfo
element.description: Returns information about the last transfer, opt may be one of the following:

element.name: curl_init
element.description: The curl_init will initialize a new session and return a CURL handle for use with the curl_setopt , curl_exec , and curl_close functions. If the optional url parameter is supplied then the CURLOPT_URL option will be set to the value of the parameter. You can manually set this using the curl_setopt function.

element.name: curl_setopt
element.description: Set an option for a CURL session identified by the ch parameter. option specifies which option to set, and value specifies the value for the option given.

element.name: curl_version
element.description: The curl_version function returns a string containing the current CURL version.

element.name: cal_days_in_month
element.description: This function will return the number of days in the month of year for the specified calendar .

element.name: cal_from_jd
element.description: cal_from_jd converts the Julian day given in jd into a date of the specified calendar . Supported calendar values are , , and .

element.name: cal_info
element.description: cal_info returns information on the specified calendar .

element.name: cal_to_jd
element.description: cal_to_jd calculates the Julian day count for a date in the specified calendar . Supported calendar s are , , and .

element.name: easter_date
element.description: Returns the Unix timestamp corresponding to midnight on Easter of the given year.

element.name: easter_days
element.description: Returns the number of days after March 21 on which Easter falls for a given year. If no year is specified, the current year is assumed.

element.name: frenchtojd
element.description: Converts a date from the French Republican Calendar to a Julian Day Count.

element.name: gregoriantojd
element.description: Valid Range for Gregorian Calendar 4714 B.C. to 9999 A.D.

element.name: jddayofweek
element.description: Returns the day of the week. Can return a string or an integer depending on the mode.

element.name: jdmonthname
element.description: Returns a string containing a month name. mode tells this function which calendar to convert the Julian Day Count to, and what type of month names are to be returned.

element.name: jdtofrench
element.description: Converts a Julian Day Count to the French Republican Calendar.

element.name: jdtogregorian
element.description: Converts Julian Day Count to a string containing the Gregorian date in the format of "month/day/year".

element.name: jdtojewish
element.description: Converts a Julian Day Count to the Jewish Calendar.

element.name: jdtojulian
element.description: Converts Julian Day Count to a string containing the Julian Calendar Date in the format of "month/day/year".

element.name: jdtounix
element.description: This function will return a Unix timestamp corresponding to the Julian Day given in jday or if jday is not inside the Unix epoch (Gregorian years between 1970 and 2037 or 2440588 < = jday < = 2465342 ). The time returned is localtime (and not GMT).

element.name: jewishtojd
element.description: Although this function can handle dates all the way back to the year 1 (3761 B.C.), such use may not be meaningful. The Jewish calendar has been in use for several thousand years, but in the early days there was no formula to determine the start of a month. A new month was started when the new moon was first observed.

element.name: juliantojd
element.description: Valid Range for Julian Calendar 4713 B.C. to 9999 A.D.

element.name: unixtojd
element.description: Return the Julian Day for a Unix timestamp (seconds since 1.1.1970), or for the current day if no timestamp is given.

element.name: call_user_method
element.description: The call_user_method function is deprecated as of PHP 4.1.0, use the call_user_func variety with the syntax instead.

element.name: call_user_method_array
element.description: The call_user_method_array function is deprecated as of PHP 4.1.0, use the call_user_func_array variety with the syntax instead.

element.name: class_exists
element.description: This function returns if the class given by class_name has been defined, otherwise.

element.name: get_class
element.description: This function returns the name of the class of which the object obj is an instance. Returns if obj is not an object.

element.name: get_class_methods
element.description: This function returns an array of method names defined for the class specified by class_name .

element.name: get_class_vars
element.description: This function will return an associative array of default public properties of the class. The resulting array elements are in the form of varname => value .

element.name: get_declared_classes
element.description: This function returns an array of the names of the declared classes in the current script.

element.name: get_declared_interfaces
element.description: This function returns an array of the names of the declared interfaces in the current script.

element.name: get_object_vars
element.description: This function returns an associative array of defined object properties for the specified object obj .

element.name: get_parent_class
element.description: If obj is an object, returns the name of the parent class of the class of which obj is an instance.

element.name: interface_exists
element.description: This function returns if the interface given by interface_name has been defined, otherwise.

element.name: is_a
element.description: This function returns if the object is of this class or has this class as one of its parents, otherwise.

element.name: is_subclass_of
element.description: This function returns if the object object , belongs to a class which is a subclass of class_name , otherwise.

element.name: method_exists
element.description: This function returns if the method given by method_name has been defined for the given object , otherwise.

element.name: classkit_import
element.description: The filename of the class method definitions to import

element.name: classkit_method_add
element.description: The class to which this method will be added

property.name: methodname
property.description: The name of the method to add

property.name: args
property.description: Comma-delimited list of arguments for the newly-created method

property.name: code
property.description: The code to be evaluated when is called

element.name: classkit_method_copy
element.description: Destination class for copied method

property.name: dMethod
property.description: Destination method name

property.name: sClass
property.description: Source class of the method to copy

property.name: sMethod
property.description: Name of the method to copy from the source class. If this parameter is omitted, the value of is assumed.

element.name: classkit_method_redefine
element.description: The class in which to redefine the method

element.name: classkit_method_remove
element.description: The class in which to remove the method

element.name: classkit_method_rename
element.description: The class in which to rename the method

property.name: newname
property.description: The new name to give to the renamed method

element.name: cpdf_add_annotation
element.description: The cpdf_add_annotation adds a note with the lower left corner at ( llx , lly ) and the upper right corner at ( urx , ury ).

element.name: cpdf_add_outline
element.description: The cpdf_add_outline function adds a bookmark with text text that points to the current page.

element.name: cpdf_arc
element.description: The cpdf_arc function draws an arc with center at point ( x_coor , y_coor ) and radius radius , starting at angle start and ending at angle end .

element.name: cpdf_begin_text
element.description: The cpdf_begin_text function starts a text section. The created text section must be ended with cpdf_end_text .

element.name: cpdf_circle
element.description: The cpdf_circle function draws a circle with center at point ( x_coor , y_coor ) and radius radius .

element.name: cpdf_clip
element.description: The cpdf_clip function clips all drawing to the current path.

element.name: cpdf_close
element.description: The cpdf_close function closes the pdf document. This should be the last function even after cpdf_finalize , cpdf_output_buffer and cpdf_save_to_file .

element.name: cpdf_closepath
element.description: The cpdf_closepath function closes the current path.

element.name: cpdf_closepath_fill_stroke
element.description: The cpdf_closepath_fill_stroke function closes, fills the interior of the current path with the current fill color and draws current path.

element.name: cpdf_closepath_stroke
element.description: The cpdf_closepath_stroke function is a combination of cpdf_closepath and cpdf_stroke . Then clears the path.

element.name: cpdf_continue_text
element.description: The cpdf_continue_text function outputs the string in text in the next line.

element.name: cpdf_curveto
element.description: The cpdf_curveto function draws a Bezier curve from the current point to the point ( x3 , y3 ) using ( x1 , y1 ) and ( x2 , y2 ) as control points.

element.name: cpdf_end_text
element.description: The cpdf_end_text function ends a text section which was started with cpdf_begin_text .

element.name: cpdf_fill
element.description: The cpdf_fill function fills the interior of the current path with the current fill color.

element.name: cpdf_fill_stroke
element.description: The cpdf_fill_stroke function fills the interior of the current path with the current fill color and draws current path.

element.name: cpdf_finalize
element.description: The cpdf_finalize function ends the document. You still have to call cpdf_close .

element.name: cpdf_finalize_page
element.description: The cpdf_finalize_page function ends the page with page number page_number .

element.name: cpdf_global_set_document_limits
element.description: The cpdf_global_set_document_limits function sets several document limits. This function has to be called before cpdf_open to take effect. It sets the limits for any document open afterwards.

element.name: cpdf_import_jpeg
element.description: The cpdf_import_jpeg function opens an image stored in the file with the name file_name . The format of the image has to be jpeg. The image is placed on the current page at position ( x_coor , y_coor ). The image is rotated by angle degrees. gsave should be non-zero to allow this function to operate correctly.

element.name: cpdf_lineto
element.description: The cpdf_lineto function draws a line from the current point to the point with coordinates ( x_coor , y_coor ).

element.name: cpdf_moveto
element.description: The cpdf_moveto function set the current point to the coordinates x_coor and y_coor .

element.name: cpdf_newpath
element.description: The cpdf_newpath starts a new path on the document given by the pdf_document parameter.

element.name: cpdf_open
element.description: The cpdf_open function opens a new pdf document. The first parameter turns document compression on if it is unequal to 0. The second optional parameter sets the file in which the document is written. If it is omitted the document is created in memory and can either be written into a file with the cpdf_save_to_file or written to standard output with cpdf_output_buffer .

element.name: cpdf_output_buffer
element.description: The cpdf_output_buffer function outputs the pdf document to stdout. The document has to be created in memory which is the case if cpdf_open has been called with no filename parameter.

element.name: cpdf_page_init
element.description: The cpdf_page_init function starts a new page with height height and width width . The page has number page_number and orientation orientation . orientation can be 0 for portrait and 1 for landscape. The last optional parameter unit sets the unit for the coordinate system. The value should be the number of postscript points per unit. Since one inch is equal to 72 points, a value of 72 would set the unit to one inch. The default is also 72.

element.name: cpdf_place_inline_image
element.description: The cpdf_place_inline_image function places an image created with the PHP image functions on the page at position ( x_coor , y_coor ). The image can be scaled at the same time.

element.name: cpdf_rect
element.description: The cpdf_rect function draws a rectangle with its lower left corner at point ( x_coor , y_coor ). This width is set to width . This height is set to height .

element.name: cpdf_restore
element.description: The cpdf_restore function restores the environment saved with cpdf_save . It works like the postscript command grestore. Very useful if you want to translate or rotate an object without effecting other objects.

element.name: cpdf_rlineto
element.description: The cpdf_rlineto function draws a line from the current point to the relative point with coordinates ( x_coor , y_coor ).

element.name: cpdf_rmoveto
element.description: The cpdf_rmoveto function set the current point relative to the coordinates x_coor and y_coor .

element.name: cpdf_rotate
element.description: The cpdf_rotate function set the rotation in degrees to angle .

element.name: cpdf_save
element.description: The cpdf_save function saves the current environment. It works like the postscript command gsave. Very useful if you want to translate or rotate an object without effecting other objects.

element.name: cpdf_save_to_file
element.description: The cpdf_save_to_file function outputs the pdf document into a file if it has been created in memory.

element.name: cpdf_scale
element.description: The cpdf_scale function set the scaling factor in both directions.

element.name: cpdf_set_char_spacing
element.description: The cpdf_set_char_spacing function sets the spacing between characters.

element.name: cpdf_set_creator
element.description: The cpdf_set_creator function sets the creator of a pdf document.

element.name: cpdf_set_current_page
element.description: The cpdf_set_current_page function set the page on which all operations are performed. One can switch between pages until a page is finished with cpdf_finalize_page .

element.name: cpdf_set_font
element.description: The cpdf_set_font function sets the current font face, font size and encoding. Currently only the standard postscript fonts are supported.

element.name: cpdf_set_horiz_scaling
element.description: The cpdf_set_horiz_scaling function sets the horizontal scaling to scale percent.

element.name: cpdf_set_keywords
element.description: The cpdf_set_keywords function sets the keywords of a pdf document.

element.name: cpdf_set_leading
element.description: The cpdf_set_leading function sets the distance between text lines. This will be used if text is output by cpdf_continue_text .

element.name: cpdf_set_page_animation
element.description: The cpdf_set_page_animation function set the transition between following pages.

element.name: cpdf_set_subject
element.description: The cpdf_set_subject function sets the subject of a pdf document.

element.name: cpdf_set_text_matrix
element.description: The cpdf_set_text_matrix function sets a matrix which describes a transformation applied on the current text font.

element.name: cpdf_set_text_pos
element.description: The cpdf_set_text_pos function sets the position of text for the next cpdf_show function call.

element.name: cpdf_set_text_rendering
element.description: The cpdf_set_text_rendering function determines how text is rendered.

element.name: cpdf_set_text_rise
element.description: The cpdf_set_text_rise function sets the text rising to value units.

element.name: cpdf_set_title
element.description: The cpdf_set_title function sets the title of a pdf document.

element.name: cpdf_set_word_spacing
element.description: The cpdf_set_word_spacing function sets the spacing between words.

element.name: cpdf_setdash
element.description: The cpdf_setdash function set the dash pattern white white units and black black units. If both are 0 a solid line is set.

element.name: cpdf_setflat
element.description: The cpdf_setflat function set the flatness to a value between 0 and 100.

element.name: cpdf_setgray
element.description: The cpdf_setgray function sets the current drawing and filling color to the given gray value.

element.name: cpdf_setgray_fill
element.description: The cpdf_setgray_fill function sets the current gray value to fill a path.

element.name: cpdf_setgray_stroke
element.description: The cpdf_setgray_stroke function sets the current drawing color to the given gray value.

element.name: cpdf_setlinecap
element.description: The cpdf_setlinecap function set the linecap parameter between a value of 0 and 2. 0 = butt end, 1 = round, 2 = projecting square.

element.name: cpdf_setlinejoin
element.description: The cpdf_setlinejoin function set the linejoin parameter between a value of 0 and 2. 0 = miter, 1 = round, 2 = bevel.

element.name: cpdf_setlinewidth
element.description: The cpdf_setlinewidth function set the line width to width .

element.name: cpdf_setmiterlimit
element.description: The cpdf_setmiterlimit function set the miter limit to a value greater or equal than 1.

element.name: cpdf_setrgbcolor
element.description: The cpdf_setrgbcolor function sets the current drawing and filling color to the given rgb color value.

element.name: cpdf_setrgbcolor_fill
element.description: The cpdf_setrgbcolor_fill function sets the current rgb color value to fill a path.

element.name: cpdf_setrgbcolor_stroke
element.description: The cpdf_setrgbcolor_stroke function sets the current drawing color to the given rgb color value.

element.name: cpdf_show
element.description: The cpdf_show function outputs the string in text at the current position.

element.name: cpdf_show_xy
element.description: The cpdf_show_xy function outputs the string text at position with coordinates ( x_coor , y_coor ).

element.name: cpdf_stringwidth
element.description: The cpdf_stringwidth function returns the width of the string in text . It requires a font to be set before.

element.name: cpdf_stroke
element.description: The cpdf_stroke function draws a line along current path.

element.name: cpdf_text
element.description: The cpdf_text function outputs the string text at position with coordinates ( x_coor , y_coor ).

element.name: cpdf_translate
element.description: The cpdf_translate function set the origin of coordinate system to the point ( x_coor , y_coor ).

element.name: crack_check
element.description: Performs an obscure check with the given password on the specified dictionary.

property.name: dictionary
property.description: The crack lib dictionary. If not specified, the last opened dictionary is used.

element.name: crack_closedict
element.description: crack_closedict closes the specified dictionary identifier.

property.name: dictionary
property.description: The dictionary to close. If not specified, the current directory is closed.

element.name: crack_getlastmessage
element.description: crack_getlastmessage returns the message from the last obscure check.

element.name: crack_opendict
element.description: crack_opendict opens the specified CrackLib dictionary for use with crack_check .

property.name: dictionary
property.description: The path to the Cracklib dictionary.

element.name: cybercash_decr
element.description: The function returns an associative array with the elements "errcode" and, if "errcode" is , "outbuff" (string), "outLth" (long) and "macbuff" (string).

element.name: cybercash_encr
element.description: The function returns an associative array with the elements "errcode" and, if "errcode" is , "outbuff" (string), "outLth" (long) and "macbuff" (string).

element.name: dbplus_add
element.description: This function will add a tuple to a relation. The tuple data is an array of attribute/value pairs to be inserted into the given relation . After successful execution the tuple array will contain the complete data of the newly created tuple, including all implicitly set domain fields like sequences.

element.name: dbplus_aql
element.description: dbplus_aql will execute an AQL query on the given server and dbpath .

element.name: dbplus_chdir
element.description: dbplus_chdir will change the virtual current directory where relation files will be looked for by dbplus_open . dbplus_chdir will return the absolute path of the current directory. Calling dbplus_chdir without giving any newdir may be used to query the current working directory.

element.name: dbplus_close
element.description: Calling dbplus_close will close a relation previously opened by dbplus_open .

element.name: dbplus_curr
element.description: dbplus_curr will read the data for the current tuple for the given relation and will pass it back as an associative array in tuple .

element.name: dbplus_errcode
element.description: dbplus_errcode returns a cleartext error string for the error code passed as errno of for the result code of the last db++ operation if no parameter is given.

element.name: dbplus_errno
element.description: dbplus_errno will return the error code returned by the last db++ operation.

element.name: dbplus_find
element.description: dbplus_find will place a constraint on the given relation. Further calls to functions like dbplus_curr or dbplus_next will only return tuples matching the given constraints.

element.name: dbplus_first
element.description: dbplus_curr will read the data for the first tuple for the given relation , make it the current tuple and pass it back as an associative array in tuple .

element.name: dbplus_flush
element.description: dbplus_flush will write all changes applied to relation since the last flush to disk.

element.name: dbplus_freealllocks
element.description: dbplus_freealllocks will free all tuple locks held by this client.

element.name: dbplus_freelock
element.description: dbplus_freelock will release a write lock on the given tuple previously obtained by dbplus_getlock .

element.name: dbplus_freerlocks
element.description: dbplus_freerlocks will free all tuple locks held on the given relation .

element.name: dbplus_getlock
element.description: dbplus_getlock will request a write lock on the specified tuple . It will return zero on success or a non-zero error code, especially DBPLUS_ERR_WLOCKED, on failure.

element.name: dbplus_getunique
element.description: dbplus_getunique will obtain a number guaranteed to be unique for the given relation and will pass it back in the variable given as uniqueid .

element.name: dbplus_last
element.description: dbplus_curr will read the data for the last tuple for the given relation , make it the current tuple and pass it back as an associative array in tuple .

element.name: dbplus_lockrel
element.description: dbplus_lockrel will request a write lock on the given relation. Other clients may still query the relation, but can't alter it while it is locked.

element.name: dbplus_next
element.description: dbplus_curr will read the data for the next tuple for the given relation , will make it the current tuple and will pass it back as an associative array in tuple .

element.name: dbplus_open
element.description: The relation file name will be opened. name can be either a file name or a relative or absolute path name. This will be mapped in any case to an absolute relation file path on a specific host machine and server.

element.name: dbplus_prev
element.description: dbplus_curr will read the data for the previous tuple for the given relation , will make it the current tuple and will pass it back as an associative array in tuple .

element.name: dbplus_rchperm
element.description: dbplus_rchperm will change access permissions as specified by mask , user and group . The values for these are operating system specific.

element.name: dbplus_rcreate
element.description: dbplus_rcreate will create a new relation named name . An existing relation by the same name will only be overwritten if the relation is currently not in use and overwrite is set to TRUE.

element.name: dbplus_rcrtexact
element.description: dbplus_rcrtexact will create an exact but empty copy of the given relation under a new name . An existing relation by the same name will only be overwritten if overwrite is and no other process is currently using the relation.

element.name: dbplus_rcrtlike
element.description: dbplus_rcrtexact will create an empty copy of the given relation under a new name , but with default indices. An existing relation by the same name will only be overwritten if overwrite is and no other process is currently using the relation.

element.name: dbplus_resolve
element.description: dbplus_resolve will try to resolve the given relation_name and find out internal server id, real hostname and the database path on this host. The function will return an array containing these values under the keys 'sid', 'host' and 'host_path' or on error.

element.name: dbplus_rkeys
element.description: dbplus_rkeys will replace the current primary key for relation with the combination of domains specified by domlist .

element.name: dbplus_ropen
element.description: dbplus_ropen will open the relation file locally for quick access without any client/server overhead. Access is read only and only dbplus_current and dbplus_next may be applied to the returned relation.

element.name: dbplus_rquery
element.description: dbplus_rquery performs a local (raw) AQL query using an AQL interpreter embedded into the db++ client library. dbplus_rquery is faster than dbplus_aql but will work on local data only.

element.name: dbplus_rrename
element.description: dbplus_rrename will change the name of relation to name .

element.name: dbplus_rsecindex
element.description: dbplus_rsecindex will create a new secondary index for relation with consists of the domains specified by domlist and is of type type

element.name: dbplus_runlink
element.description: dbplus_unlink will close and remove the relation .

element.name: dbplus_rzap
element.description: dbplus_rzap will remove all tuples from relation .

element.name: dbplus_tcl
element.description: A db++ server will prepare a TCL interpreter for each client connection. This interpreter will enable the server to execute TCL code provided by the client as a sort of stored procedures to improve the performance of database operations by avoiding client/server data transfers and context switches.

element.name: dbplus_tremove
element.description: dbplus_tremove removes tuple from relation if it perfectly matches a tuple within the relation. current , if given, will contain the data of the new current tuple after calling dbplus_tremove .

element.name: dbplus_unlockrel
element.description: dbplus_unlockrel will release a write lock previously obtained by dbplus_lockrel .

element.name: dbplus_unselect
element.description: Calling dbplus_unselect will remove a constraint previously set by dbplus_find on relation .

element.name: dbplus_update
element.description: dbplus_update replaces the tuple given by old with the data from new if and only if old completely matches a tuple within relation .

element.name: dbplus_xlockrel
element.description: dbplus_xlockrel will request an exclusive lock on relation preventing even read access from other clients.

element.name: dbplus_xunlockrel
element.description: dbplus_xunlockrel will release an exclusive lock on relation previously obtained by dbplus_xlockrel .

element.name: dbmclose
element.description: Unlocks and closes the specified database.

element.name: dbmdelete
element.description: Deletes the value for key in the database.

element.name: dbmexists
element.description: Returns if there is a value associated with the key .

element.name: dbmfetch
element.description: Returns the value associated with key .

element.name: dbmfirstkey
element.description: Returns the first key in the database. Note that no particular order is guaranteed since the database may be built using a hash-table, which doesn't guarantee any ordering.

element.name: dbminsert
element.description: Adds the value to the database with the specified key.

element.name: dbmnextkey
element.description: Returns the next key after key . By calling dbmfirstkey followed by successive calls to dbmnextkey it is possible to visit every key/value pair in the dbm database. For example:

element.name: dbmopen
element.description: The first argument is the full-path filename of the DBM file to be opened and the second is the file open mode which is one of "r", "n", "c" or "w" for read-only, new (implies read-write, and most likely will truncate an already-existing database of the same name), create (implies read-write, and will not truncate an already-existing database of the same name) and read-write respectively.

element.name: dbmreplace
element.description: Replaces the value for the specified key in the database.

element.name: appendChild
element.description: This functions appends a child to an existing list of children or creates a new list of children. The child can be created with e.g. , etc. or simply by using any other node.

property.name: newnode
property.description: The appended child.

element.name: appendData
element.description: Append the string data to the end of the character data of the node.

element.name: cloneNode
element.description: Creates a copy of the node.

property.name: deep
property.description: Indicates whether to copy all descendant nodes. This parameter is defaulted to .

element.description: This function creates a new instance of class .

element.name: createAttributeNS
element.description: This function creates a new instance of class .

property.name: namespaceURI
property.description: The URI of the namespace.

property.name: qualifiedName
property.description: The tag name and prefix of the attribute, as .

element.name: createCDATASection
element.description: This function creates a new instance of class .

element.name: createComment
element.description: This function creates a new instance of class .

element.name: createDocument
element.description: Creates a object of the specified type with its document element.

property.name: namespaceURI
property.description: The namespace URI of the document element to create.

property.name: qualifiedName
property.description: The qualified name of the document element to create.

property.name: doctype
property.description: The type of document to create or .

element.name: createDocumentFragment
element.description: This function creates a new instance of class .

element.name: createDocumentType
element.description: Creates an empty object. Entity declarations and notations are not made available. Entity reference expansions and default attribute additions do not occur.

property.name: publicId
property.description: The external subset public identifier.

property.name: systemId
property.description: The external subset system identifier.

element.name: createElement
element.description: This function creates a new instance of class .

property.name: value
property.description: The value of the element. By default, an empty element will be created. You can also set the value later with .

element.name: createElementNS

element.name: createEntityReference
element.description: This function creates a new instance of class .

element.name: createProcessingInstruction

property.name: target
property.description: The target of the processing instruction.

property.name: data
property.description: The content of the processing instruction.

element.name: createTextNode
element.description: This function creates a new instance of class .

element.name: deleteData
element.description: Deletes count characters starting from position offset .

property.name: count
property.description: The number of characters to delete. If the sum of and exceeds the length, then all characters to the end of the data are deleted.

element.name: dom_import_simplexml
element.description: This function takes the node node of class and makes it into a node. This new object can then be used as a native node.

property.name: node
property.description: The node.

element.name: evaluate
element.description: Executes the given XPath expression and returns a typed result if possible.

property.name: expression
property.description: The XPath expression to execute.

property.name: contextnode
property.description: The optional can be specified for doing relative XPath queries. By default, the queries are relative to the root element.

element.name: getAttribute
element.description: Gets the value of the attribute with name name for the current node.

element.name: getAttributeNS
element.description: Gets the value of the attribute in namespace namespaceURI with local name localName for the current node.

property.name: localName
property.description: The local name.

element.name: getAttributeNode
element.description: Returns the attribute node with name name for the current element.

element.name: getAttributeNodeNS
element.description: Returns the attribute node in namespace namespaceURI with local name localName for the current node.

element.name: getElementById
element.description: This function is similar to but searches for an element with a given id.

property.name: elementId
property.description: The unique id value for an element.

element.name: getElementsByTagName
element.description: This function returns a new instance of the class of all descendant elements with a given tag name , in the order in which they are encountered in a preorder traversal of this element tree.

element.name: getElementsByTagNameNS
element.description: This function fetch all the descendant elements with a given localName and namespaceURI .

element.name: getNamedItem
element.description: Retrieves a node specified by its .

element.name: getNamedItemNS
element.description: Retrieves a node specified by localName and namespaceURI .

element.name: hasAttribute
element.description: Indicates whether attribute named name exists as a member of the element.

element.name: hasAttributeNS
element.description: Indicates whether attribute in namespace namespaceURI named localName exists as a member of the element.

element.name: hasAttributes
element.description: This method checks if the node has attributes. The tested node have to be an .

element.name: hasChildNodes
element.description: This function checks if the node has children.

element.name: hasFeature
element.description: Test if the DOM implementation implements a specific feature .

property.name: feature
property.description: The feature to test.

property.name: version
property.description: The version number of the to test. In level 2, this can be either or .

element.name: importNode
element.description: This function returns a copy of the node to import and associates it with the current document.

property.name: importedNode
property.description: The node to import.

element.name: insertBefore
element.description: This function inserts a new node right before the reference node. If you plan to do further modifications on the appended child you must use the returned node.

property.name: refnode
property.description: The reference node. If not supplied, is appended to the children.

element.name: insertData
element.description: Inserts string data at position offset .

element.name: isId
element.description: This function checks if the attribute is a defined ID.

element.name: isSameNode
element.description: This function indicates if two nodes are the same node. The comparison is based on content

property.name: node
property.description: The compared node.

element.name: isSupported
element.description: Checks if the asked feature is supported for the specified version .

element.name: isWhitespaceInElementContent
element.description: Indicates whether this text node contains whitespace. The text node is determined to contain whitespace in element content during the load of the document.

element.name: item
element.description: Retrieves a node specified by index within the object.

property.name: index
property.description: Index of the node into the collection.

element.name: load
element.description: Loads an XML document from a file.

element.name: loadHTML
element.description: The function parses the HTML contained in the string source . Unlike loading XML, HTML does not have to be well-formed to load. This function may also be called statically to load and create a object. The static invocation may be used when no properties need to be set prior to loading.

element.name: loadHTMLFile
element.description: The function parses the HTML document in the file named filename . Unlike loading XML, HTML does not have to be well-formed to load.

element.name: loadXML
element.description: Loads an XML document from a string.

element.name: lookupNamespaceURI
element.description: Gets the namespace URI of the node based on the prefix .

property.name: prefix
property.description: The prefix of the namespace.

element.name: lookupPrefix
element.description: Gets the namespace prefix of the node based on the namespace URI.

element.name: normalize
element.description: Normalizes the node.

element.name: query
element.description: Executes the given XPath expression .

element.name: registerNamespace
element.description: Registers the namespaceURI and prefix with the DOMXpath object.

element.name: relaxNGValidate
element.description: Performs validation on the document based on the given RNG schema.

element.name: relaxNGValidateSource
element.description: Performs validation on the document based on the given RNG source.

element.name: removeAttribute
element.description: Removes attribute named name from the element.

element.name: removeAttributeNS
