element.description: Removes attribute is namespace namespaceURI named localName from the element.

element.name: removeAttributeNode
element.description: Removes attribute oldnode from the element.

property.name: oldnode
property.description: The attribute node.

element.name: removeChild
element.description: This functions removes a child from a list of children.

property.name: oldnode
property.description: The removed child.

element.name: replaceChild
element.description: This function replaces the child oldnode with the passed new node. If the new node is already a child it will not be added a second time. If the replacement succeeds the old node is returned.

element.name: replaceData
element.description: Replace count characters starting from position offset with data .

element.name: save
element.description: Creates an XML document from the DOM representation. This function is usually called after building a new dom document from scratch as in the example below.

element.name: saveHTML
element.description: Creates an HTML document from the DOM representation. This function is usually called after building a new dom document from scratch as in the example below.

element.name: saveHTMLFile
element.description: Creates an HTML document from the DOM representation. This function is usually called after building a new dom document from scratch as in the example below.

element.name: saveXML
element.description: Creates an XML document from the DOM representation. This function is usually called after building a new dom document from scratch as in the example below.

property.name: node
property.description: Use this parameter to output only a specific node without XML declaration rather than the entire document.

element.name: schemaValidate
element.description: Validates a document based on a the given schema file.

element.name: schemaValidateSource
element.description: Validates a document based on a schema defined in the given string.

element.name: setAttribute
element.description: Sets an attribute with name name to the given value. If the attribute does not exist, it will be created.

element.name: setAttributeNS
element.description: Sets an attribute with namespace namespaceURI and name name to the given value. If the attribute does not exist, it will be created.

element.name: setAttributeNode
element.description: Adds new attribute node attr to element.

property.name: attr
property.description: The attribute node.

element.name: setAttributeNodeNS
element.description: Adds new attribute node attr to element.

element.name: splitText
element.description: Breaks this node into two nodes at the specified offset , keeping both in the tree as siblings.

element.name: substringData
element.description: Returns the specified substring.

element.name: validate
element.description: Validates the document based on its DTD.

element.name: xinclude
element.description: This method substitutes in a DOMDocument object.

property.name: options
property.description: . Available since PHP 5.1.0 and Libxml 2.6.7.

element.name: DomAttribute->name
element.description: This function returns the name of the attribute.

element.name: DomAttribute->specified
element.description: Check DOM standard for a detailed explanation.

element.name: DomAttribute->value
element.description: This function returns the value of the attribute.

element.name: DomDocument->add_root
element.description: Adds a root element node to a dom document and returns the new node. The element name is given in the passed parameter.

element.name: DomDocument->create_attribute
element.description: This function returns a new instance of class . The name of the attribute is the value of the first parameter. The value of the attribute is the value of the second parameter.

element.name: DomDocument->create_cdata_section
element.description: This function returns a new instance of class . The content of the cdata is the value of the passed parameter.

element.name: DomDocument->create_comment
element.description: This function returns a new instance of class . The content of the comment is the value of the passed parameter.

element.name: DomDocument->create_element
element.description: This function returns a new instance of class . The tag name of the element is the value of the passed parameter.

element.name: DomDocument->create_element_ns
element.description: This function returns a new instance of class . The tag name of the element is the value of the passed parameter name . The URI of the namespace is the value of the passed parameter uri . If there is already a namespace declaration with the same uri in the root-node of the document, the prefix of this is taken, otherwise it will take the one provided in the optional parameter prefix or generate a random one.

element.name: DomDocument->create_entity_reference
element.description: This function returns a new instance of class . The content of the entity reference is the value of the passed parameter.

element.name: DomDocument->create_processing_instruction
element.description: This function returns a new instance of class . The content of the pi is the value of the passed parameter.

element.name: DomDocument->create_text_node
element.description: This function returns a new instance of class . The content of the text is the value of the passed parameter.

element.name: DomDocument->doctype
element.description: This function returns an object of class . In versions of PHP before 4.3 this has been the class , but the DOM Standard does not know such a class.

element.name: DomDocument->document_element
element.description: This function returns the root element node of a document.

element.name: DomDocument->dump_file
element.description: Creates an XML document from the dom representation. This function usually is called after building a new dom document from scratch as in the example below. The format specifies whether the output should be neatly formatted, or not. The first parameter specifies the name of the filename and the second parameter, whether it should be compressed or not.

element.name: DomDocument->dump_mem
element.description: Creates an XML document from the dom representation. This function usually is called after building a new dom document from scratch as in the example below. The format specifies whether the output should be neatly formatted, or not.

element.name: DomDocument->get_element_by_id
element.description: This function is similar to domdocument_get_elements_by_tagname but searches for an element with a given id. According to the DOM standard this requires a DTD which defines the attribute ID to be of type ID, though the current implementation simply does an xpath search for "//*[@ID = '%s']". This does not comply to the DOM standard which requires to return null if it is not known which attribute is of type id. This behaviour is likely to be fixed, so do not rely on the current behaviour.

element.name: DomDocument->html_dump_mem
element.description: Creates an HTML document from the dom representation. This function usually is called after building a new dom document from scratch as in the example below.

element.name: DomDocument->xinclude
element.description: This function substitutes in a DomDocument object.

element.name: DomDocumentType->name
element.description: This function returns the name of the document type.

element.name: DomDocumentType->public_id
element.description: This function returns the public id of the document type.

element.name: DomDocumentType->system_id
element.description: Returns the system id of the document type.

element.name: DomElement->get_attribute
element.description: Returns the value of the attribute named name in the current node. The name parameter is case sensitive.

element.name: DomElement->get_attribute_node
element.description: Returns the node of the attribute named name in the current element. The name parameter is case sensitive.

element.name: DomElement->get_elements_by_tagname
element.description: This function returns an array with all the elements which has name as his tagname. Every element of the array is a DomElement.

element.name: DomElement->has_attribute
element.description: This functions checks to see if an attribute named name exists in the current node.

element.name: DomElement->set_attribute
element.description: Sets an attribute with name name to the given value . If the attribute does not exist, it will be created.

element.name: DomElement->tagname
element.description: Returns the name of the current node. Calling this function is the same as accessing the property, or calling DomElement->node_name of the current node.

element.name: DomNode->append_child
element.description: This functions appends a child to an existing list of children or creates a new list of children. The child can be created with e.g. domdocument_create_element , domdocument_create_text etc. or simply by using any other node.

element.name: DomNode->append_sibling
element.description: This functions appends a sibling to an existing node. The child can be created with e.g. domdocument_create_element , domdocument_create_text etc. or simply by using any other node.

element.name: DomNode->attributes
element.description: This function only returns an array of attributes if the node is of type XML_ELEMENT_NODE.

element.name: DomNode->child_nodes
element.description: Returns all children of the node.

element.name: DomNode->first_child
element.description: Returns the first child of the node.

element.name: DomNode->get_content
element.description: This function returns the content of the actual node.

element.name: DomNode->has_attributes
element.description: This function checks if the node has attributes.

element.name: DomNode->has_child_nodes
element.description: This function checks if the node has children.

element.name: DomNode->insert_before
element.description: This function inserts the new node newnode right before the node refnode . The return value is the inserted node. If you plan to do further modifications on the appended child you must use the returned node.

element.name: DomNode->last_child
element.description: Returns the last child of the node.

element.name: DomNode->next_sibling
element.description: This function returns the next sibling of the current node. If there is no next sibling it returns ( < 4.3) or null ( > = 4.3). You can use this function to iterate over all children of a node as shown in the example.

element.name: DomNode->node_name
element.description: Returns name of the node. The name has different meanings for the different types of nodes as illustrated in the following table.

element.name: DomNode->node_type
element.description: Returns the type of the node. All possible types are listed in the table in the introduction.

element.name: DomNode->node_value
element.description: Returns value of the node. The value has different meanings for the different types of nodes as illustrated in the following table.

element.name: DomNode->owner_document
element.description: This function returns the document the current node belongs to.

element.name: DomNode->parent_node
element.description: This function returns the parent node.

element.name: DomNode->prefix
element.description: Returns the name space prefix of the node.

element.name: DomNode->previous_sibling
element.description: This function returns the previous sibling of the current node. If there is no previous sibling it returns ( < 4.3) or ( > = 4.3). You can use this function to iterate over all children of a node as shown in the example.

element.name: DomNode->remove_child
element.description: This functions removes a child from a list of children. If child cannot be removed or is not a child the function will return . If the child could be removed the functions returns the old child.

element.name: DomNode->replace_child
element.description: (PHP 4.2) This function replaces the child oldnode with the passed new node. If the new node is already a child it will not be added a second time. If the old node cannot be found the function returns . If the replacement succeeds the old node is returned.

element.name: DomNode->replace_node
element.description: (PHP 4.2) This function replaces an existing node with the passed new node. Before the replacement newnode is copied if it has a parent to make sure a node which is already in the document will not be inserted a second time. This behaviour enforces doing all modifications on the node before the replacement or to refetch the inserted node afterwards with functions like domnode_first_child , domnode_child_nodes etc..

element.name: DomNode->set_name
element.description: Sets name of node.

element.name: DomNode->set_namespace
element.description: Sets the namespace of a node to uri . If there is already a namespace declaration with the same uri in one of the parent nodes of the node, the prefix of this is taken, otherwise it will take the one provided in the optional parameter prefix or generate a random one.

element.name: DomXsltStylesheet->result_dump_file
element.description: This function is only available since PHP 4.3

element.name: DomXsltStylesheet->result_dump_mem
element.description: This function is only available since PHP 4.3

element.name: domxml_new_doc
element.description: Creates a new dom document from scratch and returns it.

element.name: domxml_open_file
element.description: The function parses the XML document in the file named filename and returns an object of class "Dom document", having the properties as listed above. The file is accessed read-only.

element.name: domxml_open_mem
element.description: The function parses the XML document in str and returns an object of class "Dom document", having the properties as listed above. This function, domxml_open_file or domxml_new_doc must be called before any other function calls.

element.name: domxml_version
element.description: This function returns the version of the version of the XML library currently used.

element.name: domxml_xmltree
element.description: The function parses the XML document in str and returns a tree PHP objects as the parsed document. This function is isolated from the other functions, which means you cannot access the tree with any of the other functions. Modifying it, for example by adding nodes, makes no sense since there is currently no way to dump it as an XML file. However this function may be valuable if you want to read a file and investigate the content.

element.name: xpath_eval
element.description: The optional contextnode can be specified for doing relative XPath queries.

element.name: checkdate
element.description: Returns if the date given is valid; otherwise returns . Checks the validity of the date formed by the arguments. A date is considered valid if:

element.name: date
element.description: Returns a string formatted according to the given format string using the given integer timestamp or the current local time if no timestamp is given. In other words, timestamp is optional and defaults to the value of time . The valid range of a timestamp is typically from Fri, 13 Dec 1901 20:45:54 GMT to Tue, 19 Jan 2038 03:14:07 GMT. (These are the dates that correspond to the minimum and maximum values for a 32-bit signed integer). On Windows this range is limited from 01-01-1970 to 19-01-2038.

element.name: date_sunrise
element.description: date_sunrise returns the sunrise time for a given day (specified as a timestamp ) and location. The latitude , longitude and zenith parameters default to the , and configuration options, respectively.

element.name: date_sunset
element.description: date_sunset returns the sunset time for a given day (specified as a timestamp ) and location. The latitude , longitude and zenith parameters default to the , and configuration options, respectively.

element.name: getdate
element.description: Returns an associative containing the date information of the timestamp , or the current local time if no timestamp is given, as the following associative array elements:

element.name: gettimeofday
element.description: This is an interface to gettimeofday(2). It returns an associative array containing the data returned from the system call.

element.name: gmdate
element.description: Identical to the date function except that the time returned is Greenwich Mean Time (GMT). For example, when run in Finland (GMT +0200), the first line below prints "Jan 01 1998 00:00:00", while the second prints "Dec 31 1997 22:00:00".

element.name: gmmktime
element.description: Identical to mktime except the passed parameters represents a GMT date.

element.name: gmstrftime
element.description: Behaves the same as strftime except that the time returned is Greenwich Mean Time (GMT). For example, when run in Eastern Standard Time (GMT -0500), the first line below prints "Dec 31 1998 20:00:00", while the second prints "Jan 01 1999 01:00:00".

element.name: idate
element.description: Returns a string formatted according to the given format string using the given integer timestamp or the current local time if no timestamp is given. In other words, timestamp is optional and defaults to the value of time .

element.name: localtime
element.description: The localtime function returns an array identical to that of the structure returned by the C function call. The first argument to localtime is the timestamp, if this is not given the current time as returned from time is used. The second argument to the localtime is the is_associative , if this is set to 0 or not supplied than the array is returned as a regular, numerically indexed array. If the argument is set to 1 then localtime is an associative array containing all the different elements of the structure returned by the C function call to localtime. The names of the different keys of the associative array are as follows:

element.name: microtime
element.description: microtime returns the current Unix timestamp with microseconds. This function is only available on operating systems that support the gettimeofday() system call.

element.name: mktime
element.description: Note the strange order of arguments, which differs from the order of arguments in a regular Unix mktime() call and which does not lend itself well to leaving out parameters from right to left (see below). It is a common error to mix these values up in a script.

element.name: strftime
element.description: Returns a string formatted according to the given format string using the given timestamp or the current local time if no timestamp is given. Month and weekday names and other language dependent strings respect the current locale set with setlocale .

element.name: strptime
element.description: strptime returns an array with the timestamp parsed, or on error.

property.name: timestamp
property.description: A timestamp (e.g. returned from )

element.name: strtotime
element.description: In PHP 5 up to 5.0.2, and other relative times are wrongly computed from today's midnight. It differs from other versions where it is correctly computed from current time.

element.name: time
element.description: Returns the current time measured in the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1 1970 00:00:00 GMT).

element.name: dio_close
element.description: The function dio_close closes the file descriptor fd .

element.name: dio_fcntl
element.description: The dio_fcntl function performs the operation specified by cmd on the file descriptor fd . Some commands require additional arguments args to be supplied.

element.name: dio_open
element.description: dio_open opens a file and returns a new file descriptor for it, or if any error occurred. If flags is O_CREAT, the optional third parameter mode will set the mode of the file (creation permissions). The flags parameter can be one of the following options: O_RDONLY - opens the file for read access.

element.name: dio_read
element.description: The function dio_read reads and returns n bytes from file with descriptor fd . If n is not specified, dio_read reads 1K sized block and returns them.

element.name: dio_seek
element.description: The function dio_seek is used to change the file position of the file with descriptor fd . The parameter whence specifies how the position pos should be interpreted: SEEK_SET (default) - specifies that pos is specified from the beginning of the file.

element.name: dio_stat
element.description: Function dio_stat returns information about the file with file descriptor fd . dio_stat returns an associative array with the following keys: "device" - device

element.name: dio_tcsetattr
element.description: The function dio_tcsetattr sets the terminal attributes and baud rate of the open resource . The currently available options are 'baud' - baud rate of the port - can be 38400,19200,9600,4800,2400,1800, 1200,600,300,200,150,134,110,75 or 50, default value is 9600.

element.name: dio_truncate
element.description: Function dio_truncate causes the file referenced by fd to be truncated to at most offset bytes in size. If the file previously was larger than this size, the extra data is lost. If the file previously was shorter, it is unspecified whether the file is left unchanged or is extended. In the latter case the extended part reads as zero bytes. .

element.name: dio_write
element.description: The function dio_write writes up to len bytes from data to file fd . If len is not specified, dio_write writes all data to the specified file. dio_write returns the number of bytes written to fd .

element.name: chdir
element.description: Changes PHP's current directory to directory .

element.name: chroot
element.description: Changes the root directory of the current process to directory .

element.name: closedir
element.description: Closes the directory stream indicated by dir_handle . The stream must have previously been opened by opendir .

element.name: getcwd
element.description: Returns the current working directory, or on failure.

element.name: opendir
element.description: Returns a directory handle to be used in subsequent closedir , readdir , and rewinddir calls.

element.name: read
element.description: A pseudo-object oriented mechanism for reading a directory. The given directory is opened. Two properties are available once the directory has been opened. The handle property can be used with other directory functions such as readdir , rewinddir and closedir . The path property is set to path the directory that was opened. Three methods are available: read, rewind and close.

element.name: readdir
element.description: Returns the filename of the next file from the directory. The filenames are returned in the order in which they are stored by the filesystem.

element.name: rewinddir
element.description: Resets the directory stream indicated by dir_handle to the beginning of the directory.

element.name: scandir
element.description: Returns an of files and directories from the directory . If directory is not a directory, then boolean is returned, and an error of level is generated.

element.name: debug_backtrace
element.description: debug_backtrace generates a PHP backtrace and returns this information as an associative . The possible returned elements are listed in the following table:

element.name: debug_print_backtrace
element.description: debug_print_backtrace prints a PHP backtrace. It prints the function calls, included/required files and eval ed stuff.

element.name: error_log
element.description: Sends an error message to the web server's error log, a port or to a file. The first parameter, message , is the error message that should be logged. The second parameter, message_type says where the message should go:

element.name: error_reporting
element.description: The error_reporting function sets the directive at runtime. PHP has many levels of errors, using this function sets that level for the duration (runtime) of your script.

element.name: restore_error_handler
element.description: Used after changing the error handler function using set_error_handler , to revert to the previous error handler (which could be the built-in or a user defined function). This function always returns .

element.name: restore_exception_handler
element.description: Used after changing the exception handler function using set_exception_handler , to revert to the previous exception handler (which could be the built-in or a user defined function). This function always returns .

element.name: set_exception_handler
element.description: Name of function to be called when an uncaught exception occurs.

property.name: exception_handler
property.description: Name of function to be called when an uncaught exception occurs.

element.name: trigger_error
element.description: Used to trigger a user error condition, it can be used by in conjunction with the built-in error handler, or with a user defined function that has been set as the new error handler ( set_error_handler ). It only works with the E_USER family of constants, and will default to .

element.name: exif_imagetype
element.description: exif_imagetype reads the first bytes of an image and checks its signature.

element.name: exif_read_data
element.description: exif_read_data reads the headers from a or image file. This way you can read meta data generated by digital cameras.

property.name: sections
property.description: Is a comma separated list of sections that need to be present in file to produce a result . If none of the requested sections could be found the return value is .

property.name: arrays
property.description: Specifies whether or not each section becomes an array. The , , and always become arrays as they may contain values whose names conflict with other sections.

property.name: thumbnail
property.description: When set to the thumbnail itself is read. Otherwise, only the tagged data is read.

element.name: exif_tagname
element.description: The image index

element.name: exif_thumbnail
element.description: exif_thumbnail reads the embedded thumbnail of a or image.

property.name: width
property.description: The return width of the returned thumbnail.

property.name: height
property.description: The returned height of the returned thumbnail.

property.name: imagetype
property.description: The returned image type of the returned thumbnail. This is either or .

element.name: fdf_add_doc_javascript
element.description: Adds a script to the FDF, which Acrobat then adds to the doc-level scripts of a document, once the FDF is imported into it. It is strongly suggested to use '\r' for linebreaks within script_code .

element.name: fdf_close
element.description: The fdf_close function closes the FDF document.

element.name: fdf_create
element.description: The fdf_create creates a new FDF document. This function is needed if one would like to populate input fields in a PDF document with data.

element.name: fdf_errno
element.description: fdf_errno returns the error code set by the last FDF function call. This is zero for a successfull operation or a non-zero error code on failure. A textual description may be obtained using the fdf_error function.

element.name: fdf_error
element.description: fdf_error returns a textual description for the fdf error code given in error_code . The function uses the internal error code set by the last operation if no error_code is given, so is a convenient shortcut for .

element.name: fdf_get_ap
element.description: The fdf_get_ap function gets the appearance of a field (i.e. the value of the /AP key) and stores it in a file. The possible values of face are , and . The appearance is stored in filename .

element.name: fdf_get_attachment
element.description: Extracts a file uploaded by means of the "file selection" field fieldname and stores it under savepath . savepath may be the name of a plain file or an existing directory in which the file is to be created under its original name. Any existing file under the same name will be overwritten.

element.name: fdf_get_encoding
element.description: The fdf_get_encoding returns the value of the /Encoding key. An empty string is returned if the default PDFDocEncoding/Unicode scheme is used.

element.name: fdf_get_file
element.description: The fdf_set_file returns the value of the /F key.

element.name: fdf_get_status
element.description: The fdf_get_status returns the value of the /STATUS key.

element.name: fdf_get_value
element.description: The fdf_get_value function returns the value for the requested fieldname .

element.name: fdf_get_version
element.description: This function will return the fdf version for the given fdf_document , or the toolkit API version number if no parameter is given.

element.name: fdf_header
element.description: This is a convenience function to set appropriate HTTP headers for FDF output. It sets the to .

element.name: fdf_next_field_name
element.description: The fdf_next_field_name function returns the name of the field after the field in fieldname or the field name of the first field if the second parameter is .

element.name: fdf_open
element.description: The fdf_open function opens a file with form data. This file must contain the data as returned from a PDF form or created using fdf_create and fdf_save .

element.name: fdf_open_string
element.description: The fdf_open_string function reads form data from a string. fdf_data must contain the data as returned from a PDF form or created using fdf_create and fdf_save_string .

element.name: fdf_save
element.description: The fdf_save function saves a FDF document. The resulting FDF will be written to filename . Without a filename fdf_save will write the FDF to the default PHP output stream.

element.name: fdf_save_string
element.description: The fdf_save_string function returns the FDF document as a string.

element.name: fdf_set_ap
element.description: The fdf_set_ap function sets the appearance of a field (i.e. the value of the /AP key). The possible values of face are , and .

element.name: fdf_set_encoding
element.description: fdf_set_encoding sets the character encoding in FDF document fdf_document . encoding should be the valid encoding name. Currently the following values are supported: " ", " ", " "," ". An empty string resets the encoding to the default PDFDocEncoding/Unicode scheme.

element.name: fdf_set_file
element.description: The fdf_set_file selects a different PDF document to display the form results in then the form it originated from. The url needs to be given as an absolute URL.

element.name: fdf_set_flags
element.description: The fdf_set_flags sets certain flags of the given field fieldname .

element.name: fdf_set_javascript_action
element.description: fdf_set_javascript_action sets a javascript action for the given field fieldname .

element.name: fdf_set_on_import_javascript
element.description: See also fdf_add_doc_javascript fdf_set_javascript_action .

element.name: fdf_set_opt
element.description: The fdf_set_opt sets options of the given field fieldname .

element.name: fdf_set_status
element.description: The fdf_set_status sets the value of the /STATUS key. When a client receives a FDF with a status set it will present the value in an alert box.

element.name: fdf_set_submit_form_action
element.description: The fdf_set_submit_form_action sets a submit form action for the given field fieldname .

element.name: fdf_set_target_frame
element.description: Sets the target frame to display a result PDF defined with fdf_save_file in.

element.name: fdf_set_value
element.description: The fdf_set_value function sets the value for a field named fieldname . The value will be stored as a string unless it is an array. In this case all array elements will be stored as a value array.

element.name: fdf_set_version
element.description: This function will set the fdf version for the given fdf_document . Some features supported by this extension are only available in newer fdf versions. For the current FDF toolkit 5.0 version may be either '1.2', '1.3' or '1.4'.

element.name: ftp_alloc
element.description: Sends an command to the remote FTP server to allocate space for a file to be uploaded.

property.name: ftp_stream
property.description: The link identifier of the FTP connection.

element.name: ftp_cdup
element.description: Changes to the parent directory.

element.name: ftp_chdir
element.description: Changes the current directory to the specified one.

element.name: ftp_chmod
element.description: Sets the permissions on the specified remote file to mode .

element.name: ftp_close
element.description: ftp_close closes the given link identifier and releases the .

element.name: ftp_connect
element.description: ftp_connect opens an FTP connection to the specified host .

property.name: host
property.description: The FTP server address. This parameter shouldn't have any trailing slashes and shouldn't be prefixed with .

property.name: port
property.description: This parameter specifies an alternate port to connect to. If it is omitted or set to zero, then the default FTP port, 21, will be used.

property.name: timeout
property.description: This parameter specifies the timeout for all subsequent network operations. If omitted, the default value is 90 seconds. The timeout can be changed and queried at any time with and .

element.name: ftp_delete
element.description: ftp_delete deletes the file specified by path from the FTP server.

element.name: ftp_exec
element.description: Sends a SITE EXEC command request to the FTP server.

property.name: command
property.description: The command to execute.

element.name: ftp_fget
element.description: ftp_fget retrieves remote_file from the FTP server, and writes it to the given file pointer.

property.name: handle
property.description: An open file pointer in which we store the data.

property.name: remote_file
property.description: The remote file path.

element.name: ftp_fput
element.description: ftp_fput uploads the data from a file pointer to a remote file on the FTP server.

element.name: ftp_get
element.description: ftp_get retrieves a remote file from the FTP server, and saves it into a local file.

property.name: local_file
property.description: The local file path (will be overwritten if the file already exists).

element.name: ftp_get_option
element.description: This function returns the value for the requested option from the specified FTP connection.

element.name: ftp_login
element.description: Logs in to the given FTP stream.

property.name: username
property.description: The username ( ).

element.name: ftp_mdtm
element.description: ftp_mdtm gets the last modified time for a remote file.

element.name: ftp_mkdir
element.description: Creates the specified directory on the FTP server.

element.name: ftp_nb_continue
element.description: Continues retrieving/sending a file non-blocking.

element.name: ftp_nb_fget
element.description: ftp_nb_fget retrieves a remote file from the FTP server.

element.name: ftp_nb_fput
element.description: ftp_nb_fput uploads the data from a file pointer to a remote file on the FTP server.

element.name: ftp_nb_get
element.description: ftp_nb_get retrieves a remote file from the FTP server, and saves it into a local file.

element.name: ftp_nb_put
element.description: ftp_nb_put stores a local file on the FTP server.

element.name: ftp_nlist
element.description: The link identifier of the FTP connection.

element.name: ftp_pasv
element.description: ftp_pasv turns on or off passive mode. In passive mode, data connections are initiated by the client, rather than by the server.

property.name: pasv
property.description: If , the passive mode is turned on, else it's turned off.

element.name: ftp_put
element.description: ftp_put stores a local file on the FTP server.

element.name: ftp_raw
element.description: Sends an arbitrary command to the FTP server.

element.name: ftp_rawlist
element.description: ftp_rawlist executes the FTP command, and returns the result as an array.

property.name: recursive
property.description: If set to , the issued command will be .

element.name: ftp_rename
element.description: ftp_rename renames a file or a directory on the FTP server.

property.name: oldname
property.description: The old file/directory name.

element.name: ftp_rmdir
element.description: Removes the specified directory on the FTP server.

element.name: ftp_set_option
element.description: This function controls various runtime options for the specified FTP stream.

element.name: ftp_site
element.description: ftp_site sends the given command to the FTP server.

element.name: ftp_size
element.description: ftp_size returns the size of a the given file in bytes.

element.name: ftp_ssl_connect
element.description: ftp_ssl_connect opens a SSL-FTP connection to the specified host .

element.name: ftp_systype
element.description: Returns the system type identifier of the remove FTP server.

element.name: basename
element.description: Given a string containing a path to a file, this function will return the base name of the file. If the filename ends in suffix this will also be cut off.

element.name: chgrp
element.description: Attempts to change the group of the file filename to group (specified by name or number). Only the superuser may change the group of a file arbitrarily; other users may change the group of a file to any group of which that user is a member.

element.name: chmod
element.description: Attempts to change the mode of the file specified by filename to that given in mode .

element.name: chown
element.description: Attempts to change the owner of the file filename to user user (specified by name or number). Only the superuser may change the owner of a file.

element.name: clearstatcache
element.description: When you use stat , lstat , or any of the other functions listed in the affected functions list (below), PHP caches the information those functions return in order to provide faster performance. However, in certain cases, you may want to clear the cached information. For instance, if the same file is being checked multiple times within a single script, and that file is in danger of being removed or changed during that script's operation, you may elect to clear the status cache. In these cases, you can use the clearstatcache function to clear the information that PHP caches about a file.

element.name: copy
element.description: Makes a copy of the file source to dest .

element.name: delete
element.description: This is a dummy manual entry to satisfy those people who are looking for unlink or unset in the wrong place.

element.name: dirname
element.description: Given a string containing a path to a file, this function will return the name of the directory.

element.name: disk_free_space
element.description: Given a string containing a directory, this function will return the number of bytes available on the corresponding filesystem or disk partition.

element.name: disk_total_space
element.description: Given a string containing a directory, this function will return the total number of bytes on the corresponding filesystem or disk partition.

element.name: fclose
element.description: The file pointed to by handle is closed.

element.name: feof
element.description: Returns if the file pointer is at EOF or an error occurs (including socket timeout); otherwise returns .

element.name: fflush
element.description: This function forces a write of all buffered output to the resource pointed to by the file handle handle .

element.name: fgetc
element.description: Returns a string containing a single character read from the file pointed to by handle . Returns on EOF.

element.name: fgets
element.description: Returns a string of up to length - 1 bytes read from the file pointed to by handle . Reading ends when length - 1 bytes have been read, on a newline (which is included in the return value), or on EOF (whichever comes first). If no length is specified, the length defaults to 1k, or 1024 bytes.

element.name: fgetss
element.description: Identical to fgets , except that fgetss attempts to strip any HTML and PHP tags from the text it reads.

element.name: file
element.description: Identical to readfile , except that file returns the file in an array. Each element of the array corresponds to a line in the file, with the newline still attached. Upon failure, file returns .

element.name: file_exists
element.description: On windows, use or to check files on network shares.

element.name: file_get_contents
element.description: Identical to file , except that file_get_contents returns the file in a string, starting at the specified offset up to maxlen bytes. On failure, file_get_contents will return .

element.name: file_put_contents
element.description: You can also specify the data parameter as an array (not multi-dimension arrays). This is equivalent to .

element.name: filectime
element.description: Returns the time the file was last changed, or in case of an error. The time is returned as a Unix timestamp.

element.name: filegroup
element.description: Returns the group ID of the file, or in case of an error. The group ID is returned in numerical format, use posix_getgrgid to resolve it to a group name. Upon failure, is returned along with an error of level .

element.name: fileinode
element.description: Returns the inode number of the file, or in case of an error.

element.name: filemtime
element.description: Returns the time the file was last modified, or in case of an error. The time is returned as a Unix timestamp, which is suitable for the date function.

element.name: fileowner
element.description: Returns the user ID of the owner of the file, or in case of an error. The user ID is returned in numerical format, use posix_getpwuid to resolve it to a username.

element.name: fileperms
element.description: Returns the permissions on the file, or in case of an error.

element.name: filesize
element.description: Returns the size of the file in bytes, or in case of an error.

element.name: filetype
element.description: Returns the type of the file. Possible values are fifo, char, dir, block, link, file, and unknown.

element.name: flock
element.description: flock is mandatory under Windows.

element.name: fnmatch
element.description: fnmatch checks if the passed string would match the given shell wildcard pattern .

element.name: fopen
element.description: The mode parameter specifies the type of access you require to the stream. It may be any of the following:

element.name: fpassthru
element.description: When using fpassthru on a binary file on Windows systems, you should make sure to open the file in binary mode by appending a to the mode used in the call to fopen .

element.name: fputcsv
element.description: fputcsv formats a line (passed as a fields array) as CSV and write it to the specified file handle . Returns the length of the written string, or on failure.

element.name: fscanf
element.description: The function fscanf is similar to sscanf , but it takes its input from a file associated with handle and interprets the input according to the specified format , which is described in the documentation for sprintf . If only two parameters were passed to this function, the values parsed will be returned as an array. Otherwise, if optional parameters are passed, the function will return the number of assigned values. The optional parameters must be passed by reference.

element.name: fseek
element.description: Sets the file position indicator for the file referenced by handle . The new position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the file, is obtained by adding offset to the position specified by whence , whose values are defined as follows:

element.name: fstat
element.description: Gathers the statistics of the file opened by the file pointer handle . This function is similar to the stat function except that it operates on an open file pointer instead of a filename.

element.name: ftell
element.description: Returns the position of the file pointer referenced by handle ; i.e., its offset into the file stream.

element.name: ftruncate
element.description: Takes the filepointer, handle , and truncates the file to length, size .

element.name: fwrite
element.description: On systems which differentiate between binary and text files (i.e. Windows) the file must be opened with 'b' included in fopen mode parameter.

element.name: glob
element.description: The glob function searches for all the pathnames matching pattern according to the rules used by the libc glob() function, which is similar to the rules used by common shells. No tilde expansion or parameter substitution is done.

element.name: is_dir
element.description: Returns if the filename exists and is a directory. If filename is a relative filename, it will be checked relative to the current working directory.

element.name: is_executable
element.description: Returns if the filename exists and is executable.

element.name: is_file
element.description: Returns if the filename exists and is a regular file.

element.name: is_link
element.description: Returns if the filename exists and is a symbolic link.

element.name: is_readable
element.description: Returns if the filename exists and is readable.

element.name: is_uploaded_file
element.description: Returns if the file named by filename was uploaded via HTTP POST. This is useful to help ensure that a malicious user hasn't tried to trick the script into working on files upon which it should not be working--for instance, .

element.name: is_writable
element.description: Returns if the filename exists and is writable. The filename argument may be a directory name allowing you to check if a directory is writeable.

element.name: link
element.description: link creates a hard link.

element.name: linkinfo
element.description: linkinfo returns the field of the Unix C stat structure returned by the system call. This function is used to verify if a link (pointed to by path ) really exists (using the same method as the S_ISLNK macro defined in ). Returns 0 or in case of error.

element.name: lstat
element.description: Gathers the statistics of the file or symbolic link named by filename . This function is identical to the stat function except that if the filename parameter is a symbolic link, the status of the symbolic link is returned, not the status of the file pointed to by the symbolic link.

element.name: mkdir
element.description: Attempts to create the directory specified by pathname.

element.name: move_uploaded_file
element.description: This function checks to ensure that the file designated by filename is a valid upload file (meaning that it was uploaded via PHP's HTTP POST upload mechanism). If the file is valid, it will be moved to the filename given by destination .

element.name: parse_ini_file
element.description: parse_ini_file loads in the ini file specified in filename , and returns the settings in it in an associative array. By setting the last process_sections parameter to , you get a multidimensional array, with the section names and settings included. The default for process_sections is

element.name: pathinfo
element.description: pathinfo returns an associative array containing information about path . The following array elements are returned: , and .

element.name: pclose
element.description: Closes a file pointer to a pipe opened by popen .

element.name: popen
element.description: Opens a pipe to a process executed by forking the command given by command.

element.name: readfile
element.description: Reads a file and writes it to the output buffer.

element.name: readlink
element.description: readlink does the same as the readlink C function and returns the contents of the symbolic link path or in case of error.

element.name: realpath
element.description: realpath expands all symbolic links and resolves references to '/./', '/../' and extra '/' characters in the input path and return the canonicalized absolute pathname. The resulting path will have no symbolic link, '/./' or '/../' components.

element.name: rename
element.description: Attempts to rename oldname to newname .

element.name: rewind
element.description: Sets the file position indicator for handle to the beginning of the file stream.

element.name: rmdir
element.description: Attempts to remove the directory named by dirname . The directory must be empty, and the relevant permissions must permit this.

element.name: stat
element.description: Gathers the statistics of the file named by filename . If filename is a symbolic link, statistics are from the file itself, not the symlink. lstat is identical to stat except it would instead be based off the symlinks status.

element.name: symlink
element.description: symlink creates a symbolic link from the existing target with the specified name link .

element.name: tempnam
element.description: Creates a file with a unique filename in the specified directory. If the directory does not exist, tempnam may generate a file in the system's temporary directory, and return the name of that.

element.name: tmpfile
element.description: Creates a temporary file with an unique name in read-write (w+) mode, returning a file handle similar to the one returned by fopen . The file is automatically removed when closed (using fclose ), or when the script ends.

element.name: touch
element.description: Attempts to set the access and modification time of the file named by filename to the value given by time . If the parameter time is not given, uses the present time. This is equivalent to what utime (sometimes referred to as utimes) does. If the third parameter atime is present, the access time of the given filename is set to the value of atime . Note that the access time is always modified, regardless of the number of parameters.

element.name: umask
element.description: umask sets PHP's umask to mask & 0777 and returns the old umask. When PHP is being used as a server module, the umask is restored when each request is finished.

element.name: unlink
element.description: Deletes filename . Similar to the Unix C unlink() function.

element.name: ibase_add_user
element.description: PHP 4 uses server , dba_user_name and dba_user_password instead of service_handle parameter.

element.name: ibase_affected_rows
element.description: This function returns the number of rows that were affected by the previous query that was executed from within the transaction context specified by link_identifier . If link_identifier is a connection resource, its default transaction is used.

element.name: ibase_blob_add
element.description: ibase_blob_add adds data into a blob created with ibase_blob_create .

element.name: ibase_blob_cancel
element.description: This function will discard a BLOB created by ibase_create_blob if it has not yet been closed by ibase_blob_close .

element.name: ibase_blob_close
element.description: This function closes a BLOB that has either been opened for reading by ibase_open_blob or has been opened for writing by ibase_create_blob . If the BLOB was being read, this function returns on success, if the BLOB was being written to, this function returns a string containing the BLOB id that has been assigned to it by the database. On failure, this function returns .

element.name: ibase_blob_create
element.description: ibase_blob_create creates a new BLOB for filling with data. It returns a BLOB handle for later use with ibase_blob_add or on failure.

element.name: ibase_blob_echo
element.description: This function opens a BLOB for reading and sends its contents directly to standard output (the browser, in most cases).

element.name: ibase_blob_get
element.description: This function returns at most len bytes from a BLOB that has been opened for reading by ibase_blob_open . Returns on failure. Whilst this example doesn't do much more than a 'ibase_blob_echo($data->BLOB_VALUE)' would do, it does show you how to get information into a $variable to manipulate as you please.

element.name: ibase_blob_import
element.description: This function creates a BLOB, reads an entire file into it, closes it and returns the assigned BLOB id. The file handle is a handle returned by fopen . Returns on failure.

element.name: ibase_blob_info
element.description: Returns an array containing information about a BLOB. The information returned consists of the length of the BLOB, the number of segments it contains, the size of the largest segment, and whether it is a stream BLOB or a segmented BLOB.

element.name: ibase_blob_open
element.description: ibase_blob_open opens an existing BLOB for reading. It returns a BLOB handle for later use with ibase_blob_get or on failure.

element.name: ibase_close
element.description: Closes the link to an InterBase database that's associated with a connection id returned from ibase_connect . If the connection id is omitted, the last opened link is assumed. Default transaction on link is committed, other transactions are rolled back.

element.name: ibase_commit
element.description: If called without an argument, this function commits the default transaction of the default link. If the argument is a connection identifier, the default transaction of the corresponding connection will be committed. If the argument is a transaction identifier, the corresponding transaction will be committed.

element.name: ibase_commit_ret
element.description: If called without an argument, this function commits the default transaction of the default link. If the argument is a connection identifier, the default transaction of the corresponding connection will be committed. If the argument is a transaction identifier, the corresponding transaction will be committed. The transaction context will be retained, so statements executed from within this transaction will not be invalidated.

element.name: ibase_connect
element.description: Establishes a connection to an InterBase server. The database argument has to be a valid path to database file on the server it resides on. If the server is not local, it must be prefixed with either 'hostname:' (TCP/IP), '//hostname/' (NetBEUI) or 'hostname@' (IPX/SPX), depending on the connection protocol used. username and password can also be specified with PHP configuration directives ibase.default_user and ibase.default_password. charset is the default character set for a database. buffers is the number of database buffers to allocate for the server-side cache. If 0 or omitted, server chooses its own default. dialect selects the default SQL dialect for any statement executed within a connection, and it defaults to the highest one supported by client libraries.

element.name: ibase_delete_user
element.description: PHP 4 uses server , dba_user_name and dba_user_password instead of service_handle parameter.

element.name: ibase_drop_db
element.description: This functions drops a database that was opened by either ibase_connect or ibase_pconnect . The database is closed and deleted from the server.

element.name: ibase_errcode
element.description: Returns the error code that resulted from the most recent InterBase function call. Returns if no error occurred.

element.name: ibase_errmsg
element.description: See also ibase_errcode .

element.name: ibase_execute
element.description: Execute a query prepared by ibase_prepare . If the query raises an error, returns . If it is successful and there is a (possibly empty) result set (such as with a SELECT query), returns a result identifier. If the query was successful and there were no results, returns .

element.name: ibase_fetch_assoc
element.description: ibase_fetch_assoc returns an associative array that corresponds to the fetched row. Subsequent calls will return the next row in the result set, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: ibase_fetch_object
element.description: Fetches a row as a pseudo-object from a result_id obtained either by ibase_query or ibase_execute .

element.name: ibase_fetch_row
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: ibase_field_info
element.description: Returns an array with information about a field after a select query has been run. The array is in the form of name, alias, relation, length, type.

element.name: ibase_free_event_handler
element.description: This function causes the registered event handler specified by event to be cancelled. The callback function will no longer be called for the events it was registered to handle.

element.name: ibase_modify_user
element.description: PHP 4 uses server , dba_user_name and dba_user_password instead of service_handle parameter.

element.name: ibase_name_result
element.description: This function assigns a name to a result set. This name can be used later in UPDATE|DELETE ... WHERE CURRENT OF name statements.

element.name: ibase_num_fields
element.description: Returns an integer containing the number of fields in a result set.

element.name: ibase_num_params
element.description: This function returns the number of parameters in the prepared query specified by query . This is the number of binding arguments that must be present when calling ibase_execute .

element.name: ibase_param_info
element.description: Returns an array with information about a parameter after a query has been prepared. The array is in the form of name, alias, relation, length, type.

element.name: ibase_pconnect
element.description: ibase_pconnect acts very much like ibase_connect with two major differences. First, when connecting, the function will first try to find a (persistent) link that's already opened with the same parameters. If one is found, an identifier for it will be returned instead of opening a new connection. Second, the connection to the InterBase server will not be closed when the execution of the script ends. Instead, the link will remain open for future use ( ibase_close will not close links established by ibase_pconnect ). This type of link is therefore called 'persistent'.

element.name: ibase_rollback
element.description: If called without an argument, this function rolls back the default transaction of the default link. If the argument is a connection identifier, the default transaction of the corresponding connection will be rolled back. If the argument is a transaction identifier, the corresponding transaction will be rolled back.

element.name: ibase_rollback_ret
element.description: If called without an argument, this function rolls back the default transaction of the default link. If the argument is a connection identifier, the default transaction of the corresponding connection will be rolled back. If the argument is a transaction identifier, the corresponding transaction will be rolled back. The transaction context will be retained, so statements executed from within this transaction will not be invalidated.

element.name: ibase_set_event_handler
element.description: This function registers a PHP user function as event handler for the specified events. The callback is called with the event name and the link resource as arguments whenever one of the specified events is posted by the database. The callback must return if the event handler should be canceled. Any other return value is ignored. This function accepts up to 15 event arguments.

element.name: ibase_timefmt
element.description: Sets the format of timestamp, date or time type columns returned from queries. Internally, the columns are formatted by c-function strftime(), so refer to its documentation regarding to the format of the string. columntype is one of the constants IBASE_TIMESTAMP, IBASE_DATE and IBASE_TIME. If omitted, defaults to IBASE_TIMESTAMP for backwards compatibility.

element.name: ibase_trans
element.description: Begins a transaction.

element.name: ibase_wait_event
element.description: This function suspends execution of the script until one of the specified events is posted by the database. The name of the event that was posted is returned. This function accepts up to 15 event arguments.

element.name: fbsql_affected_rows
element.description: fbsql_affected_rows returns the number of rows affected by the last INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE query associated with link_identifier . If the link identifier isn't specified, the last link opened by fbsql_connect is assumed.

element.name: fbsql_autocommit
element.description: fbsql_autocommit returns the current autocommit status. If the optional OnOff parameter is given the auto commit status will be changed. With OnOff set to each statement will be committed automatically, if no errors was found. With OnOff set to the user must commit or rollback the transaction using either fbsql_commit or fbsql_rollback .

element.name: fbsql_change_user
element.description: fbsql_change_user changes the logged in user of the current active connection, or the connection given by the optional parameter link_identifier. If a database is specified, this will default or current database after the user has been changed. If the new user and password authorization fails, the current connected user stays active.

element.name: fbsql_close
element.description: Returns: on success, on error.

element.name: fbsql_connect
element.description: Returns a positive FrontBase link identifier on success, or an error message on failure.

element.name: fbsql_create_blob
element.description: Returns: A resource handle to the newly created blob.

element.name: fbsql_create_clob
element.description: Returns: A resource handle to the newly created CLOB.

element.name: fbsql_create_db
element.description: fbsql_create_db attempts to create a new database named database_name on the server associated with the specified connection link_identifier .

element.name: fbsql_database_password
element.description: Returns: The database password associated with the link identifier.

element.name: fbsql_db_query
element.description: Returns: A positive FrontBase result identifier to the query result, or on error.

element.name: fbsql_db_status
element.description: Returns: An integer value with the current status.

element.name: fbsql_errno
element.description: Returns the error number from the last fbsql function, or (zero) if no error occurred.

element.name: fbsql_error
element.description: Returns the error text from the last fbsql function, or (the empty string) if no error occurred.

element.name: fbsql_fetch_array
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: fbsql_fetch_assoc
element.description: Returns an associative array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: fbsql_fetch_field
element.description: Returns an object containing field information.

element.name: fbsql_fetch_lengths
element.description: Returns: An array that corresponds to the lengths of each field in the last row fetched by fbsql_fetch_row , or on error.

element.name: fbsql_fetch_object
element.description: Returns an object with properties that correspond to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: fbsql_fetch_row
element.description: Returns: An array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: fbsql_field_flags
element.description: fbsql_field_flags returns the field flags of the specified field. The flags are reported as a single word per flag separated by a single space, so that you can split the returned value using explode .

element.name: fbsql_field_len
element.description: fbsql_field_len returns the length of the specified field.

element.name: fbsql_field_name
element.description: fbsql_field_name returns the name of the specified field index. result must be a valid result identifier and field_index is the numerical offset of the field.

element.name: fbsql_field_seek
element.description: Seeks to the specified field offset. If the next call to fbsql_fetch_field doesn't include a field offset, the field offset specified in fbsql_field_seek will be returned.

element.name: fbsql_field_table
element.description: Returns the name of the table that the specified field is in.

element.name: fbsql_field_type
element.description: fbsql_field_type is similar to the fbsql_field_name function. The arguments are identical, but the field type is returned instead. The field type will be one of "int", "real", "string", "blob", and others as detailed in the .

element.name: fbsql_free_result
element.description: fbsql_free_result will free all memory associated with the result identifier result .

element.name: fbsql_insert_id
element.description: fbsql_insert_id returns the ID generated for an column defined as DEFAULT UNIQUE by the previous INSERT query using the given link_identifier . If link_identifier isn't specified, the last opened link is assumed.

element.name: fbsql_list_dbs
element.description: fbsql_list_dbs will return a result pointer containing the databases available from the current fbsql daemon. Use the fbsql_tablename function to traverse this result pointer.

element.name: fbsql_list_fields
element.description: fbsql_list_fields retrieves information about the given tablename. Arguments are the database name and the table name. A result pointer is returned which can be used with fbsql_field_flags , fbsql_field_len , fbsql_field_name , and fbsql_field_type .

element.name: fbsql_list_tables
element.description: fbsql_list_tables takes a database name and returns a result pointer much like the fbsql_db_query function. The fbsql_tablename function should be used to extract the actual table names from the result pointer.

element.name: fbsql_next_result
element.description: When sending more than one SQL statement to the server or executing a stored procedure with multiple results will cause the server to return multiple result sets. This function will test for additional results available form the server. If an additional result set exists it will free the existing result set and prepare to fetch the words from the new result set. The function will return if an additional result set was available or otherwise.

element.name: fbsql_num_fields
element.description: fbsql_num_fields returns the number of fields in a result set.

element.name: fbsql_num_rows
element.description: fbsql_num_rows returns the number of rows in a result set. This command is only valid for SELECT statements. To retrieve the number of rows returned from a INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE query, use fbsql_affected_rows .

element.name: fbsql_pconnect
element.description: Returns: A positive FrontBase persistent link identifier on success, or on error.

element.name: fbsql_query
element.description: fbsql_query sends a query to the currently active database on the server that's associated with the specified link identifier. If link_identifier isn't specified, the last opened link is assumed. If no link is open, the function tries to establish a link as if fbsql_connect was called with no arguments, and use it.

element.name: fbsql_read_blob
element.description: Returns: A string containing the BLOB specified by blob_handle.

element.name: fbsql_read_clob
element.description: Returns: A string containing the CLOB specified by clob_handle.

element.name: fbsql_result
element.description: fbsql_result returns the contents of one cell from a FrontBase result set. The field argument can be the field's offset, or the field's name, or the field's table dot field's name (tabledname.fieldname). If the column name has been aliased ('select foo as bar from...'), use the alias instead of the column name.

element.name: fbsql_select_db
element.description: fbsql_select_db sets the current active database on the server that's associated with the specified link identifier. If no link identifier is specified, the last opened link is assumed. If no link is open, the function will try to establish a link as if fbsql_connect was called, and use it.

element.name: fbsql_set_lob_mode
element.description: Returns: on success, on error.

element.name: fbsql_tablename
element.description: fbsql_tablename takes a result pointer returned by the fbsql_list_tables function as well as an integer index and returns the name of a table. The fbsql_num_rows function may be used to determine the number of tables in the result pointer.

element.name: fbsql_warnings
element.description: Returns if warnings is turned on otherwise .

element.name: call_user_func
element.description: Call a user defined function given by the function parameter. Take the following:

element.name: call_user_func_array
element.description: Call a user defined function given by function , with the parameters in param_arr . For example:

element.name: create_function
element.description: Creates an anonymous function from the parameters passed, and returns a unique name for it. Usually the args will be passed as a single quote delimited string, and this is also recommended for the code . The reason for using single quoted strings, is to protect the variable names from parsing, otherwise, if you use double quotes there will be a need to escape the variable names, e.g. .

element.name: function_exists
element.description: Checks the list of defined functions, both built-in (internal) and user-defined, for function_name .

element.name: get_defined_functions
element.description: This function returns an multidimensional array containing a list of all defined functions, both built-in (internal) and user-defined. The internal functions will be accessible via , and the user defined ones using (see example below).

element.name: register_shutdown_function
element.description: Multiple calls to register_shutdown_function can be made, and each will be called in the same order as they were registered. If you call exit within one registered shutdown function, processing will stop completely and no other registered shutdown functions will be called.

element.name: gmp_abs
element.description: Returns absolute value of a .

element.name: gmp_add
element.description: Add two GMP numbers. The result will be a GMP number representing the sum of the arguments.

element.name: gmp_and
element.description: Calculates logical AND of two GMP numbers.

element.name: gmp_clrbit
element.description: Clears (sets to 0) bit index in a . The index starts at 0.

element.name: gmp_cmp
element.description: Returns a positive value if , zero if and a negative value if .

element.name: gmp_com
element.description: Returns the one's complement of a .

element.name: gmp_div_q
element.description: Divides a by b and returns the integer result. The result rounding is defined by the round , which can have the following values:

element.name: gmp_div_qr
element.description: The function divides n by d and returns array, with the first element being (the integer result of the division) and the second being (the remainder of the division).

element.name: gmp_div_r
element.description: Calculates remainder of the integer division of n by d . The remainder has the sign of the n argument, if not zero.

element.name: gmp_divexact
element.description: Divides n by d , using fast "exact division" algorithm. This function produces correct results only when it is known in advance that d divides n .

element.name: gmp_fact
element.description: Calculates factorial ( ) of a .

element.name: gmp_gcd
element.description: Calculate greatest common divisor of a and b . The result is always positive even if either of, or both, input operands are negative.

element.name: gmp_gcdext
element.description: Calculates g, s, and t, such that , where gcd is the greatest common divisor. Returns an array with respective elements g, s and t.

element.name: gmp_hamdist
element.description: Returns the hamming distance between a and b . Both operands should be non-negative.

element.name: gmp_init
element.description: Creates a GMP number from an integer or string. String representation can be decimal or hexadecimal. In the latter case, the string should start with . Optional parameter base is available since PHP 4.1.0.

element.name: gmp_intval
element.description: This function allows to convert GMP number to integer.

element.name: gmp_invert
element.description: Computes the inverse of a modulo b . Returns if an inverse does not exist.

element.name: gmp_jacobi
element.description: Computes of a and p . p should be odd and must be positive.

element.name: gmp_legendre
element.description: Compute the of a and p . p should be odd and must be positive.

element.name: gmp_mod
element.description: Calculates n modulo d . The result is always non-negative, the sign of d is ignored.

element.name: gmp_mul
element.description: Multiplies a by b and returns the result.

element.name: gmp_neg
element.description: Returns - a .

element.name: gmp_or
element.description: Calculates logical inclusive OR of two GMP numbers.

element.name: gmp_perfect_square
element.description: Returns if a is a perfect square, otherwise.

element.name: gmp_popcount
element.description: Return the population count of a .

element.name: gmp_pow
element.description: Raise base into power exp . The case of 0^0 yields 1. exp cannot be negative.

element.name: gmp_powm
element.description: Calculate ( base raised into power exp ) modulo mod . If exp is negative, result is undefined.

element.name: gmp_prob_prime
element.description: If this function returns 0, a is definitely not prime. If it returns 1, then a is "probably" prime. If it returns 2, then a is surely prime. Reasonable values of reps vary from 5 to 10 (default being 10); a higher value lowers the probability for a non-prime to pass as a "probable" prime.

element.name: gmp_random
element.description: Generate a random number. The number will be between zero and the number of bits per limb multiplied by limiter . If limiter is negative, negative numbers are generated.

element.name: gmp_scan0
element.description: Scans a , starting with bit start , towards more significant bits, until the first clear bit is found. Returns the index of the found bit. The index starts from 0.

element.name: gmp_scan1
element.description: Scans a , starting with bit start , towards more significant bits, until the first set bit is found. Returns the index of the found bit. If no set bit is found, -1 is returned.

element.name: gmp_setbit
element.description: Sets bit index in a . set_clear defines if the bit is set to 0 or 1. By default the bit is set to 1. Index starts at 0.

element.name: gmp_sign
element.description: Returns 1 if a is positive, -1 if a is negative, and 0 if a is zero.

element.name: gmp_sqrt
element.description: Calculates square root of a and returns the integer portion of the result.

element.name: gmp_sqrtrem
element.description: Returns array where first element is the integer square root of a (see also gmp_sqrt ), and the second is the remainder (i.e., the difference between a and the first element squared).

element.name: gmp_strval
element.description: Convert GMP number to string representation in base base . The default base is 10. Allowed values for the base are from 2 to 36.

element.name: gmp_sub
element.description: Subtracts b from a and returns the result.

element.name: gmp_xor
element.description: Calculates logical exclusive OR (XOR) of two GMP numbers.

element.name: header
element.description: header is used to send raw headers. See the for more information on headers.

element.name: headers_list
element.description: this will output :

element.name: setcookie
element.description: setcookie defines a cookie to be sent along with the rest of the HTTP headers. Like other headers, cookies must be sent any output from your script (this is a protocol restriction). This requires that you place calls to this function prior to any output, including and tags as well as any whitespace. If output exists prior to calling this function, setcookie will fail and return . If setcookie successfully runs, it will return . This does not indicate whether the user accepted the cookie.

element.name: setrawcookie
element.description: setrawcookie is exactly the same as setcookie except that the cookie value will not be automatically urlencoded when sent to the browser.

element.name: hw_array2objrec
element.description: Converts an object_array into an object record. Multiple attributes like 'Title' in different languages are treated properly.

element.name: hw_children
element.description: Returns an array of object ids. Each id belongs to a child of the collection with ID objectID . The array contains all children both documents and collections.

element.name: hw_childrenobj
element.description: Returns an array of object records. Each object record belongs to a child of the collection with ID objectID . The array contains all children both documents and collections.

element.name: hw_close
element.description: Returns if connection is not a valid connection index, otherwise . Closes down the connection to a Hyperwave server with the given connection index.

element.name: hw_connect
element.description: Opens a connection to a Hyperwave server and returns a connection index on success, or if the connection could not be made. Each of the arguments should be a quoted string, except for the port number. The username and password arguments are optional and can be left out. In such a case no identification with the server will be done. It is similar to identify as user anonymous. This function returns a connection index that is needed by other Hyperwave functions. You can have multiple connections open at once. Keep in mind, that the password is not encrypted.

element.name: hw_cp
element.description: Copies the objects with object ids as specified in the second parameter to the collection with the id destination id .

element.name: hw_deleteobject
element.description: Deletes the object with the given object id in the second parameter. It will delete all instances of the object.

element.name: hw_docbyanchor
element.description: Returns an th object id of the document to which anchorID belongs.

element.name: hw_docbyanchorobj
element.description: Returns an th object record of the document to which anchorID belongs.

element.name: hw_document_attributes
element.description: Returns the object record of the document.

element.name: hw_document_bodytag
element.description: Returns the BODY tag of the document. If the document is an HTML document the BODY tag should be printed before the document.

element.name: hw_document_content
element.description: Returns the content of the document. If the document is an HTML document the content is everything after the BODY tag. Information from the HEAD and BODY tag is in the stored in the object record.

element.name: hw_document_setcontent
element.description: Sets or replaces the content of the document. If the document is an HTML document the content is everything after the BODY tag. Information from the HEAD and BODY tag is in the stored in the object record. If you provide this information in the content of the document too, the Hyperwave server will change the object record accordingly when the document is inserted. Probably not a very good idea. If this functions fails the document will retain its old content.

element.name: hw_document_size
element.description: Returns the size in bytes of the document.

element.name: hw_edittext
element.description: Uploads the text document to the server. The object record of the document may not be modified while the document is edited. This function will only works for pure text documents. It will not open a special data connection and therefore blocks the control connection during the transfer.

element.name: hw_error
