element.description: Returns the last error number. If the return value is 0 no error has occurred. The error relates to the last command.

element.name: hw_errormsg
element.description: Returns a string containing the last error message or 'No Error'. If is returned, this function failed. The message relates to the last command.

element.name: hw_free_document
element.description: Frees the memory occupied by the Hyperwave document.

element.name: hw_getanchors
element.description: Returns an array of object ids with anchors of the document with object ID objectID .

element.name: hw_getanchorsobj
element.description: Returns an array of object records with anchors of the document with object ID objectID .

element.name: hw_getandlock
element.description: Returns the object record for the object with ID objectID . It will also lock the object, so other users cannot access it until it is unlocked.

element.name: hw_getchildcoll
element.description: Returns an array of object ids. Each object ID belongs to a child collection of the collection with ID objectID . The function will not return child documents.

element.name: hw_getchildcollobj
element.description: Returns an array of object records. Each object records belongs to a child collection of the collection with ID objectID . The function will not return child documents.

element.name: hw_getchilddoccoll
element.description: Returns array of object ids for child documents of a collection.

element.name: hw_getchilddoccollobj
element.description: Returns an array of object records for child documents of a collection.

element.name: hw_getobject
element.description: Returns the object record for the object with ID objectID if the second parameter is an integer. If the second parameter is an array of integer the function will return an array of object records. In such a case the last parameter is also evaluated which is a query string.

element.name: hw_getobjectbyquery
element.description: Searches for objects on the whole server and returns an array of object ids. The maximum number of matches is limited to max_hits . If max_hits is set to -1 the maximum number of matches is unlimited.

element.name: hw_getobjectbyquerycoll
element.description: Searches for objects in collection with ID objectID and returns an array of object ids. The maximum number of matches is limited to max_hits . If max_hits is set to -1 the maximum number of matches is unlimited.

element.name: hw_getobjectbyquerycollobj
element.description: Searches for objects in collection with ID objectID and returns an array of object records. The maximum number of matches is limited to max_hits . If max_hits is set to -1 the maximum number of matches is unlimited.

element.name: hw_getobjectbyqueryobj
element.description: Searches for objects on the whole server and returns an array of object records. The maximum number of matches is limited to max_hits . If max_hits is set to -1 the maximum number of matches is unlimited.

element.name: hw_getparents
element.description: Returns an indexed array of object ids. Each object id belongs to a parent of the object with ID objectID .

element.name: hw_getparentsobj
element.description: Returns an indexed array of object records plus an associated array with statistical information about the object records. The associated array is the last entry of the returned array. Each object record belongs to a parent of the object with ID objectID .

element.name: hw_getremote
element.description: Returns a remote document. Remote documents in Hyperwave notation are documents retrieved from an external source. Common remote documents are for example external web pages or queries in a database. In order to be able to access external sources through remote documents Hyperwave introduces the HGI (Hyperwave Gateway Interface) which is similar to the CGI. Currently, only ftp, http-servers and some databases can be accessed by the HGI. Calling hw_getremote returns the document from the external source. If you want to use this function you should be very familiar with HGIs. You should also consider to use PHP instead of Hyperwave to access external sources. Adding database support by a Hyperwave gateway should be more difficult than doing it in PHP.

element.name: hw_getremotechildren
element.description: Returns the children of a remote document. Children of a remote document are remote documents itself. This makes sense if a database query has to be narrowed and is explained in Hyperwave Programmers' Guide. If the number of children is 1 the function will return the document itself formatted by the Hyperwave Gateway Interface (HGI). If the number of children is greater than 1 it will return an array of object record with each maybe the input value for another call to hw_getremotechildren . Those object records are virtual and do not exist in the Hyperwave server, therefore they do not have a valid object ID. How exactly such an object record looks like is up to the HGI. If you want to use this function you should be very familiar with HGIs. You should also consider to use PHP instead of Hyperwave to access external sources. Adding database support by a Hyperwave gateway should be more difficult than doing it in PHP.

element.name: hw_getsrcbydestobj
element.description: Returns the object records of all anchors pointing to the object with ID objectID . The object can either be a document or an anchor of type destination.

element.name: hw_gettext
element.description: Returns the document with object ID objectID . If the document has anchors which can be inserted, they will be inserted already. The optional parameter rootID/prefix can be a string or an integer. If it is an integer it determines how links are inserted into the document. The default is 0 and will result in links that are constructed from the name of the link's destination object. This is useful for web applications. If a link points to an object with name 'internet_movie' the HTML link will be < A HREF="/internet_movie">. The actual location of the source and destination object in the document hierarchy is disregarded. You will have to set up your web browser, to rewrite that URL to for example '/my_script.php3/internet_movie'. 'my_script.php3' will have to evaluate $PATH_INFO and retrieve the document. All links will have the prefix '/my_script.php3/'. If you do not want this you can set the optional parameter rootID/prefix to any prefix which is used instead. Is this case it has to be a string.

element.name: hw_getusername
element.description: Returns the username of the connection.

element.name: hw_identify
element.description: Identifies as user with username and password . Identification is only valid for the current session. I do not thing this function will be needed very often. In most cases it will be easier to identify with the opening of the connection.

element.name: hw_incollections
element.description: Checks whether a set of objects (documents or collections) specified by the object_id_array is part of the collections listed in collection_id_array . When the fourth parameter return_collections is 0, the subset of object ids that is part of the collections (i.e., the documents or collections that are children of one or more collections of collection ids or their subcollections, recursively) is returned as an array. When the fourth parameter is 1, however, the set of collections that have one or more objects of this subset as children are returned as an array. This option allows a client to, e.g., highlight the part of the collection hierarchy that contains the matches of a previous query, in a graphical overview.

element.name: hw_info
element.description: Returns information about the current connection. The returned string has the following format: < Serverstring > , < Host > , < Port > , < Username > , < Port of Client > , < Byte swapping >

element.name: hw_inscoll
element.description: Inserts a new collection with attributes as in object_array into collection with object ID objectID .

element.name: hw_insdoc
element.description: Inserts a new document with attributes as in object_record into collection with object ID parentID . This function inserts either an object record only or an object record and a pure ascii text in text if text is given. If you want to insert a general document of any kind use hw_insertdocument instead.

element.name: hw_insertdocument
element.description: Uploads a document into the collection with parent_id . The document has to be created before with hw_new_document . Make sure that the object record of the new document contains at least the attributes: Type, DocumentType, Title and Name. Possibly you also want to set the MimeType. The functions returns the object id of the new document or .

element.name: hw_insertobject
element.description: Inserts an object into the server. The object can be any valid hyperwave object. See the HG-CSP documentation for a detailed information on how the parameters have to be.

element.name: hw_mapid
element.description: Maps a global object id on any hyperwave server, even those you did not connect to with hw_connect , onto a virtual object id. This virtual object id can then be used as any other object id, e.g. to obtain the object record with hw_getobject . The server id is the first part of the global object id (GOid) of the object which is actually the IP number as an integer.

element.name: hw_modifyobject
element.description: This command allows to remove, add, or modify individual attributes of an object record. The object is specified by the Object ID object_to_change . The first array remove is a list of attributes to remove. The second array add is a list of attributes to add. In order to modify an attribute one will have to remove the old one and add a new one. hw_modifyobject will always remove the attributes before it adds attributes unless the value of the attribute to remove is not a string or array.

element.name: hw_mv
element.description: Moves the objects with object ids as specified in the second parameter from the collection with id source_id to the collection with the id destination_id . If the destination id is 0 the objects will be unlinked from the source collection. If this is the last instance of that object it will be deleted. If you want to delete all instances at once, use hw_deleteobject .

element.name: hw_new_document
element.description: Returns a new Hyperwave document with document data set to document_data and object record set to object_record . The length of the document_data has to passed in document_size This function does not insert the document into the Hyperwave server.

element.name: hw_objrec2array
element.description: Converts an object_record into an object array. The keys of the resulting array are the attributes names. Multi-value attributes like 'Title' in different languages form its own array. The keys of this array are the left part to the colon of the attribute value. This left part must be two characters long. Other multi-value attributes without a prefix form an indexed array. If the optional parameter is missing the attributes 'Title', 'Description' and 'Keyword' are treated as language attributes and the attributes 'Group', 'Parent' and 'HtmlAttr' as non-prefixed multi-value attributes. By passing an array holding the type for each attribute you can alter this behaviour. The array is an associated array with the attribute name as its key and the value being one of or .

element.name: hw_output_document
element.description: Prints the document without the BODY tag.

element.name: hw_pconnect
element.description: Returns a connection index on success, or if the connection could not be made. Opens a persistent connection to a Hyperwave server. Each of the arguments should be a quoted string, except for the port number. The username and password arguments are optional and can be left out. In such a case no identification with the server will be done. It is similar to identify as user anonymous. This function returns a connection index that is needed by other Hyperwave functions. You can have multiple persistent connections open at once.

element.name: hw_pipedocument
element.description: Returns the Hyperwave document with object ID objectID . If the document has anchors which can be inserted, they will have been inserted already. The document will be transferred via a special data connection which does not block the control connection.

element.name: hw_root
element.description: Returns the object ID of the hyperroot collection. Currently this is always 0. The child collection of the hyperroot is the root collection of the connected server.

element.name: hw_unlock
element.description: Unlocks a document, so other users regain access.

element.name: hw_who
element.description: Returns an array of users currently logged into the Hyperwave server. Each entry in this array is an array itself containing the elements id, name, system, onSinceDate, onSinceTime, TotalTime and self. 'self' is 1 if this entry belongs to the user who initiated the request.

element.name: hw_api->checkin
element.description: This function checks in an object or a whole hierarchy of objects. The parameters array contains the required element 'objectIdentifier' and the optional element 'version', 'comment', 'mode' and 'objectQuery'. 'version' sets the version of the object. It consists of the major and minor version separated by a period. If the version is not set, the minor version is incremented. 'mode' can be one of the following values:

element.name: hw_api->checkout
element.description: This function checks out an object or a whole hierarchy of objects. The parameters array contains the required element 'objectIdentifier' and the optional element 'version', 'mode' and 'objectQuery'. 'mode' can be one of the following values:

element.name: hw_api->children
element.description: Retrieves the children of a collection or the attributes of a document. The children can be further filtered by specifying an object query. The parameter array contains the required elements 'objectIdentifier' and the optional elements 'attributeSelector' and 'objectQuery'.

element.name: hw_api->content
element.description: This function returns the content of a document as an object of type . The parameter array contains the required elements 'objectidentifier' and the optional element 'mode'. The mode can be one of the constants , or . means to insert all anchors even if the destination is not reachable. tells hw_api_content to insert only reachable links and will lead to document without any links.

element.name: hw_api->copy
element.description: This function will make a physical copy including the content if it exists and returns the new object or an error object. The parameter array contains the required elements 'objectIdentifier' and 'destinationParentIdentifier'. The optional parameter is 'attributeSelector'`

element.name: hw_api->dstanchors
element.description: Retrieves all destination anchors of an object. The parameter array contains the required element 'objectIdentifier' and the optional elements 'attributeSelector' and 'objectQuery'.

element.name: hw_api->dstofsrcanchor
element.description: Retrieves the destination object pointed by the specified source anchors. The destination object can either be a destination anchor or a whole document. The parameters array contains the required element 'objectIdentifier' and the optional element 'attributeSelector'.

element.name: hw_api->find
element.description: This functions searches for objects either by executing a key or/and full text query. The found objects can further be filtered by an optional object query. They are sorted by their importance. The second search operation is relatively slow and its result can be limited to a certain number of hits. This allows to perform an incremental search, each returning just a subset of all found documents, starting at a given index. The parameter array contains the 'keyquery' or/and 'fulltextquery' depending on who you would like to search. Optional parameters are 'objectquery', 'scope', 'languages' and 'attributeselector'. In case of an incremental search the optional parameters 'startIndex', numberOfObjectsToGet' and 'exactMatchUnit' can be passed.

element.name: hw_api->identify
element.description: Logs into the Hyperwave Server. The parameter array must contain the elements 'username' and 'password'.

element.name: hw_api->insert
element.description: Insert a new object. The object type can be user, group, document or anchor. Depending on the type other object attributes has to be set. The parameter array contains the required elements 'object' and 'content' (if the object is a document) and the optional parameters 'parameters', 'mode' and 'attributeSelector'. The 'object' must contain all attributes of the object. 'parameters' is an object as well holding further attributes like the destination (attribute key is 'Parent'). 'content' is the content of the document. 'mode' can be a combination of the following flags:

element.name: hw_api->insertanchor
element.description: This function is a shortcut for hwapi_insert . It inserts an object of type anchor and sets some of the attributes required for an anchor. The parameter array contains the required elements 'object' and 'documentIdentifier' and the optional elements 'destinationIdentifier', 'parameter', 'hint' and 'attributeSelector'. The 'documentIdentifier' specifies the document where the anchor shall be inserted. The target of the anchor is set in 'destinationIdentifier' if it already exists. If the target does not exists the element 'hint' has to be set to the name of object which is supposed to be inserted later. Once it is inserted the anchor target is resolved automatically.

element.name: hw_api->insertcollection
element.description: This function is a shortcut for hwapi_insert . It inserts an object of type collection and sets some of the attributes required for a collection. The parameter array contains the required elements 'object' and 'parentIdentifier' and the optional elements 'parameter' and 'attributeSelector'. See hwapi_insert for the meaning of each element.

element.name: hw_api->insertdocument
element.description: This function is a shortcut for hwapi_insert . It inserts an object with content and sets some of the attributes required for a document. The parameter array contains the required elements 'object', 'parentIdentifier' and 'content' and the optional elements 'mode', 'parameter' and 'attributeSelector'. See hwapi_insert for the meaning of each element.

element.name: hw_api->link
element.description: Creates a link to an object. Accessing this link is like accessing the object to links points to. The parameter array contains the required elements 'objectIdentifier' and 'destinationParentIdentifier'. 'destinationParentIdentifier' is the target collection.

element.name: hw_api->lock
element.description: Locks an object for exclusive editing by the user calling this function. The object can be only unlocked by this user or the system user. The parameter array contains the required element 'objectIdentifier' and the optional parameters 'mode' and 'objectquery'. 'mode' determines how an object is locked. means, an object is locked until it is unlocked. is only valid for collection and locks all objects within the collection and possible subcollections. means, an object is locked only as long as the session is valid.

element.name: hw_api->object
element.description: This function retrieves the attribute information of an object of any version. It will not return the document content. The parameter array contains the required elements 'objectIdentifier' and the optional elements 'attributeSelector' and 'version'.

element.name: hw_api->objectbyanchor
element.description: This function retrieves an object the specified anchor belongs to. The parameter array contains the required element 'objectIdentifier' and the optional element 'attributeSelector'.

element.name: hw_api->parents
element.description: Retrieves the parents of an object. The parents can be further filtered by specifying an object query. The parameter array contains the required elements 'objectidentifier' and the optional elements 'attributeselector' and 'objectquery'.

element.name: hw_api->remove
element.description: Removes an object from the specified parent. Collections will be removed recursively. You can pass an optional object query to remove only those objects which match the query. An object will be deleted physically if it is the last instance. The parameter array contains the required elements 'objectidentifier' and 'parentidentifier'. If you want to remove a user or group 'parentidentifier' can be skipped. The optional parameter 'mode' determines how the deletion is performed. In normal mode the object will not be removed physically until all instances are removed. In physical mode all instances of the object will be deleted immediately. In removelinks mode all references to and from the objects will be deleted as well. In nonrecursive the deletion is not performed recursive. Removing a collection which is not empty will cause an error.

element.name: hw_api->replace
element.description: Replaces the attributes and the content of an object The parameter array contains the required elements 'objectIdentifier' and 'object' and the optional parameters 'content', 'parameters', 'mode' and 'attributeSelector'. 'objectIdentifier' contains the object to be replaced. 'object' contains the new object. 'content' contains the new content. 'parameters' contain extra information for HTML documents. HTML_Language is the letter abbreviation of the language of the title. HTML_Base sets the base attribute of the HTML document. 'mode' can be a combination of the following flags:

element.name: hw_api->setcommittedversion
element.description: Commits a version of a document. The committed version is the one which is visible to users with read access. By default the last version is the committed version.

element.name: hw_api->srcanchors
element.description: Retrieves all source anchors of an object. The parameter array contains the required element 'objectIdentifier' and the optional elements 'attributeSelector' and 'objectQuery'.

element.name: hw_api->srcsofdst
element.description: Retrieves all the source anchors pointing to the specified destination. The destination object can either be a destination anchor or a whole document. The parameters array contains the required element 'objectIdentifier' and the optional element 'attributeSelector' and 'objectQuery'. The function returns an array of objects or an error.

element.name: hw_api->unlock
element.description: Unlocks a locked object. Only the user who has locked the object and the system user may unlock an object. The parameter array contains the required element 'objectIdentifier' and the optional parameters 'mode' and 'objectquery'. The meaning of 'mode' is the same as in function hwapi_lock .

element.name: hw_api_attribute
element.description: Creates a new instance of hw_api_attribute with the given name and value.

element.name: hw_api_attribute->key
element.description: Returns the name of the attribute.

element.name: hw_api_attribute->langdepvalue
element.description: Returns the value in the given language of the attribute.

element.name: hw_api_attribute->value
element.description: Returns the value of the attribute.

element.name: hw_api_attribute->values
element.description: Returns all values of the attribute as an array of strings.

element.name: hw_api_content
element.description: Creates a new content object from the string content . The mimetype is set to mimetype .

element.name: hw_api_content->mimetype
element.description: Returns the mimetype of the content.

element.name: hw_api_content->read
element.description: Reads len bytes from the content into the given buffer.

element.name: hw_api_error->count
element.description: Returns the number of error reasons.

element.name: hw_api_error->reason
element.description: Returns the first error reason.

element.name: hw_api_object->assign
element.description: Clones the attributes of an object.

element.name: hw_api_object->insert
element.description: Adds an attribute to the object. Returns on success and otherwise .

element.name: hw_api_object->remove
element.description: Removes the attribute with the given name. Returns on success and otherwise .

element.name: hw_api_object->value
element.description: Returns the value of the attribute with the given name or if an error occurred.

element.name: hw_api_reason->description
element.description: Returns the description of a reason

element.name: hw_api_reason->type
element.description: Returns the type of a reason.

element.name: hwapi_hgcsp
element.description: Opens a connection to the Hyperwave server on host hostname . The protocol used is HGCSP. If you do not pass a port number, 418 is used.

element.name: icap_close
element.description: Closes the given icap stream.

element.name: icap_delete_event
element.description: icap_delete_event deletes the calendar event specified by the uid .

element.name: icap_fetch_event
element.description: icap_fetch_event fetches an event from the calendar stream specified by event_id .

element.name: icap_list_alarms
element.description: Returns an array of event ID's that has an alarm going off at the given datetime.

element.name: icap_list_events
element.description: Returns an array of event ID's that are between the two given datetimes.

element.name: icap_open
element.description: Returns an ICAP stream on success, on error.

element.name: icap_snooze
element.description: icap_snooze turns on an alarm for a calendar event specified by the uid .

element.name: icap_store_event
element.description: icap_store_event Stores an event into an ICAP calendar. An event object consists of:

element.name: iis_get_server_by_path
element.description: Each virtual server in IIS is associated with an instance number. iis_get_server_by_path Finds the instance number from the actual path to the root directory.

element.name: imap_8bit
element.description: Convert an 8bit string to a quoted-printable string (according to , section 6.7).

element.name: imap_alerts
element.description: This function returns an array of all of the IMAP alert messages generated since the last imap_alerts call, or the beginning of the page. When imap_alerts is called, the alert stack is subsequently cleared. The IMAP specification requires that these messages be passed to the user.

element.name: imap_append
element.description: imap_append appends a string message to the specified mailbox mbox . If the optional options is specified, writes the options to that mailbox also.

element.name: imap_base64
element.description: imap_base64 function decodes BASE-64 encoded text (see , Section 6.8). The decoded message is returned as a string.

element.name: imap_binary
element.description: Convert an 8bit string to a base64 string (according to , Section 6.8).

element.name: imap_body
element.description: imap_body returns the body of the message, numbered msg_number in the current mailbox.

element.name: imap_check
element.description: Returns information about the current mailbox. Returns on failure.

element.name: imap_clearflag_full
element.description: This function causes a store to delete the specified flag to the flags set for the messages in the specified sequence . The flags which you can unset are "\\Seen", "\\Answered", "\\Flagged", "\\Deleted", and "\\Draft" (as defined by RFC2060). .

element.name: imap_close
element.description: Closes the imap stream. Takes an optional flag , which will silently expunge the mailbox before closing, removing all messages marked for deletion.

element.name: imap_createmailbox
element.description: imap_createmailbox creates a new mailbox specified by mbox . Names containing international characters should be encoded by imap_utf7_encode

element.name: imap_delete
element.description: Returns .

element.name: imap_deletemailbox
element.description: imap_deletemailbox deletes the specified mailbox (see imap_open for the format of mbox names).

element.name: imap_errors
element.description: This function returns an array of all of the IMAP error messages generated since the last imap_errors call, or the beginning of the page. When imap_errors is called, the error stack is subsequently cleared.

element.name: imap_expunge
element.description: imap_expunge deletes all the messages marked for deletion by imap_delete , imap_mail_move , or imap_setflag_full .

element.name: imap_fetch_overview
element.description: This function fetches mail headers for the given sequence and returns an overview of their contents. sequence will contain a sequence of message indices or UIDs, if flags contains FT_UID. The returned value is an array of objects describing one message header each:

element.name: imap_fetchbody
element.description: This function causes a fetch of a particular section of the body of the specified messages as a text string and returns that text string. The section specification is a string of integers delimited by period which index into a body part list as per the IMAP4 specification. Body parts are not decoded by this function.

element.name: imap_fetchheader
element.description: This function causes a fetch of the complete, unfiltered format header of the specified message as a text string and returns that text string.

element.name: imap_fetchstructure
element.description: This function fetches all the structured information for a given message. The optional options parameter only has a single option, FT_UID , which tells the function to treat the msg_number argument as a UID . The returned object includes the envelope, internal date, size, flags and body structure along with a similar object for each mime attachment. The structure of the returned objects is as follows:

element.name: imap_get_quota
element.description: Returns an array with integer values limit and usage for the given mailbox. The value of limit represents the total amount of space allowed for this mailbox. The usage value represents the mailboxes current level of capacity. Will return in the case of failure.

element.name: imap_get_quotaroot
element.description: Returns an array of integer values pertaining to the specified user mailbox. All values contain a key based upon the resource name, and a corresponding array with the usage and limit values within.

element.name: imap_getacl
element.description: This function is currently only available to users of the c-client2000 or greater library.

element.name: imap_getmailboxes
element.description: Returns an array of objects containing mailbox information. Each object has the attributes name , specifying the full name of the mailbox; delimiter , which is the hierarchy delimiter for the part of the hierarchy this mailbox is in; and attributes . Attributes is a bitmask that can be tested against:

element.name: imap_getsubscribed
element.description: This function is identical to imap_getmailboxes , except that it only returns mailboxes that the user is subscribed to.

element.name: imap_headerinfo
element.description: This function returns an object of various header elements.

element.name: imap_headers
element.description: Returns an array of string formatted with header info. One element per mail message.

element.name: imap_last_error
element.description: This function returns the full text of the last IMAP error message that occurred on the current page. The error stack is untouched; calling imap_last_error subsequently, with no intervening errors, will return the same error.

element.name: imap_list
element.description: Returns an array containing the names of the mailboxes. See imap_getmailboxes for a description of ref and pattern .

element.name: imap_listscan
element.description: Returns an array containing the names of the mailboxes that have content in the text of the mailbox.

element.name: imap_lsub
element.description: Returns an array of all the mailboxes that you have subscribed.

element.name: imap_mail
element.description: This function allows sending of emails with correct handling of Cc and Bcc receivers. .

element.name: imap_mail_copy
element.description: Copies mail messages specified by msglist to specified mailbox. .

element.name: imap_mail_move
element.description: Moves mail messages specified by msglist to specified mailbox mbox . .

element.name: imap_mailboxmsginfo
element.description: Returns information about the current mailbox. Returns on failure.

element.name: imap_mime_header_decode
element.description: imap_mime_header_decode function decodes MIME message header extensions that are non ASCII text (see ) The decoded elements are returned in an array of objects, where each object has two properties, "charset" and "text". If the element hasn't been encoded, and in other words is in plain US-ASCII,the "charset" property of that element is set to "default".

element.name: imap_msgno
element.description: This function returns the message sequence number for the given uid . It is the inverse of imap_uid .

element.name: imap_num_msg
element.description: Return the number of messages in the current mailbox.

element.name: imap_num_recent
element.description: Returns the number of recent messages in the current mailbox.

element.name: imap_open
element.description: Returns an IMAP stream on success and on error. This function can also be used to open streams to POP3 and NNTP servers, but some functions and features are only available on IMAP servers.

element.name: imap_ping
element.description: Returns if the stream is still alive, otherwise.

element.name: imap_qprint
element.description: Convert a quoted-printable string to an 8 bit string (according to , section 6.7).

element.name: imap_renamemailbox
element.description: This function renames on old mailbox to new mailbox (see imap_open for the format of mbox names).

element.name: imap_reopen
element.description: This function reopens the specified stream to a new mailbox on an IMAP or NNTP server.

element.name: imap_rfc822_parse_adrlist
element.description: This function parses the address string as defined in and for each address, returns an array of objects. The objects properties are:

element.name: imap_rfc822_parse_headers
element.description: This function returns an object of various header elements, similar to imap_header , except without the flags and other elements that come from the IMAP server.

element.name: imap_rfc822_write_address
element.description: Returns a properly formatted email address as defined in given the mailbox , host , and personal info.

element.name: imap_search
element.description: This function performs a search on the mailbox currently opened in the given imap stream. criteria is a string, delimited by spaces, in which the following keywords are allowed. Any multi-word arguments (e.g. FROM "joey smith") must be quoted.

element.name: imap_set_quota
element.description: Sets an upper limit quota on a per mailbox basis. This function requires the imap_stream to have been opened as the mail administrator account. It will not work if opened as any other user.

element.name: imap_setflag_full
element.description: This function causes a store to add the specified flag to the flags set for the messages in the specified sequence .

element.name: imap_sort
element.description: Returns an array of message numbers sorted by the given parameters.

element.name: imap_status
element.description: This function returns an object containing status information. Valid flags are:

element.name: imap_subscribe
element.description: Subscribe to a new mailbox.

element.name: imap_thread
element.description: imap_thread returns an associative array containing a tree of messages threaded by , or on error.

element.name: imap_uid
element.description: This function returns the UID for the given message sequence number. An UID is an unique identifier that will not change over time while a message sequence number may change whenever the content of the mailbox changes. This function is the inverse of imap_msgno .

element.name: imap_undelete
element.description: This function removes the deletion flag for a specified message, which is set by imap_delete or imap_mail_move .

element.name: imap_unsubscribe
element.description: Unsubscribe from a specified mailbox.

element.name: imap_utf7_decode
element.description: Decodes modified UTF-7 text into ISO-8859-1 string.

element.name: imap_utf7_encode
element.description: Converts data to modified UTF-7 text. Note that data is expected to be encoded in ISO-8859-1.

element.name: imap_utf8
element.description: Converts the given mime_encoded_text to UTF-8. MIME encoding method and the UTF-8 specification are described in and respectively.

element.name: ircg_channel_mode
element.description: Set channel mode flags for channel on server connected to by connection . Mode flags are passed in mode_spec and are applied to the user specified by nick .

element.name: ircg_disconnect
element.description: ircg_disconnect will close a connection to a server previously established with ircg_pconnect .

element.name: ircg_eval_ecmascript_params
element.description: See also ircg_lookup_format_messages .

element.name: ircg_fetch_error_msg
element.description: ircg_fetch_error_msg returns the error from a failed connection.

element.name: ircg_get_username
element.description: Function ircg_get_username returns the username for the specified connection connection . Returns if connection died or is not valid.

element.name: ircg_html_encode
element.description: Encodes a HTML string html_string for output. This exposes the interface which the IRCG extension uses internally to reformat data coming from an IRC link. The function causes IRC color/font codes to be encoded in HTML and escapes certain entities.

element.name: ircg_ignore_add
element.description: This function adds user nick to the ignore list of connection connection . Afterwards, IRCG will suppress all messages from this user through the associated connection.

element.name: ircg_ignore_del
element.description: This function removes user nick from the IRCG ignore list associated with connection .

element.name: ircg_invite
element.description: ircg_invite will send an invitation to the user nickname , prompting him to join channel .

element.name: ircg_is_conn_alive
element.description: ircg_is_conn_alive returns if connection is still alive and working or , if the connection has died for some reason.

element.name: ircg_join
element.description: Join the channel channel on the server connected to by connection . IRCG will optionally pass the room key key .

element.name: ircg_kick
element.description: Kick user nick from channel on server connected to by connection . reason should give a short message describing why this action was performed.

element.name: ircg_list
element.description: This example will output something similar to:

element.name: ircg_lookup_format_messages
element.description: Check for the existence of the format message set name . Sets may be registered with ircg_register_format_messages , a default set named is always available. Returns , if the set exists and otherwise.

element.name: ircg_lusers
element.description: ircg_lusers will request a statistical breakdown of users on the network connected to on connection . The answer is sent to the output defined by ircg_set_file or ircg_set_current .

element.name: ircg_msg
element.description: ircg_msg will send the message to a channel or user on the server connected to by connection . A recipient starting with or will send the message to a channel, anything else will be interpreted as a username.

element.name: ircg_nick
element.description: Change your nickname on the given connection to the one given in nick , if possible.

element.name: ircg_nickname_escape
element.description: Function ircg_nickname_escape returns an encoded nickname specified by nick which is IRC-compliant.

element.name: ircg_nickname_unescape
element.description: Function ircg_nickname_unescape returns a decoded nickname, which is specified in nick .

element.name: ircg_notice
element.description: This function will send the message text to the user nick on the server connected to by connection . IRC servers and other software will not automatically generate replies to NOTICEs in contrast to other message types.

element.name: ircg_oper
element.description: ircg_oper will authenticate the logged in user on connection as an IRC operator. name and password must match a registered IRC operator account.

element.name: ircg_part
element.description: Leave the channel channel on the server connected to by connection .

element.name: ircg_pconnect
element.description: ircg_pconnect will try to establish a connection to an IRC server and return a connection resource handle for further use.

element.name: ircg_register_format_messages
element.description: With ircg_register_format_messages you can customize the way your IRC output looks like or which script functions are invoked on the client side.

element.name: ircg_set_current
element.description: Select the current HTTP connection for output in this execution context. Every output sent from the server connected to by connection will be copied to standard output while using default formatting or a format message set specified by ircg_register_format_messages .

element.name: ircg_set_file
element.description: Function ircg_set_file specifies a logfile path in which all output from connection connection will be logged. Returns on success, otherwise .

element.name: ircg_set_on_die
element.description: In case of the termination of connection connection IRCG will connect to host at port (Note: host must be an IPv4 address, IRCG does not resolve host-names due to blocking issues), send data to the new host connection and will wait until the remote part closes connection. This can be used to trigger a PHP script for example.

element.name: ircg_topic
element.description: Change the topic for channel channel on the server connected to by connection to new_topic .

element.name: ircg_who
element.description: ircg_who will request a list of users whose nickname is matching mask on connected network connection . The optional parameter ops_only will shrink the list to server operators only.

element.name: ircg_whois
element.description: Sends a query to the connected server connection to ask for information about the specified user nick .

element.name: getimagesize
element.description: The getimagesize function will determine the size of any , , , , , , , , , , , , , , or image file and return the dimensions along with the file type and a height/width text string to be used inside a normal tag.

element.name: image2wbmp
element.description: image2wbmp creates the file in filename from the image image . The image argument is the return from imagecreate .

element.name: image_type_to_mime_type
element.description: The image_type_to_mime_type function will determine the Mime-Type for an IMAGETYPE constant.

element.name: imagealphablending
element.description: imagealphablending allows for two different modes of drawing on truecolor images. In blending mode, the alpha channel component of the color supplied to all drawing function, such as imagesetpixel determines how much of the underlying color should be allowed to shine through. As a result, gd automatically blends the existing color at that point with the drawing color, and stores the result in the image. The resulting pixel is opaque. In non-blending mode, the drawing color is copied literally with its alpha channel information, replacing the destination pixel. Blending mode is not available when drawing on palette images. If blendmode is , then blending mode is enabled, otherwise disabled.

element.name: imageantialias
element.description: See also imagecreatetruecolor .

element.name: imagearc
element.description: imagearc draws a partial ellipse centered at cx , cy (top left is 0, 0) in the image represented by image . W and h specifies the ellipse's width and height respectively while the start and end points are specified in degrees indicated by the s and e arguments. 0 is located at the three-o'clock position, and the arc is drawn clockwise.

element.name: imagechar
element.description: imagechar draws the first character of c in the image identified by image with its upper-left at x , y (top left is 0, 0) with the color color . If font is 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5, a built-in font is used (with higher numbers corresponding to larger fonts).

element.name: imagecharup
element.description: imagecharup draws the character c vertically in the image identified by image at coordinates x , y (top left is 0, 0) with the color color . If font is 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5, a built-in font is used.

element.name: imagecolorallocate
element.description: imagecolorallocate returns a color identifier representing the color composed of the given components. The image argument is the return from the imagecreate function. red , green and blue are the values of the red, green and blue component of the requested color respectively. These parameters are integers between 0 and 255 or hexadecimals between 0x00 and 0xFF. imagecolorallocate must be called to create each color that is to be used in the image represented by image .

element.name: imagecolorallocatealpha
element.description: imagecolorallocatealpha behaves identically to imagecolorallocate with the addition of the transparency parameter alpha which may have a value between and . indicates completely opaque while indicates completely transparent.

element.name: imagecolorat
element.description: Returns the index of the color of the pixel at the specified location in the image specified by image .

element.name: imagecolorclosest
element.description: Returns the index of the color in the palette of the image which is "closest" to the specified value.

element.name: imagecolorclosestalpha
element.description: Returns the index of the color in the palette of the image which is "closest" to the specified value and alpha level.

element.name: imagecolordeallocate
element.description: The imagecolordeallocate function de-allocates a color previously allocated with imagecolorallocate or imagecolorallocatealpha .

element.name: imagecolorexact
element.description: Returns the index of the specified color in the palette of the image.

element.name: imagecolorexactalpha
element.description: Returns the index of the specified color+alpha in the palette of the image.

element.name: imagecolormatch
element.description: image1 must be Truecolor, image2 must be Palette, and both image1 and image2 must be the same size.

element.name: imagecolorresolve
element.description: This function is guaranteed to return a color index for a requested color, either the exact color or the closest possible alternative.

element.name: imagecolorresolvealpha
element.description: This function is guaranteed to return a color index for a requested color, either the exact color or the closest possible alternative.

element.name: imagecolorset
element.description: This sets the specified index in the palette to the specified color. This is useful for creating flood-fill-like effects in palleted images without the overhead of performing the actual flood-fill.

element.name: imagecolorsforindex
element.description: This returns an associative array with red, green, blue and alpha keys that contain the appropriate values for the specified color index.

element.name: imagecolorstotal
element.description: This returns the number of colors in the specified image's palette.

element.name: imagecolortransparent
element.description: imagecolortransparent sets the transparent color in the image image to color . image is the image identifier returned by imagecreate and color is a color identifier returned by imagecolorallocate .

element.name: imagecopy
element.description: Copy a part of src_im onto dst_im starting at the x,y coordinates src_x , src_y with a width of src_w and a height of src_h . The portion defined will be copied onto the x,y coordinates, dst_x and dst_y .

element.name: imagecopymerge
element.description: Copy a part of src_im onto dst_im starting at the x,y coordinates src_x , src_y with a width of src_w and a height of src_h . The portion defined will be copied onto the x,y coordinates, dst_x and dst_y . The two images will be merged according to pct which can range from 0 to 100. When pct = 0, no action is taken, when 100 this function behaves identically to imagecopy for pallete images, while it implements alpha transparency for true colour images.

element.name: imagecopymergegray
element.description: imagecopymergegray copy a part of src_im onto dst_im starting at the x,y coordinates src_x , src_y with a width of src_w and a height of src_h . The portion defined will be copied onto the x,y coordinates, dst_x and dst_y . The two images will be merged according to pct which can range from 0 to 100. When pct = 0, no action is taken, when 100 this function behaves identically to imagecopy .

element.name: imagecopyresampled
element.description: imagecopyresampled copies a rectangular portion of one image to another image, smoothly interpolating pixel values so that, in particular, reducing the size of an image still retains a great deal of clarity.

element.name: imagecopyresized
element.description: imagecopyresized copies a rectangular portion of one image to another image. dst_image is the destination image, src_image is the source image identifier. If the source and destination coordinates and width and heights differ, appropriate stretching or shrinking of the image fragment will be performed. The coordinates refer to the upper left corner. This function can be used to copy regions within the same image (if dst_image is the same as src_image ) but if the regions overlap the results will be unpredictable.

element.name: imagecreate
element.description: imagecreate returns an image identifier representing a blank image of size x_size by y_size .

element.name: imagecreatefromgif
element.description: imagecreatefromgif returns an image identifier representing the image obtained from the given filename.

element.name: imagecreatefromjpeg
element.description: imagecreatefromjpeg returns an image identifier representing the image obtained from the given filename.

element.name: imagecreatefrompng
element.description: imagecreatefrompng returns an image identifier representing the image obtained from the given filename.

element.name: imagecreatefromstring
element.description: imagecreatefromstring returns an image identifier representing the image obtained from the given string. These types will be automatically detected if your build of PHP supports them: JPEG, PNG, GIF, WBMP, and GD2.

element.name: imagecreatefromwbmp
element.description: imagecreatefromwbmp returns an image identifier representing the image obtained from the given filename.

element.name: imagecreatefromxbm
element.description: imagecreatefromxbm returns an image identifier representing the image obtained from the given filename.

element.name: imagecreatefromxpm
element.description: imagecreatefromxpm returns an image identifier representing the image obtained from the given filename.

element.name: imagecreatetruecolor
element.description: imagecreatetruecolor returns an image identifier representing a black image of size x_size by y_size .

element.name: imagedashedline
element.description: This function is deprecated. Use combination of imagesetstyle and imageline instead.

element.name: imagedestroy
element.description: imagedestroy frees any memory associated with image image . image is the image identifier returned by the imagecreate function.

element.name: imageellipse
element.description: imageellipse draws an ellipse centered at cx , cy (top left is 0, 0) in the image represented by image . W and h specifies the ellipse's width and height respectively. The color of the ellipse is specified by color .

element.name: imagefill
element.description: imagefill performs a flood fill starting at coordinate x , y (top left is 0, 0) with color color in the image image .

element.name: imagefilledarc
element.description: imagefilledarc draws a partial ellipse centered at cx , cy (top left is 0, 0) in the image represented by image . W and h specifies the ellipse's width and height respectively while the start and end points are specified in degrees indicated by the s and e arguments. style is a bitwise OR of the following possibilities: and are mutually exclusive; just connects the starting and ending angles with a straight line, while produces a rounded edge. indicates that the arc or chord should be outlined, not filled. , used together with , indicates that the beginning and ending angles should be connected to the center - this is a good way to outline (rather than fill) a 'pie slice'.

element.name: imagefilledellipse
element.description: imagefilledellipse draws an ellipse centered at cx , cy (top left is 0, 0) in the image represented by image . W and h specifies the ellipse's width and height respectively. The ellipse is filled using color .

element.name: imagefilledpolygon
element.description: imagefilledpolygon creates a filled polygon in image image .

element.name: imagefilledrectangle
element.description: imagefilledrectangle creates a filled rectangle of color color in image image starting at upper left coordinates x1 , y1 and ending at bottom right coordinates x2 , y2 . 0, 0 is the top left corner of the image.

element.name: imagefilltoborder
element.description: imagefilltoborder performs a flood fill whose border color is defined by border . The starting point for the fill is x , y (top left is 0, 0) and the region is filled with color color .

element.name: imagefilter
element.description: imagefilter applies the filter filtertype to the image, using arg1 , arg2 and arg3 where necessary.

element.name: imagefontheight
element.description: Returns the pixel height of a character in the specified font.

element.name: imagefontwidth
element.description: Returns the pixel width of a character in font.

element.name: imagegammacorrect
element.description: The imagegammacorrect function applies gamma correction to a gd image stream ( image ) given an input gamma, the parameter inputgamma and an output gamma, the parameter outputgamma .

element.name: imagegd
element.description: imagegd outputs a GD image to filename . The image argument is the return from the imagecreate function.

element.name: imagegd2
element.description: imagegd2 outputs a GD2 image to filename . The image parameter is the return from the imagecreate function.

element.name: imagegif
element.description: imagegif creates the file in filename from the image image . The image argument is the return from the imagecreate function.

element.name: imageinterlace
element.description: imageinterlace turns the interlace bit on or off. If interlace is 1 the image will be interlaced, and if interlace is 0 the interlace bit is turned off.

element.name: imageistruecolor
element.description: imageistruecolor finds whether the image image is a truecolor image.

element.name: imagejpeg
element.description: imagejpeg creates the file in filename from the image image . The image argument is the return from the imagecreate function.

element.name: imageline
element.description: imageline draws a line from x1 , y1 to x2 , y2 (top left is 0, 0) in image image of color color .

element.name: imageloadfont
element.description: imageloadfont loads a user-defined bitmap font and returns an identifier for the font (that is always greater than 5, so it will not conflict with the built-in fonts). It returns in case of error.

element.name: imagepalettecopy
element.description: imagepalettecopy copies the palette from the source image to the destination image.

element.name: imagepng
element.description: The imagepng outputs a GD image stream ( image ) in PNG format to standard output (usually the browser) or, if a filename is given by the filename it outputs the image to the file.

element.name: imagepolygon
element.description: imagepolygon creates a polygon in image id. points is a PHP array containing the polygon's vertices, i.e. points[0] = x0, points[1] = y0, points[2] = x1, points[3] = y1, etc. num_points is the total number of points (vertices).

element.name: imagepsbbox
element.description: size is expressed in pixels.

element.name: imagepscopyfont
element.description: Use this function if you need make further modifications to the font, for example extending/condensing, slanting it or changing its character encoding vector, but need to keep the original along as well. Note that the font you want to copy must be one obtained using imagepsloadfont , not a font that is itself a copied one. You can although make modifications to it before copying.

element.name: imagepsencodefont
element.description: Loads a character encoding vector from a file and changes the fonts encoding vector to it. As a PostScript fonts default vector lacks most of the character positions above 127, you'll definitely want to change this if you use an other language than English. The exact format of this file is described in T1libs documentation. T1lib comes with two ready-to-use files, IsoLatin1.enc and IsoLatin2.enc.

element.name: imagepsextendfont
element.description: Extend or condense a font ( font_index ), if the value of the extend parameter is less than one you will be condensing the font.

element.name: imagepsfreefont
element.description: imagepsfreefont frees memory used by a PostScript Type 1 font.

element.name: imagepsloadfont
element.description: In the case everything went right, a valid font index will be returned and can be used for further purposes. Otherwise the function returns and prints a message describing what went wrong, which you cannot read directly, while the output type is image.

element.name: imagepsslantfont
element.description: Slant a font given by the font_index parameter with a slant of the value of the slant parameter.

element.name: imagepstext
element.description: foreground is the color in which the text will be painted. Background is the color to which the text will try to fade in with antialiasing. No pixels with the color background are actually painted, so the background image does not need to be of solid color.

element.name: imagerectangle
element.description: imagerectangle creates a rectangle of color col in image image starting at upper left coordinate x1, y1 and ending at bottom right coordinate x2, y2. 0, 0 is the top left corner of the image.

element.name: imagerotate
element.description: Rotates the src_im image using a given angle in degrees. bgd_color specifies the color of the uncovered zone after the rotation.

element.name: imagesavealpha
element.description: imagesavealpha sets the flag to attempt to save full alpha channel information (as opposed to single-color transparency) when saving PNG images.

element.name: imagesetbrush
element.description: imagesetbrush sets the brush image to be used by all line drawing functions (such as imageline and imagepolygon ) when drawing with the special colors or .

element.name: imagesetpixel
element.description: imagesetpixel draws a pixel at x , y (top left is 0, 0) in image image of color color .

element.name: imagesetstyle
element.description: imagesetstyle sets the style to be used by all line drawing functions (such as imageline and imagepolygon ) when drawing with the special color or lines of images with color .

element.name: imagesetthickness
element.description: imagesetthickness sets the thickness of the lines drawn when drawing rectangles, polygons, ellipses etc. etc. to thickness pixels.

element.name: imagesettile
element.description: imagesettile sets the tile image to be used by all region filling functions (such as imagefill and imagefilledpolygon ) when filling with the special color .

element.name: imagestring
element.description: imagestring draws the string s in the image identified by image with the upper-left corner at coordinates x , y (top left is 0, 0) in color col . If font is 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5, a built-in font is used.

element.name: imagestringup
element.description: imagestringup draws the string s vertically in the image identified by image at coordinates x , y (top left is 0, 0) in color col . If font is 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5, a built-in font is used.

element.name: imagesx
element.description: imagesx returns the width of the image identified by image .

element.name: imagesy
element.description: imagesy returns the height of the image identified by image .

element.name: imagetruecolortopalette
element.description: imagetruecolortopalette converts a truecolor image to a palette image. The code for this function was originally drawn from the Independent JPEG Group library code, which is excellent. The code has been modified to preserve as much alpha channel information as possible in the resulting palette, in addition to preserving colors as well as possible. This does not work as well as might be hoped. It is usually best to simply produce a truecolor output image instead, which guarantees the highest output quality.

element.name: imagettfbbox
element.description: This function calculates and returns the bounding box in pixels for a TrueType text. imagettfbbox returns an array with 8 elements representing four points making the bounding box of the text: The points are relative to the regardless of the angle, so "upper left" means in the top left-hand corner seeing the text horizontally.

element.name: imagettftext
element.description: In many cases where a font resides in the same directory as the script using it the following trick will alleviate any include problems.

element.name: imagetypes
element.description: This function returns a bit-field corresponding to the image formats supported by the version of GD linked into PHP. The following bits are returned, | | | | . To check for PNG support, for example, do this:

element.name: imagewbmp
element.description: imagewbmp creates the file in filename from the image image . The image argument is the return from the imagecreate function.

element.name: jpeg2wbmp
element.description: Converts the jpegname JPEG file to WBMP format, and saves it as wbmpname . With the d_height and d_width you specify the height and width of the destination image.

element.name: png2wbmp
element.description: Converts the pngname PNG file to WBMP format, and saves it as wbmpname . With the d_height and d_width you specify the height and width of the destination image.

element.name: ifx_affected_rows
element.description: result_id is a valid result id returned by ifx_query or ifx_prepare .

element.name: ifx_blobinfile_mode
element.description: Set the default blob mode for all select queries. Mode "0" means save Byte-Blobs in memory, and mode "1" means save Byte-Blobs in a file.

element.name: ifx_byteasvarchar
element.description: Sets the default byte mode for all select-queries. Mode "0" will return a blob id, and mode "1" will return a varchar with text content.

element.name: ifx_close
element.description: Returns: always .

element.name: ifx_connect
element.description: Returns a connection identifier on success, or on error.

element.name: ifx_copy_blob
element.description: Duplicates the given blob object. bid is the ID of the blob object.

element.name: ifx_create_blob
element.description: Creates an blob object.

element.name: ifx_create_char
element.description: Creates an char object. param should be the char content.

element.name: ifx_error
element.description: The Informix error codes (SQLSTATE & SQLCODE) formatted as follows :

element.name: ifx_errormsg
element.description: Returns the Informix error message associated with the most recent Informix error, or, when the optional " errorcode " parameter is present, the error message corresponding to " errorcode ".

element.name: ifx_fetch_row
element.description: Returns an associative array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: ifx_fieldproperties
element.description: Returns an associative array with fieldnames as key and the SQL fieldproperties as data for a query with result_id . Returns on error.

element.name: ifx_fieldtypes
element.description: Returns an associative array with fieldnames as key and the SQL fieldtypes as data for query with result_id . Returns on error.

element.name: ifx_free_blob
element.description: Deletes the blobobject for the given blob object-id bid .

element.name: ifx_free_char
element.description: Deletes the charobject for the given char object-id bid .

element.name: ifx_free_result
element.description: Releases resources for the query associated with result_id .

element.name: ifx_get_blob
element.description: Returns the content of the blob object for the given blob object-id bid .

element.name: ifx_get_char
element.description: Returns the content of the char object for the given char object-id bid .

element.name: ifx_getsqlca
element.description: result_id is a valid result id returned by ifx_query or ifx_prepare .

element.name: ifx_htmltbl_result
element.description: Returns the number of rows fetched or on error.

element.name: ifx_nullformat
element.description: Sets the default return value of a NULL-value on a fetch row. Mode "0" returns "", and mode "1" returns " ".

element.name: ifx_num_fields
element.description: Returns the number of columns in query for result_id or on error

element.name: ifx_num_rows
element.description: Gives the number of rows fetched so far for a query with result_id after a ifx_query or ifx_do query.

element.name: ifx_pconnect
element.description: Returns: A positive Informix persistent link identifier on success, or on error

element.name: ifx_prepare
element.description: Returns an integer result_id for use by ifx_do . Sets affected_rows for retrieval by the ifx_affected_rows function.

element.name: ifx_query
element.description: Returns a positive Informix result identifier on success, or on error.

element.name: ifx_textasvarchar
element.description: Sets the default text mode for all select-queries. Mode "0" will return a blob id, and mode "1" will return a varchar with text content.

element.name: ifx_update_blob
element.description: Updates the content of the blob object for the given blob object bid . content is a string with new data.

element.name: ifx_update_char
element.description: Updates the content of the char object for the given char object bid . content is a string with new data.

element.name: ifxus_close_slob
element.description: Deletes the slob object on the given slob object-id bid .

element.name: ifxus_create_slob
element.description: Creates an slob object and opens it. Modes: 1 = LO_RDONLY, 2 = LO_WRONLY, 4 = LO_APPEND, 8 = LO_RDWR, 16 = LO_BUFFER, 32 = LO_NOBUFFER -> or-mask. You can also use constants named IFX_LO_RDONLY, IFX_LO_WRONLY etc. Return on error otherwise the new slob object-id.

element.name: ifxus_free_slob
element.description: Deletes the slob object. bid is the Id of the slob object.

element.name: ifxus_open_slob
element.description: Opens an slob object. bid should be an existing slob id. Modes: 1 = LO_RDONLY, 2 = LO_WRONLY, 4 = LO_APPEND, 8 = LO_RDWR, 16 = LO_BUFFER, 32 = LO_NOBUFFER -> or-mask. Returns on error otherwise the new slob object-id.

element.name: ifxus_read_slob
element.description: Reads nbytes of the slob object. bid is a existing slob id and nbytes is the number of bytes read. Return on error otherwise the string.

element.name: ifxus_seek_slob
element.description: Sets the current file or seek position of an open slob object. bid should be an existing slob id. Modes: 0 = LO_SEEK_SET, 1 = LO_SEEK_CUR, 2 = LO_SEEK_END and offset is an byte offset. Return on error otherwise the seek position.

element.name: ifxus_tell_slob
element.description: Returns the current file or seek position of an open slob object bid should be an existing slob id. Return on error otherwise the seek position.

element.name: ifxus_write_slob
element.description: Writes a string into the slob object. bid is an existing slob id and content the content to write. Return on error otherwise bytes written.

element.name: ingres_autocommit
element.description: ingres_autocommit is called before opening a transaction (before the first call to ingres_query or just after a call to ingres_rollback or ingres_commit ) to switch the "autocommit" mode of the server on or off (when the script begins the autocommit mode is off).

element.name: ingres_close
element.description: Returns on success, or on failure.

element.name: ingres_commit
element.description: ingres_commit commits the currently open transaction, making all changes made to the database permanent.

element.name: ingres_connect
element.description: Returns a Ingres II link resource on success, or on failure.

element.name: ingres_fetch_array
element.description: ingres_fetch_array Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: ingres_fetch_object
element.description: ingres_fetch_object Returns an object that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: ingres_fetch_row
element.description: ingres_fetch_row returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows. Each result column is stored in an array offset, starting at offset 1.

element.name: ingres_field_length
element.description: ingres_field_length returns the length of a field. This is the number of bytes used by the server to store the field. For detailed information, see the Ingres/OpenAPI User Guide - Appendix C.

element.name: ingres_field_name
element.description: ingres_field_name returns the name of a field in a query result, or on failure.

element.name: ingres_field_nullable
element.description: ingres_field_nullable returns if the field can be set to the value and if it can't.

element.name: ingres_field_precision
element.description: ingres_field_precision returns the precision of a field. This value is used only for decimal, float and money SQL data types. For detailed information, see the Ingres/OpenAPI User Guide - Appendix C.

element.name: ingres_field_scale
element.description: ingres_field_scale returns the scale of a field. This value is used only for the decimal SQL data type. For detailed information, see the Ingres/OpenAPI User Guide - Appendix C.

element.name: ingres_field_type
element.description: ingres_field_type returns the type of a field in a query result, or on failure. Examples of types returned are "IIAPI_BYTE_TYPE", "IIAPI_CHA_TYPE", "IIAPI_DTE_TYPE", "IIAPI_FLT_TYPE", "IIAPI_INT_TYPE", "IIAPI_VCH_TYPE". Some of these types can map to more than one SQL type depending on the length of the field (see ingres_field_length ). For example "IIAPI_FLT_TYPE" can be a float4 or a float8. For detailed information, see the Ingres/OpenAPI User Guide - Appendix C.

element.name: ingres_num_fields
element.description: ingres_num_fields returns the number of fields in the results returned by the Ingres server after a call to ingres_query

element.name: ingres_num_rows
element.description: For delete, insert or update queries, ingres_num_rows returns the number of rows affected by the query. For other queries, ingres_num_rows returns the number of rows in the query's result.

element.name: ingres_pconnect
element.description: Returns a Ingres II link resource on success, or on failure.

element.name: ingres_query
element.description: Returns on success, or on failure.

element.name: ingres_rollback
element.description: ingres_rollback rolls back the currently open transaction, actually canceling all changes made to the database during the transaction.

element.name: java_last_exception_clear
element.description: See java_last_exception_get for an example.

element.name: java_last_exception_get
element.description: The following example demonstrates the usage of Java's exception handler from within PHP:

element.name: ldap_bind
element.description: Binds to the LDAP directory with specified RDN and password.

element.name: ldap_compare
element.description: ldap_compare is used to compare value of attribute to value of same attribute in LDAP directory entry specified with dn .

element.name: ldap_connect
element.description: Returns a positive LDAP link identifier on success, or on error. When OpenLDAP 2.x.x is used, ldap_connect will always return a as it does not actually connect but just initializes the connecting parameters. The actual connect happens with the next calls to ldap_* funcs, usually with ldap_bind .

element.name: ldap_count_entries
element.description: Returns number of entries in the result or on error.

element.name: ldap_dn2ufn
element.description: ldap_dn2ufn function is used to turn a DN, specified by dn , into a more user-friendly form, stripping off type names.

element.name: ldap_err2str
element.description: Returns string error message.

element.name: ldap_errno
element.description: Return the LDAP error number of the last LDAP command for this link.

element.name: ldap_error
element.description: Returns string error message.

element.name: ldap_explode_dn
element.description: ldap_explode_dn function is used to split the DN returned by ldap_get_dn and breaks it up into its component parts. Each part is known as Relative Distinguished Name, or RDN. ldap_explode_dn returns an array of all those components. with_attrib is used to request if the RDNs are returned with only values or their attributes as well. To get RDNs with the attributes (i.e. in attribute=value format) set with_attrib to 0 and to get only values set it to 1.

element.name: ldap_first_attribute
element.description: Returns the first attribute in the entry on success and on error.

element.name: ldap_first_entry
element.description: Returns the result entry identifier for the first entry on success and on error.

element.name: ldap_get_attributes
element.description: Returns a complete entry information in a multi-dimensional array on success and on error.

element.name: ldap_get_dn
element.description: Returns the DN of the result entry and on error.

element.name: ldap_get_entries
element.description: Returns a complete result information in a multi-dimensional array on success and on error.

element.name: ldap_get_option
element.description: Sets retval to the value of the specified option.

element.name: ldap_get_values
element.description: Returns an array of values for the attribute on success and on error.

element.name: ldap_get_values_len
element.description: Returns an array of values for the attribute on success and on error.

element.name: ldap_list
element.description: Returns a search result identifier or on error.

element.name: ldap_next_attribute
element.description: Returns the next attribute in an entry on success and on error.

element.name: ldap_next_entry
element.description: Returns entry identifier for the next entry in the result whose entries are being read starting with ldap_first_entry . If there are no more entries in the result then it returns .

element.name: ldap_read
element.description: Returns a search result identifier or on error.

element.name: ldap_rename
element.description: The entry specified by dn is renamed/moved. The new RDN is specified by newrdn and the new parent/superior entry is specified by newparent . If the parameter deleteoldrdn is the old RDN value(s) is removed, else the old RDN value(s) is retained as non-distinguished values of the entry.

element.name: ldap_search
element.description: Returns a search result identifier or on error.

element.name: ldap_set_option
element.description: Sets the value of the specified option to be newval . on error.

element.name: lzf_compress
element.description: lzf_compress compresses the given data .

element.name: lzf_decompress
element.description: lzf_compress decompresses the given data .

element.name: lzf_optimized_for
element.description: Determines for what the LZF extension was optimised.

element.name: mcal_append_event
element.description: mcal_append_event stores the global event into an MCAL calendar for the stream mcal_stream .

element.name: mcal_close
element.description: Closes the given mcal stream.

element.name: mcal_create_calendar
element.description: Creates a new calendar named calendar .

element.name: mcal_date_compare
element.description: mcal_date_compare Compares the two given dates, returns < 0, 0, >0 if a < b, a==b, a>b respectively.

element.name: mcal_date_valid
element.description: mcal_date_valid Returns if the given year, month and day is a valid date, if not.

element.name: mcal_day_of_week
element.description: mcal_day_of_week returns the day of the week of the given date. Possible return values range from 0 for Sunday through 6 for Saturday.

element.name: mcal_day_of_year
element.description: mcal_day_of_year returns the day of the year of the given date.

element.name: mcal_days_in_month
element.description: mcal_days_in_month returns the number of days in the month month , taking into account if the considered year is a leap year or not.

element.name: mcal_delete_calendar
element.description: Deletes the calendar named calendar .

element.name: mcal_delete_event
element.description: mcal_delete_event deletes the calendar event specified by the event_id.

element.name: mcal_event_add_attribute
element.description: mcal_event_add_attribute adds an attribute to the stream's global event structure with the value given by "value".

element.name: mcal_event_init
element.description: mcal_event_init initializes a streams global event structure. this effectively sets all elements of the structure to 0, or the default settings.

element.name: mcal_event_set_alarm
element.description: mcal_event_set_alarm sets the streams global event structure's alarm to the given minutes before the event.

element.name: mcal_event_set_category
element.description: mcal_event_set_category sets the streams global event structure's category to the given string.

element.name: mcal_event_set_class
element.description: mcal_event_set_class sets the streams global event structure's class to the given value. The class is either 1 for public, or 0 for private.

element.name: mcal_event_set_description
element.description: mcal_event_set_description sets the streams global event structure's description to the given string.

element.name: mcal_event_set_end
element.description: mcal_event_set_end sets the streams global event structure's end date and time to the given values.

element.name: mcal_event_set_recur_daily
element.description: mcal_event_set_recur_daily sets the streams global event structure's recurrence to the given value to be reoccurring on a daily basis, ending at the given date.

element.name: mcal_event_set_recur_monthly_mday
element.description: mcal_event_set_recur_monthly_mday sets the streams global event structure's recurrence to the given value to be reoccurring on a monthly by month day basis, ending at the given date.

element.name: mcal_event_set_recur_monthly_wday
element.description: mcal_event_set_recur_monthly_wday sets the streams global event structure's recurrence to the given value to be reoccurring on a monthly by week basis, ending at the given date.

element.name: mcal_event_set_recur_none
