element.description: mcal_event_set_recur_none sets the streams global event structure to not recur (event->recur_type is set to ).

element.name: mcal_event_set_recur_weekly
element.description: mcal_event_set_recur_weekly sets the streams global event structure's recurrence to the given value to be reoccurring on a weekly basis, ending at the given date.

element.name: mcal_event_set_recur_yearly
element.description: mcal_event_set_recur_yearly sets the streams global event structure's recurrence to the given value to be reoccurring on a yearly basis,ending at the given date.

element.name: mcal_event_set_start
element.description: mcal_event_set_start sets the streams global event structure's start date and time to the given values.

element.name: mcal_event_set_title
element.description: mcal_event_set_title sets the streams global event structure's title to the given string.

element.name: mcal_expunge
element.description: mcal_expunge deletes all events which have been previously marked for deletion.

element.name: mcal_fetch_current_stream_event
element.description: mcal_fetch_current_stream_event returns the current stream's event structure as an object containing: All datetime entries consist of an object that contains:

element.name: mcal_fetch_event
element.description: mcal_fetch_event fetches an event from the calendar stream specified by id .

element.name: mcal_is_leap_year
element.description: mcal_is_leap_year returns 1 if the given year is a leap year, 0 if not.

element.name: mcal_list_alarms
element.description: Returns an array of event ID's that has an alarm going off between the start and end dates, or if just a stream is given, uses the start and end dates in the global event structure.

element.name: mcal_list_events
element.description: Returns an array of ID's that are between the start and end dates, or if just a stream is given, uses the start and end dates in the global event structure.

element.name: mcal_next_recurrence
element.description: mcal_next_recurrence returns an object filled with the next date the event occurs, on or after the supplied date. Returns empty date field if event does not occur or something is invalid. Uses weekstart to determine what day is considered the beginning of the week.

element.name: mcal_open
element.description: Returns an MCAL stream on success, on error.

element.name: mcal_popen
element.description: Returns an MCAL stream on success, on error.

element.name: mcal_rename_calendar
element.description: Renames the calendar old_name to new_name .

element.name: mcal_reopen
element.description: Reopens an MCAL stream to a new calendar.

element.name: mcal_snooze
element.description: mcal_snooze turns off an alarm for a calendar event specified by the stream_id and event_id .

element.name: mcal_store_event
element.description: mcal_store_event stores the modifications to the current global event for the given stream.

element.name: mcal_time_valid
element.description: mcal_time_valid Returns if the given hour, minutes and seconds is a valid time, if not.

element.name: mcal_week_of_year
element.description: mcal_week_of_year returns the week number of the given date.

element.name: mssql_bind
element.description: See also mssql_execute , mssql_free_statement , and mssql_init .

element.name: mssql_close
element.description: mssql_close closes the link to a MS SQL Server database that's associated with the specified link identifier. If the link identifier isn't specified, the last opened link is assumed.

element.name: mssql_connect
element.description: Returns: A positive MS SQL link identifier on success, or on error.

element.name: mssql_execute
element.description: See also mssql_bind , mssql_free_statement , and mssql_init .

element.name: mssql_fetch_array
element.description: Returns: An array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: mssql_fetch_field
element.description: Returns an object containing field information.

element.name: mssql_fetch_object
element.description: Returns: An object with properties that correspond to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: mssql_fetch_row
element.description: Returns: An array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: mssql_field_length
element.description: This function returns the length of field no. offset in result result . If offset is omitted, the current field is used.

element.name: mssql_field_seek
element.description: Seeks to the specified field offset. If the next call to mssql_fetch_field won't include a field offset, this field would be returned.

element.name: mssql_free_result
element.description: mssql_free_result only needs to be called if you are worried about using too much memory while your script is running. All result memory will automatically be freed when the script ends. You may call mssql_free_result with the result identifier as an argument and the associated result memory will be freed.

element.name: mssql_free_statement
element.description: mssql_free_statement only needs to be called if you are worried about using too much memory while your script is running. All statement memory will automatically be freed when the script ends. You may call mssql_free_statement with the statement identifier as an argument and the associated statement memory will be freed.

element.name: mssql_init
element.description: See also mssql_bind , mssql_execute , and mssql_free_statement

element.name: mssql_next_result
element.description: When sending more than one SQL statement to the server or executing a stored procedure with multiple results, it will cause the server to return multiple result sets. This function will test for additional results available form the server. If an additional result set exists it will free the existing result set and prepare to fetch the rows from the new result set. The function will return if an additional result set was available or otherwise.

element.name: mssql_num_fields
element.description: mssql_num_fields returns the number of fields in a result set.

element.name: mssql_num_rows
element.description: mssql_num_rows returns the number of rows in a result set.

element.name: mssql_pconnect
element.description: Returns: A positive MS SQL persistent link identifier on success, or on error.

element.name: mssql_query
element.description: Returns: A positive MS SQL result identifier on success, if no rows were returned, or on error.

element.name: mssql_result
element.description: mssql_result returns the contents of one cell from a MS SQL result set. The field argument can be the field's offset, the field's name or the field's table dot field's name (tablename.fieldname). If the column name has been aliased ('select foo as bar from...'), it uses the alias instead of the column name.

element.name: mail
element.description: Sends an email.

property.name: additional_parameters
property.description: The parameter can be used to pass an additional parameter to the program configured to use when sending mail using the configuration setting. For example, this can be used to set the envelope sender address when using sendmail with the sendmail option. The user that the webserver runs as should be added as a trusted user to the sendmail configuration to prevent a 'X-Warning' header from being added to the message when the envelope sender (-f) is set using this method. For sendmail users, this file is .

element.name: abs
element.description: Returns the absolute value of number . If the argument number is of type , the return type is also , otherwise it is (as usually has a bigger value range than ).

element.name: acos
element.description: Returns the arc cosine of arg in radians. acos is the complementary function of cos , which means that for every value of a that is within acos ' range.

element.name: acosh
element.description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic cosine of arg , i.e. the value whose hyperbolic cosine is arg .

element.name: asin
element.description: Returns the arc sine of arg in radians. asin is the complementary function of sin , which means that for every value of a that is within asin 's range.

element.name: asinh
element.description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic sine of arg , i.e. the value whose hyperbolic sine is arg .

element.name: atan
element.description: Returns the arc tangent of arg in radians. atan is the complementary function of tan , which means that for every value of a that is within atan 's range.

element.name: atan2
element.description: See also acos and atan .

element.name: atanh
element.description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic tangent of arg , i.e. the value whose hyperbolic tangent is arg .

element.name: base_convert
element.description: Returns a string containing number represented in base tobase . The base in which number is given is specified in frombase . Both frombase and tobase have to be between 2 and 36, inclusive. Digits in numbers with a base higher than 10 will be represented with the letters a-z, with a meaning 10, b meaning 11 and z meaning 35. Outputs:

element.name: bindec
element.description: Returns the decimal equivalent of the binary number represented by the binary_string argument.

element.name: cos
element.description: cos returns the cosine of the arg parameter. The arg parameter is in radians.

element.name: cosh
element.description: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of arg , defined as .

element.name: decbin
element.description: Returns a string containing a binary representation of the given number argument. The largest number that can be converted is 4294967295 in decimal resulting to a string of 32 1's.

element.name: dechex
element.description: Returns a string containing a hexadecimal representation of the given number argument. The largest number that can be converted is 4294967295 in decimal resulting to "ffffffff".

element.name: decoct
element.description: Returns a string containing an octal representation of the given number argument. The largest number that can be converted is 4294967295 in decimal resulting to "37777777777".

element.name: deg2rad
element.description: This function converts number from degrees to the radian equivalent.

element.name: exp
element.description: Returns raised to the power of arg .

element.name: expm1
element.description: expm1 returns the equivalent to 'exp( number ) - 1' computed in a way that is accurate even if the value of number is near zero, a case where 'exp ( number ) - 1' would be inaccurate due to subtraction of two numbers that are nearly equal.

element.name: fmod
element.description: Returns the floating point remainder of dividing the dividend ( x ) by the divisor ( y ). The reminder ( ) is defined as: x = i * y + r, for some integer . If y is non-zero, has the same sign as x and a magnitude less than the magnitude of y .

element.name: hexdec
element.description: Returns the decimal equivalent of the hexadecimal number represented by the hex_string argument. hexdec converts a hexadecimal string to a decimal number. The largest number that can be converted is 7fffffff or 2147483647 in decimal. As of PHP 4.1.0, this function can also convert larger numbers. It returns in that case.

element.name: hypot
element.description: hypot returns the length of the hypotenuse of a right-angle triangle with sides of length x and y , or the distance of the point ( x , y ) from the origin. This is equivalent to .

element.name: is_finite
element.description: Returns if val is a legal finite number within the allowed range for a PHP float on this platform.

element.name: is_infinite
element.description: Returns if val is infinite (positive or negative), like the result of or any value too big to fit into a float on this platform.

element.name: is_nan
element.description: Returns if val is 'not a number', like the result of .

element.name: lcg_value
element.description: lcg_value returns a pseudo random number in the range of (0, 1). The function combines two CGs with periods of 2^31 - 85 and 2^31 - 249. The period of this function is equal to the product of both primes.

element.name: log
element.description: If the optional base parameter is specified, log returns log arg , otherwise log returns the natural logarithm of arg .

element.name: log10
element.description: Returns the base-10 logarithm of arg .

element.name: log1p
element.description: log1p returns log(1 + number ) computed in a way that is accurante even when the value of number is close to zero.

element.name: max
element.description: max returns the numerically highest of the parameter values.

element.name: min
element.description: min returns the numerically lowest of the parameter values.

element.name: mt_rand
element.description: The above example will output something similar to:

element.name: mt_srand
element.description: Seeds the random number generator with seed . Since PHP 4.2.0, the seed becomes optional and defaults to a random value if omitted.

element.name: octdec
element.description: Returns the decimal equivalent of the octal number represented by the octal_string argument. The largest number that can be converted is 17777777777 or 2147483647 in decimal. As of PHP 4.1.0, this function can also convert larger numbers. It returns in that case.

element.name: pow
element.description: Returns base raised to the power of exp . If possible, this function will return an .

element.name: rad2deg
element.description: This function converts number from radian to degrees.

element.name: rand
element.description: The above example will output something similar to:

element.name: round
element.description: Returns the rounded value of val to specified precision (number of digits after the decimal point). precision can also be negative or zero (default).

element.name: sin
element.description: sin returns the sine of the arg parameter. The arg parameter is in radians.

element.name: sinh
element.description: Returns the hyperbolic sine of arg , defined as .

element.name: sqrt
element.description: Returns the square root of arg .

element.name: srand
element.description: Seeds the random number generator with seed . Since PHP 4.2.0, the seed becomes optional and defaults to a random value if omitted.

element.name: tan
element.description: tan returns the tangent of the arg parameter. The arg parameter is in radians.

element.name: tanh
element.description: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of arg , defined as .

element.name: maxdb_affected_rows
element.description: maxdb_affected_rows returns the number of rows affected by the last INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE query associated with the provided link parameter. If this number cannot be determined, this function will return -1.

element.name: maxdb_autocommit
element.description: maxdb_autocommit is used to turn on or off auto-commit mode on queries for the database connection represented by the link resource.

element.name: maxdb_change_user
element.description: maxdb_change_user is used to change the user of the specified database connection as given by the link parameter and to set the current database to that specified by the database parameter.

element.name: maxdb_character_set_name
element.description: Returns the current character set for the database connection specified by the link parameter.

element.name: maxdb_close
element.description: The maxdb_close function closes a previously opened database connection specified by the link parameter.

element.name: maxdb_commit
element.description: Commits the current transaction for the database connection specified by the link parameter.

element.name: maxdb_connect
element.description: The maxdb_connect function attempts to open a connection to the MaxDB Server running on host which can be either a host name or an IP address. Passing the string "localhost" to this parameter, the local host is assumed. If successful, the maxdb_connect will return an resource representing the connection to the database, or on failure.

element.name: maxdb_connect_errno
element.description: The maxdb_connect_errno function will return the last error code number for last call to maxdb_connect . If no errors have occured, this function will return zero.

element.name: maxdb_connect_error
element.description: The maxdb_connect_error function is identical to the corresponding maxdb_connect_errno function in every way, except instead of returning an integer error code the maxdb_connect_error function will return a string representation of the last error to occur for the last maxdb_connect call. If no error has occured, this function will return an empty string.

element.name: maxdb_data_seek
element.description: The maxdb_data_seek function seeks to an arbitrary result pointer specified by the offset in the result set represented by result . The offset parameter must be between zero and the total number of rows minus one (0.. maxdb_num_rows - 1).

element.name: maxdb_debug
element.description: maxdb_debug doesn't return any value.

element.name: maxdb_errno
element.description: The maxdb_errno function will return the last error code for the most recent MaxDB function call that can succeed or fail with respect to the database link defined by the link parameter. If no errors have occured, this function will return zero.

element.name: maxdb_error
element.description: The maxdb_error function is identical to the corresponding maxdb_errno function in every way, except instead of returning an integer error code the maxdb_error function will return a string representation of the last error to occur for the database connection represented by the link parameter. If no error has occured, this function will return an empty string.

element.name: maxdb_fetch_array
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row or if there are no more rows for the resultset represented by the result parameter.

element.name: maxdb_fetch_assoc
element.description: Returns an associative array that corresponds to the fetched row or if there are no more rows.

element.name: maxdb_fetch_field
element.description: The maxdb_fetch_field returns the definition of one column of a result set as an resource. Call this function repeatedly to retrieve information about all columns in the result set. maxdb_fetch_field returns when no more fields are left.

element.name: maxdb_fetch_field_direct
element.description: maxdb_fetch_field_direct returns an resource which contains field definition informations from specified resultset. The value of fieldnr must be in the range from to .

element.name: maxdb_fetch_fields
element.description: This function serves an identical purpose to the maxdb_fetch_field function with the single difference that, instead of returning one resource at a time for each field, the columns are returned as an array of resources.

element.name: maxdb_fetch_lengths
element.description: The maxdb_fetch_lengths function returns an array containing the lengths of every column of the current row within the result set represented by the result parameter. If successful, a numerically indexed array representing the lengths of each column is returned or on failure.

element.name: maxdb_fetch_resource
element.description: The maxdb_fetch_resource will return the current row result set as an resource where the attributes of the resource represent the names of the fields found within the result set. If no more rows exist in the current result set, is returned.

element.name: maxdb_fetch_row
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: maxdb_field_count
element.description: Returns the number of columns for the most recent query on the connection represented by the link parameter. This function can be useful when using the maxdb_store_result function to determine if the query should have produced a non-empty result set or not without knowing the nature of the query.

element.name: maxdb_field_seek
element.description: Sets the field cursor to the given offset. The next call to maxdb_fetch_field will retrieve the field definition of the column associated with that offset.

element.name: maxdb_field_tell
element.description: Returns the position of the field cursor used for the last maxdb_fetch_field call. This value can be used as an argument to maxdb_field_seek .

element.name: maxdb_free_result
element.description: The maxdb_free_result function frees the memory associated with the result represented by the result parameter, which was allocated by maxdb_query , maxdb_store_result or maxdb_use_result .

element.name: maxdb_get_client_info
element.description: The maxdb_get_client_info function is used to return a string representing the client version being used in the MaxDB extension.

element.name: maxdb_get_client_version
element.description: Returns client version number as an integer.

element.name: maxdb_get_host_info
element.description: The maxdb_get_host_info function returns a string describing the connection represented by the link parameter is using.

element.name: maxdb_get_proto_info
element.description: Returns an integer representing the MaxDB protocol version used by the connection represented by the link parameter.

element.name: maxdb_get_server_info
element.description: Returns a string representing the version of the MaxDB server that the MaxDB extension is connected to (represented by the link parameter).

element.name: maxdb_get_server_version
element.description: The maxdb_get_server_version function returns the version of the server connected to (represented by the link parameter) as an integer.

element.name: maxdb_info
element.description: The maxdb_info function returns a string providing information about the last query executed. The nature of this string is provided below:

element.name: maxdb_init
element.description: Allocates or initializes a MaxDB resource suitable for maxdb_options and maxdb_real_connect .

element.name: maxdb_insert_id
element.description: The maxdb_insert_id function returns the ID generated by a query on a table with a column having the DEFAULT SERIAL attribute. If the last query wasn't an INSERT or UPDATE statement or if the modified table does not have a column with the DEFAULT SERIAL attribute, this function will return zero.

element.name: maxdb_kill
element.description: This function is used to disconnect from a MaxDB server specified by the processid parameter.

element.name: maxdb_more_results
element.description: maxdb_more_results indicates if one or more result sets are available from a previous call to maxdb_multi_query .

element.name: maxdb_multi_query
element.description: The maxdb_multi_query works like the function maxdb_query . Multiple queries are not yet supported.

element.name: maxdb_next_result
element.description: Since multiple queries are not yet supported, maxdb_next_result returns always .

element.name: maxdb_num_fields
element.description: maxdb_num_fields returns the number of fields from specified result set.

element.name: maxdb_num_rows
element.description: Returns the number of rows in the result set.

element.name: maxdb_options
element.description: maxdb_options can be used to set extra connect options and affect behavior for a connection.

element.name: maxdb_ping
element.description: Checks whether the connection to the server is working. If it has gone down, and global option is enabled an automatic reconnection is attempted.

element.name: maxdb_prepare
element.description: maxdb_prepare prepares the SQL query pointed to by the null-terminated string query, and returns a statement handle to be used for further operations on the statement. The query must consist of a single SQL statement.

element.name: maxdb_query
element.description: The maxdb_query function is used to simplify the act of performing a query against the database represented by the link parameter.

element.name: maxdb_real_connect
element.description: maxdb_real_connect attempts to establish a connection to a MaxDB database engine running on hostname .

element.name: maxdb_real_escape_string
element.description: This function is used to create a legal SQL string that you can use in a SQL statement. The string is encoded to an escaped SQL string, taking into account the current character set of the connection.

element.name: maxdb_real_query
element.description: The maxdb_real_query is functionally identical with the maxdb_query .

element.name: maxdb_report
element.description: The above examples would produce the following output:

element.name: maxdb_rollback
element.description: Rollbacks the current transaction for the database specified by the link parameter.

element.name: maxdb_select_db
element.description: The maxdb_select_db function selects the default database (specified by the dbname parameter) to be used when performing queries against the database connection represented by the link parameter.

element.name: maxdb_sqlstate
element.description: Returns a string containing the SQLSTATE error code for the last error. The error code consists of five characters. means no error. The values are specified by ANSI SQL and ODBC.

element.name: maxdb_stat
element.description: maxdb_stat returns a string containing several information about the MaxDB server running.

element.name: maxdb_stmt_affected_rows
element.description: maxdb_stmt_affected_rows returns the number of rows affected by INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE query. If the last query was invalid or the number of rows can not determined, this function will return -1.

element.name: maxdb_stmt_bind_param
element.description: maxdb_stmt_bind_param is used to bind variables for the parameter markers in the SQL statement that was passed to maxdb_prepare . The string types contains one or more characters which specify the types for the corresponding bind variables

element.name: maxdb_stmt_bind_result
element.description: maxdb_stmt_bind_result is used to associate (bind) columns in the result set to variables. When maxdb_stmt_fetch is called to fetch data, the MaxDB client/server protocol places the data for the bound columns into the specified variables var1, ... .

element.name: maxdb_stmt_close
element.description: Closes a prepared statement. maxdb_stmt_close also deallocates the statement handle pointed to by stmt . If the current statement has pending or unread results, this function cancels them so that the next query can be executed.

element.name: maxdb_stmt_close_long_data
element.description: This function has to be called after a sequence of maxdb_stmt_send_long_data , that was started after maxdb_execute .

element.name: maxdb_stmt_data_seek
element.description: The maxdb_stmt_data_seek function seeks to an arbitrary result pointer specified by the offset in the statement result set represented by statement . The offset parameter must be between zero and the total number of rows minus one (0.. maxdb_stmt_num_rows - 1).

element.name: maxdb_stmt_errno
element.description: For the statement specified by , maxdb_stmt_errno returns the error code for the most recently invoked statement function that can succeed or fail.

element.name: maxdb_stmt_error
element.description: For the statement specified by , maxdb_stmt_error returns a containing the error message for the most recently invoked statement function that can succeed or fail.

element.name: maxdb_stmt_execute
element.description: The maxdb_stmt_execute function executes a query that has been previously prepared using the maxdb_prepare function represented by the stmt resource. When executed any parameter markers which exist will automatically be replaced with the appropiate data.

element.name: maxdb_stmt_fetch
element.description: maxdb_stmt_fetch returns row data using the variables bound by maxdb_stmt_bind_result .

element.name: maxdb_stmt_free_result
element.description: The maxdb_stmt_free_result function frees the result memory associated with the statement represented by the stmt parameter, which was allocated by maxdb_stmt_store_result .

element.name: maxdb_stmt_init
element.description: Allocates and initializes a statement resource suitable for maxdb_stmt_prepare .

element.name: maxdb_stmt_num_rows
element.description: Returns the number of rows in the result set.

element.name: maxdb_stmt_param_count
element.description: maxdb_stmt_param_count returns the number of parameter markers present in the prepared statement.

element.name: maxdb_stmt_prepare
element.description: maxdb_stmt_prepare prepares the SQL query pointed to by the null-terminated string query. The statement resource has to be allocated by maxdb_stmt_init . The query must consist of a single SQL statement.

element.name: maxdb_stmt_result_metadata
element.description: If a statement passed to maxdb_prepare is one that produces a result set, maxdb_stmt_result_metadata returns the result resource that can be used to process the meta information such as total number of fields and individual field information.

element.name: maxdb_stmt_send_long_data
element.description: Allows to send parameter data to the server in pieces (or chunks). This function can be called multiple times to send the parts of a character or binary data value for a column, which must be one of the TEXT or BLOB datatypes.

element.name: maxdb_stmt_sqlstate
element.description: Returns a string containing the SQLSTATE error code for the most recently invoked prepared statement function that can succeed or fail. The error code consists of five characters. means no error. The values are specified by ANSI SQL and ODBC.

element.name: maxdb_stmt_store_result
element.description: maxdb_stmt_store_result has no functionally effect and should not be used for retrieving data from MaxDB server.

element.name: maxdb_store_result
element.description: This function has no functionally effect.

element.name: maxdb_thread_id
element.description: The maxdb_thread_id function returns the thread ID for the current connection which can then be killed using the maxdb_kill function. If the connection is lost and you reconnect with maxdb_ping , the thread ID will be other. Therefore you should get the thread ID only when you need it.

element.name: maxdb_thread_safe
element.description: maxdb_thread_safe indicates whether the client library is compiled as thread-safe.

element.name: maxdb_use_result
element.description: maxdb_use_result has no effect.

element.name: maxdb_warning_count
element.description: maxdb_warning_count returns the number of warnings from the last query in the connection represented by the link parameter.

element.name: Memcache::add
element.description: Memcache::add stores variable var with key only if such key doesn't exist at the server yet. Memcache::add returns if such key already exist. For the rest Memcache::add behaves similarly to Memcache::set .

element.name: Memcache::close
element.description: Memcache::close closes connection to memcached server. This function doesn't close persistent connections, which are closed only during web-server shutdown/restart.

element.name: Memcache::connect
element.description: Memcache::connect establishes a connection to the memcached server. Parameters host and port point to the host and port, where memcached is listening for connections. Parameter port is optional, it's default value is 11211. Also you can define a timeout , which will be used when connecting to the daemon. Think twice before changing the default value - you can loose all the advantages of caching if your connection is too slow.

element.name: Memcache::decrement
element.description: Memcache::decrement decrements value of the item by value . Similarly to Memcache::increment , current value of the item is being converted to numerical and after that value is substracted.

element.name: Memcache::delete
element.description: Memcache::delete deletes item with the key . If parameter timeout is specified, the item will expire after timeout seconds.

element.name: Memcache::flush
element.description: Memcache::flush immediately invalidates all existing items. Memcache::flush doesn't actually free any resources, it only marks all the items as expired, so occupied memory will be overwritten by new items.

element.name: Memcache::get
element.description: Memcache::get returns previously stored data if an item with such key exists on the server at this moment.

element.name: Memcache::getStats
element.description: Memcache::getStats returns an associative array with server's statistics. Array keys correspond to stats parameters and values to parameter's values.

element.name: Memcache::getVersion
element.description: Memcache::getVersion returns a string with server's version number.

element.name: Memcache::increment
element.description: Memcache::increment increments value of the item on the specified value . If item with key key was not numeric and cannot be converted to number, it will change it's value to value .

element.name: Memcache::pconnect
element.description: Memcache::pconnect is similar to Memcache::connect with the difference, that the connection it establishes is persistent. This connection is not closed after the end of script execution and by Memcache::close function.

element.name: Memcache::replace
element.description: Memcache::replace should be used to replace value of existing item with key . In case if item with such key doesn't exists, Memcache::replace returns . For the rest Memcache::replace behaves similarly to Memcache::set .

element.name: Memcache::set
element.description: Memcache::set stores an item var with key on the memcached server. Parameter expire is expiration time in seconds. If it's 0, the item never expires (but memcached server doesn't guarantee this item to be stored all the time, it could be deleted from the cache to make place for other items).

element.name: memcache_debug
element.description: memcache_debug turns on debug output if parameter on_off is equal to 1 and turns off if it's 0.

element.name: mime_content_type
element.description: Returns the MIME content type for a file as determined by using information from the file. Content types are returned in MIME format, like or .

element.name: SWFShape->addFill
element.description: SWFShape->addFill adds a solid fill to the shape's list of fill styles. SWFShape->addFill accepts three different types of arguments.

element.name: swfaction
element.description: swfaction creates a new Action, and compiles the given script into an SWFAction object.

element.name: swfbitmap
element.description: swfbitmap creates a new SWFBitmap object from the Jpeg or DBL file in file . alphafile is a MSK file to be used as an alpha mask for a Jpeg image. Both parameters can be fopen resources or binary strings.

element.name: swfbitmap->getheight
element.description: swfbitmap->getheight returns the bitmap's height in pixels.

element.name: swfbitmap->getwidth
element.description: swfbitmap->getwidth returns the bitmap's width in pixels.

element.name: swfbutton
element.description: swfbutton creates a new Button. Roll over it, click it, see it call action code. Swank.

element.name: swfbutton->addaction
element.description: swfbutton->addaction adds the action action to this button for the given conditions. The following flags are valid: SWFBUTTON_MOUSEOVER, SWFBUTTON_MOUSEOUT, SWFBUTTON_MOUSEUP, SWFBUTTON_MOUSEUPOUTSIDE, SWFBUTTON_MOUSEDOWN, SWFBUTTON_DRAGOUT and SWFBUTTON_DRAGOVER.

element.name: swfbutton->addshape
element.description: swfbutton->addshape adds the shape shape to this button. The following flags ' values are valid: SWFBUTTON_UP, SWFBUTTON_OVER, SWFBUTTON_DOWN or SWFBUTTON_HIT. SWFBUTTON_HIT isn't ever displayed, it defines the hit region for the button. That is, everywhere the hit shape would be drawn is considered a "touchable" part of the button.

element.name: swfbutton->setaction
element.description: swfbutton->setaction sets the action to be performed when the button is clicked. Alias for addAction(shape, SWFBUTTON_MOUSEUP). action is a swfaction .

element.name: swfbutton->setdown
element.description: swfbutton->setdown alias for addShape(shape, SWFBUTTON_DOWN).

element.name: swfbutton->sethit
element.description: swfbutton->sethit alias for addShape(shape, SWFBUTTON_HIT).

element.name: swfbutton->setover
element.description: swfbutton->setover alias for addShape(shape, SWFBUTTON_OVER).

element.name: swfbutton->setup
element.description: swfbutton->setup alias for addShape(shape, SWFBUTTON_UP).

element.name: swfdisplayitem
element.description: swfdisplayitem creates a new swfdisplayitem object.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->addcolor
element.description: swfdisplayitem->addcolor adds the color to this item's color transform. The color is given in its RGB form.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->move
element.description: swfdisplayitem->move moves the current object by ( dx , dy ) from its current position.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->moveto
element.description: swfdisplayitem->moveto moves the current object to ( x , y ) in global coordinates.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->multcolor
element.description: swfdisplayitem->multcolor multiplies the item's color transform by the given values.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->remove
element.description: swfdisplayitem->remove removes this object from the movie's display list.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->rotate
element.description: swfdisplayitem->rotate rotates the current object by ddegrees degrees from its current rotation.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->rotateto
element.description: swfdisplayitem->rotateto set the current object rotation to degrees degrees in global coordinates.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->scale
element.description: swfdisplayitem->scale scales the current object by ( dx , dy ) from its current size.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->scaleto
element.description: swfdisplayitem->scaleto scales the current object to ( x , y ) in global coordinates.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->setdepth
element.description: swfdisplayitem->setdepth sets the object's z-order to depth . Depth defaults to the order in which instances are created (by adding a shape/text to a movie)- newer ones are on top of older ones. If two objects are given the same depth, only the later-defined one can be moved.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->setname
element.description: swfdisplayitem->setname sets the object's name to name , for targetting with action script. Only useful on sprites.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->setratio
element.description: swfdisplayitem->setratio sets the object's ratio to ratio . Obviously only useful for morphs.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->skewx
element.description: swfdisplayitem->skewx adds ddegrees to current x-skew.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->skewxto
element.description: swfdisplayitem->skewxto sets the x-skew to degrees . For degrees is 1.0, it means a 45-degree forward slant. More is more forward, less is more backward.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->skewy
element.description: swfdisplayitem->skewy adds ddegrees to current y-skew.

element.name: swfdisplayitem->skewyto
element.description: swfdisplayitem->skewyto sets the y-skew to degrees . For degrees is 1.0, it means a 45-degree forward slant. More is more upward, less is more downward.

element.name: swffill
element.description: The swffill object allows you to transform (scale, skew, rotate) bitmap and gradient fills. swffill objects are created by the swfshape->addfill methods.

element.name: swffill->moveto
element.description: swffill->moveto moves fill's origin to ( x , y ) in global coordinates.

element.name: swffill->rotateto
element.description: swffill->rotateto sets fill's rotation to degrees degrees.

element.name: swffill->scaleto
element.description: swffill->scaleto sets fill's scale to x in the x-direction, y in the y-direction.

element.name: swffill->skewxto
element.description: swffill->skewxto sets fill x-skew to x . For x is 1.0, it is a 45-degree forward slant. More is more forward, less is more backward.

element.name: swffill->skewyto
element.description: swffill->skewyto sets fill y-skew to y . For y is 1.0, it is a 45-degree upward slant. More is more upward, less is more downward.

element.name: swffont
element.description: If filename is the name of an FDB file (i.e., it ends in ".fdb"), load the font definition found in said file. Otherwise, create a browser-defined font reference.

element.name: swffont->getwidth
element.description: swffont->getwidth returns the string string 's width, using font's default scaling. You'll probably want to use the swftext version of this method which uses the text object's scale.

element.name: swfgradient
element.description: swfgradient creates a new SWFGradient object.

element.name: swfgradient->addentry
element.description: swfgradient->addentry adds an entry to the gradient list. ratio is a number between 0 and 1 indicating where in the gradient this color appears. Thou shalt add entries in order of increasing ratio.

element.name: swfmorph
element.description: swfmorph creates a new SWFMorph object.

element.name: swfmorph->getshape1
element.description: swfmorph->getshape1 gets a handle to the morph's starting shape. swfmorph->getshape1 returns an swfshape object.

element.name: swfmorph->getshape2
element.description: swfmorph->getshape2 gets a handle to the morph's ending shape. swfmorph->getshape2 returns an swfshape object.

element.name: swfmovie
element.description: swfmovie creates a new movie object, representing an SWF version 4 movie.

element.name: swfmovie->add
element.description: swfmovie->add adds instance to the current movie. instance is any type of data : Shapes, text, fonts, etc. must all be added to the movie to make this work.

element.name: swfmovie->nextframe
element.description: swfmovie->nextframe moves to the next frame of the animation.

element.name: swfmovie->output
element.description: swfmovie->output dumps your lovingly prepared movie out. In PHP, preceding this with the command convinces the browser to display this as a flash movie.

element.name: swfmovie->remove
element.description: swfmovie->remove removes the object instance instance from the display list.

element.name: swfmovie->save
element.description: swfmovie->save saves your movie to the file named filename .

element.name: swfmovie->setbackground
element.description: swfmovie->setbackground sets the background color. Why is there no rgba version? Think about it. (Actually, that's not such a dumb question after all- you might want to let the HTML background show through. There's a way to do that, but it only works on IE4. Search the site for details.)

element.name: swfmovie->setdimension
element.description: swfmovie->setdimension sets the movie's width to width and height to height .

element.name: swfmovie->setframes
element.description: swfmovie->setframes sets the total number of frames in the animation to numberofframes .

element.name: swfmovie->setrate
element.description: swfmovie->setrate sets the frame rate to rate , in frame per seconds. Animation will slow down if the player can't render frames fast enough- unless there's a streaming sound, in which case display frames are sacrificed to keep sound from skipping.

element.name: swfmovie->streammp3
element.description: swfmovie->streammp3 streams the mp3 file mp3File . Not very robust in dealing with oddities (can skip over an initial ID3 tag, but that's about it). Like swfshape->addjpegfill , this isn't a stable function- we'll probably need to make a separate SWFSound object to contain sound types. Parameter mp3File can be a fopen resource or a binary string.

element.name: swfshape
element.description: swfshape creates a new shape object.

element.name: swfshape->setleftfill
element.description: What this nonsense is about is, every edge segment borders at most two fills. When rasterizing the object, it's pretty handy to know what those fills are ahead of time, so the swf format requires these to be specified.

element.name: swfshape->setline
element.description: swfshape->setline sets the shape's line style. width is the line's width. If width is 0, the line's style is removed (then, all other arguments are ignored). If width > 0, then line's color is set to red , green , blue . Last parameter a is optional.

element.name: swfsprite
element.description: swfsprite are also known as a "movie clip", this allows one to create objects which are animated in their own timelines. Hence, the sprite has most of the same methods as the movie.

element.name: swfsprite->add
element.description: swfsprite->add adds a swfshape , a swfbutton , a swftext , a swfaction or a swfsprite object.

element.name: swfsprite->nextframe
element.description: swfsprite->setframes moves to the next frame of the animation.

element.name: swfsprite->remove
element.description: swfsprite->remove remove a swfshape , a swfbutton , a swftext , a swfaction or a swfsprite object from the sprite.

element.name: swfsprite->setframes
element.description: swfsprite->setframes sets the total number of frames in the animation to numberofframes .

element.name: swftext
element.description: swftext creates a new SWFText object, fresh for manipulating.

element.name: swftext->addstring
element.description: swftext->addstring draws the string string at the current pen (cursor) location. Pen is at the baseline of the text; i.e., ascending text is in the -y direction.

element.name: swftext->getwidth
element.description: swftext->addstring returns the rendered width of the string string at the text object's current font, scale, and spacing settings.

element.name: swftext->moveto
element.description: swftext->moveto moves the pen (or cursor, if that makes more sense) to ( x , y ) in text object's coordinate space. If either is zero, though, value in that dimension stays the same. Annoying, should be fixed.

element.name: swftext->setcolor
element.description: swftext->setspacing changes the current text color. Default is black. I think. Color is represented using the RGB system.

element.name: swftext->setfont
element.description: swftext->setfont sets the current font to font .

element.name: swftext->setheight
element.description: swftext->setheight sets the current font height to height . Default is 240.

element.name: swftext->setspacing
element.description: swftext->setspacing sets the current font spacing to spacing spacing . Default is 1.0. 0 is all of the letters written at the same point. This doesn't really work that well because it inflates the advance across the letter, doesn't add the same amount of spacing between the letters. I should try and explain that better, prolly. Or just fix the damn thing to do constant spacing. This was really just a way to figure out how letter advances work, anyway.. So nyah.

element.name: swftextfield
element.description: swftextfield creates a new text field object. Text Fields are less flexible than swftext objects- they can't be rotated, scaled non-proportionally, or skewed, but they can be used as form entries, and they can use browser-defined fonts.

element.name: swftextfield->addstring
element.description: swftextfield->setname concatenates the string string to the text field.

element.name: swftextfield->align
element.description: swftextfield->align sets the text field alignment to alignement . Valid values for alignement are : SWFTEXTFIELD_ALIGN_LEFT, SWFTEXTFIELD_ALIGN_RIGHT, SWFTEXTFIELD_ALIGN_CENTER and SWFTEXTFIELD_ALIGN_JUSTIFY.

element.name: swftextfield->setbounds
element.description: swftextfield->setbounds sets the text field width to width and height to height . If you don't set the bounds yourself, Ming makes a poor guess at what the bounds are.

element.name: swftextfield->setcolor
element.description: swftextfield->setcolor sets the color of the text field. Default is fully opaque black. Color is represented using RGB system.

element.name: swftextfield->setfont
element.description: swftextfield->setfont sets the text field font to the [browser-defined?] font font.

element.name: swftextfield->setheight
element.description: swftextfield->setheight sets the font height of this text field font to the given height height . Default is 240.

element.name: swftextfield->setindentation
element.description: swftextfield->setindentation sets the indentation of the first line in the text field, to width .

element.name: swftextfield->setleftmargin
element.description: swftextfield->setleftmargin sets the left margin width of the text field to width . Default is 0.

element.name: swftextfield->setlinespacing
element.description: swftextfield->setlinespacing sets the line spacing of the text field to the height of height . Default is 40.

element.name: swftextfield->setmargins
element.description: swftextfield->setmargins set both margins at once, for the man on the go.

element.name: swftextfield->setname
element.description: swftextfield->setname sets the variable name of this text field to name , for form posting and action scripting purposes.

element.name: swftextfield->setrightmargin
element.description: swftextfield->setrightmargin sets the right margin width of the text field to width . Default is 0.

element.name: connection_aborted
element.description: See also connection_status , and ignore_user_abort .

element.name: connection_status
element.description: See also connection_aborted , and ignore_user_abort .

element.name: connection_timeout
element.description: See also connection_status .

element.name: define
element.description: Defines a named constant. See the for more details.

element.name: defined
element.description: Returns if the named constant given by name has been defined, otherwise.

element.name: eval
element.description: The above example will show:

element.name: get_browser
element.description: get_browser attempts to determine the capabilities of the user's browser. This is done by looking up the browser's information in the file.

element.name: highlight_file
element.description: Many servers are configured to automatically highlight files with a extension. For example, when viewed will show the syntax highlighted source of the file. To enable this, add this line to the :

element.name: highlight_string
element.description: The above example will output (in PHP 4):

element.name: ignore_user_abort
element.description: See also connection_aborted , and connection_status .

element.name: pack
element.description: Pack given arguments into binary string according to format . Returns binary string containing data.

element.name: php_check_syntax
element.description: The name of the file being checked.

property.name: error_message
property.description: If the parameter is used, it will contain the error message generated by the syntax check. is passed by .

element.name: php_strip_whitespace
element.description: Returns the PHP source code in filename with PHP comments and whitespace removed. This may be useful for determining the amount of actual code in your scripts compared with the amount of comments. This is similar to using from the .

element.name: sleep
element.description: This example will output (after 10 seconds)

element.name: time_nanosleep
element.description: Delays program execution for the given number of seconds and nanoseconds .

element.name: uniqid
element.description: If you need a unique identifier or token and you intend to give out that token to the user via the network (i.e. session cookies), it is recommended that you use something along these lines:

element.name: unpack
element.description: unpack from binary string into array according to format . Returns array containing unpacked elements of binary string.

element.name: usleep
element.description: This script will output :

element.name: msession_listvar
element.description: Returns an associative array of value/session for all sessions with a variable named name .

element.name: mb_convert_case
element.description: mb_convert_case returns case folded version of string converted in the way specified by mode .

element.name: mb_convert_encoding
element.description: mb_convert_encoding converts character encoding of string str from from_encoding to to_encoding .

element.name: mb_convert_kana
element.description: mb_convert_kana performs "han-kaku" - "zen-kaku" conversion for string str . It returns converted string. This function is only useful for Japanese.

element.name: mb_convert_variables
element.description: mb_convert_variables convert character encoding of variables vars in encoding from_encoding to encoding to_encoding . It returns character encoding before conversion for success, for failure.

element.name: mb_decode_mimeheader
element.description: mb_decode_mimeheader decodes encoded-word string str in MIME header.

element.name: mb_decode_numericentity
element.description: Convert numeric string reference of string str in specified block to character. It returns converted string.

element.name: mb_detect_encoding
element.description: mb_detect_encoding detects character encoding in string str . It returns detected character encoding.

element.name: mb_detect_order
element.description: mb_detect_order sets automatic character encoding detection order to encoding_list . It returns for success, for failure.

element.name: mb_encode_mimeheader
element.description: mb_encode_mimeheader encodes a given string str by the MIME header encoding scheme. Returns a converted version of the string represented in ASCII.

element.name: mb_encode_numericentity
element.description: mb_encode_numericentity converts specified character codes in string str from HTML numeric character reference to character code. It returns converted string.

element.name: mb_ereg
element.description: The internal encoding or the character encoding specified in mb_regex_encoding will be used as character encoding.

element.name: mb_ereg_match
element.description: The internal encoding or the character encoding specified in mb_regex_encoding will be used as character encoding.

element.name: mb_ereg_replace
element.description: The internal encoding or the character encoding specified in mb_regex_encoding will be used as character encoding.

element.name: mb_ereg_search
element.description: The internal encoding or the character encoding specified in mb_regex_encoding will be used as character encoding.

element.name: mb_ereg_search_getpos
element.description: The internal encoding or the character encoding specified in mb_regex_encoding will be used as character encoding.

element.name: mb_ereg_search_getregs
element.description: The internal encoding or the character encoding specified in mb_regex_encoding will be used as character encoding.

element.name: mb_ereg_search_init
element.description: The internal encoding or the character encoding specified in mb_regex_encoding will be used as character encoding.

element.name: mb_ereg_search_pos
element.description: The string for match is specified by mb_ereg_search_init . It it is not specified, the previous one will be used.

element.name: mb_ereg_search_regs
element.description: The internal encoding or the character encoding specified in mb_regex_encoding will be used as character encoding.

element.name: mb_ereg_search_setpos
element.description: The internal encoding or the character encoding specified in mb_regex_encoding will be used as character encoding.

element.name: mb_eregi
element.description: The internal encoding or the character encoding specified in mb_regex_encoding will be used as character encoding.

element.name: mb_eregi_replace
element.description: The internal encoding or the character encoding specified in mb_regex_encoding will be used as character encoding.

element.name: mb_get_info
element.description: If type isn't specified or is specified to "all", an array having the elements "internal_encoding", "http_output", "http_input", "func_overload" will be returned.

element.name: mb_http_input
element.description: type : Input string specifies input type. " G " for GET, " P " for POST, " C " for COOKIE. If type is omitted, it returns last input type processed.

element.name: mb_http_output
element.description: If encoding is set, mb_http_output sets HTTP output character encoding to encoding . Output after this function is converted to encoding . mb_http_output returns for success and for failure.

element.name: mb_internal_encoding
element.description: mb_internal_encoding sets internal character encoding to encoding If parameter is omitted, it returns current internal encoding.

element.name: mb_language
element.description: mb_language sets language. If language is omitted, it returns current language as string.

element.name: mb_list_encodings
element.description: mb_list_encodings returns an array with all supported encodings.

element.name: mb_output_handler
element.description: mb_output_handler is ob_start callback function. mb_output_handler converts characters in output buffer from internal character encoding to HTTP output character encoding.

element.name: mb_parse_str
element.description: mb_parse_str parses GET/POST/COOKIE data and sets global variables. Since PHP does not provide raw POST/COOKIE data, it can only used for GET data for now. It preses URL encoded data, detects encoding, converts coding to internal encoding and set values to result array or global variables.

element.name: mb_preferred_mime_name
element.description: mb_preferred_mime_name returns MIME string for character encoding encoding . It returns string.

element.name: mb_regex_encoding
element.description: If the optional parameter encoding is specified, it is set to the character encoding for multibyte regex. The default value is the internal character encoding.

element.name: mb_regex_set_options
element.description: Returns the previous options. If options is omitted, it returns the string that describes the current options.

element.name: mb_send_mail
element.description: mb_send_mail sends email. Headers and message are converted and encoded according to mb_language setting. mb_send_mail is wrapper function of mail . See mail for details.

element.name: mb_split
element.description: The internal encoding or the character encoding specified in mb_regex_encoding will be used as character encoding.

element.name: mb_strcut
element.description: mb_strcut returns the portion of str specified by the start and length parameters.

element.name: mb_strimwidth
element.description: mb_strimwidth truncates string str to specified width . It returns truncated string.

element.name: mb_strlen
element.description: mb_strlen returns number of characters in string str having character encoding encoding . A multi-byte character is counted as 1.

element.name: mb_strpos
element.description: mb_strpos returns the numeric position of the first occurrence of needle in the haystack string. If needle is not found, it returns .

element.name: mb_strrpos
element.description: mb_strrpos returns the numeric position of the last occurrence of needle in the haystack string. If needle is not found, it returns .

element.name: mb_strtolower
element.description: mb_strtolower returns str with all alphabetic characters converted to lowercase.

element.name: mb_strtoupper
element.description: mb_strtoupper returns str with all alphabetic characters converted to uppercase.

element.name: mb_strwidth
element.description: mb_strwidth returns width of string str .

element.name: mb_substitute_character
element.description: mb_substitute_character specifies substitution character when input character encoding is invalid or character code is not exist in output character encoding. Invalid characters may be substituted (no output), string or integer value (Unicode character code value).

element.name: mb_substr
element.description: mb_substr returns the portion of str specified by the start and length parameters.

element.name: mb_substr_count
element.description: mb_substr_count returns the number of times the needle substring occurs in the haystack string.

element.name: mysql_affected_rows
element.description: mysql_affected_rows returns the number of rows affected by the last INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE query associated with link_identifier . If the link identifier isn't specified, the last link opened by mysql_connect is assumed.

element.name: mysql_change_user
element.description: mysql_change_user changes the logged in user of the current active connection, or the connection given by the optional link_identifier parameter. If a database is specified, this will be the current database after the user has been changed. If the new user and password authorization fails, the current connected user stays active.

element.name: mysql_client_encoding
element.description: mysql_client_encoding returns the default character set name for the current connection.

element.name: mysql_connect
element.description: Returns a MySQL link identifier on success, or on failure.

element.name: mysql_create_db
element.description: mysql_create_db attempts to create a new database on the server associated with the specified link identifier.

element.name: mysql_data_seek
element.description: mysql_data_seek moves the internal row pointer of the MySQL result associated with the specified result identifier to point to the specified row number. The next call to mysql_fetch_row would return that row.

element.name: mysql_db_name
element.description: mysql_db_name takes as its first parameter the result pointer from a call to mysql_list_dbs . The row parameter is an index into the result set.

element.name: mysql_db_query
element.description: Returns a positive MySQL result resource to the query result, or on error. The function also returns / for / / queries to indicate success/failure.

element.name: mysql_drop_db
element.description: mysql_drop_db attempts to drop (remove) an entire database from the server associated with the specified link identifier.

element.name: mysql_errno
element.description: Returns the error number from the last MySQL function, or (zero) if no error occurred.

element.name: mysql_error
element.description: Returns the error text from the last MySQL function, or (the empty string) if no error occurred. If no link is explicitly passed to the function, the last successful open link will be used to retrieve the error message from the MySQL server.

element.name: mysql_escape_string
element.description: This function will escape the unescaped_string , so that it is safe to place it in a mysql_query .

element.name: mysql_fetch_array
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: mysql_fetch_assoc
element.description: Returns an associative array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: mysql_fetch_field
element.description: Returns an object containing field information.

element.name: mysql_fetch_lengths
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the lengths of each field in the last row fetched by mysql_fetch_row , or on error.

element.name: mysql_fetch_object
element.description: Returns an object with properties that correspond to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: mysql_fetch_row
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: mysql_field_flags
element.description: mysql_field_flags returns the field flags of the specified field. The flags are reported as a single word per flag separated by a single space, so that you can split the returned value using explode .

element.name: mysql_field_len
element.description: mysql_field_len returns the length of the specified field.

element.name: mysql_field_name
element.description: mysql_field_name returns the name of the specified field index. result must be a valid result identifier and field_index is the numerical offset of the field.

element.name: mysql_field_seek
element.description: Seeks to the specified field offset. If the next call to mysql_fetch_field doesn't include a field offset, the field offset specified in mysql_field_seek will be returned.

element.name: mysql_field_table
element.description: Returns the name of the table that the specified field is in.

element.name: mysql_field_type
element.description: mysql_field_type is similar to the mysql_field_name function. The arguments are identical, but the field type is returned instead. The field type will be one of , , , , and others as detailed in the . The above example would produce the following output:

element.name: mysql_free_result
element.description: mysql_free_result will free all memory associated with the result identifier result .

element.name: mysql_get_client_info
element.description: mysql_get_client_info returns a string that represents the client library version.

element.name: mysql_get_host_info
element.description: mysql_get_host_info returns a string describing the type of connection in use for the connection link_identifier , including the server host name. If link_identifier is omitted, the last opened connection will be used.

element.name: mysql_get_proto_info
element.description: mysql_get_proto_info returns the protocol version used by connection link_identifier . If link_identifier is omitted, the last opened connection will be used.

element.name: mysql_get_server_info
element.description: mysql_get_server_info returns the server version used by connection link_identifier . If link_identifier is omitted, the last opened connection will be used.

element.name: mysql_info
element.description: mysql_info returns detailed information about the last query using the given link_identifier . If link_identifier isn't specified, the last opened link is assumed.

element.name: mysql_insert_id
element.description: mysql_insert_id returns the ID generated for an AUTO_INCREMENT column by the previous INSERT query using the given link_identifier . If link_identifier isn't specified, the last opened link is assumed.

element.name: mysql_list_dbs
element.description: mysql_list_dbs will return a result pointer containing the databases available from the current mysql daemon. Use the mysql_tablename function to traverse this result pointer, or any function for result tables, such as mysql_fetch_array .

element.name: mysql_list_fields
element.description: The function mysql_list_fields is deprecated. It is preferable to use mysql_query to issue a SQL Statement instead.

element.name: mysql_list_processes
element.description: mysql_list_processes returns a result pointer describing the current server threads.

element.name: mysql_list_tables
element.description: mysql_list_tables takes a database name and returns a result pointer much like the mysql_query function. Use the mysql_tablename function to traverse this result pointer, or any function for result tables, such as mysql_fetch_array .

element.name: mysql_num_fields
element.description: mysql_num_fields returns the number of fields in the result set result .

element.name: mysql_num_rows
element.description: mysql_num_rows returns the number of rows in a result set. This command is only valid for SELECT statements. To retrieve the number of rows affected by a INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE query, use mysql_affected_rows .

element.name: mysql_pconnect
element.description: Returns a positive MySQL persistent link identifier on success, or on error.

element.name: mysql_ping
element.description: mysql_ping checks whether or not the connection to the server is working. If it has gone down, an automatic reconnection is attempted. This function can be used by scripts that remain idle for a long while, to check whether or not the server has closed the connection and reconnect if necessary. mysql_ping returns if the connection to the server is working, otherwise .

element.name: mysql_query
element.description: mysql_query sends a query (to the currently active database on the server that's associated with the specified link_identifier ).

element.name: mysql_result
element.description: mysql_result returns the contents of one cell from a MySQL result set. The field argument can be the field's offset, or the field's name, or the field's table dot field name (tablename.fieldname). If the column name has been aliased ('select foo as bar from...'), use the alias instead of the column name.

element.name: mysql_stat
element.description: mysql_stat returns the current server status.

element.name: mysql_tablename
element.description: mysql_tablename takes a result pointer returned by the mysql_list_tables function as well as an integer index and returns the name of a table. The mysql_num_rows function may be used to determine the number of tables in the result pointer. Use the mysql_tablename function to traverse this result pointer, or any function for result tables, such as mysql_fetch_array .

element.name: mysql_thread_id
element.description: mysql_thread_id returns the current thread ID. If the connection is lost and you reconnect with mysql_ping , the thread ID will change. This means you should not get the thread ID and store it for later. You should get it when you need it.

element.name: mysql_unbuffered_query
element.description: mysql_unbuffered_query sends a SQL query query to MySQL, without fetching and buffering the result rows automatically, as mysql_query does. On the one hand, this saves a considerable amount of memory with SQL queries that produce large result sets. On the other hand, you can start working on the result set immediately after the first row has been retrieved: you don't have to wait until the complete SQL query has been performed. When using multiple DB-connects, you have to specify the optional parameter link_identifier .

element.name: nsapi_request_headers
element.description: nsapi_request_headers gets all the HTTP headers in the current request. This is only supported when PHP runs as a module.

element.name: nsapi_response_headers
element.description: Gets all the NSAPI response headers.

element.name: nsapi_virtual
element.description: nsapi_virtual is an NSAPI-specific function which is equivalent to < !--#include virtual...-- > in SSI ( files). It does an NSAPI sub-request. It is useful for including CGI scripts or .shtml files, or anything else that you'd parse through webserver.

element.name: ncurses_beep
element.description: ncurses_beep sends an audible alert (bell) and if its not possible flashes the screen.

element.name: ncurses_can_change_color
element.description: The function ncurses_can_change_color returns or , depending on whether the terminal has color capabilities and whether the programmer can change the colors.

element.name: ncurses_cbreak
element.description: ncurses_cbreak disables line buffering and character processing (interrupt and flow control characters are unaffected), making characters typed by the user immediately available to the program.

element.name: ncurses_clear
element.description: ncurses_clear clears the screen completely without setting blanks.

element.name: ncurses_clrtobot
element.description: ncurses_clrtobot erases all lines from cursor to end of screen and creates blanks. Blanks created by ncurses_clrtobot have the current background rendition.

element.name: ncurses_clrtoeol
element.description: ncurses_clrtoeol erases the current line from cursor position to the end. Blanks created by ncurses_clrtoeol have the current background rendition.

element.name: ncurses_def_prog_mode
element.description: ncurses_def_prog_mode saves the current terminal modes for program (in curses) for use by ncurses_reset_prog_mode . Returns on success, otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_def_shell_mode
element.description: ncurses_def_shell_mode saves the current terminal modes for shell (not in curses) for use by ncurses_reset_shell_mode . Returns on success, otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_delch
element.description: ncurses_delch deletes the character under the cursor. All characters to the right of the cursor on the same line are moved to the left one position and the last character on the line is filled with a blank. The cursor position does not change. Returns on success, otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_deleteln
element.description: ncurses_deleteln deletes the current line under cursorposition. All lines below the current line are moved up one line. The bottom line of window is cleared. Cursor position does not change. Returns on success, otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_doupdate
element.description: ncurses_doupdate() compares the virtual screen to the physical screen and updates the physical screen. This way is more effective than using multiple refresh calls.

element.name: ncurses_echo
element.description: ncurses_echo enables echo mode. All characters typed by user are echoed by ncurses_getch . Returns on success, if any error occurred.

element.name: ncurses_erase
element.description: ncurses_erase fills the terminal screen with blanks. Created blanks have the current background rendition, set by ncurses_bkgd .

element.name: ncurses_erasechar
element.description: ncurses_erasechar returns the current erase char character.

element.name: ncurses_flash
element.description: ncurses_flash flashes the screen, and if its not possible, sends an audible alert (bell). Returns on success, otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_flushinp
element.description: The ncurses_flushinp throws away any typeahead that has been typed and has not yet been read by your program. Returns on success, otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_getmouse
element.description: ncurses_getmouse reads mouse event out of queue. Function ncurses_getmouse will return ; if a mouse event is actually visible in the given window, otherwise it will return . Event options will be delivered in parameter mevent , which has to be an array, passed by reference (see example below). On success an associative array with following keys will be delivered: "id" : Id to distinguish multiple devices

element.name: ncurses_has_colors
element.description: ncurses_has_colors returns or depending on whether the terminal has color capacities.

element.name: ncurses_has_ic
element.description: ncurses_has_ic checks terminals insert- and delete capabilities. It returns when terminal has insert/delete-capabilities, otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_has_il
element.description: ncurses_has_il checks terminals insert- and delete-line-capabilities. It returns when terminal has insert/delete-line capabilities, otherwise

element.name: ncurses_inch
element.description: ncurses_inch returns the character from the current position.

element.name: ncurses_insertln
element.description: ncurses_insertln inserts a new line above the current line. The bottom line will be lost.

element.name: ncurses_instr
element.description: ncurses_instr returns the number of characters read from the current character position until end of line. buffer contains the characters. Attributes are stripped from the characters.

element.name: ncurses_isendwin
element.description: ncurses_isendwin returns , if ncurses_endwin has been called without any subsequent calls to ncurses_wrefresh , otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_killchar
element.description: ncurses_killchar returns the current line kill character.

element.name: ncurses_longname
element.description: ncurses_longname returns a verbose description of the terminal. The description is truncated to 128 characters. On Error ncurses_longname returns NULL.

element.name: ncurses_mousemask
element.description: Function ncurses_mousemask will set mouse events to be reported. By default no mouse events will be reported. The function ncurses_mousemask will return a mask to indicated which of the in parameter newmask specified mouse events can be reported. On complete failure, it returns 0. In parameter oldmask , which is passed by reference ncurses_mousemask returns the previous value of mouse event mask. Mouse events are represented by NCURSES_KEY_MOUSE in the ncurses_wgetch input stream. To read the event data and pop the event of of queue, call ncurses_getmouse .

element.name: ncurses_nocbreak
element.description: ncurses_nocbreak routine returns terminal to normal (cooked) mode. Initially the terminal may or may not in cbreak mode as the mode is inherited. Therefore a program should call ncurses_cbreak and ncurses_nocbreak explicitly. Returns if any error occurred, otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_noecho
element.description: ncurses_noecho prevents echoing of user typed characters. Returns if any error occurred, otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_noraw
element.description: ncurses_noraw switches the terminal out of raw mode. Raw mode is similar to cbreak mode, in that characters typed are immediately passed through to the user program. The differences that are that in raw mode, the interrupt, quit, suspend and flow control characters are all passed through uninterpreted, instead of generating a signal. Returns if any error occurred, otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_raw
element.description: ncurses_raw places the terminal in raw mode. Raw mode is similar to cbreak mode, in that characters typed are immediately passed through to the user program. The differences that are that in raw mode, the interrupt, quit, suspend and flow control characters are all passed through uninterpreted, instead of generating a signal. Returns if any error occurred, otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_resetty
element.description: Function ncurses_resetty restores the terminal state, which was previously saved by calling ncurses_savetty . This function always returns .

element.name: ncurses_savetty
element.description: Function ncurses_savetty saves the current terminal state. The saved terminal state can be restored with function ncurses_resetty . ncurses_savetty always returns .

element.name: ncurses_slk_attr
element.description: ncurses_slk_attr returns the current soft label key attribute. On error returns , otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_slk_clear
element.description: The function ncurses_slk_clear clears soft label keys from screen. Returns on error, otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_slk_init
element.description: Function ncurses_slk_init must be called before ncurses_initscr or ncurses_newterm is called. If ncurses_initscr eventually uses a line from stdscr to emulate the soft labels, then format determines how the labels are arranged of the screen. Setting format to 0 indicates a 3-2-3 arrangement of the labels, 1 indicates a 4-4 arrangement and 2 indicates the PC like 4-4-4 mode, but in addition an index line will be created.

element.name: ncurses_slk_refresh
element.description: ncurses_slk_refresh copies soft label keys from virtual screen to physical screen. Returns on error, otherwise .

element.name: ncurses_slk_restore
element.description: The function ncurses_slk_restore restores the soft label keys after ncurses_slk_clear has been performed.

element.name: ncurses_slk_touch
element.description: The ncurses_slk_touch function forces all the soft labels to be output the next time a ncurses_slk_noutrefresh is performed.

element.name: ncurses_termname
element.description: ncurses_termname returns terminals shortname. The shortname is truncated to 14 characters. On error ncurses_termname returns NULL.

element.name: ncurses_ungetmouse
element.description: ncurses_getmouse pushes a KEY_MOUSE event onto the unput queue and associates with this event the given state sata and screen-relative character cell coordinates, specified in mevent . Event options will be specified in associative array mevent : "id" : Id to distinguish multiple devices

element.name: closelog
