element.description: closelog closes the descriptor being used to write to the system logger. The use of closelog is optional.

element.name: debugger_off
element.description: Disables the internal PHP debugger. This function is only available in PHP 3.

element.name: debugger_on
element.description: Enables the internal PHP debugger, connecting it to address . This function is only available in PHP 3.

element.name: define_syslog_variables
element.description: Initializes all constants used in the syslog functions.

element.name: dns_check_record
element.description: Check DNS records corresponding to a given Internet host name or IP address

element.name: dns_get_mx
element.description: Get MX records corresponding to a given Internet host name.

element.name: fsockopen
element.description: Initiates a socket connection to the resource specified by target . PHP supports targets in the Internet and Unix domains as described in . A list of supported transports can also be retrieved using stream_get_transports .

element.name: gethostbyaddr
element.description: Returns the host name of the Internet host specified by ip_address or a string containing the unmodified ip_address on failure.

element.name: gethostbyname
element.description: Returns the IP address of the Internet host specified by hostname or a string containing the unmodified hostname on failure.

element.name: gethostbynamel
element.description: Returns a list of IP addresses to which the Internet host specified by hostname resolves. Returns if hostname could not be resolved.

element.name: getprotobyname
element.description: getprotobyname returns the protocol number associated with the protocol name as per .

element.name: getprotobynumber
element.description: getprotobynumber returns the protocol name associated with protocol number as per .

element.name: getservbyname
element.description: getservbyname returns the Internet port which corresponds to service for the specified protocol as per . protocol is either or (in lowercase). Returns if service or protocol is not found.

element.name: getservbyport
element.description: getservbyport returns the Internet service associated with port for the specified protocol as per . protocol is either or (in lowercase).

element.name: inet_ntop
element.description: See also long2ip , inet_pton , and ip2long .

element.name: inet_pton
element.description: See also ip2long , inet_ntop , and long2ip .

element.name: ip2long
element.description: The function ip2long generates an IPv4 Internet network address from its Internet standard format (dotted string) representation. If ip_address is invalid then is returned. Note that does not evaluate as in PHP.

element.name: long2ip
element.description: The function long2ip generates an Internet address in dotted format (i.e.: aaa.bbb.ccc.ddd) from the proper address representation.

element.name: openlog
element.description: openlog opens a connection to the system logger for a program. The string ident is added to each message. Values for option and facility are given below. The option argument is used to indicate what logging options will be used when generating a log message. The facility argument is used to specify what type of program is logging the message. This allows you to specify (in your machine's syslog configuration) how messages coming from different facilities will be handled. The use of openlog is optional. It will automatically be called by syslog if necessary, in which case ident will default to .

element.name: pfsockopen
element.description: This function behaves exactly as fsockopen with the difference that the connection is not closed after the script finishes. It is the persistent version of fsockopen .

element.name: syslog
element.description: syslog generates a log message that will be distributed by the system logger. priority is a combination of the facility and the level, values for which are given in the next section. The remaining argument is the message to send, except that the two characters will be replaced by the error message string (strerror) corresponding to the present value of .

element.name: OCI-Collection->append
element.description: Appends an object to the end of the collection. Parameter value can be a string or a number.

element.name: OCI-Collection->assign
element.description: Assigns a value to the collection from another, previously created collection. Both collections must be created with oci_new_collection prior to using them.

element.name: OCI-Collection->assignElem
element.description: Assigns a value to the element with index index . Parameter value can be a string or a number.

element.name: OCI-Collection->free
element.description: Frees resources associated with collection object.

element.name: OCI-Collection->getElem
element.description: Method OCI-Collection->getElem returns value of the element with index index (1-based).

element.name: OCI-Collection->max
element.description: Returns the maximum number of elements in the collection. If the returned value is 0, then the number of elements is not limited. OCI-Collection->max returns in case of error.

element.name: OCI-Collection->size
element.description: Returns the number of elements in the collection.

element.name: OCI-Collection->trim
element.description: Trims num of elements from the end of the collection.

element.name: descriptor->free
element.description: descriptor->free frees resources associated with descriptor, previously allocated with oci_new_descriptor .

element.name: lob->append
element.description: Appends data from the large object to the end of another large object.

element.name: lob->close
element.description: lob->close closes descriptor of LOB or FILE. This function should be used only with lob->writeTemporary .

element.name: lob->eof
element.description: Returns if internal pointer of large object is at the end of LOB. Otherwise returns .

element.name: lob->erase
element.description: Erases a specified portion of the internal LOB data starting at a specified offset . Parameters length and offset are optional. lob->erase erases all LOB data by default.

element.name: lob->export
element.description: Exports LOB's contents to a file, which name is given in parameter filename . Optional parameter start indicates from what position to start export and parameter length - length of data to be exported.

element.name: lob->flush
element.description: lob->flush actually writes data to the server. By default, resources are not freed, but using flag you can do it explicitly. Be sure you know what you're doing - next read/write operation to the same part of LOB will involve a round-trip to the server and initialize new buffer resources. Tt is recommended to use flag only when you are not going to work with the LOB anymore.

element.name: lob->getBuffering
element.description: Returns if buffering for the large object is off and if buffering is used.

element.name: lob->import
element.description: Writes data from filename in to the current position of large object.

element.name: lob->load
element.description: Returns large object's contents. As script execution is terminated when the is reached, ensure that the LOB does not exceed this limit. In most cases it's recommended to use oci_lob_read instead. In case of error lob->load returns .

element.name: lob->read
element.description: Reads length bytes from the current position of LOB's internal pointer. Reading stops when length bytes have been read or end of large object is reached. Internal pointer of large object will be shifted on the amount of bytes read.

element.name: lob->rewind
element.description: Sets the internal pointer to the beginning of the large object.

element.name: lob->save
element.description: Saves data to the large object. Parameter offset can be used to indicate offset from the beginning of the large object.

element.name: lob->seek
element.description: Sets the internal pointer of the large object. Parameter offset indicates the amount of bytes, on which internal pointer should be moved from the position, pointed by whence :

element.name: lob->setBuffering
element.description: lob->setBuffering sets the buffering for the large object, depending on the value of the on_off parameter. Repeated calls to lob->setBuffering with the same flag will return . The values for on_off are: for on and for off.

element.name: lob->size
element.description: Returns length of large object value or in case of error. Empty objects have zero length.

element.name: lob->tell
element.description: Returns current position of a LOB's internal pointer or if an error occurred.

element.name: lob->truncate
element.description: If parameter length is given, lob->truncate truncates large object to length bytes. Otherwise, lob->truncate will purge the LOB completely.

element.name: lob->write
element.description: Writes data from the parameter data into the current position of LOB's internal pointer. If the parameter length is given, writing will stop after length bytes have been written or the end of data is reached, whichever comes first.

element.name: lob->writeTemporary
element.description: Creates a temporary large object and writes data to it.

element.name: oci_bind_by_name
element.description: oci_bind_by_name binds the PHP variable variable to the Oracle placeholder ph_name . Whether it will be used for input or output will be determined at run-time and the necessary storage space will be allocated. The length parameter sets the maximum length for the bind. If you set length to -1 oci_bind_by_name will use the current length of variable to set the maximum length.

element.name: oci_cancel
element.description: oci_cancel invalidates a cursor, freeing all associated resources and cancels the ability to read from it.

element.name: oci_close
element.description: oci_close closes the Oracle connection connection .

element.name: oci_commit
element.description: oci_commit commits all outstanding statements for the active transaction on the Oracle connection connection .

element.name: oci_connect
element.description: oci_connect returns a connection identifier needed for most other OCI calls. The optional third parameter can either contain the name of the local Oracle instance or the name of the entry in to which you want to connect. If the optional third parameter is not specified, PHP uses the environment variables (Oracle instance) or ( ) to determine which database to connect to.

element.name: oci_define_by_name
element.description: oci_define_by_name defines PHP variables for fetches of SQL-Columns. Be careful that Oracle uses ALL-UPPERCASE column names, whereby in your select you can also write lowercase. oci_define_by_name expects the column_name to be in uppercase. If you define a variable that doesn't exists in your select statement, no error will issued.

element.name: oci_error
element.description: For most errors, the parameter is the most appropriate resource handle. For connection errors with oci_connect , oci_new_connect or oci_pconnect , do not pass a parameter. If no error is found, oci_error returns . oci_error returns the error as an associative array. In this array, consists the oracle error code and the oracle error string.

element.name: oci_execute
element.description: oci_execute executes a previously parsed statement (see oci_parse ). The optional mode allows you to specify the execution mode (default is ). If you don't want statements to be committed automatically, you should specify as your mode .

element.name: oci_fetch
element.description: oci_fetch fetches the next row (for SELECT statements) into the internal result-buffer.

element.name: oci_fetch_all
element.description: oci_fetch_all fetches all the rows from a result into a user-defined array. oci_fetch_all returns the number of rows fetched or in case of error. skip is the number of initial rows to ignore when fetching the result (default value of 0, to start at the first line). maxrows is the number of rows to read, starting at the skip th row (default to -1, meaning all the rows).

element.name: oci_fetch_array
element.description: Returns an array, which corresponds to the next result row or in case of error or there is no more rows in the result.

element.name: oci_fetch_assoc
element.description: oci_fetch_assoc returns the next row from the result data as an associative array (identical to oci_fetch_array call with flag).

element.name: oci_fetch_object
element.description: oci_fetch_object returns the next row from the result data as an object, which attributes correspond to fields in statement.

element.name: oci_fetch_row
element.description: Calling oci_fetch_row is identical to oci_fetch_array with flag and returns the next row from the result data as a numeric array.

element.name: oci_field_is_null
element.description: oci_field_is_null returns if field field from the statement is . Parameter field could be a field's index or a field's name (uppercased).

element.name: oci_field_name
element.description: oci_field_name returns the name of the field corresponding to the field number (1-based).

element.name: oci_field_precision
element.description: Returns precision of the field with field index (1-based).

element.name: oci_field_scale
element.description: Returns scale of the column with field index (1-based) or if there is no such field.

element.name: oci_field_size
element.description: oci_field_size returns the size of a field in bytes. Value of field parameter can be the field's index (1-based) or it's name.

element.name: oci_field_type_raw
element.description: oci_field_type_raw returns Oracle's raw data type of the field.

element.name: oci_free_statement
element.description: oci_free_statement frees resources associated with Oracle's cursor or statement, which was received from as a result of oci_parse or obtained from Oracle.

element.name: oci_internal_debug
element.description: oci_internal_debug enables or disables internal debug output. Set onoff to 0 to turn debug output off or 1 to turn it on.

element.name: oci_lob_copy
element.description: Copies large object or a part of large object to another large object. Parameter length indicates the length of data to be copied. Old data of LOB-recipient will be overwritten.

element.name: oci_lob_is_equal
element.description: Compares two LOB/FILE locators. Returns if these objects are equal and otherwise.

element.name: oci_new_collection
element.description: Allocates new collection object. Parameter tdo should be a valid named type (uppercased). Third, optional parameter schema should point to the scheme, where the named type was created. oci_new_collection uses name of the current user as default value of schema .

element.name: oci_new_connect
element.description: oci_new_connect creates a new connection to an Oracle server and logs on. The optional third parameter can either contain the name of the local Oracle instance or the name of the entry in . If the third parameter is not specified, PHP uses environment variables and to determine the name of local Oracle instance and location of accordingly.

element.name: oci_new_cursor
element.description: oci_new_cursor allocates a new statement handle on the specified connection.

element.name: oci_new_descriptor
element.description: oci_new_descriptor allocates resources to hold descriptor or LOB locator. Valid values for type are: , and .

element.name: oci_num_fields
element.description: oci_num_fields returns the number of columns in the statement .

element.name: oci_num_rows
element.description: oci_num_rows returns number of rows affected during statement execution.

element.name: oci_parse
element.description: oci_parse prepares the query using connection and returns the statement identifier, which can be used with oci_bind_by_name , oci_execute and other functions.

element.name: oci_password_change
element.description: Changes password for user with username . Parameters old_password and new_password should indicate old and new passwords respectively.

element.name: oci_pconnect
element.description: oci_pconnect creates a new persistent connection to an Oracle server and logs on. The optional third parameter can either contain the name of the local Oracle instance or the name of the entry in . If the third parameter is not specified, PHP uses environment variables and to determine the name of local Oracle instance and location of accordingly.

element.name: oci_result
element.description: oci_result returns the data from the field field in the current row, fetched by oci_fetch . oci_result returns everything as strings except for abstract types (ROWIDs, LOBs and FILEs). oci_result returns on error.

element.name: oci_rollback
element.description: oci_rollback rolls back all outstanding statements for Oracle connection connection .

element.name: oci_server_version
element.description: Returns a string with version information of the Oracle server, which uses connection connection or returns on error.

element.name: oci_set_prefetch
element.description: Sets the number of rows to be prefetched after successful call to oci_execute . The default value for rows is 1.

element.name: oci_statement_type
element.description: oci_statement_type returns the query type of statement statement as one of the following values:

element.name: ocibindbyname
element.description: ocibindbyname binds the PHP variable variable to the Oracle placeholder ph_name . Whether it will be used for input or output will be determined run-time, and the necessary storage space will be allocated. The length parameter sets the maximum length for the bind. If you set length to -1 ocibindbyname will use the current length of variable to set the maximum length.

element.name: ocicancel
element.description: If you do not want read more data from a cursor, then call ocicancel .

element.name: ocicloselob
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_lob_close after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocicloselob can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ocicollappend
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_collection_append after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocicollappend can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ocicollassign
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_collection_assign after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocicollassign can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ocicollassignelem
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_collection_element_assign after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocicollassignelem can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ocicollgetelem
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_collection_element_get after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocicollgetelem can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ocicollmax
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_collection_max after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocicollmax can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ocicollsize
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_collection_size after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocicollsize can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ocicolltrim
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_collection_trim after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocicolltrim can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ocicolumnisnull
element.description: ocicolumnisnull returns if the returned column column in the result from the statement stmt is . You can either use the column-number (1-Based) or the column-name, in uppercase, for the col parameter.

element.name: ocicolumnprecision
element.description: Returns precision of the field with col index (1-based).

element.name: ocicolumnscale
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_field_scale after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocicolumnscale can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ocicolumnsize
element.description: ocicolumnsize returns the size of the column as given by Oracle. You can either use the column-number (1-Based) or the column-name for the column parameter.

element.name: ocicolumntyperaw
element.description: ocicolumntyperaw returns Oracle's raw data type of the field.

element.name: ocicommit
element.description: ocicommit commits all outstanding statements for the active transaction on Oracle connection connection .

element.name: ocidefinebyname
element.description: ocidefinebyname binds PHP variables for fetches of SQL-Columns. Be careful that Oracle uses ALL-UPPERCASE column-names, whereby in your select you can also write lowercase. ocidefinebyname expects the column_name to be in uppercase. If you define a variable that doesn't exists in your select statement, no error will be given!

element.name: ocierror
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_error after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocierror can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ociexecute
element.description: ociexecute executes a previously parsed statement. (see ociparse ). The optional mode allows you to specify the execution-mode (default is OCI_COMMIT_ON_SUCCESS). If you don't want statements to be committed automatically specify OCI_DEFAULT as your mode.

element.name: ocifetch
element.description: ocifetch fetches the next row (for SELECT statements) into the internal result-buffer.

element.name: ocifetchinto
element.description: This function is deprecated. Recommended alternatives: oci_fetch_array , oci_fetch_object , oci_fetch_assoc and oci_fetch_row .

element.name: ocifetchstatement
element.description: In PHP 5.0.0 this function became an alias for oci_fetch_all . This name still can be used, it was left as alias of oci_fetch_all for downwards compatability. This, however, is deprecated and not recommended.

element.name: ocifreecollection
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_free_collection after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocifreecollection can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ocifreecursor
element.description: ocifreecursor frees all resources associated with the cursor stmt .

element.name: ocifreedesc
element.description: ocifreedesc deletes a large object descriptor.

element.name: ocifreestatement
element.description: ocifreestatement free all resources associated with the statement stmt .

element.name: ociinternaldebug
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_internal_debug after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ociinternaldebug can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ociloadlob
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_lob_load after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ociloadlob can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ocilogoff
element.description: ocilogoff closes the Oracle connection connection .

element.name: ocilogon
element.description: ocilogon returns an connection identifier needed for most other OCI calls. The optional third parameter can either contain the name of the local Oracle instance or the name of the entry in tnsnames.ora to which you want to connect. If the optional third parameter is not specified, PHP uses the environment variables ORACLE_SID (Oracle instance) or TWO_TASK (tnsnames.ora) to determine which database to connect to.

element.name: ocinewcollection
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_new_collection after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocinewcollection can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ocinewcursor
element.description: ocinewcursor allocates a new statement handle on the specified connection.

element.name: ocinewdescriptor
element.description: ocinewdescriptor allocates storage to hold descriptors or LOB locators. Valid values for type are , and . For LOB descriptors, the methods load, save, and savefile are associated with the descriptor, for BFILE only the load method exists. See the second example usage hints.

element.name: ocinlogon
element.description: ocinlogon creates a new connection to an Oracle 8 database and logs on. The optional third parameter can either contain the name of the local Oracle instance or the name of the entry in tnsnames.ora to which you want to connect. If the optional third parameter is not specified, PHP uses the environment variables ORACLE_SID (Oracle instance) or TWO_TASK (tnsnames.ora) to determine which database to connect to.

element.name: ocinumcols
element.description: ocinumcols returns the number of columns in the statement stmt .

element.name: ociparse
element.description: ociparse parses the query using conn . It returns the statement identity if the query is valid, if not. The query can be any valid SQL statement or PL/SQL block.

element.name: ociplogon
element.description: ociplogon creates a persistent connection to an Oracle 8 database and logs on. The optional third parameter can either contain the name of the local Oracle instance or the name of the entry in tnsnames.ora to which you want to connect. If the optional third parameter is not specified, PHP uses the environment variables (Oracle instance) or (tnsnames.ora) to determine which database to connect to.

element.name: ociresult
element.description: ociresult returns the data for column column in the current row (see ocifetch ). ociresult will return everything as strings except for abstract types (ROWIDs, LOBs and FILEs).

element.name: ocirollback
element.description: ocirollback rolls back all outstanding statements for Oracle connection connection .

element.name: ocirowcount
element.description: ocirowcount returns the number of rows affected for e.g. update-statements. This function will not tell you the number of rows that a select will return!

element.name: ocisavelob
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_lob_save after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocisavelob can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ocisavelobfile
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_lob_import after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocisavelobfile can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ocisetprefetch
element.description: Sets the number of top level rows to be prefetched to rows . The default value for rows is 1 row.

element.name: ocistatementtype
element.description: ocistatementtype returns one of the following values:

element.name: ociwritelobtofile
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_lob_export after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ociwritelobtofile can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: ociwritetemporarylob
element.description: This function was renamed to oci_lob_write_temporary after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ociwritetemporarylob can also be used. This is deprecated, however.

element.name: odbc_autocommit
element.description: Without the OnOff parameter, this function returns auto-commit status for connection_id . is returned if auto-commit is on, if it is off or an error occurs.

element.name: odbc_binmode
element.description: (ODBC SQL types affected: BINARY, VARBINARY, LONGVARBINARY)

element.name: odbc_close
element.description: odbc_close will close down the connection to the database server associated with the given connection identifier.

element.name: odbc_close_all
element.description: odbc_close_all will close down all connections to database server(s).

element.name: odbc_columnprivileges
element.description: Lists columns and associated privileges for the given table. Returns an ODBC result identifier or on failure.

element.name: odbc_columns
element.description: Lists all columns in the requested range. Returns an ODBC result identifier containing the information or on failure.

element.name: odbc_commit
element.description: odbc_commit commits all pending transactions on the connection_id connection.

element.name: odbc_connect
element.description: Returns an ODBC connection id or 0 ( ) on error.

element.name: odbc_cursor
element.description: odbc_cursor will return a cursorname for the given result_id.

element.name: odbc_data_source
element.description: Returns on error, and an array upon success.

element.name: odbc_do
element.description: odbc_do will execute a query on the given connection.

element.name: odbc_exec
element.description: Returns on error. Returns an ODBC result identifier if the SQL command was executed successfully.

element.name: odbc_execute
element.description: Executes a statement prepared with odbc_prepare . The array parameters_array only needs to be given if you really have parameters in your statement.

element.name: odbc_fetch_into
element.description: Returns the number of columns in the result; on error. result_array must be passed by reference, but it can be of any type since it will be converted to type array. The array will contain the column values starting at array index 0.

element.name: odbc_fetch_row
element.description: If odbc_fetch_row was successful (there was a row), is returned. If there are no more rows, is returned.

element.name: odbc_field_len
element.description: odbc_field_len will return the length of the field referenced by number in the given ODBC result identifier. Field numbering starts at 1.

element.name: odbc_field_name
element.description: odbc_field_name will return the name of the field occupying the given column number in the given ODBC result identifier. Field numbering starts at 1. is returned on error.

element.name: odbc_field_num
element.description: odbc_field_num will return the number of the column slot that corresponds to the named field in the given ODBC result identifier. Field numbering starts at 1. is returned on error.

element.name: odbc_field_precision
element.description: odbc_field_precision will return the precision of the field referenced by number in the given ODBC result identifier.

element.name: odbc_field_scale
element.description: odbc_field_scale will return the scale of the field referenced by number in the given ODBC result identifier.

element.name: odbc_field_type
element.description: odbc_field_type will return the SQL type of the field referenced by number in the given ODBC result identifier. Field numbering starts at 1.

element.name: odbc_foreignkeys
element.description: odbc_foreignkeys retrieves information about foreign keys. Returns an ODBC result identifier or on failure.

element.name: odbc_free_result
element.description: Always returns .

element.name: odbc_gettypeinfo
element.description: Retrieves information about data types supported by the data source. Returns an ODBC result identifier or on failure. The optional argument data_type can be used to restrict the information to a single data type.

element.name: odbc_longreadlen
element.description: (ODBC SQL types affected: LONG, LONGVARBINARY) The number of bytes returned to PHP is controlled by the parameter length. If it is set to 0, Long column data is passed through to the client.

element.name: odbc_num_fields
element.description: odbc_num_fields will return the number of fields (columns) in an ODBC result. This function will return -1 on error. The argument is a valid result identifier returned by odbc_exec .

element.name: odbc_num_rows
element.description: odbc_num_rows will return the number of rows in an ODBC result. This function will return -1 on error. For INSERT, UPDATE and DELETE statements odbc_num_rows returns the number of rows affected. For a SELECT clause this be the number of rows available.

element.name: odbc_pconnect
element.description: Returns an ODBC connection id or 0 ( ) on error. This function is much like odbc_connect , except that the connection is not really closed when the script has finished. Future requests for a connection with the same dsn , user , password combination (via odbc_connect and odbc_pconnect ) can reuse the persistent connection.

element.name: odbc_prepare
element.description: Returns on error.

element.name: odbc_primarykeys
element.description: Returns the column names that comprise the primary key for a table. Returns an ODBC result identifier or on failure.

element.name: odbc_procedurecolumns
element.description: Returns the list of input and output parameters, as well as the columns that make up the result set for the specified procedures. Returns an ODBC result identifier or on failure.

element.name: odbc_procedures
element.description: Lists all procedures in the requested range. Returns an ODBC result identifier containing the information or on failure.

element.name: odbc_result
element.description: Returns the contents of the field.

element.name: odbc_result_all
element.description: Returns the number of rows in the result or on error.

element.name: odbc_rollback
element.description: Rolls back all pending statements on connection_id . Returns on success, on failure.

element.name: odbc_setoption
element.description: This function allows fiddling with the ODBC options for a particular connection or query result. It was written to help find work around to problems in quirky ODBC drivers. You should probably only use this function if you are an ODBC programmer and understand the effects the various options will have. You will certainly need a good ODBC reference to explain all the different options and values that can be used. Different driver versions support different options.

element.name: odbc_specialcolumns
element.description: The result set has the following columns:

element.name: odbc_statistics
element.description: Get statistics about a table and its indexes. Returns an ODBC result identifier or on failure.

element.name: odbc_tableprivileges
element.description: Lists tables in the requested range and the privileges associated with each table. Returns an ODBC result identifier or on failure.

element.name: odbc_tables
element.description: Lists all tables in the requested range. Returns an ODBC result identifier containing the information or on failure.

element.name: aggregate
element.description: Aggregates methods and properties defined in a class to an existing object. Methods and properties with names starting with an underscore character (_) are considered private to the aggregated class and are not used, constructors are also excluded from the aggregation procedure.

element.name: aggregate_info
element.description: Will return the aggregation information for a particular object as an associative array of arrays of methods and properties. The key for the main array is the name of the aggregated class.

element.name: aggregate_methods
element.description: Aggregates all methods defined in a class to an existing object, except for the class constructor, or methods whose names start with an underscore character (_) which are considered private to the aggregated class.

element.name: aggregate_methods_by_list
element.description: Aggregates methods from a class to an existing object using a list of method names. The optional parameter exclude is used to decide whether the list contains the names of methods to include in the aggregation (i.e. exclude is , which is the default value), or to exclude from the aggregation ( exclude is ).

element.name: aggregate_methods_by_regexp
element.description: Aggregates methods from a class to an existing object using a regular expression to match method names. The optional parameter exclude is used to decide whether the regular expression will select the names of methods to include in the aggregation (i.e. exclude is , which is the default value), or to exclude from the aggregation ( exclude is ).

element.name: aggregate_properties
element.description: Aggregates all properties defined in a class to an existing object, except for properties whose names start with an underscore character (_) which are considered private to the aggregated class.

element.name: aggregate_properties_by_list
element.description: Aggregates properties from a class to an existing object using a list of property names. The optional parameter exclude is used to decide whether the list contains the names of class properties to include in the aggregation (i.e. exclude is , which is the default value), or to exclude from the aggregation ( exclude is ).

element.name: aggregate_properties_by_regexp
element.description: Aggregates properties from a class to an existing object using a regular expression to match their names. The optional parameter exclude is used to decide whether the regular expression will select the names of class properties to include in the aggregation (i.e. exclude is , which is the default value), or to exclude from the aggregation ( exclude is ).

element.name: deaggregate
element.description: Removes the methods and properties from classes that were aggregated to an object. If the optional class_name parameters is passed, only those methods and properties defined in that class are removed, otherwise all aggregated methods and properties are eliminated.

group.name: Object overloading
group.description: Object property and method call overloading

element.name: overload
element.description: The overload function will enable property and method call overloading for a class identified by class_name . .

element.name: openssl_csr_export
element.description: openssl_csr_export takes the Certificate Signing Request represented by csr and stores it as ascii-armoured text into out , which is passed by reference.

element.name: openssl_csr_export_to_file
element.description: openssl_csr_export_to_file takes the Certificate Signing Request represented by csr and saves it as ascii-armoured text into the file named by outfilename .

element.name: openssl_csr_new
element.description: openssl_csr_new generates a new CSR (Certificate Signing Request) based on the information provided by dn , which represents the Distinguished Name to be used in the certificate.

element.name: openssl_csr_sign
element.description: openssl_csr_sign generates an x509 certificate resource from the csr previously generated by openssl_csr_new , but it can also be the path to a PEM encoded CSR when specified as or an exported string generated by openssl_csr_export . The generated certificate will be signed by cacert . If cacert is , the generated certificate will be a self-signed certificate. priv_key is the private key that corresponds to cacert . days specifies the length of time for which the generated certificate will be valid, in days. You can finetune the CSR signing by configargs . See openssl_csr_new for more information about configargs . Since PHP 4.3.3 you can specify the serial number of issued certificate by serial . In earlier versions, it was always 0.

element.name: openssl_error_string
element.description: Returns an error message string, or if there are no more error messages to return.

element.name: openssl_free_key
element.description: openssl_free_key frees the key associated with the specified key_identifier from memory.

element.name: openssl_get_privatekey
element.description: This is an alias for openssl_pkey_get_private .

element.name: openssl_get_publickey
element.description: This is an alias for openssl_pkey_get_public .

element.name: openssl_open
element.description: If successful the opened data is returned in open_data .

element.name: openssl_pkcs7_decrypt
element.description: Decrypts the S/MIME encrypted message contained in the file specified by infilename using the certificate and its associated private key specified by recipcert and recipkey .

element.name: openssl_pkcs7_encrypt
element.description: openssl_pkcs7_encrypt takes the contents of the file named infile and encrypts them using an RC2 40-bit cipher so that they can only be read by the intended recipients specified by recipcerts , which is either a lone X.509 certificate, or an array of X.509 certificates. headers is an array of headers that will be prepended to the data after it has been encrypted. flags can be used to specify options that affect the encoding process - see . headers can be either an associative array keyed by header name, or an indexed array, where each element contains a single header line. Cipher can be selected with cipherid since PHP 5.

element.name: openssl_pkcs7_sign
element.description: openssl_pkcs7_sign takes the contents of the file named infilename and signs them using the certificate and its matching private key specified by signcert and privkey parameters.

element.name: openssl_pkcs7_verify
element.description: openssl_pkcs7_verify reads the S/MIME message contained in the filename specified by filename and examines the digital signature. It returns if the signature is verified, if it is not correct (the message has been tampered with, or the signing certificate is invalid), or -1 on error.

element.name: openssl_pkey_export
element.description: openssl_pkey_export exports key as a PEM encoded string and stores it into out (which is passed by reference). The key is optionally protected by passphrase . configargs can be used to fine-tune the export process by specifying and/or overriding options for the openssl configuration file. See openssl_csr_new for more information about configargs .

element.name: openssl_pkey_export_to_file
element.description: openssl_pkey_export_to_file saves an ascii-armoured (PEM encoded) rendition of key into the file named by outfilename . The key can be optionally protected by a passphrase . configargs can be used to fine-tune the export process by specifying and/or overriding options for the openssl configuration file. See openssl_csr_new for more information about configargs .

element.name: openssl_pkey_get_private
element.description: Returns a positive key resource identifier on success, or on error.

element.name: openssl_pkey_get_public
element.description: Returns a positive key resource identifier on success, or on error.

element.name: openssl_pkey_new
element.description: openssl_pkey_new generates a new private and public key pair. The public component of the key can be obtained using openssl_pkey_get_public . You can finetune the key generation (such as specifying the number of bits) using configargs . See openssl_csr_new for more information about configargs .

element.name: openssl_private_decrypt
element.description: openssl_private_decrypt decrypts data that was previous encrypted via openssl_public_encrypt and stores the result into decrypted . key must be the private key corresponding that was used to encrypt the data. padding defaults to , but can also be one of , , .

element.name: openssl_private_encrypt
element.description: openssl_private_encrypt encrypts data with private key and stores the result into crypted . Encrypted data can be decrypted via openssl_public_decrypt . padding defaults to , but can also be .

element.name: openssl_public_decrypt
element.description: openssl_public_decrypt decrypts data that was previous encrypted via openssl_private_encrypt and stores the result into decrypted . key must be the public key corresponding that was used to encrypt the data. padding defaults to , but can also be .

element.name: openssl_public_encrypt
element.description: openssl_public_encrypt encrypts data with public key and stores the result into crypted . Encrypted data can be decrypted via openssl_private_decrypt . padding defaults to , but can also be one of , , .

element.name: openssl_seal
element.description: Returns the length of the sealed data on success, or on error. If successful the sealed data is returned in sealed_data , and the envelope keys in env_keys .

element.name: openssl_sign
element.description: If successful the signature is returned in signature .

element.name: openssl_verify
element.description: Returns 1 if the signature is correct, 0 if it is incorrect, and -1 on error.

element.name: openssl_x509_check_private_key
element.description: openssl_x509_check_private_key returns if key is the private key that corresponds to cert , or otherwise.

element.name: openssl_x509_checkpurpose
element.description: Returns if the certificate can be used for the intended purpose, if it cannot, or -1 on error.

element.name: openssl_x509_export
element.description: openssl_x509_export stores x509 into a string named by output in a PEM encoded format.

element.name: openssl_x509_export_to_file
element.description: openssl_x509_export_to_file stores x509 into a file named by outfilename in a PEM encoded format.

element.name: openssl_x509_free
element.description: openssl_x509_free frees the certificate associated with the specified x509cert resource from memory.

element.name: openssl_x509_parse
element.description: openssl_x509_parse returns information about the supplied x509cert , including fields such as subject name, issuer name, purposes, valid from and valid to dates etc. shortnames controls how the data is indexed in the array - if shortnames is (the default) then fields will be indexed with the short name form, otherwise, the long name form will be used - e.g.: CN is the shortname form of commonName.

element.name: openssl_x509_read
element.description: openssl_x509_read parses the certificate supplied by x509certdata and returns a resource identifier for it.

element.name: ora_bind
element.description: This function binds the named PHP variable with a SQL parameter. The SQL parameter must be in the form ":name". With the optional type parameter, you can define whether the SQL parameter is an in/out (0, default), in (1) or out (2) parameter. As of PHP 3.0.1, you can use the constants ORA_BIND_INOUT, ORA_BIND_IN and ORA_BIND_OUT instead of the numbers.

element.name: ora_close
element.description: This function closes a data cursor opened with ora_open .

element.name: ora_columnname
element.description: Returns the name of the field/column column on the cursor cursor . The returned name is in all uppercase letters. Column 0 is the first column.

element.name: ora_columnsize
element.description: Returns the size of the Oracle column column on the cursor cursor . Column 0 is the first column.

element.name: ora_columntype
element.description: Returns the Oracle data type name of the field/column column on the cursor cursor . Column 0 is the first column. The returned type will be one of the following:

element.name: ora_commit
element.description: This function commits an Oracle transaction. A transaction is defined as all the changes on a given connection since the last commit/rollback, autocommit was turned off or when the connection was established.

element.name: ora_commitoff
element.description: This function turns off automatic commit after each ora_exec on the given connection.

element.name: ora_commiton
element.description: This function turns on automatic commit after each ora_exec on the given connection.

element.name: ora_do
element.description: ora_do is quick combination of ora_parse , ora_exec and ora_fetch . It will parse and execute a statement, then fetch the first result row.

element.name: ora_error
element.description: Returns an error message of the form - where is where the error comes from and identifies the error message.

element.name: ora_errorcode
element.description: Returns the numeric error code of the last executed statement on the specified cursor or connection. Support for connection ids was added in 3.0.4.

element.name: ora_exec
element.description: ora_exec execute the parsed statement cursor , already parsed by ora_parse .

element.name: ora_fetch
element.description: Retrieves a row of data from the specified cursor .

element.name: ora_fetch_into
element.description: Fetches a row of data into an array. The flags has two flag values: if the flag is set, columns with values are set in the array; and if the flag is set, an associative array is created.

element.name: ora_getcolumn
element.description: Fetches the data for a column or function result.

element.name: ora_logoff
element.description: Logs out the user and disconnects from the server.

element.name: ora_logon
element.description: Establishes a connection between PHP and an Oracle database with the given username user and password password .

element.name: ora_numcols
element.description: ora_numcols returns the number of columns in a result. Only returns meaningful values after an parse/exec/fetch sequence.

element.name: ora_numrows
element.description: ora_numrows returns the number of rows in a result.

element.name: ora_open
element.description: Opens an Oracle cursor associated with connection.

element.name: ora_parse
element.description: This function parses an SQL statement or a PL/SQL block and associates it with the given cursor.

element.name: ora_plogon
element.description: Establishes a persistent connection between PHP and an Oracle database with the username user and password password .

element.name: ora_rollback
element.description: This function undoes an Oracle transaction. (See ora_commit for the definition of a transaction.)

element.name: flush
element.description: flush has no effect on the buffering scheme of your webserver or the browser on the client side. Thus you need to call both ob_flush and flush to flush the output buffers.

element.name: ob_clean
element.description: This function discards the contents of the output buffer.

element.name: ob_end_clean
element.description: This function discards the contents of the topmost output buffer and turns off this output buffering. If you want to further process the buffer's contents you have to call ob_get_contents before ob_end_clean as the buffer contents are discarded when ob_end_flush is called. The function returns when it successfully discarded one buffer and otherwise. Reasons for failure are first that you called the function without an active buffer or that for some reason a buffer could not be deleted (possible for special buffer).

element.name: ob_end_flush
element.description: This function will send the contents of the topmost output buffer (if any) and turn this output buffer off. If you want to further process the buffer's contents you have to call ob_get_contents before ob_end_flush as the buffer contents are discarded after ob_end_flush is called. The function returns when it successfully discarded one buffer and otherwise. Reasons for failure are first that you called the function without an active buffer or that for some reason a buffer could not be deleted (possible for special buffer).

element.name: ob_flush
element.description: This function will send the contents of the output buffer (if any). If you want to further process the buffer's contents you have to call ob_get_contents before ob_flush as the buffer contents are discarded after ob_flush is called.

element.name: ob_get_clean
element.description: This will return the contents of the output buffer and end output buffering. If output buffering isn't active then is returned. ob_get_clean essentially executes both ob_get_contents and ob_end_clean .

element.name: ob_get_contents
element.description: This will return the contents of the output buffer or , if output buffering isn't active.

element.name: ob_get_flush
element.description: ob_get_flush flushs the output buffer, return it as a string and turns off output buffering. ob_get_flush returns if no buffering is active.

element.name: ob_get_length
element.description: This will return the length of the contents in the output buffer or , if output buffering isn't active.

element.name: ob_get_level
element.description: This will return the level of nested output buffering handlers or zero if output buffering is not activated.

element.name: ob_get_status
element.description: This will return the current status of output buffers. It returns array contains buffer status or for error.

element.name: ob_gzhandler
element.description: ob_gzhandler requires the extension.

element.name: ob_implicit_flush
element.description: ob_implicit_flush will turn implicit flushing on or off (if no flag is given, it defaults to on). Implicit flushing will result in a flush operation after every output call, so that explicit calls to flush will no longer be needed.

element.name: ob_list_handlers
element.description: This will return an array with the output handlers in use (if any). If is enabled, ob_list_handlers will return "default output handler".

element.name: ob_start
element.description: This function will turn output buffering on. While output buffering is active no output is sent from the script (other than headers), instead the output is stored in an internal buffer.

element.name: output_add_rewrite_var
element.description: This function rewrite the URLs and forms with the given variable.

element.name: output_reset_rewrite_vars
element.description: This function resets the URL rewriter and undo the changes made by output_add_rewrite_var and/or by session_start that are still in the buffer.

element.name: ovrimos_close
element.description: ovrimos_close is used to close the specified connection to Ovrimos. This has the effect of rolling back uncommitted transactions.

element.name: ovrimos_commit
element.description: ovrimos_commit is used to commit the transaction.

element.name: ovrimos_connect
element.description: ovrimos_connect is used to connect to the specified database.

element.name: ovrimos_cursor
element.description: ovrimos_cursor returns the name of the cursor. Useful when wishing to perform positioned updates or deletes.

element.name: ovrimos_exec
element.description: ovrimos_exec executes an SQL statement (query or update) and returns a result_id or . Evidently, the SQL statement should not contain parameters.

element.name: ovrimos_execute
element.description: ovrimos_execute executes a prepared statement. If the prepared statement contained parameters (question marks in the statement), the correct number of parameters should be passed in an array. Notice that I don't follow the PHP convention of placing just the name of the optional parameter inside square brackets. I couldn't bring myself on liking it.

element.name: ovrimos_fetch_into
element.description: ovrimos_fetch_into fetches a row from the result set into result_array , which should be passed by reference. Which row is fetched is determined by the two last parameters. how is one of (default), , , , , corresponding to forward direction from current position, backward direction from current position, forward direction from the start, backward direction from the end and absolute position from the start (essentially equivalent to 'first' but needs 'rownumber'). Case is not significant. rownumber is optional except for absolute positioning.

element.name: ovrimos_fetch_row
element.description: ovrimos_fetch_row fetches a row from the result set. Column values should be retrieved with other calls.

element.name: ovrimos_field_len
element.description: ovrimos_field_len is used to get the length of the output column with number field_number (1-based), in result result_id .

element.name: ovrimos_field_name
element.description: ovrimos_field_name returns the output column name at the (1-based) index specified.

element.name: ovrimos_field_num
element.description: ovrimos_field_num returns the (1-based) index of the output column specified by field_name , or .

element.name: ovrimos_field_type
element.description: ovrimos_field_type returns the (numeric) type of the output column at the (1-based) index specified by field_number .

element.name: ovrimos_free_result
element.description: ovrimos_free_result frees the specified result_id . Returns .

element.name: ovrimos_longreadlen
element.description: ovrimos_longreadlen specifies how many bytes are to be retrieved from long datatypes (long varchar and long varbinary). Default is zero. It currently sets this parameter the specified result set. Returns .

element.name: ovrimos_num_fields
element.description: ovrimos_num_fields returns the number of columns in a result_id resulting from a query.

element.name: ovrimos_num_rows
element.description: ovrimos_num_rows returns the number of rows affected by update operations.

element.name: ovrimos_prepare
element.description: ovrimos_prepare prepares an SQL statement and returns a result_id (or on failure).

element.name: ovrimos_result
element.description: ovrimos_result retrieves the output column specified by field , either as a string or as an 1-based index. Returns on failure.

element.name: ovrimos_result_all
element.description: ovrimos_result_all prints the whole result set as an HTML table. Returns the number of rows in the generated table.

element.name: ovrimos_rollback
element.description: ovrimos_rollback is used to roll back the transaction.

element.name: pcntl_alarm
element.description: The pcntl_alarm function creates a timer that will send a signal to the process after seconds seconds. If seconds is zero, no new alarm is created. Any call to pcntl_alarm will cancel any previously set alarm.

element.name: pcntl_exec
element.description: pcntl_exec executes the program path with arguments args . path must be the path to a binary executable or a script with a valid path pointing to an executable in the shebang ( #!/usr/local/bin/perl for example) as the first line. See your system's man execve(2) page for additional information.

element.name: pcntl_fork
element.description: The pcntl_fork function creates a child process that differs from the parent process only in its PID and PPID. Please see your system's fork(2) man page for specific details as to how fork works on your system.

element.name: pcntl_getpriority
element.description: pcntl_getpriority gets the priority of pid . If pid is not specified, the pid of the current process is used. Because priority levels can differ between system types and kernel versions, please see your system's getpriority(2) man page for specific details.

element.name: pcntl_setpriority
element.description: pcntl_setpriority sets the priority of pid to priority . If pid is not specified, the pid of the current process is used.

element.name: pcntl_signal
element.description: The pcntl_signal function installs a new signal handler for the signal indicated by signo . The signal handler is set to handler which may be the name of a user created function, or either of the two global constants SIG_IGN or SIG_DFL. The optional restart_syscalls specifies whether system call restarting should be used when this signal arrives and defaults to .

element.name: pcntl_wait
element.description: The wait function suspends execution of the current process until a child has exited, or until a signal is delivered whose action is to terminate the current process or to call a signal handling function. If a child has already exited by the time of the call (a so-called "zombie" process), the function returns immediately. Any system resources used by the child are freed. Please see your system's wait(2) man page for specific details as to how wait works on your system.

element.name: pcntl_waitpid
element.description: The pcntl_waitpid function suspends execution of the current process until a child as specified by the pid argument has exited, or until a signal is delivered whose action is to terminate the current process or to call a signal handling function. If a child as requested by pid has already exited by the time of the call (a so-called "zombie" process), the function returns immediately. Any system resources used by the child are freed. Please see your system's waitpid(2) man page for specific details as to how waitpid works on your system.

element.name: pcntl_wexitstatus
element.description: Returns the return code of a terminated child. This function is only useful if pcntl_wifexited returned .

element.name: pcntl_wifexited
element.description: Returns if the child status code represents a successful exit.

element.name: pcntl_wifsignaled
element.description: Returns if the child process exited because of a signal which was not caught.

element.name: pcntl_wifstopped
element.description: Returns if the child process which caused the return is currently stopped; this is only possible if the call to pcntl_waitpid was done using the option .

element.name: pcntl_wstopsig
element.description: Returns the number of the signal which caused the child to stop. This function is only useful if pcntl_wifstopped returned .

element.name: pcntl_wtermsig
element.description: Returns the number of the signal that caused the child process to terminate. This function is only useful if pcntl_wifsignaled returned .

element.name: preg_grep
element.description: preg_grep returns the array consisting of the elements of the input array that match the given pattern .

element.name: preg_match
element.description: Searches subject for a match to the regular expression given in pattern .

element.name: preg_match_all
element.description: Searches subject for all matches to the regular expression given in pattern and puts them in matches in the order specified by flags .

element.name: preg_quote
element.description: preg_quote takes str and puts a backslash in front of every character that is part of the regular expression syntax. This is useful if you have a run-time string that you need to match in some text and the string may contain special regex characters.

element.name: preg_replace
element.description: Searches subject for matches to pattern and replaces them with replacement . If limit is specified, then only limit matches will be replaced; if limit is omitted or is -1, then all matches are replaced.

element.name: preg_replace_callback
element.description: The behavior of this function is almost identical to preg_replace , except for the fact that instead of replacement parameter, one should specify a callback that will be called and passed an array of matched elements in the subject string. The callback should return the replacement string.

element.name: preg_split
element.description: Returns an array containing substrings of subject split along boundaries matched by pattern .

element.name: pdf_add_bookmark
element.description: Add a nested bookmark under parent , or a new top-level bookmark if parent = 0. Returns a bookmark descriptor which may be used as parent for subsequent nested bookmarks. If open = 1, child bookmarks will be folded out, and invisible if open = 0. Parameters parent and open were optional before PHP 5.

element.name: pdf_add_launchlink
element.description: Adds a link to a web resource specified by filename .

element.name: pdf_add_locallink
element.description: Add a link annotation to a target within the current PDF file.

element.name: pdf_add_note
element.description: Sets an annotation for the current page. icon is one of , , , , , , or .

element.name: pdf_add_pdflink
element.description: Add a file link annotation (to a PDF target).

element.name: pdf_add_thumbnail
element.description: Adds an existing image as thumbnail for the current page. Thumbnail images must not be wider or higher than 106 pixels.

element.name: pdf_add_weblink
element.description: Add a weblink annotation to a target url on the Web.

element.name: pdf_arc
element.description: Add a counterclockwise circular arc from alpha to beta degrees with center ( x ; y ) and radius r . Actual drawing of the circle is performed by the next stroke or fill operation.

element.name: pdf_arcn
element.description: Add a clockwise circular arc from alpha to beta degrees with center ( x ; y ) and radius r . Actual drawing of the circle is performed by the next stroke or fill operation.

element.name: pdf_attach_file
element.description: Add a file attachment annotation. icon is one of , , , or .

element.name: pdf_begin_page
element.description: Add a new page to the document. The width and height are specified in points, which are 1/72 of an inch.

element.name: pdf_begin_pattern
element.description: Starts a new pattern definition and returns a pattern handle. width , and height define the bounding box for the pattern. xstep and ystep give the repeated pattern offsets. painttype =1 means that the pattern has its own colour settings whereas a value of 2 indicates that the current colour is used when the pattern is applied.

element.name: pdf_begin_template
element.description: Start a new template definition.

element.name: pdf_circle
element.description: Add a circle with center ( x , y ) and radius r to the current page. Actual drawing of the circle is performed by the next stroke or fill operation.

element.name: pdf_clip
element.description: Use the current path as clipping path.

element.name: pdf_close
element.description: Close the generated PDF file, and free all document-related resources.

element.name: pdf_close_image
element.description: Close an image retrieved with the pdf_open_image function.

element.name: pdf_close_pdi
element.description: Close all open page handles, and close the input PDF document.

element.name: pdf_close_pdi_page
element.description: Close the page handle, and free all page-related resources.

element.name: pdf_closepath
element.description: Close the current path.

element.name: pdf_closepath_fill_stroke
element.description: Close the path, fill, and stroke it.

element.name: pdf_closepath_stroke
element.description: Close the path, and stroke it.

element.name: pdf_concat
element.description: Concatenate a matrix to the CTM.

element.name: pdf_continue_text
element.description: Print text at the next line.

element.name: pdf_curveto
element.description: Draw a Bezier curve from the current point, using 3 more control points.

element.name: pdf_delete
element.description: Delete the PDF resource, and free all internal resources.

element.name: pdf_end_page
element.description: Finish the page.

element.name: pdf_end_pattern
element.description: Finish the pattern definition.

element.name: pdf_end_template
element.description: Finish the template definition.

element.name: pdf_fill
element.description: Fill the interior of the path with the current fill color.

element.name: pdf_fill_stroke
element.description: Fill and stroke the path with the current fill and stroke color.

element.name: pdf_findfont
element.description: Prepare a font for later use with pdf_setfont . The metrics will be loaded, and if embed is nonzero, the font file will be checked, but not yet used. encoding is one of , , , , a user-defined encoding name or the name of a CMap. Parameter embed was optional before PHP 5.

element.name: pdf_get_buffer
element.description: Get the contents of the PDF output buffer. The result must be used by the client before calling any other PDFlib function.

element.name: pdf_get_majorversion
element.description: Returns the major version number of the PDFlib.

element.name: pdf_get_minorversion
element.description: Returns the minor version number of the PDFlib.

element.name: pdf_get_parameter
element.description: Get the contents of some PDFlib parameter with string type. Parameter modifier was optional before PHP 5.

element.name: pdf_get_pdi_parameter
element.description: Get the contents of some PDI document parameter with string type.

element.name: pdf_get_pdi_value
element.description: Get the contents of some PDI document parameter with numerical type.

element.name: pdf_get_value
element.description: Get the contents of some PDFlib parameter with float type. Parameter modifier was optional before PHP 5.

element.name: pdf_initgraphics
element.description: Reset all implicit color and graphics state parameters to their defaults.

element.name: pdf_lineto
element.description: Draw a line from the current point to ( x , y ).

element.name: pdf_makespotcolor
element.description: Make a named spot color from the current color.

element.name: pdf_moveto
element.description: Set the current point to ( x , y .

element.name: pdf_new
element.description: Create a new PDF resource, using default error handling and memory management.

element.name: pdf_open_ccitt
element.description: Open a raw CCITT image.

element.name: pdf_open_file
element.description: Create a new PDF file using the supplied file name. If filename is empty the PDF document will be generated in memory instead of on file. The result must be fetched by the client with the pdf_get_buffer function. Parameter filename was optional before PHP 5.

element.name: pdf_open_image
element.description: Use image data from a variety of data sources. Supported types are , , . Supported sources are , , . len is only used when type is , params is only used when type is .

element.name: pdf_open_image_file
element.description: Open an image file. Supported types are , , , and . stringparam is either empty, , , or . intparam is either 0, the image id of the applied mask, or the page. Parameters stringparam and intparam were optional before PHP 5.

element.name: pdf_open_memory_image
element.description: The pdf_open_memory_image function takes an image created with the PHP's image functions and makes it available for the pdf resource. The function returns a pdf image identifier.

element.name: pdf_open_pdi
element.description: Opens an existing PDF document and prepares it for later use.

element.name: pdf_open_pdi_page
element.description: Prepare a page for later use with pdf_place_image

element.name: pdf_place_image
element.description: Place an image with the lower left corner at ( x , y ), and scale it.

element.name: pdf_place_pdi_page
element.description: Place a PDI page with the lower left corner at ( x , y ), and scale it.

element.name: pdf_rect
element.description: Draw a ( width * height ) rectangle at lower left ( x , y ).

element.name: pdf_restore
element.description: Restore the most recently saved graphics state.

element.name: pdf_rotate
element.description: Rotate the coordinate system by phi degrees.

element.name: pdf_save
element.description: Save the current graphics state.

element.name: pdf_scale
element.description: Scale the coordinate system.

element.name: pdf_set_border_color
element.description: Set the border color for all kinds of annotations.

element.name: pdf_set_border_dash
element.description: Sets the border dash style for all kinds of annotations.

element.name: pdf_set_border_style
element.description: Sets the border style for all kinds of annotations. style is solid or dashed .

element.name: pdf_set_info
element.description: Fill document information field key with value . key is one of , , , , , or a user-defined key.

element.name: pdf_set_parameter
element.description: Sets some PDFlib parameters with string type.

element.name: pdf_set_text_pos
element.description: Set the text output position specified by x and y .

element.name: pdf_set_value
element.description: Set the value of some PDFlib parameter with float type.

element.name: pdf_setcolor
element.description: Set the current color space and color. The parameter type can be , or to specify that the color is set for filling, stroking or both filling and stroking. The parameter colorspace can be , , , or . The parameters c1 , c2 , c3 and c4 represent the color components for the color space specified by colorspace . Except as otherwise noted, the color components are floating-point values that range from 0 to 1. Parameters c2 , c3 and c4 were optional before PHP 5.

element.name: pdf_setdash
element.description: Set the current dash pattern to b black and w white units.

element.name: pdf_setflat
element.description: Sets the flatness to a value between 0 and 100 inclusive.

element.name: pdf_setfont
element.description: Set the current font in the given size , using a font handle returned by pdf_findfont .

element.name: pdf_setgray
element.description: Set the current fill and stroke color.

element.name: pdf_setgray_fill
element.description: Set the current fill color to a gray value between 0 and 1 inclusive.

element.name: pdf_setgray_stroke
element.description: Set the current stroke color to a gray value between 0 and 1 inclusive.

element.name: pdf_setlinecap
element.description: Set the linecap parameter to a value between 0 and 2 inclusive.

element.name: pdf_setlinejoin
element.description: Sets the line join parameter to a value between 0 and 2 inclusive.

element.name: pdf_setlinewidth
element.description: Sets the current linewidth to width .

element.name: pdf_setmatrix
element.description: Explicitly set the current transformation matrix.

element.name: pdf_setmiterlimit
element.description: Set the miter limit to a value greater than or equal to 1.

element.name: pdf_setrgbcolor
element.description: Set the current fill and stroke color to the supplied RGB values.

element.name: pdf_setrgbcolor_fill
element.description: Set the current fill color to the supplied RGB values.

element.name: pdf_setrgbcolor_stroke
element.description: Set the current stroke color to the supplied RGB values.

element.name: pdf_show
element.description: Print text in the current font and size at the current position.

element.name: pdf_show_boxed
element.description: Format text in the current font and size into the supplied text box according to the requested formatting mode , which must be one of , , , or . If width and height are 0, only a single line is placed at the point ( left , top ) in the requested mode . Parameter feature was optional before PHP 5.

element.name: pdf_show_xy
element.description: Print text in the current font at ( x , y ).

element.name: pdf_skew
element.description: Skew the coordinate system in x and y direction by alpha and beta degrees.

element.name: pdf_stringwidth
element.description: Returns the width of text using the last font set by pdf_setfont . If the optional parameters font and size are specified, the width will be calculated using that font and size instead. Please note that font is a font handle returned by pdf_findfont . Parameters font and size were optional before PHP 5.

element.name: pdf_stroke
element.description: Stroke the path with the current color and line width, and clear it.

element.name: pdf_translate
element.description: Translate the origin of the coordinate system.

element.name: PDO::__construct
element.description: Creates a PDO instance to represent a connection to the requested database.

element.name: PDO::beginTransaction
element.description: Turns off autocommit mode. Call PDO::commit or PDO::rollback to end the transaction and return to autocommit mode.

element.name: PDO::commit
element.description: Commits a transaction, returning the database connection to autocommit mode until the next call to PDO::beginTransaction starts a new transaction.

element.name: PDO::errorCode
element.description: Returns a SQLSTATE, a five-character alphanumeric identifier defined in the ANSI SQL standard.

element.name: PDO::errorInfo
element.description: PDO::errorInfo returns an array of error information about the last operation performed by this database handle. The array consists of the following fields:

element.name: PDO::exec
element.description: PDO::exec prepares and executes an SQL statement in a single function call, returning the number of rows affected by the statement.

property.name: statement
property.description: The SQL statement to prepare and execute.

element.name: PDO::getAttribute
element.description: This function returns the value of a database connection attribute. To retrieve PDOStatement attributes, refer to PDOStatement::getAttribute .

property.name: attribute
property.description: One of the constants. The constants that apply to database connections are as follows:

element.name: PDO::lastInsertId
element.description: Due to differences between database server implementations, this method may not always return a meaningful result.

element.name: PDO::prepare
element.description: Prepares an SQL statement to be executed by the PDOStatement::execute method. The SQL statement can contain zero or more named (:name) or question mark (?) parameter markers for which real values will be substituted when the statement is executed.

element.name: PDO::query
element.description: PDO::query prepares and executes an SQL statement in a single function call, returning the result set (if any) returned by the statement as a PDOStatement object.

element.name: PDO::quote
element.description: PDO::quote places quotes around the input string and escapes and single quotes within the input string. Quoting input strings has been a common means of attempting to prevent SQL injection attacks; however, an even safer approach is to use prepared statements with named parameters or placeholders for the input values.

property.name: parameter_type
property.description: Provides a data type hint for drivers that have alternate quoting styles. The default value is PDO_PARAM_STR.

element.name: PDO::rollBack
element.description: When issued against databases that support transactions, PDO::rollBack rolls back any work in progress and and returns the connection state to autocommit mode.

element.name: PDO::setAttribute
element.description: Sets a database connection attribute. The generic PDO connection attributes include: : Force column names to a specific case. : Force column names to lower case.

element.name: PDOStatement::bindColumn
element.description: On each row fetch param will contain the value of the corresponding column. column is the 1-based offset of the column, or the column name. For maximum portability, do not call this function before calling PDOStatement::execute .

property.name: param
property.description: Name of the PHP variable to which the column will be bound.

element.name: PDOStatement::bindParam
element.description: Binds an SQL statement parameter to the specified variable name. The SQL statement parameter can either be a named placeholder or a question mark placeholder.

element.name: PDOStatement::columnCount
element.description: Use PDOStatement::columnCount to return the number of columns in the result set represented by the PDOStatement object.

element.name: PDOStatement::errorCode
element.description: Returns a SQLSTATE, a five-character alphanumeric identifier defined in the ANSI SQL standard. PDOStatement::errorCode only retrieves error codes for operations performed with PDOStatement objects.

element.name: PDOStatement::errorInfo
element.description: PDOStatement::errorInfo returns an array of error information about the last operation performed by this statement handle. The array consists of the following fields:

element.name: PDOStatement::execute
element.description: Execute the prepared statement. If the prepared statement included parameter markers, you must either: call PDOStatement::bindParam to bind PHP variables to the parameter markers: bound variables pass their value as input and receive the output value, if any, of their associated parameter markers

element.name: PDOStatement::fetch
element.description: Fetches a row from a result set associated with a PDOStatement object.

property.name: fetch_style
property.description: Controls how the next row will be returned to the caller.
