This value must be one of the constants, defaulting to . : returns an array indexed by column name as returned in your result set (default): returns an array indexed by both column name and column number as returned in your result set : returns and assigns the values of the columns in your result set to the PHP variables to which they were bound with the method : combines and , creating the object variable names as they are accessed : returns an anonymous object with property names that correspond to the column names returned in your result set : returns an array indexed by column number as returned in your result set, starting at column 0

property.name: cursor_orientation
property.description: For a PDOStatement object representing a scrollable cursor, this value determines which row will be returned to the caller. This value must be one of the constants, defaulting to .

element.name: PDOStatement::fetchAll
element.description: Controls the contents of the returned array as documented in PDOStatement::fetch . Defaults to .

element.name: PDOStatement::fetchSingle
element.description: PDOStatement::fetchSingle returns the first column in the next row of a result set as a value.

element.name: PDOStatement::getColumnMeta
element.description: Its description

element.name: PDOStatement::rowCount
element.description: PDOStatement::rowCount returns the number of rows affected by the last DELETE, INSERT, or UPDATE statement executed by the corresponding object.

element.name: PDOStatement::setFetchMode
element.description: The fetch mode must be one of the constants.

element.name: assert
element.description: assert will check the given assertion and take appropriate action if its result is .

element.name: assert_options
element.description: Using assert_options you may set the various assert control options or just query their current settings.

element.name: dl
element.description: Loads the PHP extension given by the parameter library . The library parameter is the filename of the extension to load which also depends on your platform. For example, the extension (if compiled as a shared module, not the default!) would be called on Unix platforms whereas it is called on the Windows platform.

element.name: extension_loaded
element.description: Returns if the extension identified by name is loaded, otherwise.

element.name: get_defined_constants
element.description: This function returns the names and values of all the constants currently defined. This includes those created by extensions as well as those created with the define function.

element.name: get_extension_funcs
element.description: This function returns the names of all the functions defined in the module indicated by module_name .

element.name: get_included_files
element.description: Returns an array of the names of all files that have been included using include , include_once , require or require_once .

element.name: get_loaded_extensions
element.description: This function returns the names of all the modules compiled and loaded in the PHP interpreter.

element.name: get_magic_quotes_gpc
element.description: If the directive is ON it will completely override magic_quotes_gpc . So even when get_magic_quotes returns neither double quotes, backslashes or NUL's will be escaped. Only single quotes will be escaped. In this case they'll look like:

element.name: getenv
element.description: Returns the value of the environment variable varname , or on an error.

element.name: getlastmod
element.description: Returns the time of the last modification of the current page. The value returned is a Unix timestamp, suitable for feeding to date . Returns on error.

element.name: getmyinode
element.description: Returns the current script's inode, or on error.

element.name: getmypid
element.description: Returns the current PHP process ID, or on error.

element.name: getopt
element.description: Returns an associative array of option / argument pairs based on the options format specified in options , or on an error.

element.name: getrusage
element.description: This is an interface to getrusage(2). It returns an associative array containing the data returned from the system call. If who is 1, getrusage will be called with RUSAGE_CHILDREN.

element.name: ini_get
element.description: Returns the value of the configuration option on success. Failure, such as querying for a non-existent value, will return an empty string.

element.name: ini_get_all
element.description: Returns all the registered configuration options as an associative array. If the optional extension parameter is set, returns only options specific for that extension.

element.name: ini_restore
element.description: Restores a given configuration option to its original value.

element.name: ini_set
element.description: Sets the value of the given configuration option. Returns the old value on success, on failure. The configuration option will keep this new value during the script's execution, and will be restored at the script's ending.

element.name: memory_get_usage
element.description: Returns the amount of memory, in bytes, that's currently being allocated to your PHP script.

element.name: php_logo_guid
element.description: This function returns the ID which can be used to display the PHP logo using the built-in image.

element.name: php_uname
element.description: php_uname returns a description of the operating system PHP is running on. For the name of just the operating system, consider using the constant, but be reminded this constant will contain the operating system PHP was on.

element.name: phpcredits
element.description: This function prints out the credits listing the PHP developers, modules, etc. It generates the appropriate HTML codes to insert the information in a page. flag is optional, and it defaults to . To generate a custom credits page, you may want to use the flag parameter. For example to print the general credits, you will use somewhere in your code:

element.name: phpinfo
element.description: Outputs a large amount of information about the current state of PHP. This includes information about PHP compilation options and extensions, the PHP version, server information and environment (if compiled as a module), the PHP environment, OS version information, paths, master and local values of configuration options, HTTP headers, and the PHP License.

element.name: phpversion
element.description: Returns a string containing the version of the currently running PHP parser. If the optional extension parameter is specified, phpversion returns the version of that extension, or if there is no version information associated or the extension isn't enabled.

element.name: putenv
element.description: Adds setting to the server environment. The environment variable will only exist for the duration of the current request. At the end of the request the environment is restored to its original state.

element.name: set_time_limit
element.description: set_time_limit has no effect when PHP is running in . There is no workaround other than turning off safe mode or changing the time limit in the .

element.name: version_compare
element.description: version_compare compares two "PHP-standardized" version number strings. This is useful if you would like to write programs working only on some versions of PHP.

element.name: zend_logo_guid
element.description: This function returns the ID which can be used to display the Zend logo using the built-in image.

element.name: zend_version
element.description: Returns a string containing the version of the currently running Zend Engine.

element.name: posix_access
element.description: posix_access checks the user's permission of a file.

element.name: posix_get_last_error
element.description: Returns the errno (error number) set by the last posix function that failed. If no errors exist, 0 is returned. If you're wanting the system error message associated with the errno, use posix_strerror .

element.name: posix_getcwd
element.description: posix_getcwd returns the absolute pathname of the script's current working directory. posix_getcwd returns on error.

element.name: posix_getegid
element.description: Return the numeric effective group ID of the current process. See also posix_getgrgid for information on how to convert this into a useable group name.

element.name: posix_geteuid
element.description: Return the numeric effective user ID of the current process. See also posix_getpwuid for information on how to convert this into a useable username.

element.name: posix_getgid
element.description: Return the numeric real group ID of the current process. See also posix_getgrgid for information on how to convert this into a useable group name.

element.name: posix_getgrgid
element.description: Returns an of information about a group and on failure. If gid isn't a number then is returned and an level error is generated.

element.name: posix_getgroups
element.description: Returns an array of integers containing the numeric group ids of the group set of the current process. See also posix_getgrgid for information on how to convert this into useable group names.

element.name: posix_getlogin
element.description: Returns the login name of the user owning the current process. See posix_getpwnam for information how to get more information about this user.

element.name: posix_getpgid
element.description: Returns the process group identifier of the process pid .

element.name: posix_getpgrp
element.description: Return the process group identifier of the current process. See POSIX.1 and the getpgrp(2) manual page on your POSIX system for more information on process groups.

element.name: posix_getpid
element.description: Return the process identifier of the current process.

element.name: posix_getppid
element.description: Return the process identifier of the parent process of the current process.

element.name: posix_getpwnam
element.description: Returns an associative array containing information about a user referenced by an alphanumeric username, passed in the username parameter.

element.name: posix_getpwuid
element.description: Returns an associative array containing information about a user referenced by a numeric user ID, passed in the uid parameter.

element.name: posix_getsid
element.description: Return the sid of the process pid . If pid is 0, the sid of the current process is returned.

element.name: posix_getuid
element.description: Return the numeric real user ID of the current process. See also posix_getpwuid for information on how to convert this into a useable username.

element.name: posix_kill
element.description: Send the signal sig to the process with the process identifier pid . Returns , if unable to send the signal, otherwise.

element.name: posix_mkfifo
element.description: posix_mkfifo creates a special file which exists in the file system and acts as a bidirectional communication endpoint for processes.

element.name: posix_setegid
element.description: Set the effective group ID of the current process. This is a privileged function and you need appropriate privileges (usually root) on your system to be able to perform this function.

element.name: posix_seteuid
element.description: Set the real user ID of the current process. This is a privileged function and you need appropriate privileges (usually root) on your system to be able to perform this function.

element.name: posix_setgid
element.description: Set the real group ID of the current process. This is a privileged function and you need appropriate privileges (usually root) on your system to be able to perform this function. The appropriate order of function calls is posix_setgid first, posix_setuid last.

element.name: posix_setpgid
element.description: Let the process pid join the process group pgid . See POSIX.1 and the setsid(2) manual page on your POSIX system for more informations on process groups and job control.

element.name: posix_setsid
element.description: Make the current process a session leader. See POSIX.1 and the setsid(2) manual page on your POSIX system for more information on process groups and job control. Returns the session id.

element.name: posix_setuid
element.description: Set the real user ID of the current process. This is a privileged function and you need appropriate privileges (usually root) on your system to be able to perform this function.

element.name: posix_strerror
element.description: Returns the POSIX system error message associated with the given errno. If errno is 0, then the string "Success" is returned. The function posix_get_last_error is used for retrieving the last POSIX errno.

element.name: posix_times
element.description: Returns a hash of strings with information about the current process CPU usage. The indices of the hash are

element.name: posix_uname
element.description: Returns a hash of strings with information about the system. The indices of the hash are

element.name: ereg
element.description: preg_match , which uses a Perl-compatible regular expression syntax, is often a faster alternative to ereg .

element.name: ereg_replace
element.description: For example, the following code snippet prints "This was a test" three times:

element.name: eregi
element.description: This function is identical to ereg except that this ignores case distinction when matching alphabetic characters.

element.name: eregi_replace
element.description: This function is identical to ereg_replace except that this ignores case distinction when matching alphabetic characters.

element.name: split
element.description: preg_split , which uses a Perl-compatible regular expression syntax, is often a faster alternative to split . If you don't require the power of regular expressions, it is faster to use explode , which doesn't incur the overhead of the regular expression engine.

element.name: spliti
element.description: This function is identical to split except that this ignores case distinction when matching alphabetic characters.

element.name: sql_regcase
element.description: Returns a valid regular expression which will match string , ignoring case. This expression is string with each alphabetic character converted to a bracket expression; this bracket expression contains that character's uppercase and lowercase form. Other characters remain unchanged.

element.name: parsekit_compile_file
element.description: A string containing the name of the file to compile. Similar to the argument to include .

property.name: errors
property.description: A 2D hash of errors (including fatal errors) encountered during compilation. Returned by reference.

element.name: parsekit_compile_string
element.description: A string containing phpcode. Similar to the argument to eval .

element.name: parsekit_func_arginfo
element.description: A string describing a function, or an array describing a class/method.

element.name: pg_affected_rows
element.description: pg_affected_rows returns the number of tuples (instances/records/rows) affected by INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE queries executed by pg_query . If no tuple is affected by this function, it will return 0.

element.name: pg_cancel_query
element.description: pg_cancel_query cancel asynchronous query sent by pg_send_query . You cannot cancel query executed by pg_query .

element.name: pg_client_encoding
element.description: pg_client_encoding returns the client encoding as the string. The returned string should be either : SQL_ASCII, EUC_JP, EUC_CN, EUC_KR, EUC_TW, UNICODE, MULE_INTERNAL, LATINX (X=1...9), KOI8, WIN, ALT, SJIS, BIG5, WIN1250.

element.name: pg_close
element.description: pg_close closes the non-persistent connection to a PostgreSQL database associated with the given connection resource.

element.name: pg_connect
element.description: pg_connect returns a connection resource that is needed by other PostgreSQL functions.

element.name: pg_connection_busy
element.description: pg_connection_busy returns if the connection is busy. If it is busy, a previous query is still executing. If pg_get_result is called, it will be blocked.

element.name: pg_connection_reset
element.description: pg_connection_reset resets the connection. It is useful for error recovery.

element.name: pg_connection_status
element.description: pg_connection_status returns a connection status. Possible statuses are and . The return value 0 as integer indicates a valid connection.

element.name: pg_convert
element.description: pg_convert checks and converts the values in into suitable values for use in a SQL statement. Precondition for pg_convert is the existence of a table which has at least as many columns as has elements. The fieldnames as well as the fieldvalues in must match the indices and values of . Returns an array with the converted values on success, otherwise.

element.name: pg_copy_from
element.description: pg_copy_from insert records into a table from rows . It issues SQL command internally to insert records.

element.name: pg_copy_to
element.description: pg_copy_to copies a table to an array. It issues SQL command internally to retrieve records. The resulting array is returned. It returns on failure.

element.name: pg_dbname
element.description: pg_dbname returns the name of the database that the given PostgreSQL connection resource. It returns , if connection is not a valid PostgreSQL connection resource.

element.name: pg_delete
element.description: pg_delete deletes record condition specified by which has . If is specified, pg_convert is applied to with specified option.

element.name: pg_end_copy
element.description: pg_end_copy syncs the PostgreSQL frontend (usually a web server process) with the PostgreSQL server after doing a copy operation performed by pg_put_line . pg_end_copy must be issued, otherwise the PostgreSQL server may get out of sync with the frontend and will report an error.

element.name: pg_escape_bytea
element.description: pg_escape_bytea escapes string for bytea datatype. It returns escaped string.

element.name: pg_escape_string
element.description: pg_escape_string escapes string for text/char datatype. It returns escaped string for PostgreSQL. Use of this function is recommended instead of addslashes .

element.name: pg_fetch_all
element.description: pg_fetch_all returns an array that contains all rows (tuples/records) in result resource. It returns , if there are no rows.

element.name: pg_fetch_array
element.description: pg_fetch_array returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row (tuples/records). It returns , if there are no more rows.

element.name: pg_fetch_assoc
element.description: pg_fetch_assoc returns an associative array that corresponds to the fetched row (tuples/records). It returns , if there are no more rows.

element.name: pg_fetch_object
element.description: pg_fetch_object returns an object with properties that correspond to the fetched row. It returns if there are no more rows or error.

element.name: pg_fetch_result
element.description: pg_fetch_result returns values from a result resource returned by pg_query . row is integer. field is field name (string) or field index (integer). The row and field specify what cell in the table of results to return. Row numbering starts from 0. Instead of naming the field, you may use the field index as an unquoted number. Field indices start from 0.

element.name: pg_fetch_row
element.description: pg_fetch_row fetches one row of data from the result associated with the specified result resource. The row (record) is returned as an array. Each result column is stored in an array offset, starting at offset 0.

element.name: pg_field_is_null
element.description: pg_field_is_null tests if a field is or not. It returns 1 if the field in the given row is . It returns 0 if the field in the given row is NOT . Field can be specified as column index (number) or fieldname (string). Row numbering starts at 0.

element.name: pg_field_name
element.description: pg_field_name returns the name of the field occupying the given field_number in the given PostgreSQL result resource. Field numbering starts from 0.

element.name: pg_field_num
element.description: pg_field_num will return the number of the column (field) slot that corresponds to the field_name in the given PostgreSQL result resource. Field numbering starts at 0. This function will return -1 on error.

element.name: pg_field_prtlen
element.description: pg_field_prtlen returns the actual printed length (number of characters) of a specific value in a PostgreSQL result . Row numbering starts at 0. This function will return -1 on an error.

element.name: pg_field_size
element.description: pg_field_size returns the internal storage size (in bytes) of the field number in the given PostgreSQL result . Field numbering starts at 0. A field size of -1 indicates a variable length field. This function will return on error.

element.name: pg_field_type
element.description: pg_field_type returns a string containing the type name of the given field_number in the given PostgreSQL result resource. Field numbering starts at 0.

element.name: pg_field_type_oid
element.description: pg_field_type_oid returns an integer containing the type ID the given field_number in the given PostgreSQL result resource. Field numbering starts at 0.

element.name: pg_free_result
element.description: pg_free_result only needs to be called if you are worried about using too much memory while your script is running. All result memory will automatically be freed when the script is finished. But, if you are sure you are not going to need the result data anymore in a script, you may call pg_free_result with the result resource as an argument and the associated result memory will be freed.

element.name: pg_get_notify
element.description: pg_get_notify gets notify message sent by SQL command. To receive notify messages, SQL command must be issued. If there is notify message on the connection, array contains message name and backend PID is returned. If there is no message, is returned.

element.name: pg_get_pid
element.description: pg_get_pid gets backend (database server process) PID. PID is useful to check if message is sent from other process or not.

element.name: pg_get_result
element.description: pg_get_result get result resource from async query executed by pg_send_query . pg_send_query can send multiple queries to PostgreSQL server and pg_get_result is used to get query result one by one. It returns result resource. If there is no more results, it returns .

element.name: pg_host
element.description: pg_host returns the host name of the given PostgreSQL connection resource is connected to.

element.name: pg_insert
element.description: pg_insert inserts the values of assoc_array into the table specified by table_name . table_name must at least have as many columns as assoc_array has elements. The fieldnames as well as the fieldvalues in table_name must match the indices and values of assoc_array . If options is specified, pg_insert is applied to assoc_array with specified option.

element.name: pg_last_error
element.description: pg_last_error returns the last error message for given connection .

element.name: pg_last_notice
element.description: pg_last_notice returns the last notice message from the PostgreSQL server specified by connection . The PostgreSQL server sends notice messages in several cases, e.g. if the transactions can't be continued. With pg_last_notice , you can avoid issuing useless queries, by checking whether the notice is related to the transaction or not.

element.name: pg_last_oid
element.description: pg_last_oid is used to retrieve the assigned to an inserted tuple (record) if the result resource is used from the last command sent via pg_query and was an SQL INSERT. Returns a positive integer if there was a valid . It returns if an error occurs or the last command sent via pg_query was not an INSERT or INSERT is failed.

element.name: pg_lo_close
element.description: pg_lo_close closes a Large Object. large_object is a resource for the large object from pg_lo_open .

element.name: pg_lo_create
element.description: pg_lo_create creates a Large Object and returns the of the large object. connection specifies a valid database connection opened by pg_connect or pg_pconnect . PostgreSQL access modes INV_READ, INV_WRITE, and INV_ARCHIVE are not supported, the object is created always with both read and write access. INV_ARCHIVE has been removed from PostgreSQL itself (version 6.3 and above). It returns large object oid, otherwise it returns if an error occurred.

element.name: pg_lo_export
element.description: The oid argument specifies oid of the large object to export and the pathname argument specifies the pathname of the file. It returns if an error occurred, otherwise.

element.name: pg_lo_import
element.description: The pathname argument specifies the pathname of the file to be imported as a large object. It returns if an error occurred, oid of the just created large object otherwise.

element.name: pg_lo_open
element.description: pg_lo_open opens a Large Object and returns large object resource. The resource encapsulates information about the connection. oid specifies a valid large object oid and mode can be either "r", "w", or "rw". It returns if there is an error.

element.name: pg_lo_read
element.description: pg_lo_read reads at most len (defaults to 8192) bytes from a large object and returns it as a string. large_object specifies a valid large object resource and len specifies the maximum allowable size of the large object segment. It returns if there is an error.

element.name: pg_lo_read_all
element.description: pg_lo_read_all reads a large object and passes it straight through to the browser after sending all pending headers. Mainly intended for sending binary data like images or sound. It returns number of bytes read. It returns , if an error occurred.

element.name: pg_lo_seek
element.description: pg_lo_seek seeks position of large object resource. whence is PGSQL_SEEK_SET, PGSQL_SEEK_CUR or PGSQL_SEEK_END.

element.name: pg_lo_tell
element.description: pg_lo_tell returns current position (offset from the beginning of large object).

element.name: pg_lo_unlink
element.description: pg_lo_unlink deletes a large object with the oid .

element.name: pg_lo_write
element.description: pg_lo_write writes at most to a large object from a variable data and returns the number of bytes actually written, or in the case of an error. large_object is a large object resource from pg_lo_open .

element.name: pg_meta_data
element.description: pg_meta_data returns table definition for as an array. If there is error, it returns

element.name: pg_num_fields
element.description: pg_num_fields returns the number of fields (columns) in a PostgreSQL result . The argument is a result resource returned by pg_query . This function will return -1 on error.

element.name: pg_num_rows
element.description: pg_num_rows will return the number of rows in a PostgreSQL result resource. result is a query result resource returned by pg_query . This function will return -1 on error.

element.name: pg_options
element.description: pg_options will return a string containing the options specified on the given PostgreSQL connection resource.

element.name: pg_parameter_status
element.description: pg_parameter_status returns a string with the current param_name value. Returns on failure.

element.name: pg_pconnect
element.description: pg_pconnect opens a connection to a PostgreSQL database. It returns a connection resource that is needed by other PostgreSQL functions.

element.name: pg_ping
element.description: pg_ping ping database connection, try to reconnect if it is broken. It returns if connection is alive, otherwise .

element.name: pg_port
element.description: pg_port returns the port number that the given PostgreSQL connection resource is connected to.

element.name: pg_put_line
element.description: pg_put_line sends a NULL-terminated string to the PostgreSQL backend server. This is useful for example for very high-speed inserting of data into a table, initiated by starting a PostgreSQL copy-operation. That final NULL-character is added automatically.

element.name: pg_query
element.description: pg_query returns a query result resource if query could be executed. It returns on failure or if connection is not a valid connection. Details about the error can be retrieved using the pg_last_error function if connection is valid. pg_query sends an SQL statement to the PostgreSQL database specified by the connection resource. The connection must be a valid connection that was returned by pg_connect or pg_pconnect . The return value of this function is an query result resource to be used to access the results from other PostgreSQL functions such as pg_fetch_array .

element.name: pg_result_error
element.description: pg_result_error returns error message associated with result resource. Therefore, user has better chance to get better error message than pg_last_error .

element.name: pg_result_seek
element.description: pg_result_seek set internal row offset in result resource. It returns , if there is error.

element.name: pg_result_status
element.description: pg_result_status returns status of result resource. Possible return values are PGSQL_EMPTY_QUERY, PGSQL_COMMAND_OK, PGSQL_TUPLES_OK, PGSQL_COPY_TO, PGSQL_COPY_FROM, PGSQL_BAD_RESPONSE, PGSQL_NONFATAL_ERROR and PGSQL_FATAL_ERROR.

element.name: pg_select
element.description: pg_select selects records specified by which has . For successful query, it returns array contains all records and fields that match the condition specified by . If is specified, pg_convert is applied to with specified option.

element.name: pg_send_query
element.description: pg_send_query send asynchronous query to the connection . Unlike pg_query , it can send multiple query to PostgreSQL and get the result one by one using pg_get_result . Script execution is not blocked while query is executing. Use pg_connection_busy to check connection is busy (i.e. query is executing). Query may be cancelled by calling pg_cancel_query .

element.name: pg_set_client_encoding
element.description: pg_set_client_encoding sets the client encoding and returns 0 if success or -1 if error.

element.name: pg_trace
element.description: pg_trace enables tracing of the PostgreSQL frontend/backend communication to a debugging file specified as pathname . To fully understand the results, one needs to be familiar with the internals of PostgreSQL communication protocol. For those who are not, it can still be useful for tracing errors in queries sent to the server, you could do for example and see what query actually were sent to the PostgreSQL server. For more information, refer to PostgreSQL manual.

element.name: pg_tty
element.description: pg_tty returns the tty name that server side debugging output is sent to on the given PostgreSQL connection resource.

element.name: pg_unescape_bytea
element.description: pg_unescape_bytea unescapes string from bytea datatype. It returns unescaped string (binary).

element.name: pg_untrace
element.description: Stop tracing started by pg_trace . connection specifies the connection that was traced and defaults to the last one opened.

element.name: pg_update
element.description: pg_update updates records that matches with . If is specified, pg_convert is applied to with specified options.

element.name: pg_version
element.description: pg_version returns an array with the client, protocol and server version. Protocol and server versions are only avaliable if PHP was compiled with PostgreSQL 7.4 or later.

element.name: printer_abort
element.description: This function deletes the printers spool file.

element.name: printer_close
element.description: This function closes the printer connection. printer_close also closes the active device context.

element.name: printer_create_brush
element.description: The function creates a new brush and returns a handle to it. A brush is used to fill shapes. For an example see printer_select_brush . color must be a color in RGB hex format, i.e. "000000" for black, style must be one of the following constants:

element.name: printer_create_dc
element.description: The function creates a new device context. A device context is used to customize the graphic objects of the document. handle must be a valid handle to a printer.

element.name: printer_create_font
element.description: The function creates a new font and returns a handle to it. A font is used to draw text. For an example see printer_select_font . face must be a string specifying the font face. height specifies the font height, and width the font width. The font_weight specifies the font weight (400 is normal), and can be one of the following predefined constants.

element.name: printer_create_pen
element.description: The function creates a new pen and returns a handle to it. A pen is used to draw lines and curves. For an example see printer_select_pen . color must be a color in RGB hex format, i.e. "000000" for black, width specifies the width of the pen whereas style must be one of the following constants:

element.name: printer_delete_brush
element.description: The function deletes the selected brush. For an example see printer_select_brush . handle must be a valid handle to a brush.

element.name: printer_delete_dc
element.description: The function deletes the device context. For an example see printer_create_dc . handle must be a valid handle to a printer.

element.name: printer_delete_font
element.description: The function deletes the selected font. For an example see printer_select_font . handle must be a valid handle to a font.

element.name: printer_delete_pen
element.description: The function deletes the selected pen. For an example see printer_select_pen . handle must be a valid handle to a pen.

element.name: printer_draw_bmp
element.description: The function simply draws an bmp the bitmap filename at position x , y . handle must be a valid handle to a printer.

element.name: printer_draw_chord
element.description: The function simply draws an chord. handle must be a valid handle to a printer.

element.name: printer_draw_elipse
element.description: The function simply draws an ellipse. handle must be a valid handle to a printer.

element.name: printer_draw_line
element.description: The function simply draws a line from position from_x , from_y to position to_x , to_y using the selected pen. printer_handle must be a valid handle to a printer.

element.name: printer_draw_pie
element.description: The function simply draws an pie. handle must be a valid handle to a printer.

element.name: printer_draw_rectangle
element.description: The function simply draws a rectangle.

element.name: printer_draw_roundrect
element.description: The function simply draws a rectangle with rounded corners.

element.name: printer_draw_text
element.description: The function simply draws text at position x , y using the selected font. printer_handle must be a valid handle to a printer.

element.name: printer_end_doc
element.description: Closes a new document in the printer spooler. The document is now ready for printing. For an example see printer_start_doc . handle must be a valid handle to a printer.

element.name: printer_end_page
element.description: The function closes the active page in the active document. For an example see printer_start_doc . handle must be a valid handle to a printer.

element.name: printer_get_option
element.description: The function retrieves the configuration setting of option . handle must be a valid handle to a printer. Take a look at printer_set_option for the settings that can be retrieved, additionally the following settings can be retrieved:

element.name: printer_list
element.description: The function enumerates available printers and their capabilities. level sets the level of information request. Can be 1,2,4 or 5. enumtype must be one of the following predefined constants:

element.name: printer_logical_fontheight
element.description: The function calculates the logical font height of height . handle must be a valid handle to a printer.

element.name: printer_open
element.description: This function tries to open a connection to the printer devicename , and returns a handle on success or on failure.

element.name: printer_select_brush
element.description: The function selects a brush as the active drawing object of the actual device context. A brush is used to fill shapes. If you draw an rectangle the brush is used to draw the shapes, while the pen is used to draw the border. If you haven't selected a brush before drawing shapes, the shape won't be filled. printer_handle must be a valid handle to a printer. brush_handle must be a valid handle to a brush.

element.name: printer_select_font
element.description: The function selects a font to draw text. printer_handle must be a valid handle to a printer. font_handle must be a valid handle to a font.

element.name: printer_select_pen
element.description: The function selects a pen as the active drawing object of the actual device context. A pen is used to draw lines and curves. I.e. if you draw a single line the pen is used. If you draw an rectangle the pen is used to draw the borders, while the brush is used to fill the shape. If you haven't selected a pen before drawing shapes, the shape won't be outlined. printer_handle must be a valid handle to a printer. pen_handle must be a valid handle to a pen.

element.name: printer_set_option
element.description: The function sets the following options for the current connection. handle must be a valid handle to a printer. For option can be one of the following constants:

element.name: printer_start_doc
element.description: The function creates a new document in the printer spooler. A document can contain multiple pages, it's used to schedule the print job in the spooler. handle must be a valid handle to a printer. The optional parameter document can be used to set an alternative document name.

element.name: printer_start_page
element.description: The function creates a new page in the active document. For an example see printer_start_doc . handle must be a valid handle to a printer.

element.name: printer_write
element.description: Writes content directly to the printer.

element.name: escapeshellarg
element.description: escapeshellarg adds single quotes around a string and quotes/escapes any existing single quotes allowing you to pass a string directly to a shell function and having it be treated as a single safe argument. This function should be used to escape individual arguments to shell functions coming from user input. The shell functions include exec , system and the . A standard use would be:

element.name: escapeshellcmd
element.description: escapeshellcmd escapes any characters in a string that might be used to trick a shell command into executing arbitrary commands. This function should be used to make sure that any data coming from user input is escaped before this data is passed to the exec or system functions, or to the . A standard use would be:

element.name: exec
element.description: exec executes the given command , however it does not output anything. It simply returns the last line from the result of the command. If you need to execute a command and have all the data from the command passed directly back without any interference, use the passthru function.

element.name: passthru
element.description: The passthru function is similar to the exec function in that it executes a command . If the return_var argument is present, the return status of the Unix command will be placed here. This function should be used in place of exec or system when the output from the Unix command is binary data which needs to be passed directly back to the browser. A common use for this is to execute something like the pbmplus utilities that can output an image stream directly. By setting the Content-type to and then calling a pbmplus program to output a gif, you can create PHP scripts that output images directly.

element.name: proc_close
element.description: proc_close is similar to pclose except that it only works on processes opened by proc_open . proc_close waits for the process to terminate, and returns its exit code. If you have open pipes to that process, you should fclose them prior to calling this function in order to avoid a deadlock - the child process may not be able to exit while the pipes are open.

element.name: proc_get_status
element.description: proc_get_status fetches data about a process opened using proc_open . The collected information is returned in an array containing the following elements:

element.name: proc_nice
element.description: proc_nice changes the priority of the current process by the amount specified in increment . A positive increment will lower the priority of the current process, whereas a negative increment will raise the priority. If an error occurs, like the user lacks permission to change the priority, an error of level is generated and is returned. Otherwise, is returned.

element.name: proc_open
element.description: proc_open is similar to popen but provides a much greater degree of control over the program execution. cmd is the command to be executed by the shell. descriptorspec is an indexed array where the key represents the descriptor number and the value represents how PHP will pass that descriptor to the child process. pipes will be set to an indexed array of file pointers that correspond to PHP's end of any pipes that are created. The return value is a resource representing the process; you should free it using proc_close when you are finished with it.

element.name: proc_terminate
element.description: Signals a process (created using proc_open ) that it should terminate. proc_terminate returns immediately and does not wait for the process to terminate.

element.name: shell_exec
element.description: This function is identical to the .

element.name: system
element.description: system is just like the C version of the function in that it executes the given command and outputs the result. If a variable is provided as the second argument, then the return status code of the executed command will be written to this variable.

element.name: pspell_config_create
element.description: The language parameter is the language code which consists of the two letter ISO 639 language code and an optional two letter ISO 3166 country code after a dash or underscore.

element.name: pspell_config_mode
element.description: The mode parameter is the mode in which spellchecker will work. There are several modes available:

element.name: pspell_new
element.description: The language parameter is the language code which consists of the two letter ISO 639 language code and an optional two letter ISO 3166 country code after a dash or underscore.

element.name: pspell_new_config
element.description: The config parameter is the one returned by pspell_config_create when the config was created.

element.name: pspell_new_personal
element.description: The personal parameter specifies the file where words added to the personal list will be stored. It should be an absolute filename beginning with '/' because otherwise it will be relative to $HOME, which is "/root" for most systems, and is probably not what you want.

element.name: Rar::extract
element.description: Rar::extract extracts entry's data to the dir . It will create new file in the specified dir with the name identical to the entry's name. If parameter filepath is specified instead dir , Rar::extract will extract entry's data to the specified file.

element.name: Rar::getAttr
element.description: Rar::getAttr returns attributes of the archive entry.

element.name: Rar::getCrc
element.description: Rar::getCrc returns CRC of the archive entry.

element.name: Rar::getFileTime
element.description: Rar::getFileTime returns entry last modification time as string in format YYYY-MM-DD HH:II:SS.

element.name: Rar::getHostOs
element.description: Rar::getHostOs return code of the host OS of the archive entry.

element.name: Rar::getMethod
element.description: Rar::getMethod returns number of the method used when adding current archive entry.

element.name: Rar::getName
element.description: Rar::getName returns full name of the archive entry.

element.name: Rar::getPackedSize
element.description: Get packed size of the archive entry.

element.name: Rar::getUnpackedSize
element.description: Get unpacked size of the archive entry.

element.name: Rar::getVersion
element.description: Get version of the archiver used to add the archive entry.

element.name: rar_close
element.description: Close Rar archive and free all allocated resources.

element.name: rar_entry_get
element.description: Get entry object from the Rar archive.

element.name: rar_list
element.description: Get entries list from the Rar archive.

element.name: rar_open
element.description: Open specified Rar archive and return Rar file resource.

element.name: readline
element.description: This function returns a single string from the user. You may specify a string with which to prompt the user. The line returned has the ending newline removed. You must add this line to the history yourself using readline_add_history .

element.name: readline_add_history
element.description: This function adds a line to the command line history.

element.name: readline_callback_handler_install
element.description: Sets up a readline callback interface then prints prompt and immediately returns. The callback function takes one parameter; the user input returned. Calling this function twice without removing the previous callback interface will automatically and conveniently overwrite the old interface.

element.name: readline_callback_handler_remove
element.description: Removes a previously installed callback handler and restores terminal settings.

element.name: readline_callback_read_char
element.description: Reads a character of user input. When a line is received, this function informs the readline callback interface installed using readline_callback_handler_install that a line is ready for input.

element.name: readline_clear_history
element.description: This function clears the entire command line history.

element.name: readline_completion_function
element.description: This function registers a completion function. You must supply the name of an existing function which accepts a partial command line and returns an array of possible matches. This is the same kind of functionality you'd get if you hit your tab key while using Bash.

element.name: readline_info
element.description: If called with no parameters, this function returns an array of values for all the setting readline uses. The elements will be indexed by the following values: done, end, erase_empty_line, library_version, line_buffer, mark, pending_input, point, prompt, readline_name, and terminal_name.

element.name: readline_list_history
element.description: This function returns an array of the entire command line history. The elements are indexed by integers starting at zero.

element.name: readline_read_history
element.description: This function reads a command history from a file.

element.name: readline_write_history
element.description: This function writes the command history to a file.

element.name: recode_file
element.description: Recode the file referenced by file handle input into the file referenced by file handle output according to the recode request . Returns , if unable to comply, otherwise.

element.name: recode_string
element.description: Recode the string string according to the recode request request . Returns the recoded string or , if unable to perform the recode request.

element.name: sesam_affected_rows
element.description: result_id is a valid result id returned by sesam_query .

element.name: sesam_commit
element.description: Returns: on success, on errors

element.name: sesam_connect
element.description: Returns if a connection to the SESAM database was made, or on error.

element.name: sesam_diagnostic
element.description: Returns an associative array of status and return codes for the last SQL query/statement/command. Elements of the array are:

element.name: sesam_disconnect
element.description: Returns: always .

element.name: sesam_errormsg
element.description: Returns the SESAM error message associated with the most recent SESAM error.

element.name: sesam_execimm
element.description: Returns: A SESAM "result identifier" on success, or on error.

element.name: sesam_fetch_array
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: sesam_fetch_result
element.description: Returns a mixed array with the query result entries, optionally limited to a maximum of max_rows rows. Note that both row and column indexes are zero-based. Note that the amount of memory used up by a large query may be gigantic. Use the max_rows parameter to limit the maximum number of rows returned, unless you are absolutely sure that your result will not use up all available memory.

element.name: sesam_fetch_row
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: sesam_field_array
element.description: result_id is a valid result id returned by sesam_query .

element.name: sesam_field_name
element.description: Returns the name of a field (i.e., the column name) in the result set, or on error.

element.name: sesam_free_result
element.description: Releases resources for the query associated with result_id . Returns on error.

element.name: sesam_num_fields
element.description: After calling sesam_query with a "select type" query, this function gives you the number of columns in the result. Returns an integer describing the total number of columns (aka. fields) in the current result_id result set or on error.

element.name: sesam_query
element.description: Returns: A SESAM "result identifier" on success, or on error.

element.name: sesam_rollback
element.description: Returns: on success, on errors

element.name: sesam_seek_row
element.description: result_id is a valid result id (select type queries only, and only if a "scrollable" cursor was requested when calling sesam_query ).

element.name: sesam_settransaction
element.description: Returns: if the values are valid, and the settransaction operation was successful, otherwise.

element.name: snmp_get_quick_print
element.description: Returns the current value stored in the UCD Library for quick_print. quick_print is off by default.

element.name: snmp_set_quick_print
element.description: Sets the value of quick_print within the UCD SNMP library. When this is set (1), the SNMP library will return 'quick printed' values. This means that just the value will be printed. When quick_print is not enabled (default) the UCD SNMP library prints extra information including the type of the value (i.e. IpAddress or OID). Additionally, if quick_print is not enabled, the library prints additional hex values for all strings of three characters or less.

element.name: snmpget
element.description: Returns SNMP object value on success and on error.

element.name: snmpset
element.description: Sets the specified SNMP object value, returning on success and on error.

element.name: snmpwalk
element.description: Returns an array of SNMP object values starting from the object_id as root and on error.

element.name: snmpwalkoid
element.description: Returns an associative array with object ids and their respective object value starting from the object_id as root and on error.

element.name: __call
element.description: This method is deprecated. Use instead of it.

element.name: __doRequest
element.description: Performs SOAP request over HTTP.

property.name: action
property.description: The SOAP version.

element.name: __getFunctions
element.description: Returns the list of SOAP functions.

element.name: __getLastRequest
element.description: This method works only if the object was created with the option.

element.name: __getLastRequestHeaders
element.description: This method works only if the object was created with the option.

element.name: __getLastResponse
element.description: This method works only if the object was created with the option.

element.name: __getLastResponseHeaders
element.description: This method works only if the object was created with the option.

element.name: __getTypes
element.description: This function works only in WSDL mode.

element.name: __setCookie
element.description: Defines a cookie to be sent along with the SOAP requests.

element.name: __soapCall
element.description: This is a low level API function that is used to make a SOAP call. Usually, in WSDL mode, you can simply call SOAP functions as methods. This method useful in non-WSDL mode when is unknown, differs from the default or when sending and/or receiving SOAP Headers.

element.name: addFunction
element.description: Exports one or more functions for remote clients.

property.name: functions
property.description: To export one function, pass the function name into this parameter as a string. To export several functions, pass an array of function names. To export all the functions, pass a special constant . must receive all input arguments in the same order as defined in the WSDL file (They should not receive any output parameters as arguments) and return one or more values. To return several values they must return an array with named output parameters.

element.name: getFunctions
element.description: This method returns the list of all functions added by or .

element.name: handle
element.description: Processes a SOAP request, calls necessary functions, and sends a response back.

property.name: soap_request
property.description: The SOAP request. If this argument is omitted, the request is supposed to be in the PHP variable.

element.name: is_soap_fault
element.description: This function is useful when you like to check if the SOAP call failed, but don't like to use exceptions. To use it you must create a object with the option set to zero or . In this case, the SOAP method will return a special object which encapsulates the fault details (faultcode, faultstring, faultactor and faultdetails).

element.name: setClass
element.description: Exports all methods from specified class.

element.name: setPersistence
element.description: This function allows saving data between requests in a PHP session. It works only with a server that exports functions from a class with .

element.name: sqlite_array_query
element.description: sqlite_array_query executes the given query and returns an array of the entire result set. It is similar to calling sqlite_query and then sqlite_fetch_array for each row in the result set. sqlite_array_query is significantly faster than the aforementioned.

element.name: sqlite_busy_timeout
element.description: Set the maximum time, in milliseconds, that SQLite will wait for a dbhandle to become ready for use.

element.name: sqlite_changes
element.description: Returns the numbers of rows that were changed by the most recent SQL statement executed against the dbhandle database handle.

element.name: sqlite_close
element.description: Closes the given database handle. If the database was persistent, it will be closed and removed from the persistent list.

element.name: sqlite_column
element.description: Fetches the value of a column named index_or_name (if it is a string), or of the ordinal column numbered index_or_name (if it is an integer) from the current row of the query result handle result .

element.name: sqlite_create_aggregate
element.description: sqlite_create_aggregate is similar to sqlite_create_function except that it registers functions that can be used to calculate a result aggregated across all the rows of a query.

element.name: sqlite_create_function
element.description: sqlite_create_function allows you to register a PHP function with SQLite as an (User Defined Function), so that it can be called from within your SQL statements.

element.name: sqlite_current
element.description: sqlite_current is identical to sqlite_fetch_array except that it does not advance to the next row prior to returning the data; it returns the data from the current position only.

element.name: sqlite_error_string
element.description: Returns a human readable description of the error_code returned from sqlite_last_error .

element.name: sqlite_escape_string
element.description: sqlite_escape_string will correctly quote the string specified by item for use in an SQLite SQL statement. This includes doubling up single-quote characters ( ) and checking for binary-unsafe characters in the query string.

element.name: sqlite_exec
element.description: Executes an SQL statement given by the query against a given database handle (specified by the dbhandle parameter).

element.name: sqlite_factory
element.description: sqlite_factory behaves similarly to sqlite_open in that it opens an SQLite database or attempts to create it if it does not exist. However, a object is returned rather than a resource. Please see the sqlite_open reference page for further usage and caveats.

element.name: sqlite_fetch_all
element.description: sqlite_fetch_all returns an array of the entire result set from the result resource. It is similar to calling sqlite_query (or sqlite_unbuffered_query ) and then sqlite_fetch_array for each row in the result set.

element.name: sqlite_fetch_array
element.description: Fetches the next row from the given result handle. If there are no more rows, returns , otherwise returns an associative array representing the row data.

element.name: sqlite_fetch_column_types
element.description: sqlite_fetch_column_types returns an array of column data types from the specified table_name table.

element.name: sqlite_fetch_single
element.description: sqlite_fetch_single is identical to sqlite_fetch_array except that it returns the value of the first column of the rowset.

element.name: sqlite_field_name
element.description: Given the ordinal column number, field_index , sqlite_field_name returns the name of that field in the result set result .

element.name: sqlite_has_more
element.description: Finds whether more rows are available from the given result set.

element.name: sqlite_has_prev
element.description: Find whether there are more previous rows from the given result handle.

element.name: sqlite_key
element.description: sqlite_key returns the current row index of the buffered result set result .

element.name: sqlite_last_error
element.description: Returns the error code from the last operation performed on dbhandle , the database handle. A human readable description of the error code can be retrieved using sqlite_error_string .

element.name: sqlite_last_insert_rowid
element.description: Returns the rowid of the row that was most recently inserted into the database dbhandle , if it was created as an auto-increment field.

element.name: sqlite_libencoding
element.description: The SQLite library may be compiled in either ISO-8859-1 or UTF-8 compatible modes. This function allows you to determine which encoding scheme is used by your version of the library.

element.name: sqlite_libversion
element.description: Returns the version of the linked SQLite library.

element.name: sqlite_next
element.description: sqlite_next advances the result handle result to the next row.

element.name: sqlite_num_fields
element.description: Returns the number of fields in the result set.

element.name: sqlite_num_rows
element.description: Returns the number of rows in the buffered result set.

element.name: sqlite_open
element.description: Object oriented style (constructor):

element.name: sqlite_popen
element.description: sqlite_popen will first check to see if a persistent handle has already been opened for the given filename . If it finds one, it returns that handle to your script, otherwise it opens a fresh handle to the database.

element.name: sqlite_prev
element.description: sqlite_prev seeks back the result handle to the previous row.

element.name: sqlite_query
element.description: Executes an SQL statement given by the query against a given database handle.

element.name: sqlite_rewind
element.description: sqlite_rewind seeks back to the first row in the given result set.

element.name: sqlite_seek
element.description: sqlite_seek seeks to the row given by the parameter rownum .

element.name: sqlite_udf_decode_binary
element.description: sqlite_udf_decode_binary decodes the binary encoding that was applied to the parameter by either sqlite_udf_encode_binary or sqlite_escape_string .

element.name: sqlite_udf_encode_binary
element.description: sqlite_udf_encode_binary applies a binary encoding to the data so that it can be safely returned from queries (since the underlying libsqlite API is not binary safe).

element.name: sqlite_unbuffered_query
element.description: sqlite_unbuffered_query is identical to sqlite_query except that the result that is returned is a sequential forward-only result set that can only be used to read each row, one after the other.

element.name: sqlite_valid
element.description: Finds whether more rows are available from the given result handle.

element.name: swf_actiongeturl
element.description: The swf_actiongeturl function gets the URL specified by the parameter url with the target target .

element.name: swf_actiongotoframe
element.description: The swf_actiongotoframe function will go to the frame specified by framenumber , play it, and then stop.

element.name: swf_actiongotolabel
element.description: The swf_actiongotolabel function displays the frame with the label given by the label parameter and then stops.

element.name: swf_actionnextframe
element.description: Go forward one frame.

element.name: swf_actionplay
element.description: Start playing the flash movie from the current frame.

element.name: swf_actionsettarget
element.description: The swf_actionsettarget function sets the context for all actions. You can use this to control other flash movies that are currently playing.

element.name: swf_actionstop
element.description: Stop playing the flash movie at the current frame.

element.name: swf_actiontogglequality
element.description: Toggle the flash movie between high and low quality.

element.name: swf_actionwaitforframe
element.description: The swf_actionwaitforframe function will check to see if the frame, specified by the framenumber parameter has been loaded, if not it will skip the number of actions specified by the skipcount parameter. This can be useful for "Loading..." type animations.

element.name: swf_addbuttonrecord
element.description: The swf_addbuttonrecord function allows you to define the specifics of using a button. The first parameter, states , defines what states the button can have, these can be any or all of the following constants: BSHitTest, BSDown, BSOver or BSUp. The second parameter, the shapeid is the look of the button, this is usually the object id of the shape of the button. The depth parameter is the placement of the button in the current frame.

element.name: swf_addcolor
element.description: The swf_addcolor function sets the global add color to the rgba color specified. This color is then used (implicitly) by the swf_placeobject , swf_modifyobject and the swf_addbuttonrecord functions. The color of the object will be add by the rgba values when the object is written to the screen.

element.name: swf_closefile
element.description: Close a file that was opened by the swf_openfile function. If the return_file parameter is set then the contents of the SWF file are returned from the function.

element.name: swf_definebitmap
element.description: The swf_definebitmap function defines a bitmap given a GIF, JPEG, RGB or FI image. The image will be converted into a Flash JPEG or Flash color map format.

element.name: swf_definefont
element.description: The swf_definefont function defines a font given by the fontname parameter and gives it the id specified by the fontid parameter. It then sets the font given by fontname to the current font.

element.name: swf_defineline
element.description: The swf_defineline defines a line starting from the x coordinate given by x1 and the y coordinate given by y1 parameter. Up to the x coordinate given by the x2 parameter and the y coordinate given by the y2 parameter. It will have a width defined by the width parameter.

element.name: swf_definepoly
element.description: The swf_definepoly function defines a polygon given an array of x, y coordinates (the coordinates are defined in the parameter coords ). The parameter npoints is the number of overall points that are contained in the array given by coords . The width is the width of the polygon's border, if set to 0.0 the polygon is filled.

element.name: swf_definerect
element.description: The swf_definerect defines a rectangle with an upper left hand coordinate given by the x, x1 , and the y, y1 . And a lower right hand coordinate given by the x coordinate, x2 , and the y coordinate, y2 . Width of the rectangles border is given by the width parameter, if the width is 0.0 then the rectangle is filled.

element.name: swf_definetext
element.description: Define a text string (the str parameter) using the current font and font size. The docenter is where the word is centered, if docenter is 1, then the word is centered in x.

element.name: swf_endbutton
element.description: The swf_endbutton function ends the definition of the current button.

element.name: swf_enddoaction
element.description: Ends the current action started by the swf_startdoaction function.

element.name: swf_endshape
element.description: The swf_endshape completes the definition of the current shape.

element.name: swf_endsymbol
element.description: The swf_endsymbol function ends the definition of a symbol that was started by the swf_startsymbol function.

element.name: swf_fontsize
element.description: The swf_fontsize function changes the font size to the value given by the size parameter.

element.name: swf_fontslant
element.description: Set the current font slant to the angle indicated by the slant parameter. Positive values create a forward slant, negative values create a negative slant.

element.name: swf_fonttracking
element.description: Set the font tracking to the value specified by the tracking parameter. This function is used to increase the spacing between letters and text, positive values increase the space and negative values decrease the space between letters.

element.name: swf_getbitmapinfo
element.description: The swf_getbitmapinfo function returns an array of information about a bitmap given by the bitmapid parameter. The returned array has the following elements:

element.name: swf_getfontinfo
element.description: The swf_getfontinfo function returns an associative array with the following parameters:

element.name: swf_getframe
element.description: The swf_getframe function gets the number of the current frame.

element.name: swf_labelframe
element.description: Label the current frame with the name given by the name parameter.

element.name: swf_lookat
element.description: The swf_lookat function defines a viewing transformation by giving the viewing position (the parameters view_x , view_y , and view_z ) and the coordinates of a reference point in the scene, the reference point is defined by the reference_x , reference_y , and reference_z parameters. The twist controls the rotation along with viewer's z axis.

element.name: swf_modifyobject
element.description: Updates the position and/or color of the object at the specified depth, depth . The parameter how determines what is updated. how can either be the constant MOD_MATRIX or MOD_COLOR or it can be a combination of both (MOD_MATRIX|MOD_COLOR).

element.name: swf_mulcolor
element.description: The swf_mulcolor function sets the global multiply color to the rgba color specified. This color is then used (implicitly) by the swf_placeobject , swf_modifyobject and the swf_addbuttonrecord functions. The color of the object will be multiplied by the rgba values when the object is written to the screen.

element.name: swf_nextid
element.description: The swf_nextid function returns the next available object id.

element.name: swf_oncondition
element.description: The swf_oncondition function describes a transition that will trigger an action list. There are several types of possible transitions, the following are for buttons defined as TYPE_MENUBUTTON: For TYPE_PUSHBUTTON there are the following options:

element.name: swf_openfile
element.description: The swf_openfile function opens a new file named filename with a width of width and a height of height a frame rate of framerate and background with a red color of r a green color of g and a blue color of b .

element.name: swf_ortho
element.description: The swf_ortho function defines an orthographic mapping of user coordinates onto the current viewport.

element.name: swf_ortho2
element.description: The swf_ortho2 function defines a two dimensional orthographic mapping of user coordinates onto the current viewport, this defaults to one to one mapping of the area of the Flash movie. If a perspective transformation is desired, the swf_perspective function can be used.

element.name: swf_perspective
element.description: The swf_perspective function defines a perspective projection transformation. The fovy parameter is field-of-view angle in the y direction. The aspect parameter should be set to the aspect ratio of the viewport that is being drawn onto. The near parameter is the near clipping plane and the far parameter is the far clipping plane.

element.name: swf_placeobject
element.description: Places the object specified by objid in the current frame at a depth of depth . The objid parameter and the depth must be between 1 and 65535.

element.name: swf_polarview
element.description: The swf_polarview function defines the viewer's position in polar coordinates. The dist parameter gives the distance between the viewpoint to the world space origin. The azimuth parameter defines the azimuthal angle in the x,y coordinate plane, measured in distance from the y axis. The incidence parameter defines the angle of incidence in the y,z plane, measured in distance from the z axis. The incidence angle is defined as the angle of the viewport relative to the z axis. Finally the twist specifies the amount that the viewpoint is to be rotated about the line of sight using the right hand rule.

element.name: swf_popmatrix
element.description: The swf_popmatrix function pushes the current transformation matrix back onto the stack.

element.name: swf_posround
element.description: The swf_posround function enables or disables the rounding of the translation when objects are placed or moved, there are times when text becomes more readable because rounding has been enabled. The round is whether to enable rounding or not, if set to the value of 1, then rounding is enabled, if set to 0 then rounding is disabled.

element.name: swf_pushmatrix
element.description: The swf_pushmatrix function pushes the current transformation matrix back onto the stack.

element.name: swf_removeobject
element.description: Removes the object at the depth specified by depth .

element.name: swf_rotate
element.description: The swf_rotate rotates the current transformation by the angle given by the angle parameter around the axis given by the axis parameter. Valid values for the axis are 'x' (the x axis), 'y' (the y axis) or 'z' (the z axis).

element.name: swf_scale
element.description: The swf_scale scales the x coordinate of the curve by the value of the x parameter, the y coordinate of the curve by the value of the y parameter, and the z coordinate of the curve by the value of the z parameter.

element.name: swf_setfont
element.description: The swf_setfont sets the current font to the value given by the fontid parameter.

element.name: swf_setframe
element.description: The swf_setframe changes the active frame to the frame specified by framenumber .

element.name: swf_shapearc
element.description: The swf_shapearc function draws a circular arc from angle A given by the ang1 parameter to angle B given by the ang2 parameter. The center of the circle has an x coordinate given by the x parameter and a y coordinate given by the y , the radius of the circle is given by the r parameter.

element.name: swf_shapecurveto
element.description: The swf_shapecurveto function draws a quadratic bezier curve from the current location, though the x coordinate given by x1 and the y coordinate given by y1 to the x coordinate given by x2 and the y coordinate given by y2 . The current position is then set to the x,y coordinates given by the x2 and y2 parameters

element.name: swf_shapecurveto3
element.description: Draw a cubic bezier curve using the x,y coordinate pairs x1 , y1 and x2 , y2 as off curve control points and the x,y coordinate x3 , y3 as an endpoint. The current position is then set to the x,y coordinate pair given by x3 , y3 .

element.name: swf_shapefillbitmapclip
element.description: Sets the fill to bitmap clipped, empty spaces will be filled by the bitmap given by the bitmapid parameter.

element.name: swf_shapefillbitmaptile
element.description: Sets the fill to bitmap tile, empty spaces will be filled by the bitmap given by the bitmapid parameter (tiled).

element.name: swf_shapefilloff
element.description: The swf_shapefilloff function turns off filling for the current shape.

element.name: swf_shapefillsolid
element.description: The swf_shapefillsolid function sets the current fill style to solid, and then sets the fill color to the values of the rgba parameters.

element.name: swf_shapelinesolid
element.description: The swf_shapelinesolid function sets the current line style to the color of the rgba parameters and width to the width parameter. If 0.0 is given as a width then no lines are drawn.

element.name: swf_shapelineto
element.description: The swf_shapelineto draws a line to the x,y coordinates given by the x parameter & the y parameter. The current position is then set to the x,y parameters.

element.name: swf_shapemoveto
element.description: The swf_shapemoveto function moves the current position to the x coordinate given by the x parameter and the y position given by the y parameter.

element.name: swf_showframe
element.description: The swf_showframe function will output the current frame.

element.name: swf_startbutton
element.description: The swf_startbutton function starts off the definition of a button. The type parameter can either be TYPE_MENUBUTTON or TYPE_PUSHBUTTON. The TYPE_MENUBUTTON constant allows the focus to travel from the button when the mouse is down, TYPE_PUSHBUTTON does not allow the focus to travel when the mouse is down.

element.name: swf_startdoaction
element.description: The swf_startdoaction function starts the description of an action list for the current frame. This must be called before actions are defined for the current frame.

element.name: swf_startshape
element.description: The swf_startshape function starts a complex shape, with an object id given by the objid parameter.

element.name: swf_startsymbol
element.description: Define an object id as a symbol. Symbols are tiny flash movies that can be played simultaneously. The objid parameter is the object id you want to define as a symbol.

element.name: swf_textwidth
element.description: The swf_textwidth function gives the width of the string, str , in pixels, using the current font and font size.

element.name: swf_translate
element.description: The swf_translate function translates the current transformation by the x , y , and z values given.

element.name: swf_viewport
element.description: The swf_viewport function selects an area for future drawing for xmin to xmax and ymin to ymax , if this function is not called the area defaults to the size of the screen.

group.name: Semaphore
group.description: Semaphore, Shared Memory and IPC Functions

element.name: ftok
element.description: The function converts the pathname of an existing accessible file and a project identifier ( proj ) into a for use with for example shmop_open and other System V IPC keys. The proj parameter should be a one character string.

element.name: msg_get_queue
element.description: msg_get_queue returns an id that can be used to access the System V message queue with the given key . The first call creates the message queue with the optional perms (default: 0666). A second call to msg_get_queue for the same key will return a different message queue identifier, but both identifiers access the same underlying message queue. If the message queue already exists, the perms will be ignored.

element.name: msg_receive
element.description: msg_receive will receive the first message from the specified queue of the type specified by desiredmsgtype . The type of the message that was received will be stored in msgtype . The maximum size of message to be accepted is specified by the maxsize ; if the message in the queue is larger than this size the function will fail (unless you set flags as described below). The received message will be stored in message , unless there were errors receiving the message, in which case the optional errorcode will be set to the value of the system errno variable to help you identify the cause.

element.name: msg_remove_queue
element.description: msg_remove_queue destroys the message queue specified by the queue . Only use this function when all processes have finished working with the message queue and you need to release the system resources held by it.

element.name: msg_send
element.description: msg_send sends a message of type msgtype (which MUST be greater than 0) to a the message queue specified by queue .

element.name: msg_set_queue
element.description: msg_set_queue allows you to change the values of the msg_perm.uid, msg_perm.gid, msg_perm.mode and msg_qbytes fields of the underlying message queue data structure. You specify the values you require by setting the value of the keys that you require in the data array.

element.name: msg_stat_queue
element.description: msg_stat_queue returns the message queue meta data for the message queue specified by the queue . This is useful, for example, to determine which process sent the message that was just received.

element.name: sem_acquire
element.description: sem_acquire blocks (if necessary) until the semaphore can be acquired. A process attempting to acquire a semaphore which it has already acquired will block forever if acquiring the semaphore would cause its maximum number of semaphore to be exceeded. sem_identifier is a semaphore ressource, obtained from sem_get .

element.name: sem_get
element.description: sem_get returns an id that can be used to access the System V semaphore with the given key . The semaphore is created if necessary using the permission bits specified in perm (defaults to 0666). The number of processes that can acquire the semaphore simultaneously is set to max_acquire (defaults to 1). Actually this value is set only if the process finds it is the only process currently attached to the semaphore.

element.name: sem_release
element.description: sem_release releases the semaphore if it is currently acquired by the calling process, otherwise a warning is generated.

element.name: sem_remove
element.description: sem_remove removes the semaphore sem_identifier if it has been created by sem_get , otherwise generates a warning.

element.name: shm_attach
