element.description: shm_attach returns an id that that can be used to access the System V shared memory with the given key, the first call creates the shared memory segment with memsize (default: sysvshm.init_mem in the , otherwise 10000 bytes) and the optional perm-bits perm (default: 0666).

element.name: shm_detach
element.description: shm_detach disconnects from the shared memory given by the shm_identifier created by shm_attach . Remember, that shared memory still exist in the Unix system and the data is still present.

element.name: shm_get_var
element.description: shm_get_var returns the variable with a given variable_key , in the shared memory segment identified by shm_identifier . shm_identifier was obtained from shm_attach . The variable is still present in the shared memory.

element.name: shm_put_var
element.description: shm_put_var inserts or updates the variable with the given variable_key . are supported.

element.name: shm_remove
element.description: shm_remove removes the shared memory shm_identifier . All data will be destroyed.

element.name: shm_remove_var
element.description: Removes a variable with a given variable_key and frees the occupied memory.

element.name: session_cache_expire
element.description: session_cache_expire returns the current setting of . The value returned should be read in minutes, defaults to 180. If new_cache_expire is given, the current cache expire is replaced with new_cache_expire .

element.name: session_cache_limiter
element.description: session_cache_limiter returns the name of the current cache limiter. If cache_limiter is specified, the name of the current cache limiter is changed to the new value.

element.name: session_decode
element.description: session_decode decodes the session data in data , setting variables stored in the session.

element.name: session_destroy
element.description: In order to kill the session altogether, like to log the user out, the session id must also be unset. If a cookie is used to propagate the session id (default behavior), then the session cookie must be deleted. setcookie may be used for that.

element.name: session_encode
element.description: session_encode returns a string with the contents of the current session encoded within.

element.name: session_get_cookie_params
element.description: The session_get_cookie_params function returns an array with the current session cookie information, the array contains the following items:

element.name: session_id
element.description: session_id returns the session id for the current session.

element.name: session_is_registered
element.description: session_is_registered returns if there is a global variable with the name name registered in the current session.

element.name: session_module_name
element.description: session_module_name returns the name of the current session module. If module is specified, that module will be used instead.

element.name: session_name
element.description: session_name returns the name of the current session. If name is specified, the name of the current session is changed to its value.

element.name: session_regenerate_id
element.description: session_regenerate_id will replace the current session id with a new one, and keep the current session information.

element.name: session_register
element.description: session_register accepts a variable number of arguments, any of which can be either a string holding the name of a variable or an array consisting of variable names or other arrays. For each name, session_register registers the global variable with that name in the current session.

element.name: session_save_path
element.description: session_save_path returns the path of the current directory used to save session data. If path is specified, the path to which data is saved will be changed. session_save_path needs to be called before session_start for that purpose. On some operating systems, you may want to specify a path on a filesystem that handles lots of small files efficiently. For example, on Linux, reiserfs may provide better performance than ext2fs.

element.name: session_set_cookie_params
element.description: Set cookie parameters defined in the file. The effect of this function only lasts for the duration of the script. Thus, you need to call session_set_cookie_params for every request and before session_start is called.

element.name: session_set_save_handler
element.description: session_set_save_handler sets the user-level session storage functions which are used for storing and retrieving data associated with a session. This is most useful when a storage method other than those supplied by PHP sessions is preferred. i.e. Storing the session data in a local database.

element.name: session_start
element.description: If you are using cookie-based sessions, you must call session_start before anything is outputted to the browser.

element.name: session_unregister
element.description: session_unregister unregisters the global variable named name from the current session.

element.name: session_unset
element.description: The session_unset function frees all session variables currently registered.

element.name: session_write_close
element.description: End the current session and store session data.

element.name: SimpleXMLElement->asXML
element.description: The method formats the parent object's data in XML version 1.0.

element.name: SimpleXMLElement->xpath
element.description: The method searches the SimpleXML node for children matching the path . It always returns an of SimpleXMLElement objects.

element.name: simplexml_element->attributes
element.description: This function provides the attributes and values defined within an xml tag.

element.name: simplexml_element->children
element.description: This method finds the children of the element of which it is a member. The result follows normal iteration rules.

element.name: simplexml_import_dom
element.description: This function takes a node of a document and makes it into a SimpleXML node. This new object can then be used as a native SimpleXML element. If any errors occur, it returns .

element.name: simplexml_load_file
element.description: This function will convert the well-formed XML document in the file specified by filename to an of class . If any errors occur during file access or interpretation, the function returns .

element.name: simplexml_load_string
element.description: This function will take the well-formed xml string data and return an of class with properties containing the data held within the xml document. If any errors occur, it returns .

element.name: socket_accept
element.description: After the socket socket has been created using socket_create , bound to a name with socket_bind , and told to listen for connections with socket_listen , this function will accept incoming connections on that socket. Once a successful connection is made, a new socket resource is returned, which may be used for communication. If there are multiple connections queued on the socket, the first will be used. If there are no pending connections, socket_accept will block until a connection becomes present. If socket has been made non-blocking using socket_set_blocking or socket_set_nonblock , will be returned.

element.name: socket_bind
element.description: socket_bind binds the name given in address to the socket described by socket , which must be a valid socket resource created with socket_create .

element.name: socket_clear_error
element.description: This function clears the error code on the given socket or the global last socket error.

element.name: socket_close
element.description: socket_close closes the socket resource given by socket .

element.name: socket_connect
element.description: Initiates a connection using the socket resource socket , which must be a valid socket resource created with socket_create .

element.name: socket_create
element.description: Creates and returns a socket resource, also referred to as an endpoint of communication. A typical network connection is made up of 2 sockets, one performing the role of the client, and another performing the role of the server.

element.name: socket_create_listen
element.description: This function is meant to ease the task of creating a new socket which only listens to accept new connections.

element.name: socket_create_pair
element.description: socket_create_pair creates two connected and indistinguishable sockets, and stores them in fd . This function is commonly used in IPC (InterProcess Communication).

element.name: socket_get_option
element.description: The socket_get_option function retrieves the value for the option specified by the optname parameter for the socket specified by the socket parameter. socket_get_option will return on failure.

element.name: socket_getpeername
element.description: If the given socket is of type or , socket_getpeername will return the peers (remote) in appropriate notation (e.g. or ) in the address parameter and, if the optional port parameter is present, also the associated port.

element.name: socket_getsockname
element.description: If the given socket is of type or , socket_getsockname will return the local in appropriate notation (e.g. or ) in the address parameter and, if the optional port parameter is present, also the associated port.

element.name: socket_last_error
element.description: This function returns a socket error code.

element.name: socket_listen
element.description: After the socket socket has been created using socket_create and bound to a name with socket_bind , it may be told to listen for incoming connections on socket .

element.name: socket_read
element.description: The function socket_read reads from the socket resource socket created by the socket_create or socket_accept functions. The maximum number of bytes read is specified by the length parameter. Otherwise you can use \r, \n, or \0 to end reading (depending on the type parameter, see below).

element.name: socket_select
element.description: socket_select accepts arrays of sockets and waits for them to change status. Those coming with BSD sockets background will recognize that those socket resource arrays are in fact the so-called file descriptor sets. Three independent arrays of socket resources are watched.

element.name: socket_send
element.description: The function socket_send sends len bytes to the socket socket from buf

element.name: socket_sendto
element.description: The function socket_sendto sends len bytes from buf through the socket socket to the port at the address addr

element.name: socket_set_block
element.description: The socket_set_block function removes the O_NONBLOCK flag on the socket specified by the socket parameter.

element.name: socket_set_nonblock
element.description: The socket_set_nonblock function sets the O_NONBLOCK flag on the socket specified by the socket parameter.

element.name: socket_set_option
element.description: The socket_set_option function sets the option specified by the optname parameter, at the protocol level specified by the level parameter, to the value pointed to by the optval parameter for the socket specified by the socket parameter. socket_set_option will return on failure.

element.name: socket_shutdown
element.description: The socket_shutdown function allows you to stop incoming, outgoing or all data (the default) from being sent through the socket

element.name: socket_strerror
element.description: socket_strerror takes as its errno parameter a socket error code as returned by socket_last_error and returns the corresponding explanatory text. This makes it a bit more pleasant to figure out why something didn't work; for instance, instead of having to track down a system include file to find out what '-111' means, you just pass it to socket_strerror , and it tells you what happened.

element.name: socket_write
element.description: The function socket_write writes to the socket socket from buffer .

group.name: Streams
group.description: Streams are an integral part of PHP as of version 4.3.0. No steps are required to enable them.

element.name: stream_copy_to_stream
element.description: Makes a copy of up to maxlength bytes of data from the current position in source to dest . If maxlength is not specified, all remaining content in source will be copied. Returns the total count of bytes copied.

element.name: stream_filter_append
element.description: Adds filtername to the list of filters attached to stream . This filter will be added with the specified params to the of the list and will therefore be called last during stream operations. To add a filter to the beginning of the list, use stream_filter_prepend .

element.name: stream_filter_prepend
element.description: Adds filtername to the list of filters attached to stream . This filter will be added with the specified params to the of the list and will therefore be called first during stream operations. To add a filter to the end of the list, use stream_filter_append .

element.name: stream_filter_register
element.description: This method is called upon filter shutdown (typically, this is also during stream shutdown), and is executed the method is called. If any resources were allocated or initialzed during this would be the time to destroy or dispose of them.

element.name: stream_get_contents
element.description: Identical to file_get_contents , except that stream_get_contents operates on an already open stream resource and returns the remaining contents in a string, up to maxlength bytes and starting at the specified offset .

element.name: stream_get_filters
element.description: Output will be similar to the following. Note: there may be more or fewer filters in your version of PHP.

element.name: stream_get_line
element.description: Returns a string of up to length bytes read from the file pointed to by handle . Reading ends when length bytes have been read, when the string specified by ending is found (which is included in the return value), or on EOF (whichever comes first).

element.name: stream_get_meta_data
element.description: timed_out (bool) - if the stream timed out while waiting for data on the last call to fread or fgets .

element.name: stream_get_transports
element.description: Output will be similar to the following. Note: there may be more or fewer transports in your version of PHP.

element.name: stream_get_wrappers
element.description: Returns an indexed array containing the name of all stream wrappers available on the running system.

element.name: stream_select
element.description: When stream_select returns, the arrays read , write and except are modified to indicate which stream resource(s) actually changed status.

element.name: stream_set_blocking
element.description: If mode is , the given stream will be switched to non-blocking mode, and if , it will be switched to blocking mode. This affects calls like fgets and fread that read from the stream. In non-blocking mode an fgets call will always return right away while in blocking mode it will wait for data to become available on the stream.

element.name: stream_set_timeout
element.description: Sets the timeout value on stream , expressed in the sum of seconds and microseconds .

element.name: stream_set_write_buffer
element.description: The following example demonstrates how to use stream_set_write_buffer to create an unbuffered stream.

element.name: stream_socket_accept
element.description: Accept a connection on a socket previously created by stream_socket_server . If timeout is specified, the default socket accept timeout will be overridden with the time specified in seconds. The name (address) of the client which connected will be passed back in peername if included and available from the selected transport.

element.name: stream_socket_client
element.description: Initiates a stream or datagram connection to the destination specified by remote_socket . The type of socket created is determined by the transport specified using standard URL formatting: . For Internet Domain sockets (AF_INET) such as TCP and UDP, the portion of the remote_socket parameter should consist of a hostname or IP address followed by a colon and a port number. For Unix domain sockets, the target portion should point to the socket file on the filesystem. The optional timeout can be used to set a timeout in seconds for the connect system call. flags is a bitmask field which may be set to any combination of connection flags. Currently the selection of connection flags is limited to (default), and .

element.name: stream_socket_enable_crypto
element.description: Valid values for crypto_type

element.name: stream_socket_get_name
element.description: Returns the local or remote name of a given socket connection. If want_peer is set to the remote socket name will be returned, if it is set to the local socket name will be returned.

element.name: stream_socket_pair
element.description: stream_socket_pair creates a pair of connected, indistinguishable socket streams. This function is commonly used in IPC (InterProcess Communication).

element.name: stream_socket_recvfrom
element.description: The function stream_socket_recvfrom accepts data from a remote socket up to length bytes. If address is provided it will be populated with the address of the remote socket.

element.name: stream_socket_sendto
element.description: The function stream_socket_sendto sends the data specified by data through the socket specified by socket . The address specified when the socket stream was created will be used unless an alternate address is specified in address .

element.name: stream_socket_server
element.description: Creates a stream or datagram socket on the specified local_socket . The type of socket created is determined by the transport specified using standard URL formatting: . For Internet Domain sockets (AF_INET) such as TCP and UDP, the portion of the remote_socket parameter should consist of a hostname or IP address followed by a colon and a port number. For Unix domain sockets, the target portion should point to the socket file on the filesystem. flags is a bitmask field which may be set to any combination of socket creation flags. The default value of flags is | .

element.name: stream_wrapper_register
element.description: This method is called in response to closedir . You should release any resources which were locked or allocated during the opening and use of the directory stream.

element.name: stream_wrapper_restore
element.description: Restores a built-in wrapper previously unregistered with stream_wrapper_unregister .

element.name: stream_wrapper_unregister
element.description: stream_wrapper_unregister allows you to disable an already defined stream wrapper. Once the wrapper has been disabled you may override it with a user-defined wrapper using stream_wrapper_register or reenable it later on with stream_wrapper_restore .

element.name: addcslashes
element.description: Returns a string with backslashes before characters that are listed in charlist parameter. It escapes , etc. in C-like style, characters with ASCII code lower than 32 and higher than 126 are converted to octal representation.

element.name: addslashes
element.description: Returns a string with backslashes before characters that need to be quoted in database queries etc. These characters are single quote ( ), double quote ( ), backslash ( ) and NUL (the byte).

element.name: bin2hex
element.description: Returns an ASCII string containing the hexadecimal representation of str . The conversion is done byte-wise with the high-nibble first.

element.name: chr
element.description: Returns a one-character string containing the character specified by ascii .

element.name: chunk_split
element.description: Can be used to split a string into smaller chunks which is useful for e.g. converting base64_encode output to match RFC 2045 semantics. It inserts end (defaults to "\r\n") every chunklen characters (defaults to 76). It returns the new string leaving the original string untouched.

element.name: convert_cyr_string
element.description: This function returns the given string converted from one Cyrillic character set to another. The from and to arguments are single characters that represent the source and target Cyrillic character sets. The supported types are:

element.name: convert_uudecode
element.description: convert_uudecode decodes a uuencoded string.

element.name: convert_uuencode
element.description: convert_uuencode encodes a string using the uuencode algorithm.

element.name: count_chars
element.description: Counts the number of occurrences of every byte-value (0..255) in string and returns it in various ways. The optional parameter mode defaults to 0. Depending on mode count_chars returns one of the following:

element.name: crc32
element.description: Generates the cyclic redundancy checksum polynomial of 32-bit lengths of the str . This is usually used to validate the integrity of data being transmitted.

element.name: crypt
element.description: crypt will return an encrypted string using the standard Unix -based encryption algorithm or alternative algorithms that may be available on the system. Arguments are a string to be encrypted and an optional salt string to base the encryption on. See the Unix man page for your crypt function for more information.

element.name: echo
element.description: echo is not actually a function (it is a language construct) so you are not required to use parentheses with it. In fact, if you want to pass more than one parameter to echo, you must not enclose the parameters within parentheses.

element.name: explode
element.description: Returns an array of strings, each of which is a substring of string formed by splitting it on boundaries formed by the string separator . If limit is set, the returned array will contain a maximum of limit elements with the last element containing the rest of string .

element.name: get_html_translation_table
element.description: get_html_translation_table will return the translation table that is used internally for htmlspecialchars and htmlentities .

element.name: hebrev
element.description: The optional parameter max_chars_per_line indicates maximum number of characters per line that will be returned. The function tries to avoid breaking words.

element.name: hebrevc
element.description: This function is similar to hebrev with the difference that it converts newlines (\n) to " < br > \n". The optional parameter max_chars_per_line indicates maximum number of characters per line that will be returned. The function tries to avoid breaking words.

element.name: html_entity_decode
element.description: html_entity_decode is the opposite of htmlentities in that it converts all HTML entities to their applicable characters from string .

element.name: htmlentities
element.description: This function is identical to htmlspecialchars in all ways, except with htmlentities , all characters which have HTML character entity equivalents are translated into these entities.

element.name: htmlspecialchars
element.description: Certain characters have special significance in HTML, and should be represented by HTML entities if they are to preserve their meanings. This function returns a string with some of these conversions made; the translations made are those most useful for everyday web programming. If you require all HTML character entities to be translated, use htmlentities instead.

element.name: implode
element.description: Returns a string containing a string representation of all the array elements in the same order, with the glue string between each element.

element.name: levenshtein
element.description: This function returns the Levenshtein-Distance between the two argument strings or -1, if one of the argument strings is longer than the limit of 255 characters.

element.name: localeconv
element.description: Returns an associative array containing localized numeric and monetary formatting information.

element.name: ltrim
element.description: This function returns a string with whitespace stripped from the beginning of str . Without the second parameter, ltrim will strip these characters:

element.name: md5
element.description: Calculates the MD5 hash of str using the , and returns that hash. The hash is a 32-character hexadecimal number. If the optional raw_output is set to , then the md5 digest is instead returned in raw binary format with a length of 16.

element.name: md5_file
element.description: Calculates the MD5 hash of the file specified by the filename parameter using the , and returns that hash. The hash is a 32-character hexadecimal number. If the optional raw_output is set to , then the md5 digest is instead returned in raw binary format with a length of 16.

element.name: metaphone
element.description: Calculates the metaphone key of str .

element.name: money_format
element.description: money_format returns a formatted version of number . This function wraps the C library function strfmon , with the difference that this implementation converts only one number at a time.

element.name: nl2br
element.description: Returns string with ' < br / > ' inserted before all newlines.

element.name: nl_langinfo
element.description: nl_langinfo is used to access individual elements of the locale categories. Unlike localeconv , which returns all of the elements, nl_langinfo allows you to select any specific element.

element.name: number_format
element.description: number_format returns a formatted version of number . This function accepts either one, two or four parameters (not three):

element.name: ord
element.description: Returns the ASCII value of the first character of string . This function complements chr .

element.name: parse_str
element.description: Parses str as if it were the query string passed via a URL and sets variables in the current scope. If the second parameter arr is present, variables are stored in this variable as array elements instead.

element.name: print
element.description: print is not actually a real function (it is a language construct) so you are not required to use parentheses with its argument list.

element.name: quotemeta
element.description: Returns a version of str with a backslash character ( ) before every character that is among these:

element.name: rtrim
element.description: This function returns a string with whitespace stripped from the end of str . Without the second parameter, rtrim will strip these characters:

element.name: setlocale
element.description: category is a named constant (or string) specifying the category of the functions affected by the locale setting:

element.name: similar_text
element.description: This calculates the similarity between two strings as described in Oliver [1993]. Note that this implementation does not use a stack as in Oliver's pseudo code, but recursive calls which may or may not speed up the whole process. Note also that the complexity of this algorithm is O(N**3) where N is the length of the longest string.

element.name: soundex
element.description: Calculates the soundex key of str .

element.name: sprintf
element.description: Each conversion specification consists of a percent sign ( ), followed by one or more of these elements, in order: A that says what type the argument data should be treated as. Possible types:

element.name: sscanf
element.description: The function sscanf is the input analog of printf . sscanf reads from the string str and interprets it according to the specified format , which is described in the documentation for sprintf . If only two parameters were passed to this function, the values parsed will be returned as an array. Otherwise, if optional parameters are passed, the function will return the number of assigned values. The optional parameters must be passed by reference.

element.name: str_ireplace
element.description: This function returns a string or an array with all occurrences of search in subject (ignoring case) replaced with the given replace value. If you don't need fancy replacing rules, you should generally use this function instead of eregi_replace or preg_replace with the modifier.

element.name: str_pad
element.description: This functions returns the input string padded on the left, the right, or both sides to the specified padding length. If the optional argument pad_string is not supplied, the input is padded with spaces, otherwise it is padded with characters from pad_string up to the limit.

element.name: str_repeat
element.description: Returns input_str repeated multiplier times. multiplier has to be greater than or equal to 0. If the multiplier is set to 0, the function will return an empty string.

element.name: str_replace
element.description: This function returns a string or an array with all occurrences of search in subject replaced with the given replace value. If you don't need fancy replacing rules (like regular expressions), you should always use this function instead of ereg_replace or preg_replace .

element.name: str_rot13
element.description: This function performs the ROT13 encoding on the str argument and returns the resulting string. The ROT13 encoding simply shifts every letter by 13 places in the alphabet while leaving non-alpha characters untouched. Encoding and decoding are done by the same function, passing an encoded string as argument will return the original version.

element.name: str_split
element.description: Converts a string to an array. If the optional split_length parameter is specified, the returned array will be broken down into chunks with each being split_length in length, otherwise each chunk will be one character in length.

element.name: str_word_count
element.description: Counts the number of words inside string . If the optional format is not specified, then the return value will be an integer representing the number of words found. In the event the format is specified, the return value will be an array, content of which is dependent on the format . The possible value for the format and the resultant outputs are listed below.

element.name: strcasecmp
element.description: Returns < 0 if str1 is less than str2 ; > 0 if str1 is greater than str2 , and 0 if they are equal.

element.name: strcoll
element.description: strcoll was added in PHP 4.0.5, but was not enabled for win32 until 4.2.3.

element.name: strip_tags
element.description: This function tries to return a string with all HTML and PHP tags stripped from a given str . It uses the same tag stripping state machine as the fgetss function.

element.name: stripcslashes
element.description: Returns a string with backslashes stripped off. Recognizes C-like , ..., octal and hexadecimal representation.

element.name: stripos
element.description: Returns the numeric position of the first occurrence of needle in the haystack . Unlike strpos , stripos is case-insensitive.

element.name: stripslashes
element.description: Returns a string with backslashes stripped off. ( becomes and so on.) Double backslashes ( ) are made into a single backslash ( ).

element.name: stristr
element.description: Returns all of haystack from the first occurrence of needle to the end. needle and haystack are examined in a case-insensitive manner.

element.name: strlen
element.description: Returns the length of the given string .

element.name: strnatcasecmp
element.description: This function implements a comparison algorithm that orders alphanumeric strings in the way a human being would. The behaviour of this function is similar to strnatcmp , except that the comparison is not case sensitive. For more information see: Martin Pool's page.

element.name: strnatcmp
element.description: This function implements a comparison algorithm that orders alphanumeric strings in the way a human being would, this is described as a "natural ordering". An example of the difference between this algorithm and the regular computer string sorting algorithms (used in strcmp ) can be seen below: The code above will generate the following output: For more information see: Martin Pool's page.

element.name: strncasecmp
element.description: This function is similar to strcasecmp , with the difference that you can specify the (upper limit of the) number of characters ( len ) from each string to be used in the comparison.

element.name: strncmp
element.description: This function is similar to strcmp , with the difference that you can specify the (upper limit of the) number of characters ( len ) from each string to be used in the comparison.

element.name: strpbrk
element.description: strpbrk searches the haystack string for a char_list , and returns a string starting from the character found (or if it is not found).

element.name: strpos
element.description: Returns the numeric position of the first occurrence of needle in the haystack string. Unlike the strrpos , this function can take a full string as the needle parameter and the entire string will be used.

element.name: strrchr
element.description: This function returns the portion of haystack which starts at the last occurrence of needle and goes until the end of haystack .

element.name: strrev
element.description: Returns string , reversed.

element.name: strripos
element.description: Returns the numeric position of the last occurrence of needle in the haystack string. Unlike strrpos , strripos is case-insensitive. Also note that string positions start at 0, and not 1.

element.name: strrpos
element.description: Returns the numeric position of the last occurrence of needle in the haystack string. Note that the needle in this case can only be a single character in PHP 4. If a string is passed as the needle, then only the first character of that string will be used.

element.name: strspn
element.description: The line of code: will assign 2 to , because the string "42" will be the longest segment containing characters from "1234567890".

element.name: strstr
element.description: Returns part of haystack string from the first occurrence of needle to the end of haystack .

element.name: strtok
element.description: strtok splits a string ( str ) into smaller strings (tokens), with each token being delimited by any character from token . That is, if you have a string like "This is an example string" you could tokenize this string into its individual words by using the space character as the token.

element.name: strtolower
element.description: Returns string with all alphabetic characters converted to lowercase.

element.name: strtoupper
element.description: Returns string with all alphabetic characters converted to uppercase.

element.name: strtr
element.description: This function returns a copy of str , translating all occurrences of each character in from to the corresponding character in to .

element.name: substr
element.description: substr returns the portion of string specified by the start and length parameters.

element.name: substr_compare
element.description: substr_compare compares main_str from position offset with str up to length characters.

element.name: substr_count
element.description: substr_count returns the number of times the needle substring occurs in the haystack string. Please note that needle is case sensitive.

element.name: substr_replace
element.description: substr_replace replaces a copy of string delimited by the start and (optionally) length parameters with the string given in replacement . The result is returned.

element.name: trim
element.description: This function returns a string with whitespace stripped from the beginning and end of str . Without the second parameter, trim will strip these characters:

element.name: ucfirst
element.description: Returns a string with the first character of str capitalized, if that character is alphabetic.

element.name: ucwords
element.description: Returns a string with the first character of each word in str capitalized, if that character is alphabetic.

element.name: wordwrap
element.description: Returns a string with str wrapped at the column number specified by the optional width parameter. The line is broken using the (optional) break parameter.

element.name: sybase_affected_rows
element.description: sybase_affected_rows returns the number of rows affected by the last INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE query on the server associated with the specified link identifier. If the link identifier isn't specified, the last opened link is assumed.

element.name: sybase_close
element.description: sybase_close closes the link to a Sybase database that's associated with the specified link link_identifier . If the link identifier isn't specified, the last opened link is assumed.

element.name: sybase_connect
element.description: Returns a positive Sybase link identifier on success, or on failure.

element.name: sybase_deadlock_retry_count
element.description: Using sybase_deadlock_retry_count , the number of retries can be defined in cases of deadlocks. By default, every deadlock is retried an infinite number of times or until the process is killed by Sybase, the executing script is killed (for instance, by set_time_limit ) or the query succeeds.

element.name: sybase_fetch_array
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: sybase_fetch_assoc
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: sybase_fetch_field
element.description: Returns an object containing field information.

element.name: sybase_fetch_object
element.description: Returns an object with properties that correspond to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: sybase_fetch_row
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: sybase_field_seek
element.description: Seeks to the specified field offset. If the next call to sybase_fetch_field won't include a field offset, this field would be returned.

element.name: sybase_free_result
element.description: sybase_free_result only needs to be called if you are worried about using too much memory while your script is running. All result memory will automatically be freed when the script ends. You may call sybase_free_result with the result identifier as an argument and the associated result memory will be freed.

element.name: sybase_get_last_message
element.description: sybase_get_last_message returns the last message reported by the server.

element.name: sybase_min_client_severity
element.description: sybase_min_client_severity sets the minimum client severity level.

element.name: sybase_min_error_severity
element.description: sybase_min_error_severity sets the minimum error severity level.

element.name: sybase_min_message_severity
element.description: sybase_min_message_severity sets the minimum message severity level.

element.name: sybase_min_server_severity
element.description: sybase_min_server_severity sets the minimum server severity level.

element.name: sybase_num_fields
element.description: sybase_num_fields returns the number of fields in a result set.

element.name: sybase_num_rows
element.description: sybase_num_rows returns the number of rows in a result set.

element.name: sybase_pconnect
element.description: Returns a positive Sybase persistent link identifier on success, or on error.

element.name: sybase_query
element.description: Returns a positive Sybase result identifier on success, or on error.

element.name: sybase_result
element.description: Returns the contents of the cell at the row and offset in the specified Sybase result set.

element.name: sybase_select_db
element.description: sybase_select_db sets the current active database on the server that's associated with the specified link identifier. If no link identifier is specified, the last opened link is assumed. If no link is open, the function will try to establish a link as if sybase_connect was called, and use it.

element.name: sybase_set_message_handler
element.description: sybase_set_message_handler sets a user function to handle messages generated by the server. You may specify the name of a global function, or use an array to specify an object reference and a method name.

element.name: sybase_unbuffered_query
element.description: Returns a positive Sybase result identifier on success, or on error.

element.name: tcpwrap_check
element.description: This function consults the and files to check if access to service daemon should be granted or denied for a client.

property.name: daemon
property.description: The service name.

property.name: nodns
property.description: If looks like domain name then DNS is used to resolve it to IP address; set to to avoid this.

element.name: token_get_all
element.description: token_get_all parses the given source string into PHP language tokens using the Zend engine ' s lexical scanner.

element.name: token_name
element.description: token_name gets the symbolic name for a PHP token value.

property.name: token
property.description: The token value.

element.name: base64_decode
element.description: base64_decode decodes encoded_data and returns the original data or on failure. The returned data may be binary.

element.name: base64_encode
element.description: base64_encode returns data encoded with base64. This encoding is designed to make binary data survive transport through transport layers that are not 8-bit clean, such as mail bodies.

element.name: get_headers
element.description: get_headers returns an array with the headers sent by the server in response to a HTTP request. Returns on failure.

element.name: get_meta_tags
element.description: Opens filename and parses it line by line for < meta > tags in the file. This can be a local file or an . The parsing stops at .

element.name: http_build_query
element.description: this will output : (word wrapped for readability)

element.name: parse_url
element.description: This function returns an associative array containing any of the various components of the URL that are present. If one of them is missing, no entry will be created for it. The components are :

element.name: rawurldecode
element.description: Returns a string in which the sequences with percent ( ) signs followed by two hex digits have been replaced with literal characters.

element.name: rawurlencode
element.description: Returns a string in which all non-alphanumeric characters except have been replaced with a percent ( ) sign followed by two hex digits. This is the encoding described in RFC 1738 for protecting literal characters from being interpreted as special URL delimiters, and for protecting URL's from being mangled by transmission media with character conversions (like some email systems). For example, if you want to include a password in an FTP URL:

element.name: urldecode
element.description: Decodes any encoding in the given string. The decoded string is returned.

element.name: urlencode
element.description: Returns a string in which all non-alphanumeric characters except have been replaced with a percent ( ) sign followed by two hex digits and spaces encoded as plus ( ) signs. It is encoded the same way that the posted data from a WWW form is encoded, that is the same way as in media type. This differs from the RFC1738 encoding (see rawurlencode ) in that for historical reasons, spaces are encoded as plus (+) signs. This function is convenient when encoding a string to be used in a query part of a URL, as a convenient way to pass variables to the next page:

element.name: debug_zval_dump
element.description: Dumps a string representation of an internal zend value to output.

element.name: empty
element.description: Determine whether a variable is considered to be empty.

element.name: floatval
element.description: Gets the value of var .

element.name: get_defined_vars
element.description: This function returns a multidimensional array containing a list of all defined variables, be them environment, server or user-defined variables, within the scope that get_defined_vars is called.

element.name: get_resource_type
element.description: This function returns a string representing the type of the passed to it. If the parameter is not a valid , it generates an error.

element.name: gettype
element.description: Returns the type of the PHP variable var .

element.name: import_request_variables
element.description: Although the prefix parameter is optional, you will get an level error if you specify no prefix, or specify an empty string as a prefix. This is a possible security hazard. Notice level errors are not displayed using the default level.

element.name: intval
element.description: The base argument for intval has no effect unless the var argument is a string.

element.name: is_array
element.description: Finds whether the given variable is an array.

element.name: is_bool
element.description: Finds whether the given variable is a boolean.

element.name: is_callable
element.description: Verify that the contents of a variable can be called as a function. This can check that a simple variable contains the name of a valid function, or that an array contains a properly encoded object and function name.

element.name: is_float
element.description: Finds whether the given variable is a float.

element.name: is_int
element.description: Finds whether the given variable is an integer.

element.name: is_null
element.description: Finds whether the given variable is .

element.name: is_numeric
element.description: Finds whether the given variable is numeric.

element.name: is_object
element.description: Finds whether the given variable is an object.

element.name: is_resource
element.description: is_resource returns if the variable given by the var parameter is a , otherwise it returns .

element.name: is_scalar
element.description: is_scalar returns if the variable given by the var parameter is a scalar, otherwise it returns .

element.name: is_string
element.description: Finds whether the given variable is a string.

element.name: isset
element.description: If a variable has been unset with unset , it will no longer be set. isset will return if testing a variable that has been set to . Also note that a byte ( ) is not equivalent to the PHP constant.

element.name: serialize
element.description: In PHP 3, object properties will be serialized, but methods are lost. That limitation was removed in PHP 4 as both properties and methods are now restored. Please see the section of for more information.

element.name: settype
element.description: Set the type of variable var to type .

element.name: unserialize
element.description: It's possible to set a callback-function which will be called, if an undefined class should be instantiated during unserializing. (to prevent getting an incomplete "__PHP_Incomplete_Class".) Use your , ini_set or to define 'unserialize_callback_func'. Everytime an undefined class should be instantiated, it'll be called. To disable this feature just empty this setting. Also note that the directive unserialize_callback_func directive became available in PHP 4.2.0.

element.name: unset
element.description: unset destroys the specified variables. Note that in PHP 3, unset will always return (actually, the integer value 1). In PHP 4, however, unset is no longer a true function: it is now a statement. As such no value is returned, and attempting to take the value of unset results in a parse error.

element.name: pfpro_cleanup
element.description: pfpro_cleanup is used to shutdown the Payflow Pro library cleanly. It should be called after you have processed any transactions and before the end of your script. However you may omit this call, in which case this extension will automatically call pfpro_cleanup after your script terminates.

element.name: pfpro_init
element.description: pfpro_init is used to initialise the Payflow Pro library. You may omit this call, in which case this extension will automatically call pfpro_init before the first transaction.

element.name: pfpro_process
element.description: Returns: An associative array containing the response

element.name: pfpro_process_raw
element.description: Returns: A string containing the response.

element.name: pfpro_version
element.description: pfpro_version returns the version string of the Payflow Pro library. At the time of writing, this was L211.

element.name: w32api_deftype
element.description: If you would like to define a type for a w32api call, you need to call w32api_deftype . This function takes 2n+1 arguments, where n is the number of members the type has. The first argument is the name of the type. After that is the type of the member followed by the members name (in pairs). A member type can be a user defined type. All the type names are case sensitive. Built in type names should be provided in lowercase.

element.name: w32api_init_dtype
element.description: This function creates an instance of the data type named typename , filling in the values of the data type. The typename parameter is case sensitive. You should give the values in the same order as you defined the data type with w32api_deftype . The type of the resource returned is .

element.name: w32api_invoke_function
element.description: w32api_invoke_function tries to find the previously registered function, named funcname , passing the parameters you provided. The return type is the one you set when you registered the function, the value is the one returned by the function itself. Any of the arguments can be of any PHP type or w32api_deftype defined type, as needed.

element.name: w32api_register_function
element.description: This function tries to find the function_name function in libary , and tries to import it into PHP. The function will be registered with the given return_type . This type can be a generic PHP type, or a type defined with w32api_deftype . All type names are case sensitive. Built in type names should be provided in lowercase.

element.name: w32api_set_call_method
element.description: This function sets the method call type. The parameter can be one of the constants or . The extension default is .

element.name: wddx_add_vars
element.description: wddx_add_vars is used to serialize passed variables and add the result to the packet specified by the packet_id . The variables to be serialized are specified in exactly the same way as wddx_serialize_vars .

element.name: wddx_deserialize
element.description: wddx_deserialize takes a packet string and deserializes it. It returns the result which can be string, number, or array. Note that structures are deserialized into associative arrays.

element.name: wddx_packet_end
element.description: wddx_packet_end ends the WDDX packet specified by the packet_id and returns the string with the packet.

element.name: wddx_packet_start
element.description: Use wddx_packet_start to start a new WDDX packet for incremental addition of variables. It takes an optional comment string and returns a packet ID for use in later functions. It automatically creates a structure definition inside the packet to contain the variables.

element.name: wddx_serialize_value
element.description: wddx_serialize_value is used to create a WDDX packet from a single given value. It takes the value contained in var , and an optional comment string that appears in the packet header, and returns the WDDX packet.

element.name: wddx_serialize_vars
element.description: wddx_serialize_vars is used to create a WDDX packet with a structure that contains the serialized representation of the passed variables.

element.name: utf8_decode
element.description: This function decodes data , assumed to be encoded, to .

element.name: utf8_encode
element.description: This function encodes the string data to , and returns the encoded version. is a standard mechanism used by for encoding values into a byte stream. is transparent to plain characters, is self-synchronized (meaning it is possible for a program to figure out where in the bytestream characters start) and can be used with normal string comparison functions for sorting and such. PHP encodes characters in up to four bytes, like this: Each represents a bit that can be used to store character data.

element.name: xml_error_string
element.description: Gets the XML parser error string associated with the given code .

element.name: xml_get_current_byte_index
element.description: Gets the current byte index of the given XML parser.

property.name: parser
property.description: A reference to the XML parser to get byte index from.

element.name: xml_get_current_column_number
element.description: Gets the current column number of the given XML parser.

element.name: xml_get_current_line_number
element.description: Gets the current line number for the given XML parser.

element.name: xml_get_error_code
element.description: Gets the XML parser error code.

element.name: xml_parse
element.description: xml_parse parses an XML document. The handlers for the configured events are called as many times as necessary.

property.name: is_final
property.description: If set and , is the last piece of data sent in this parse.

element.name: xml_parse_into_struct
element.description: This function parses an XML file into 2 parallel array structures, one ( index ) containing pointers to the location of the appropriate values in the values array. These last two parameters must be passed by reference.

element.name: xml_parser_create
element.description: xml_parser_create creates a new XML parser and returns a resource handle referencing it to be used by the other XML functions.

element.name: xml_parser_create_ns
element.description: xml_parser_create_ns creates a new XML parser with XML namespace support and returns a resource handle referencing it to be used by the other XML functions.

element.name: xml_set_object
element.description: This function allows to use parser inside object . All callback functions could be set with xml_set_element_handler etc and assumed to be methods of object .

element.name: xmlrpc_get_type
element.description: This function is especially useful for base64 and datetime strings.

element.name: getParameter
element.description: Gets a parameter if previously set by .

element.name: hasExsltSupport
element.description: This method determine if PHP was built with the .

element.name: importStylesheet
element.description: This method import the stylesheet into the for transformations.

property.name: stylesheet
property.description: The imported style sheet as a object.

element.name: registerPHPFunctions
element.description: This method enables the ability to use PHP functions as XSLT functions within XSL stylesheets.

element.name: removeParameter
element.description: Removes a parameter, if set. This will make the processor use the default value for the parameter as specified in the stylesheet.

element.name: setParameter
element.description: Sets the value of one or more parameters to be used in subsequent transformations with . If the parameter doesn't exist in the stylesheet it will be ignored.

element.name: transformToDoc
element.description: Transforms the source node to a applying the stylesheet given by the method.

property.name: doc
property.description: The node to be transformed.

element.name: transformToURI
element.description: Transforms the source node to an URI applying the stylesheet given by the method.

property.name: doc
property.description: The transformed document.

element.name: transformToXML
element.description: Transforms the source node to a string applying the stylesheet given by the method.

element.name: xslt_backend_info
element.description: xslt_backend_info returns a string with information about the compilation setting of the backend or an error string when no information available.

element.name: xslt_backend_name
element.description: xslt_backend_name will always return .

element.name: xslt_backend_version
element.description: xslt_backend_version returns the version number of if available, otherwise.

element.name: xslt_create
element.description: Create and return a new XSLT processor resource for manipulation by the other XSLT functions.

element.name: xslt_errno
element.description: Returns an error code describing the last error that occurred on the passed XSLT processor.

element.name: xslt_error
element.description: Returns a string describing the last error that occurred on the passed XSLT processor.

element.name: xslt_free
element.description: Free the XSLT processor identified by the given handle.

element.name: xslt_getopt
element.description: xslt_getopt returns the options on the given processor .

element.name: xslt_process
element.description: The xslt_process function is the crux of the new XSLT extension. It allows you to perform an XSLT transformation using almost any type of input source - the containers. This is accomplished through the use of argument buffers -- a concept taken from the Sablotron XSLT processor (currently the only XSLT processor this extension supports). The input containers default to a filename 'containing' the document to be processed. The result container defaults to a filename for the transformed document. If the result container is not specified - i.e. - than the result is returned.

element.name: xslt_set_base
element.description: Sets the base URI for all XSLT transformations, the base URI is used with Xpath instructions to resolve document() and other commands which access external resources. It is also used to resolve URIs for the < xsl:include > and < xsl:import > elements.

element.name: xslt_set_encoding
element.description: Set the output encoding for the XSLT transformations. When using the backend, this option is only available when you compile with encoding support.

element.name: xslt_set_object
element.description: This function allows to use the processor inside an object and to resolve all callback functions in it.

element.name: xslt_set_sax_handler
element.description: Set SAX handlers on the resource handle given by xh . SAX handlers should be a two dimensional array with the format (all top level elements are optional):

element.name: xslt_set_scheme_handler
element.description: Set Scheme handlers on the resource handle given by xh . Scheme handlers should be an array with the format (all elements are optional):

element.name: xslt_setopt
element.description: xslt_setopt sets the options specified by newmask on the given processor .

element.name: yaz_addinfo
element.description: Returns additional error message for server (last request), identified by parameter id . An empty string is returned if the last operation was successful or if no additional information was provided by the server.

element.name: yaz_ccl_conf
element.description: This function configures the CCL query parser for a server with definitions of access points (CCL qualifiers) and their mapping to RPN. To map a specific CCL query to RPN afterwards call the yaz_ccl_parse function. Each index of the array config is the name of a CCL field and the corresponding value holds a string that specifies a mapping to RPN. The mapping is a sequence of attribute-type, attribute-value pairs. Attribute-type and attribute-value is separated by an equal sign ( ). Each pair is separated by white space.

element.name: yaz_ccl_parse
element.description: This function invokes a CCL parser. It converts a given CCL FIND query to an RPN query which may be passed to the yaz_search function to perform a search. To define a set of valid CCL fields call yaz_ccl_conf prior to this function. If the supplied query was successfully converted to RPN, this function returns , and the index of the supplied array result holds a valid RPN query. If the query could not be converted (because of invalid syntax, unknown field, etc.) this function returns and three indexes are set in the resulting array to indicate the cause of failure: CCL error code (integer), CCL error string, and approximate position in query of failure (integer is character position).

element.name: yaz_close
element.description: Closes the connection given by parameter id . The id is a connection resource as returned by a previous call to yaz_connect .

element.name: yaz_connect
element.description: This function returns a connection resource on success, zero on failure.

element.name: yaz_database
element.description: This function specifies one or more databases to be used in search, retrieval, etc. - overriding databases specified in call to yaz_connect . Multiple databases are separated by a plus sign .

element.name: yaz_element
element.description: This function sets the element set name for retrieval. Call this function before yaz_search or yaz_present to specify the element set name for records to be retrieved. Most servers support (for full records) and (for brief records).

element.name: yaz_errno
element.description: Returns an errornumber for the server (last request) identified by id . The error code is either a Z39.50 diagnostic code (usually a Bib-1 diagnostic) or a client side error code which is generated by PHP/YAZ itself, such as "Connect failed", "Init Rejected", etc.

element.name: yaz_error
element.description: Returns an error text message for server (last request), identified by parameter id . An empty string is returned if the last operation was successful.

element.name: yaz_get_option
element.description: Returns the value of the option specified with name . If an option is not set, an empty string is returned.

element.name: yaz_hits
element.description: yaz_hits returns the number of hits for the last search.

element.name: yaz_itemorder
element.description: This function prepares for an Extended Services request using the Profile for the Use of Z39.50 Item Order Extended Service to Transport ILL (Profile/1). See and the . The args parameter must be a hash array with information about the Item Order request to be sent. The key of the hash is the name of the corresponding ASN.1 tag path. For example, the ISBN below the Item-ID has the key item-id,ISBN.

element.name: yaz_present
element.description: This function prepares for retrieval of records after a successful search. The yaz_range should be called prior to this function to specify the range of records to be retrieved.

element.name: yaz_range
element.description: This function should be called before either yaz_search or yaz_present to specify a range of records to be retrieved. The parameter start specifies the position of the first record to be retrieved and parameter number is the number of records. Records in a result set are numbered 1, 2, ... $hits where $hits is the count returned by yaz_hits .

element.name: yaz_record
element.description: Returns the record at position pos or an empty string if no record exists at the given position.

element.name: yaz_scan
element.description: This function prepares for a Z39.50 Scan Request, where parameter id specifies connection. Starting term point for the scan is given by startterm . The form in which the starting term is specified is given by parameter type . Currently only type is supported. The optional parameter flags specifies additional information to control the behaviour of the scan request. Three indexes are currently read from the flags: (number of terms requested), (preferred position of term) and (preferred step size). To actually transfer the Scan Request to the server and receive the Scan Response, yaz_wait must be called. Upon completion of yaz_wait call yaz_error and yaz_scan_result to handle the response.

element.name: yaz_scan_result
element.description: yaz_scan_result returns terms and associated information as received from the server in the last performed yaz_scan . This function returns an array (0..n-1) where n is the number of terms returned. Each value is a pair where the first item is the term, and the second item is the result-count. If the optional parameter result is given it will be modified to hold additional information taken from the Scan Response: (number of entries returned), (Step-size), (position of term), (Scan Status).

element.name: yaz_schema
element.description: The schema must be specified as an OID (Object Identifier) in a raw dot-notation (like ) or as one of the known registered schemas: , , , ... This function should be called before yaz_search or yaz_present .

element.name: yaz_search
element.description: yaz_search prepares for a search on the connection given by parameter id . The parameter type represents the query type - only is supported now in which case the third argument specifies a Type-1 query in prefix query notation. Like yaz_connect this function is non-blocking and only prepares for a search to be executed later when yaz_wait is called.

element.name: yaz_set_option
element.description: Sets option name to value .

element.name: yaz_sort
element.description: This function sets sorting criteria and enables Z39.50 Sort. Call this function yaz_search . Using this function alone does not have any effect. When used in conjunction with yaz_search , a Z39.50 Sort will be sent after a search response has been received and before any records are retrieved with Z39.50 Present ( yaz_present . The parameter criteria takes the form

element.name: yaz_syntax
element.description: The syntax must be specified as an OID (Object Identifier) in a raw dot-notation (like ) or as one of the known registered record syntaxes (sutrs, usmarc, grs1, xml, etc.). This function should be called before yaz_search or yaz_present .

element.name: yaz_wait
element.description: This function carries out networked (blocked) activity for outstanding requests which have been prepared by the functions yaz_connect , yaz_search , yaz_present , yaz_scan and yaz_itemorder . yaz_wait returns when all servers have either completed all requests or aborted (in case of errors).

element.name: yp_cat
element.description: yp_cat returns all map entries as an array with the maps key values as array indices and the maps entries as array data.

element.name: yp_err_string
element.description: yp_err_string returns the error message associated with the given error code. Useful to indicate what exactly went wrong.

element.name: yp_errno
element.description: yp_errno returns the error code of the previous operation.

element.name: yp_first
element.description: yp_first returns the first key-value pair from the named map in the named domain, otherwise .

element.name: yp_get_default_domain
element.description: yp_get_default_domain returns the default domain of the node or . Can be used as the domain parameter for successive NIS calls.

element.name: yp_master
element.description: yp_master returns the machine name of the master NIS server for a map.

element.name: yp_match
element.description: yp_match returns the value associated with the passed key out of the specified map or . This key must be exact.

element.name: yp_next
element.description: yp_next returns the next key-value pair in the named map after the specified key or .

element.name: yp_order
element.description: yp_order returns the order number for a map or .

element.name: zip_close
element.description: Closes the given ZIP file archive.

property.name: zip
property.description: A ZIP file previously opened with .

element.name: zip_entry_close
element.description: Closes the specified directory entry.

property.name: zip_entry
property.description: A directory entry previously opened .

element.name: zip_entry_compressedsize
element.description: Returns the compressed size of the specified directory entry.

element.name: zip_entry_compressionmethod
element.description: Returns the compression method of the directory entry specified by zip_entry .

element.name: zip_entry_filesize
element.description: Returns the actual size of the specified directory entry.

element.name: zip_entry_name
element.description: Returns the name of the specified directory entry.

element.name: zip_entry_open
element.description: Opens a directory entry in a zip file for reading.

element.name: zip_entry_read
element.description: Reads from an open directory entry.

element.name: zip_open
element.description: Opens a new zip archive for reading.

element.name: zip_read
element.description: Reads the next entry in a zip file archive.

element.name: gzclose
element.description: Closes the given gz-file pointer.

property.name: zp
property.description: The gz-file pointer. It must be valid, and must point to a file successfully opened by .

element.name: gzcompress
element.description: This function compress the given string using the data format.

element.name: gzdeflate
element.description: This function compress the given string using the data format.

element.name: gzencode
element.description: This function returns a compressed version of the input data compatible with the output of the program.

property.name: encoding_mode
property.description: The encoding mode. Can be (the default) or . If you use , you get a standard zlib deflated string (inclusive zlib headers) after the gzip file header but without the trailing crc32 checksum.

element.name: gzeof
element.description: Tests the given GZ file pointer for EOF (end-of-file).

element.name: gzfile
element.description: This function is identical to readgzfile , except that it returns the file in an array.

element.name: gzgetc
element.description: Returns a string containing a single (uncompressed) character read from the given gz-file pointer.

element.name: gzgets
element.description: Gets a (uncompressed) string of up to length - 1 bytes read from the given file pointer. Reading ends when length - 1 bytes have been read, on a newline, or on EOF (whichever comes first).

element.name: gzgetss
element.description: Identical to gzgets , except that gzgetss attempts to strip any HTML and PHP tags from the text it reads.

element.name: gzinflate
element.description: This function inflate a deflated string.

element.name: gzopen
element.description: Opens a gzip (.gz) file for reading or writing.

element.name: gzpassthru
element.description: Reads to EOF on the given gz-file pointer from the current position and writes the (uncompressed) results to standard output.

element.name: gzread
element.description: gzread reads up to length bytes from the given gz-file pointer. Reading stops when length (uncompressed) bytes have been read or EOF is reached, whichever comes first.

element.name: gzrewind
element.description: Sets the file position indicator of the given gz-file pointer to the beginning of the file stream.

element.name: gzseek
element.description: Sets the file position indicator for the given file pointer to the given offset byte into the file stream. Equivalent to calling (in C) .

element.name: gztell
element.description: Gets the position of the given file pointer; i.e., its offset into the file stream.

element.name: gzuncompress
element.description: This function uncompress a compressed string.

element.name: gzwrite
element.description: gzwrite writes the contents of string to the given gz-file.

element.name: readgzfile
element.description: Reads a file, decompresses it and writes it to standard output.

element.name: zlib_get_coding_type
element.description: Returns the coding type used for output compression.

element.name: bcompiler_load
element.description: Please use include or require statements to parse bytecodes, it's more portable and convenient way than using this function.

element.name: bcompiler_load_exe
element.description: Reads data from a bcompiler exe file and creates classes from the bytecodes

element.name: bcompiler_parse_class
element.description: This function has been removed from bcompiler and is no longer available as of bcompiler 0.5.

element.name: bcompiler_read
element.description: Please use include or require statements to parse bytecodes, it's more portable and convenient way than using this function.

element.name: bcompiler_write_class
element.description: This reads the bytecodes from PHP for an existing class, and writes them to the open file handle, It does not perform dependency checking, so make sure you write the classes in an order that will not result in an 'undefined class' occurring when you load it.

element.name: bcompiler_write_constant
element.description: This function reads the bytecodes from PHP for an existing constant, and writes them to the open file handle.

element.name: bcompiler_write_exe_footer
element.description: An EXE (or self executable) file consists of 3 parts,

element.name: bcompiler_write_file
element.description: This function complies specified source file into bytecodes, and writes them to the open file handle.

element.name: bcompiler_write_footer
element.description: Writes the a single character \x00 to indicate End of compiled data

element.name: bcompiler_write_function
element.description: This reads the bytecodes from PHP for an existing function, and writes them to the open file handle. Order is not important, (eg. if function b uses function a, and you compile it like the example below, it will work perfectly OK)

element.name: bcompiler_write_functions_from_file
element.description: This function searches for all functions declared in the given file, and writes their correspondent bytecodes to the open file handle. Always remember to include/require the file you intend to compile.

element.name: bcompiler_write_header
element.description: Writes the header part of a bcompiler file. Optional second parameter can be used to write bytecode in a previously used format, so that you can use it with older versions of bcompiler.

element.name: ctype_alnum
element.description: Returns if every character in text is either a letter or a digit, otherwise. In the standard locale letters are just and the function is equivalent to .

element.name: ctype_alpha
element.description: Returns if every character in text is a letter from the current locale, otherwise. In the standard locale letters are just and ctype_alpha is equivalent to if $text is just a single character, but other languages have letters that are considered neither upper nor lower case.

element.name: ctype_cntrl
element.description: Returns if every character in text has a special control function, otherwise. Control characters are e.g. line feed, tab, esc.

element.name: ctype_digit
element.description: Returns if every character in text is a decimal digit, otherwise.

element.name: ctype_graph
element.description: Returns if every character in text is printable and actually creates visible output (no white space), otherwise.

element.name: ctype_lower
element.description: Returns if every character in text is a lowercase letter in the current locale.

element.name: ctype_print
element.description: Returns if every character in text will actually create output (including blanks). Returns if text contains control characters or characters that do not have any output or control function at all.

element.name: ctype_punct
element.description: Returns if every character in text is printable, but neither letter, digit or blank, otherwise.

element.name: ctype_space
element.description: Returns if every character in text creates some sort of white space, otherwise. Besides the blank character this also includes tab, vertical tab, line feed, carriage return and form feed characters.

element.name: ctype_upper
element.description: Returns if every character in text is an uppercase letter in the current locale.

element.name: ctype_xdigit
element.description: Returns if every character in text is a hexadecimal 'digit', that is a decimal digit or a character from , otherwise.

element.name: dbase_add_record
element.description: Adds the given data to the database.

property.name: dbase_identifier
property.description: The database link identifier, returned by or .

property.name: record
property.description: An indexed array of data. The number of items must be equal to the number of fields in the database, otherwise will fail. If you're using return value for this parameter, remember to reset the key named .

element.name: dbase_close
element.description: Closes the given database link identifier.

element.name: dbase_create
element.description: dbase_create creates a dBase database with the given definition.

property.name: fields
property.description: An array of arrays, each array describing the format of one field of the database. Each field consists of a name, a character indicating the field type, and optionally, a length, and a precision. The fieldnames are limited in length and must not exceed 10 chars.

element.name: dbase_delete_record
element.description: Marks the given record to be deleted from the database.

property.name: record_number
property.description: An integer which spans from 1 to the number of records in the database (as returned by ).

element.name: dbase_get_header_info
element.description: Returns information on the column structure of the given database link identifier.

element.name: dbase_get_record
element.description: Gets a record from a database as an indexed array.

element.name: dbase_get_record_with_names
element.description: Gets a record from a dBase database as an associative array.

element.name: dbase_numfields
element.description: Gets the number of fields (columns) in the specified database.

element.name: dbase_numrecords
element.description: Gets the number of records (rows) in the specified database.

element.name: dbase_open
element.description: dbase_open opens a dBase database with the given access mode.

element.name: dbase_pack
element.description: Packs the specified database by permanently deleting all records marked for deletion using dbase_delete_record .

element.name: dbase_replace_record
element.description: Replaces the given record in the database with the given data.

element.name: dba_close
element.description: dba_close closes the established database and frees all resources of the specified database handle.

element.name: dba_delete
element.description: dba_delete deletes the specified entry from the database.

element.name: dba_exists
element.description: dba_exists checks whether the specified key exists in the database.

element.name: dba_fetch
element.description: dba_fetch fetches the data specified by key from the database specified with handle .

property.name: skip
property.description: The number of key-value pairs to ignore when using cdb databases. This value is ignored for all other databases which do not support multiple keys with the same name.

element.name: dba_firstkey
element.description: dba_firstkey returns the first key of the database and resets the internal key pointer. This permits a linear search through the whole database.

element.name: dba_handlers
element.description: dba_handlers list all the handlers supported by this extension.

property.name: full_info
property.description: Turns on/off full information display in the result. The default is .

element.name: dba_insert
element.description: dba_insert inserts the entry described with key and value into the database.

element.name: dba_key_split
element.description: dba_key_split splits a key (string representation) into an array representation.

element.name: dba_list
element.description: dba_list list all open database files.

element.name: dba_nextkey
element.description: dba_nextkey returns the next key of the database and advances the internal key pointer.

element.name: dba_open
element.description: dba_open establishes a database instance for path with mode using handler .

property.name: handler
property.description: The name of the which shall be used for accessing . It is passed all optional parameters given to and can act on behalf of them.
