element.name: dba_optimize
element.description: dba_optimize optimizes the underlying database.

element.name: dba_popen
element.description: dba_popen establishes a persistent database instance for path with mode using handler .

element.name: dba_replace
element.description: dba_replace replaces or inserts the entry described with key and value into the database specified by handle .

element.name: dba_sync
element.description: dba_sync synchronizes the database. This will probably trigger a physical write to the disk, if supported.

element.name: dbx_compare
element.description: dbx_compare returns if the is equal to , and or if the former is greater or is smaller than the latter one, respectively, or vice versa if the flag is set to . dbx_compare is a helper function for dbx_sort to ease the make and use of the custom sorting function.

element.name: dbx_error
element.description: Always refer to the module-specific documentation as well.

element.name: dbx_escape_string
element.description: See also dbx_query .

element.name: dbx_fetch_row
element.description: The result_identifier parameter is the result object returned by a call to dbx_query .

element.name: dbx_query
element.description: The flags parameter is used to control the amount of information that is returned. It may be any combination of the following constants with the bitwise OR operator (|). The DBX_COLNAMES_* flags override the dbx.colnames_case setting from . Note that is always used, regardless of the actual value of flags parameter. This means that only the following combinations are effective:

element.name: fam_cancel_monitor
element.description: fam_cancel_monitor terminates monitoring on a resource previously requested using one of the functions. In addition an event occurs.

element.name: fam_close
element.description: fam_close closes a connection to the FAM service previously opened using fam_open .

element.name: fam_monitor_collection
element.description: fam_monitor_collection requests monitoring for a collection of files within a directory. The actual files to be monitored are specified by a directory path in dirname , the maximum search depth starting from this directory and a shell pattern mask restricting the file names to look for.

element.name: fam_monitor_directory
element.description: fam_monitor_directory requests monitoring for a directory and all contained files. A FAM event will be generated whenever the status of the directory (i.e. the result of function stat on that directory) or its content (i.e. the results of readdir ) change.

element.name: fam_monitor_file
element.description: fam_monitor_file requests monitoring for a single file. A FAM event will be generated whenever the file status (i.e. the result of function stat on that file) changes.

element.name: fam_next_event
element.description: fam_next_event returns the next pending FAM event. The function will block until an event is available which can be checked for using fam_pending .

element.name: fam_open
element.description: fam_open opens a connection to the FAM service daemon. The optional parameter appname should be set to a string identifying the application for logging reasons.

element.name: fam_pending
element.description: fam_pending returns if events are available to be fetched using fam_next_event .

element.name: fam_resume_monitor
element.description: fam_resume_monitor resumes monitoring of a resource previously suspend using fam_suspend_monitor .

element.name: fam_suspend_monitor
element.description: fam_suspend_monitor temporarily suspend monitoring of a resource previously requested using one of the functions. Monitoring can later be continued using fam_resume_monitor without the need of requesting a complete new monitor.

element.name: filepro
element.description: This reads and verifies the map file, storing the field count and info.

element.name: filepro_fieldcount
element.description: Returns the number of fields (columns) in the opened filePro database.

element.name: filepro_fieldname
element.description: Returns the name of the field corresponding to field_number .

element.name: filepro_fieldtype
element.description: Returns the edit type of the field corresponding to field_number .

element.name: filepro_fieldwidth
element.description: Returns the width of the field corresponding to field_number .

element.name: filepro_retrieve
element.description: Returns the data from the specified location in the database. The row_number parameter must be between zero and the total number of rows minus one (0.. filepro_rowcount - 1). Likewise, field_number accepts values between zero and the total number of fields minus one (0.. filepro_fieldcount - 1)

element.name: filepro_rowcount
element.description: Returns the number of rows in the opened filePro database.

element.name: bind_textdomain_codeset
element.description: With bind_textdomain_codeset , you can set in which encoding will be messages from domain returned by gettext and similar functions.

element.name: bindtextdomain
element.description: The bindtextdomain function sets the path for a domain. It returns the full pathname for the domain currently being set.

element.name: dcgettext
element.description: This function allows you to override the current domain for a single message lookup. It also allows you to specify a category .

element.name: dcngettext
element.description: This function allows you to override the current domain for a single plural message lookup. It also allows you to specify a category .

element.name: dgettext
element.description: The dgettext function allows you to override the current domain for a single message lookup.

element.name: dngettext
element.description: The dngettext function allows you to override the current domain for a single plural message lookup.

element.name: gettext
element.description: This function returns a translated string if one is found in the translation table, or the submitted message if not found. You may use the underscore character '_' as an alias to this function.

element.name: ngettext
element.description: ngettext returns correct plural form of message identified by msgid1 and msgid2 for count n . Some languages have more than one form for plural messages dependent on the count.

element.name: textdomain
element.description: This function sets the domain to search within when calls are made to gettext , usually the named after an application. The previous default domain is returned. Call it with as parameter to get the current setting without changing it.

element.name: iconv
element.description: Performs a character set conversion on the string str from in_charset to out_charset . Returns the converted string or on failure.

element.name: iconv_get_encoding
element.description: iconv_get_encoding returns the current value of the internal configuration variable if successful, or on failure.

element.name: iconv_mime_decode
element.description: Returns a decoded field on success, or if an error occurs during the decoding.

element.name: iconv_mime_decode_headers
element.description: Returns an associative array that holds a whole set of header fields specified by encoded_headers on success, or if an error occurs during the decoding.

element.name: iconv_mime_encode
element.description: Composes and returns a string that represents a valid header field, which looks like the following: In the above example, "Subject" is the field name and the portion that begins with "=?ISO-8859-1?..." is the field value.

element.name: iconv_set_encoding
element.description: iconv_set_encoding changes the value of the internal configuration variable specified by type to charset .

element.name: iconv_strlen
element.description: Returns the character count of str .

element.name: iconv_strpos
element.description: Returns the numeric position of the first occurrence of needle in haystack .

element.name: iconv_strrpos
element.description: Returns the numeric position of the last occurrence of needle in haystack .

element.name: iconv_substr
element.description: Returns the portion of str specified by the start and length parameters.

element.name: ob_iconv_handler
element.description: It converts the string encoded in internal_encoding to output_encoding .

element.name: id3_get_frame_long_name
element.description: id3_get_frame_long_name returns the long name for an ID3v2 frame.

element.name: id3_get_frame_short_name
element.description: id3_get_frame_short_name returns the short name for an ID3v2 frame.

element.name: id3_get_genre_id
element.description: id3_get_genre_id returns the id for a genre. If the specified genre is not available in the genre list, id3_get_genre_id will return

element.name: id3_get_genre_list
element.description: id3_get_genre_list returns an array containing all possible genres that may be stored in an ID3 tag. This list has been created by Eric Kemp and later extended by WinAmp.

element.name: id3_get_genre_name
element.description: id3_get_genre_name returns the name for a genre id.

element.name: id3_get_tag
element.description: id3_get_tag is used to get all information stored in the id3 tag of the specified file.

element.name: id3_get_version
element.description: id3_get_version retrieves the version(s) of the ID3 tag(s) in the MP3 file. As a tag can contain ID3 v1.x and v2.x tags, the return value of this function should be bitwise compared with the predefined constants , and .

element.name: id3_remove_tag
element.description: id3_remove_tag is used to remove the information stored of an ID3 tag. If no tag has been present, it will return and leave the file as it was.

element.name: id3_set_tag
element.description: id3_set_tag is used to change the information stored of an ID3 tag. If no tag has been present, it will be added to the file.

element.name: libxml_clear_errors
element.description: libxml_clear_errors clears the libxml error buffer.

element.name: libxml_get_errors
element.description: Retrieve array of errors.

element.name: libxml_get_last_error
element.description: Retrieve last error from libxml.

element.name: libxml_set_streams_context
element.description: Sets the streams context for the next libxml document load or write.

property.name: streams_context
property.description: The stream context resource (created with )

element.name: libxml_use_internal_errors
element.description: libxml_use_internal_errors allows you to disable standard libxml errors and enable user error handling.

property.name: use_errors
property.description: Whether to enable user error handling. Defaults to .

element.name: msql_affected_rows
element.description: Returns number of affected ("touched") rows by a specific query (i.e. the number of rows returned by a SELECT, the number of rows modified by an update, or the number of rows removed by a delete).

element.name: msql_close
element.description: msql_close closes the link to a mSQL database that's associated with the specified link identifier. If the link identifier isn't specified, the last opened link is assumed.

element.name: msql_connect
element.description: msql_connect establishes a connection to a mSQL server. The hostname parameter can also include a port number. e.g. " hostname:port " . If the hostname is not specified, the connection is established by the means of a Unix domain socket, being then more efficient then a localhost TCP socket connection.

element.name: msql_create_db
element.description: msql_create_db attempts to create a new database on the server associated with the specified link_identifier .

element.name: msql_data_seek
element.description: msql_data_seek moves the internal row pointer of the mSQL result associated with the specified query identifier to point to the specified row number. The next call to msql_fetch_row would return that row.

element.name: msql_db_query
element.description: Returns a positive mSQL query identifier to the query result, or on error.

element.name: msql_error
element.description: msql_error returns the last issued error by the mSQL server or an empty string if no error was issued. If no link is explicitly passed, the last successful open link will be used to retrieve the error message. Note that only the last error message is accessible with msql_error .

element.name: msql_fetch_array
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: msql_fetch_field
element.description: Returns an object containing field information

element.name: msql_fetch_object
element.description: Returns an object with properties that correspond to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: msql_fetch_row
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: msql_field_flags
element.description: msql_field_flags returns the field flags of the specified field. Currently this is either, "not ", "primary key", a combination of the two or "" (an empty string).

element.name: msql_field_len
element.description: msql_field_len returns the length of the specified field or on error.

element.name: msql_field_name
element.description: msql_field_name returns the name of the specified field from the result resource query_identifier . will return the name of the second field in the result set associated with the result identifier.

element.name: msql_field_seek
element.description: Seeks to the specified field offset. If the next call to msql_fetch_field won't include a field offset, this field would be returned.

element.name: msql_field_table
element.description: Returns the name of the table field was fetched from.

element.name: msql_field_type
element.description: msql_field_type is similar to the msql_field_name function. The arguments are identical, but the field type is returned. This will be one of "int", "char" or "real".

element.name: msql_free_result
element.description: msql_free_result frees the memory associated with query_identifier . When PHP completes a request, this memory is freed automatically, so you only need to call this function when you want to make sure you don't use too much memory while the script is running.

element.name: msql_list_dbs
element.description: msql_list_dbs will return a result pointer containing the databases available from the current msql daemon. Use the msql_result function to traverse this result pointer.

element.name: msql_list_fields
element.description: msql_list_fields retrieves information about the given tablename . The returned result set can be traversed with any function that fetches result sets, such as msql_fetch_array .

element.name: msql_list_tables
element.description: msql_list_tables lists the tables on the specified database . It returns a result set which may be traversed with any function that fetches result sets, such as msql_fetch_array .

element.name: msql_num_fields
element.description: msql_num_fields returns the number of fields in a result set.

element.name: msql_num_rows
element.description: msql_num_rows returns the number of rows in a result set.

element.name: msql_pconnect
element.description: msql_pconnect acts very much like msql_connect with two major differences.

element.name: msql_query
element.description: msql_query sends a query to the currently active database on the server that's associated with the specified link identifier. If the link identifier isn't specified, the last opened link is assumed. If no link is open, the function tries to establish a link as if msql_connect was called, and use it.

element.name: msql_result
element.description: Returns the contents of the cell at the row and offset in the specified mSQL result set.

element.name: msql_select_db
element.description: msql_select_db sets the current active database on the server that's associated with the specified link_identifier . If no link identifier is specified, the last opened link is assumed. If no link is open, the function will try to establish a link as if msql_connect was called, and use it.

element.name: mcrypt_cbc
element.description: The first prototype is when linked against libmcrypt 2.2.x, the second when linked against libmcrypt 2.4.x or higher. The mode should be either or .

element.name: mcrypt_cfb
element.description: The first prototype is when linked against libmcrypt 2.2.x, the second when linked against libmcrypt 2.4.x or higher. The mode should be either or .

element.name: mcrypt_create_iv
element.description: mcrypt_create_iv is used to create an IV.

element.name: mcrypt_decrypt
element.description: mcrypt_decrypt decrypts the data and returns the unencrypted data.

element.name: mcrypt_ecb
element.description: The first prototype is when linked against libmcrypt 2.2.x, the second when linked against libmcrypt 2.4.x or higher. The mode should be either or .

element.name: mcrypt_enc_get_algorithms_name
element.description: This function returns the name of the algorithm.

element.name: mcrypt_enc_get_block_size
element.description: This function returns the block size of the algorithm specified by the encryption descriptor td in bytes.

element.name: mcrypt_enc_get_iv_size
element.description: This function returns the size of the iv of the algorithm specified by the encryption descriptor in bytes. If it returns '0' then the IV is ignored in the algorithm. An IV is used in cbc, cfb and ofb modes, and in some algorithms in stream mode.

element.name: mcrypt_enc_get_key_size
element.description: This function returns the maximum supported key size of the algorithm specified by the encryption descriptor td in bytes.

element.name: mcrypt_enc_get_modes_name
element.description: This function returns the name of the mode.

element.name: mcrypt_enc_get_supported_key_sizes
element.description: Returns an array with the key sizes supported by the algorithm specified by the encryption descriptor. If it returns an empty array then all key sizes between 1 and mcrypt_enc_get_key_size are supported by the algorithm.

element.name: mcrypt_enc_is_block_algorithm
element.description: This function returns if the algorithm is a block algorithm, or if it is a stream algorithm.

element.name: mcrypt_enc_is_block_algorithm_mode
element.description: This function returns if the mode is for use with block algorithms, otherwise it returns . (e.g. for stream, and for cbc, cfb, ofb).

element.name: mcrypt_enc_is_block_mode
element.description: This function returns if the mode outputs blocks of bytes or if it outputs bytes. (e.g. for cbc and ecb, and for cfb and stream).

element.name: mcrypt_enc_self_test
element.description: This function runs the self test on the algorithm specified by the descriptor td . If the self test succeeds it returns . In case of an error, it returns .

element.name: mcrypt_encrypt
element.description: mcrypt_encrypt encrypts the data and returns the encrypted data.

element.name: mcrypt_generic
element.description: This function encrypts data. The data is padded with " " to make sure the length of the data is n * blocksize. This function returns the encrypted data. Note that the length of the returned string can in fact be longer then the input, due to the padding of the data.

element.name: mcrypt_generic_deinit
element.description: This function terminates encryption specified by the encryption descriptor ( td ). It clears all buffers, but does not close the module. You need to call mcrypt_module_close yourself. (But PHP does this for you at the end of the script.) Returns on error, or on success.

element.name: mcrypt_generic_end
element.description: This function is deprecated, use mcrypt_generic_deinit instead. It can cause crashes when used with mcrypt_module_close due to multiple buffer frees.

element.name: mcrypt_generic_init
element.description: The maximum length of the key should be the one obtained by calling mcrypt_enc_get_key_size and every value smaller than this is legal. The IV should normally have the size of the algorithms block size, but you must obtain the size by calling mcrypt_enc_get_iv_size . IV is ignored in ECB. IV MUST exist in CFB, CBC, STREAM, nOFB and OFB modes. It needs to be random and unique (but not secret). The same IV must be used for encryption/decryption. If you do not want to use it you should set it to zeros, but this is not recommended.

element.name: mcrypt_get_block_size
element.description: The first prototype is when linked against libmcrypt 2.2.x, the second when linked against libmcrypt 2.4.x or 2.5.x.

element.name: mcrypt_get_cipher_name
element.description: mcrypt_get_cipher_name is used to get the name of the specified cipher.

element.name: mcrypt_get_iv_size
element.description: mcrypt_get_iv_size returns the size of the Initialisation Vector (IV) in bytes. On error the function returns . If the IV is ignored in the specified cipher/mode combination zero is returned.

element.name: mcrypt_get_key_size
element.description: The first prototype is when linked against libmcrypt 2.2.x, the second when linked against libmcrypt 2.4.x or 2.5.x.

element.name: mcrypt_list_algorithms
element.description: mcrypt_list_algorithms is used to get an array of all supported algorithms in the lib_dir parameter.

element.name: mcrypt_list_modes
element.description: mcrypt_list_modes is used to get an array of all supported modes in the lib_dir .

element.name: mcrypt_module_close
element.description: This function closes the specified encryption handle.

element.name: mcrypt_module_get_algo_block_size
element.description: This function returns the block size of the algorithm specified in bytes. The optional lib_dir parameter can contain the location where the mode module is on the system.

element.name: mcrypt_module_get_algo_key_size
element.description: This function returns the maximum supported key size of the algorithm specified in bytes. The optional lib_dir parameter can contain the location where the mode module is on the system.

element.name: mcrypt_module_get_supported_key_sizes
element.description: Returns an array with the key sizes supported by the specified algorithm. If it returns an empty array then all key sizes between 1 and mcrypt_module_get_algo_key_size are supported by the algorithm. The optional lib_dir parameter can contain the location where the mode module is on the system.

element.name: mcrypt_module_is_block_algorithm
element.description: This function returns if the specified algorithm is a block algorithm, or is it is a stream algorithm. The optional lib_dir parameter can contain the location where the algorithm module is on the system.

element.name: mcrypt_module_is_block_algorithm_mode
element.description: This function returns if the mode is for use with block algorithms, otherwise it returns . (e.g. for stream, and for cbc, cfb, ofb). The optional lib_dir parameter can contain the location where the mode module is on the system.

element.name: mcrypt_module_is_block_mode
element.description: This function returns if the mode outputs blocks of bytes or if it outputs just bytes. (e.g. for cbc and ecb, and for cfb and stream). The optional lib_dir parameter can contain the location where the mode module is on the system.

element.name: mcrypt_module_open
element.description: This function opens the module of the algorithm and the mode to be used. The name of the algorithm is specified in algorithm, e.g. "twofish" or is one of the MCRYPT_ciphername constants. The module is closed by calling mcrypt_module_close . Normally it returns an encryption descriptor, or on error.

element.name: mcrypt_module_self_test
element.description: This function runs the self test on the algorithm specified. The optional lib_dir parameter can contain the location of where the algorithm module is on the system.

element.name: mcrypt_ofb
element.description: The first prototype is when linked against libmcrypt 2.2.x, the second when linked against libmcrypt 2.4.x or higher. The mode should be either or .

element.name: mdecrypt_generic
element.description: This function decrypts data. Note that the length of the returned string can in fact be longer then the unencrypted string, due to the padding of the data.

element.name: mhash
element.description: mhash applies a hash function specified by hash to the data and returns the resulting hash (also called digest). If the key is specified it will return the resulting HMAC. HMAC is keyed hashing for message authentication, or simply a message digest that depends on the specified key. Not all algorithms supported in mhash can be used in HMAC mode. In case of an error returns .

element.name: mhash_count
element.description: mhash_count returns the highest available hash id. Hashes are numbered from 0 to this hash id.

element.name: mhash_get_block_size
element.description: mhash_get_block_size is used to get the size of a block of the specified hash .

element.name: mhash_get_hash_name
element.description: mhash_get_hash_name is used to get the name of the specified hash.

element.name: mhash_keygen_s2k
element.description: mhash_keygen_s2k generates a key that is bytes long, from a user given password. This is the Salted S2K algorithm as specified in the OpenPGP document (RFC 2440). That algorithm will use the specified hash algorithm to create the key. The salt must be different and random enough for every key you generate in order to create different keys. That salt must be known when you check the keys, thus it is a good idea to append the key to it. Salt has a fixed length of 8 bytes and will be padded with zeros if you supply less bytes.

element.name: udm_add_search_limit
element.description: udm_add_search_limit adds search restrictions.

element.name: udm_alloc_agent
element.description: Returns a mnogosearch agent identifier on success, on failure. This function creates a session with database parameters.

element.name: udm_alloc_agent_array
element.description: udm_alloc_agent_array will create an agent with multiple database connections. The array databases must contain one database URL per element, analog to the first parameter of udm_alloc_agent .

element.name: udm_api_version
element.description: udm_api_version returns the mnoGoSearch API version number. E.g. if mnoGoSearch 3.1.10 API is used, this function will return .

element.name: udm_cat_list
element.description: Returns an array listing all categories of the same level as the current category in the categories tree. agent is the agent identifier returned by a previous call to >udm_alloc_agent .

element.name: udm_cat_path
element.description: Returns an array describing the path in the categories tree from the tree root to the current one, specified by category . agent is the agent identifier returned by a previous call to >udm_alloc_agent .

element.name: udm_clear_search_limits
element.description: udm_clear_search_limits resets defined search limitations and returns .

element.name: udm_errno
element.description: udm_errno returns mnoGoSearch error number, zero if no error.

element.name: udm_error
element.description: udm_error returns mnoGoSearch error message, empty string if no error.

element.name: udm_find
element.description: Returns a result link identifier on success, or on failure.

element.name: udm_free_ispell_data
element.description: udm_free_ispell_data always returns .

element.name: udm_get_doc_count
element.description: udm_get_doc_count returns the number of documents in the database.

element.name: udm_get_res_field
element.description: udm_get_res_field returns result field value on success, on error.

element.name: udm_get_res_param
element.description: udm_get_res_param returns result parameter value on success, on error.

element.name: udm_hash32
element.description: udm_hash32 will take a string str and return a quite unique 32-bit hash number from it. Requires an allocated agent .

element.name: udm_load_ispell_data
element.description: udm_load_ispell_data loads ispell data.

element.name: udm_set_agent_param
element.description: Defines mnoGoSearch session parameters.

element.name: muscat_setup_net
element.description: muscat_setup_net creates a new muscat session and returns the handle.

element.name: mysqli_affected_rows
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_autocommit
element.description: mysqli_autocommit is used to turn on or off auto-commit mode on queries for the database connection represented by the link object.

element.name: mysqli_change_user
element.description: mysqli_change_user is used to change the user of the specified database connection as given by the link parameter and to set the current database to that specified by the database parameter.

element.name: mysqli_character_set_name
element.description: Returns the current character set for the database connection specified by the link parameter.

element.name: mysqli_close
element.description: The mysqli_close function closes a previously opened database connection specified by the link parameter.

element.name: mysqli_commit
element.description: Commits the current transaction for the database connection specified by the link parameter.

element.name: mysqli_connect
element.description: Object oriented style (constructor):

element.name: mysqli_connect_errno
element.description: The mysqli_connect_errno function will return the last error code number for last call to mysqli_connect . If no errors have occured, this function will return zero.

element.name: mysqli_connect_error
element.description: The mysqli_connect_error function is identical to the corresponding mysqli_connect_errno function in every way, except instead of returning an integer error code the mysqli_connect_error function will return a string representation of the last error to occur for the last mysqli_connect call. If no error has occured, this function will return an empty string.

element.name: mysqli_data_seek
element.description: The mysqli_data_seek function seeks to an arbitrary result pointer specified by the offset in the result set represented by result . The offset parameter must be between zero and the total number of rows minus one (0.. mysqli_num_rows - 1).

element.name: mysqli_debug
element.description: The mysqli_debug function is used to perform debugging operations using the Fred Fish debugging library. The debug parameter is a string representing the debugging operation to perform.

element.name: mysqli_dump_debug_info
element.description: This function is designed to be executed by an user with the SUPER privilege and is used to dump debugging information into the log for the MySQL Server relating to the connection specified by the link parameter.

element.name: mysqli_errno
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_error
element.description: Object oriented style (property)

element.name: mysqli_fetch_array
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row or if there are no more rows for the resultset represented by the result parameter.

element.name: mysqli_fetch_assoc
element.description: Returns an associative array that corresponds to the fetched row or if there are no more rows.

element.name: mysqli_fetch_field
element.description: The mysqli_fetch_field returns the definition of one column of a result set as an object. Call this function repeatedly to retrieve information about all columns in the result set. mysqli_fetch_field returns when no more fields are left.

element.name: mysqli_fetch_field_direct
element.description: mysqli_fetch_field_direct returns an object which contains field definition informations from specified resultset. The value of fieldnr must be in the range from to .

element.name: mysqli_fetch_fields
element.description: This function serves an identical purpose to the mysqli_fetch_field function with the single difference that, instead of returning one object at a time for each field, the columns are returned as an array of objects.

element.name: mysqli_fetch_lengths
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_fetch_object
element.description: The mysqli_fetch_object will return the current row result set as an object where the attributes of the object represent the names of the fields found within the result set. If no more rows exist in the current result set, is returned.

element.name: mysqli_fetch_row
element.description: Returns an array that corresponds to the fetched row, or if there are no more rows.

element.name: mysqli_field_count
element.description: Returns the number of columns for the most recent query on the connection represented by the link parameter. This function can be useful when using the mysqli_store_result function to determine if the query should have produced a non-empty result set or not without knowing the nature of the query.

element.name: mysqli_field_seek
element.description: Sets the field cursor to the given offset. The next call to mysqli_fetch_field will retrieve the field definition of the column associated with that offset.

element.name: mysqli_field_tell
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_free_result
element.description: The mysqli_free_result function frees the memory associated with the result represented by the result parameter, which was allocated by mysqli_query , mysqli_store_result or mysqli_use_result .

element.name: mysqli_get_client_info
element.description: The mysqli_get_client_info function is used to return a string representing the client version being used in the MySQLi extension.

element.name: mysqli_get_client_version
element.description: Returns client version number as an integer.

element.name: mysqli_get_host_info
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_get_proto_info
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_get_server_info
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_get_server_version
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_info
element.description: Object oriented style (property)

element.name: mysqli_init
element.description: Allocates or initializes a MYSQL object suitable for mysqli_options and mysqli_real_connect .

element.name: mysqli_insert_id
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_kill
element.description: This function is used to ask the server to kill a MySQL thread specified by the processid parameter. This value must be retrieved by calling the mysqli_thread_id function.

element.name: mysqli_more_results
element.description: mysqli_more_results indicates if one or more result sets are available from a previous call to mysqli_multi_query .

element.name: mysqli_multi_query
element.description: The mysqli_multi_query executes one or multiple queries which are concatenated by a semicolon.

element.name: mysqli_next_result
element.description: mysqli_next_result prepares next result set from a previous call to mysqli_multi_query which can be retrieved by mysqli_store_result or mysqli_use_result .

element.name: mysqli_num_fields
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_num_rows
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_options
element.description: mysqli_options can be used to set extra connect options and affect behavior for a connection.

element.name: mysqli_ping
element.description: Checks whether the connection to the server is working. If it has gone down, and global option is enabled an automatic reconnection is attempted.

element.name: mysqli_prepare
element.description: mysqli_prepare prepares the SQL query pointed to by the null-terminated string query, and returns a statement handle to be used for further operations on the statement. The query must consist of a single SQL statement.

element.name: mysqli_query
element.description: The mysqli_query function is used to simplify the act of performing a query against the database represented by the link parameter.

element.name: mysqli_real_connect
element.description: mysqli_real_connect attempts to establish a connection to a MySQL database engine running on hostname .

element.name: mysqli_real_escape_string
element.description: This function is used to create a legal SQL string that you can use in a SQL statement. The string is encoded to an escaped SQL string, taking into account the current character set of the connection.

element.name: mysqli_real_query
element.description: The mysqli_real_query function is used to execute only a query against the database represented by the link whose result can then be retrieved or stored using the mysqli_store_result or mysqli_use_result functions.

element.name: mysqli_report
element.description: mysqli_report is a powerful function to improve your queries and code during development and testing phase. Depending on the flags it reports errors from mysqli function calls or queries which don't use an index (or use a bad index).

element.name: mysqli_rollback
element.description: Rollbacks the current transaction for the database specified by the link parameter.

element.name: mysqli_select_db
element.description: The mysqli_select_db function selects the default database (specified by the dbname parameter) to be used when performing queries against the database connection represented by the link parameter.

element.name: mysqli_sqlstate
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_ssl_set
element.description: The function mysqli_ssl_set is used for establishing secure connections using SSL. It must be called before mysqli_real_connect . This function does nothing unless OpenSSL support is enabled.

element.name: mysqli_stat
element.description: mysqli_stat returns a string containing information similar to that provided by the 'mysqladmin status' command. This includes uptime in seconds and the number of running threads, questions, reloads, and open tables.

element.name: mysqli_stmt_affected_rows
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_stmt_bind_param
element.description: mysqli_stmt_bind_param is used to bind variables for the parameter markers in the SQL statement that was passed to mysqli_prepare . The string types contains one or more characters which specify the types for the corresponding bind variables

element.name: mysqli_stmt_bind_result
element.description: mysqli_stmt_bind_result is used to associate (bind) columns in the result set to variables. When mysqli_stmt_fetch is called to fetch data, the MySQL client/server protocol places the data for the bound columns into the specified variables var1, ... .

element.name: mysqli_stmt_close
element.description: Closes a prepared statement. mysqli_stmt_close also deallocates the statement handle pointed to by stmt . If the current statement has pending or unread results, this function cancels them so that the next query can be executed.

element.name: mysqli_stmt_data_seek
element.description: The mysqli_stmt_data_seek function seeks to an arbitrary result pointer specified by the offset in the statement result set represented by statement . The offset parameter must be between zero and the total number of rows minus one (0.. mysqli_stmt_num_rows - 1).

element.name: mysqli_stmt_errno
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_stmt_error
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_stmt_execute
element.description: The mysqli_stmt_execute function executes a query that has been previously prepared using the mysqli_prepare function represented by the stmt object. When executed any parameter markers which exist will automatically be replaced with the appropiate data.

element.name: mysqli_stmt_fetch
element.description: mysqli_stmt_fetch fetch the result from a prepared statement into the variables bound by mysqli_stmt_bind_result .

element.name: mysqli_stmt_free_result
element.description: The mysqli_stmt_free_result function frees the result memory associated with the statement represented by the stmt parameter, which was allocated by mysqli_stmt_store_result .

element.name: mysqli_stmt_init
element.description: Allocates and initializes a statement object suitable for mysqli_stmt_prepare .

element.name: mysqli_stmt_num_rows
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_stmt_param_count
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_stmt_prepare
element.description: mysqli_stmt_prepare prepares the SQL query pointed to by the null-terminated string query. The statement object has to be allocated by mysqli_stmt_init . The query must consist of a single SQL statement.

element.name: mysqli_stmt_reset
element.description: The mysqli_stmt_reset resets a prepared statement on client and server to state after prepare. For now this is mainly used to reset data sent with mysqli_stmt_send_long_data .

element.name: mysqli_stmt_result_metadata
element.description: If a statement passed to mysqli_prepare is one that produces a result set, mysqli_stmt_result_metadata returns the result object that can be used to process the meta information such as total number of fields and individual field information.

element.name: mysqli_stmt_send_long_data
element.description: Allows to send parameter data to the server in pieces (or chunks), e.g. if the size of a blob exceeds the size of . This function can be called multiple times to send the parts of a character or binary data value for a column, which must be one of the TEXT or BLOB datatypes.

element.name: mysqli_stmt_sqlstate
element.description: Returns a string containing the SQLSTATE error code for the most recently invoked prepared statement function that can succeed or fail. The error code consists of five characters. means no error. The values are specified by ANSI SQL and ODBC. For a list of possible values, see .

element.name: mysqli_stmt_store_result
element.description: You must call mysqli_stmt_store_result for every query that successfully produces a result set ( ), and only if you want to buffer the complete result set by the client, so that the subsequent mysqli_fetch call returns buffered data.

element.name: mysqli_store_result
element.description: Transfers the result set from the last query on the database connection represented by the link parameter to be used with the mysqli_data_seek function.

element.name: mysqli_thread_id
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: mysqli_thread_safe
element.description: mysqli_thread_safe indicates whether the client library is compiled as thread-safe.

element.name: mysqli_use_result
element.description: mysqli_use_result is used to initiate the retrieval of a result set from the last query executed using the mysqli_real_query function on the database connection specified by the link parameter. Either this or the mysqli_store_result function must be called before the results of a query can be retrieved, and one or the other must be called to prevent the next query on that database connection from failing.

element.name: mysqli_warning_count
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: openal_buffer_create
element.description: Returns an resource on success or on failure.

element.name: openal_buffer_data
element.description: An resource (previously created by openal_buffer_create ).

element.name: openal_buffer_destroy
element.description: An resource (previously created by openal_buffer_create ).

element.name: openal_buffer_get

element.name: openal_buffer_loadwav

property.name: wavfile

element.name: openal_context_current

element.name: openal_context_suspend

element.description: An resource (previously created by openal_device_open ) to be closed.

element.name: openal_device_open
element.description: Open an audio device optionally specified by device_desc . If device_desc is not specified the first available audio device will be used.

element.name: openal_listener_get
element.description: Property to retrieve, one of: (float), (array(float,float,float)), (array(float,float,float)) (array(float,float,float)).

element.name: openal_listener_set
element.description: Property to set, one of: (float), (array(float,float,float)), (array(float,float,float)) (array(float,float,float)).

element.name: shmop_close
element.description: shmop_close is used to close a shared memory block.

element.name: shmop_delete
element.description: shmop_delete is used to delete a shared memory block.

element.name: shmop_open
element.description: shmop_open can create or open a shared memory block.

element.name: shmop_read
element.description: shmop_read will read a string from shared memory block.

element.name: shmop_size
element.description: shmop_size is used to get the size, in bytes of the shared memory block.

element.name: shmop_write
element.description: shmop_write will write a string into shared memory block.

element.name: ArrayIterator::current
element.description: This function returns the current array entry

element.name: ArrayIterator::key
element.description: This function returns the current array key

element.name: ArrayIterator::next
element.description: This function moves the iterator to the next entry.

element.name: ArrayIterator::rewind
element.description: This function rewinds the iterator to the beginning.

element.name: ArrayIterator::valid
element.description: This function checks if the array contains any more entries.

element.name: ArrayObject::__construct
element.description: This constructs a new array object. The input parameter accepts an array or another ArrayObject.

element.name: ArrayObject::getIterator
element.description: This function will return an iterator from an ArrayObject.

element.name: class_implements
element.description: This function returns an array with the name of the interfaces that the given class implements.

element.name: class_parents
element.description: This function returns an array with the name of the parent classes of the given class .

element.name: spl_classes
element.description: This function returns an array with the current available SPL classes.

element.name: ob_tidyhandler
element.description: ob_tidyhandler is intended to be used as a callback function for ob_start to repair the buffer.

element.name: tidy::__construct
element.description: tidy::__construct constructs a new tidy object.

element.name: tidyNode->isAsp
element.description: This functions returns if the current node is ASP, or otherwise.

element.name: tidyNode->isPhp
element.description: Returns if the current node is PHP code, otherwise.

element.name: tidy_access_count
element.description: tidy_access_count returns the number of accessibility warnings found for the specified document.

element.name: tidy_clean_repair
element.description: This function cleans and repairs the given tidy object .

element.name: tidy_config_count
element.description: tidy_config_count returns the number of errors encountered in the configuration of the specified tidy object .

element.name: tidy_diagnose
element.description: tidy_diagnose runs diagnostic tests on the given tidy object , adding some more information about the document in the error buffer.

element.name: tidy_error_count
element.description: tidy_error_count returns the number of Tidy errors encountered for the specified document.

element.name: tidy_get_body
element.description: This function returns a tidyNode object starting from the < body > tag of the tidy parse tree.

element.name: tidy_get_config
element.description: tidy_get_config returns an array with the configuration options in use by the given tidy object .

element.name: tidy_get_error_buffer
element.description: Object oriented style (property):

element.name: tidy_get_head
element.description: This function returns a tidyNode object starting from the < head > tag of the tidy parse tree.

element.name: tidy_get_html
element.description: This function returns a tidyNode object starting from the < html > tag of the tidy parse tree.

element.name: tidy_get_html_ver
element.description: tidy_get_html_ver returns the detected HTML version for the specified tidy object .

element.name: tidy_get_output
element.description: tidy_get_output returns a string with the repaired html.

element.name: tidy_get_release
element.description: This function returns a string with the release date of the Tidy library.

element.name: tidy_get_root
element.description: Returns a tidyNode object representing the root of the tidy parse tree.

element.name: tidy_get_status
element.description: tidy_get_status returns the status for the specified tidy object . It returns 0 if no error/warning was raised, 1 for warnings or accessibility errors, or 2 for errors.

element.name: tidy_getopt
element.description: tidy_getopt returns the value of the specified option for the specified tidy object . The return type depends on the type of the specified option . You will find a list with each configuration option and their types at: .

element.name: tidy_is_xhtml
element.description: This function returns if the specified tidy object is a XHTML document, or otherwise.

element.name: tidy_is_xml
element.description: This function returns if the specified tidy object is a generic XML document (non HTML/XHTML), or otherwise.

element.name: tidy_load_config
element.description: This function loads a Tidy configuration file, with the specified encoding .

element.name: tidy_node->hasChildren
element.description: This function was named tidy_node->has_children in PHP 4/Tidy 1.

element.name: tidy_node->hasSiblings
element.description: This function was named tidy_node->has_siblings in PHP 4/Tidy 1.

element.name: tidy_node->isComment
element.description: This function was named tidy_node->is_comment in PHP 4/Tidy 1.

element.name: tidy_node->isHtml
element.description: This function was named tidy_node->is_html in PHP 4/Tidy 1.

element.name: tidy_node->isJste
element.description: This function was named tidy_node->is_jste in PHP 4/Tidy 1.

element.name: tidy_node->isText
element.description: This function was named tidy_node->is_text in PHP 4/Tidy 1.

element.name: tidy_node->isXhtml
element.description: This functions was named tidy_node->is_xhtml in PHP 4/Tidy 1.

element.name: tidy_node->isXml
element.description: This function was named tidy_node->is_xml in PHP 4/Tidy 1.

element.name: tidy_parse_file
element.description: This function parses the given file.

element.name: tidy_parse_string
element.description: tidy_parse_string parses a document stored in a string.

element.name: tidy_repair_file
element.description: This function repairs the given file and returns it as a string.

element.name: tidy_repair_string
element.description: This function repairs the given string.

element.name: tidy_reset_config
element.description: This function restores the Tidy configuration to the default values.

element.name: tidy_save_config
element.description: tidy_save_config saves current settings to the specified file. Only non-default values are written.

element.name: tidy_set_encoding
element.description: Sets the encoding for input/output documents. Possible values for encoding are ascii, latin0, latin1, raw, utf8, iso2022, mac, win1252, ibm858, utf16, utf16le, utf16be, big5 and shiftjis

element.name: tidy_setopt
element.description: tidy_setopt updates the specified option with a new value .

element.name: tidy_warning_count
element.description: tidy_warning_count returns the number of Tidy warnings encountered for the specified document.

element.name: xattr_get
element.description: This function gets the value of an extended attribute of a file.

element.name: xattr_list
element.description: This functions gets a list of names of extended attributes of a file.

element.name: xattr_remove
element.description: This function removes an extended attribute of a file.

element.name: xattr_set
element.description: This function sets the value of an extended attribute of a file.

element.name: xattr_supported
element.description: This functions checks if the filesystem holding the given file supports extended attributes. Read access to the file is required.

element.name: xdiff_file_diff
element.description: xdiff_file_diff makes unified diff of files file1 and file2 and stores result in file dest . context indicated how many lines of context you want to include in diff result. Set minimal to if you want to minimalize size of diff (can take a long time). Resulting file is human-readable.

element.name: xdiff_file_diff_binary
element.description: xdiff_file_diff_binary makes binary diff of files file1 and file2 and stores result in file dest . This function works with both text and binary files. Resulting file is in binary format.

element.name: xdiff_file_merge3
element.description: xdiff_file_merge3 merges files file1 , file2 and file3 into one and stores result in file dest .

element.name: xdiff_file_patch
element.description: xdiff_file_patch patches file file with unified patch in file patch and stores result in file dest .

element.name: xdiff_file_patch_binary
element.description: xdiff_file_patch_binary patches file file with binary patch in file patch and stores result in file dest .

element.name: xdiff_string_diff
element.description: xdiff_string_diff makes unified diff of strings str1 and str2 . context indicated how many lines of context you want to include in diff result. Set minimal to if you want to minimalize size of diff (can take a long time).

element.name: xdiff_string_diff_binary
element.description: xdiff_string_diff_binary makes binary diff of strings str1 and str2 .

element.name: xdiff_string_merge3
element.description: xdiff_string_merge3 merges strings str1 , str2 and str3 into one.

element.name: xdiff_string_patch
element.description: xdiff_string_patch patches string str with unified patch in string patch .

element.name: xdiff_string_patch_binary
element.description: xdiff_string_patch_binary patches string str with binary patch in string patch .
